jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Adobe.com Program Management Intern will build a foundational approach to A/B Testing on our ecommerce platform. The successful candidate will build cohesive documentation and data repositories for the wide variety of tests that are conducted on Adobe.com. This documentation will ultimately inform a framework model for Product Managers to reference when kicking off testing and optimization concepting. The candidate will partner with Product and Analytics teams to conduct interviews during the research and development phase. After working closely with the Adobe.com team, the individual will have extensive knowledge of optimizing for a D2C ecommerce platform and networks to help them get started on developing a career in tech. What You'll Do Partner with team members on a global scale across Product, Analytics, and Studio Teams. They will conduct interviews, collect feedback and data points that will inform documentation efforts. Work with Product partners to understand initiatives, testing types, pages we test on and cadence of testing. Work with Analytics team members to understand what the average return is on the various testing types. Work with Studio teams to understand average timelines and project size for the various test types. Frequently check-in with teams to ensure they are on track to meet completion efforts. Build presentation slides and internal-customer-facing documentation. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university and actively pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in business administration, marketing, communications, or computer science. Must have a genuine passion for documentation solutions, process optimization and be a data driven problem solver. Strong written and verbal communications skills, public speaking skills, and not afraid to network or get to know new people. Desire to learn about the inner workings of website creation, customer insights, page design and personalization. Special consideration to candidates who demonstrate an eagerness to fill documentation gaps. Microsoft PowerPoint expert.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Would you like to work for a leading international software company and grow within a team of strong contributors? Join the Adobe Developer Platform (ADP) engineering team! We empower Adobe's Developer Ecosystem by building platform software to create an amazing customer experience. The Adobe Developer website team is looking for a self-driven website engineer who wants to be challenged and learn from an experienced distributed team. You will have the opportunity to help plan, design, develop, and test software for the Developer Website platform that supports https://developer.adobe.com To be successful, you should have some practical experience with developing platform components or websites using CSS, JavaScript, Markdown, HTML, and JSON. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What you'll Do Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code using CSS, JavaScript, Markdown/MDX, HTML. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Collaborate with engineers and participate in weekly demos and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Collaborate with other teams on open development projects to build functionality across the Developer website. What you need to succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience required. Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills Previous related experience in software engineering specifically website development. (applicable coursework, projects, internships, etc.) Proficiency or some experience with at least one or more of the following: Markdown, MDX, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, JSON Familiar with APIs, Github and Jira is a bonus. Familiar with the software development lifecycle - designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining websites and mobile apps Self-driven, Results-oriented, with ability and interest in learning new technologies and adapting quickly to new requirements and environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Engineer interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products. Adobe software engineer interns can work directly on products for our Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, or Experience Cloud teams, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Work towards results-oriented research goals, while identifying intermediate achievements. Contribute to applied research that can be applied to Adobe product development. Explore and lead innovative imaging technology for Adobe customers Help integrate novel research work into Adobe’s product. Lead and collaborate on applied research projects across different Adobe divisions Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a PhD degree in machine learning, AI, computer science, statistics, or scene semantic understanding; or equivalent experience required Be able to evaluate, improve, or develop advance machine learning algorithms for complex use cases Experience communicating research ideas and machine learning for public audiences of peers. Experience working in teams. Knowledge in a programming language (Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc) Familiar with the ML development lifecycle – data acquisition and annotation, ML model design and implementation, ML model evaluation and deployment Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a Machine Learning intern who will apply AI and machine learning techniques to big-data problems to help Adobe better understand, lead and optimize the experience of its customers. By using predictive models, experimental design methods, and optimization techniques, the candidate will be working on the research and development of exciting projects like real-time online media optimization, sales operation analytics, customer churn scoring and management, customer understanding, product recommendation and customer lifetime value prediction. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems with statistical modeling, machine learning, and analytics techniques. Develop and implement scalable, efficient, and interpretable modeling algorithms that can work with large-scale data in production systems Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering; or equivalent experience required Good understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning, or data analytics concepts. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java and C Familiar with one or more machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as R, Matlab and scikit learn Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability. Excellent communication, relationship skills and a team player Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands— everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Architect interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products. Adobe software engineer interns can work directly on products for our Marketing, Sales, & Customer Support Systems, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Learn and work in Github to update and publish content for solution guidance in Parliament. You will use GitHub to automate the capture and usage of architecture standards and guidance for our architecture artifacts. You will learn the LeanIX architecture tool to capture current state and target state architecture. You will also co-develop architecture guidance and standards based on areas of need. Collaborate with Solution Architects to complete Architecture design prior to ARB Reviews. Participate in defining Architecture Roadmap for target state architecture for next 3-5 years. Learn infrastructure cloud technology for Azure and AWS and participate in cloud design activities. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer, or equivalent experience required Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills Previous related experience in software engineering (applicable coursework, projects, internships, etc.) Proficiency and experience with at least one or more of the following: Java, C++, JavaScript, Python Familiar with the software development lifecycle - designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining web and mobile apps Results-oriented, with ability and interest in learning new technologies and adapting quickly to new requirements and environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

The Opportunity The Infrastructure Asset Management team within Adobe is responsible for ordering and receiving all of the hardware that Adobe uses to provide network, compute, and storage services used across our product portfolio. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide sample of partners throughout the company to implement a formal asset receiving program designed to ensure that we are able to track this important equipment throughout its lifecycle. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols What You’ll Do Work with collaborators to define program requirements and success criteria Run all logistics including working sessions, communications, outcome tracking, and updates. Write communications that is elegant, clear, concise, and persuasive that excites and encourages participation from partners. Build an asset receiving program in partnership with business partners ensure program reflects the needs and requirements of the company. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, or similar field required 0-2 Number of years of experience in a Project or Program Management type role Exposure to conducting information gathering exercises to collect requirements from internal partners Ability to communicate complicated processes clearly and concisely to influence and motivate partners. Great interpersonal communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Skilled in collecting, prioritizing, and responding to input from multiple sources (internal partners, vendor management, global receiving teams, etc.) Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

The Opportunity The Digital Media B2B (business-to-business) Analytics team is responsible for driving revenue growth and customer success for the by unlocking key business insights and enabling decision-makers with practical recommendations. As a Strategy & Ops MBA intern, you’ll play a key role in helping Adobe drive value through data driven insights to expand our B2B footprint. We aspire to advance Adobe’s ability to understand and fulfill the needs of its business customers better than any company, by demonstrating the power of data, analytics, and data science. What You'll Do Find opportunities to accelerate businesses through unlocking new revenue streams or improving operational efficiency Collaborate with Analytics and Ops teams to understand trends in the business and develop insights that translate into meaningful recommendations for growth. Crafting the strategy, using data to advise the approach Operationalizing the plan by partnering with team members across the organization Engage frequently with leadership to share progress, recommendations, and insights What You’ll Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in an MBA program graduating between December 2023 – June 2024 Background in consulting, analytics, or strategy Ability to think critically to break-down sophisticated problems Proven analytical problem-solving skills, with a hypothesis driven approach Proven track record of partnering cross-functionally to complete initiatives Strong communication, executive presentation, and interpersonal skills Comfort with ambiguity and a willingness to work with a high degree of autonomy All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We have an extraordinary and unique opportunity within Adobe's Benefits organization, for you to learn how we design, deliver and measure the success of our impactful benefits at Adobe! This role will have exposure to how the Adobe Benefits team makes our employee experience come alive through our employee benefit and wellbeing programs! This position will be based in one of Adobe’s key locations; San Jose, Lehi or New York. What you'll Do You will primarily support the benefits and wellbeing teams on a wide range of projects. Areas of focus may include retirement, pension, time off, wellbeing, and other benefits as needed. The responsibilities of this Intern experience will include research, reporting, analysis, and presentation, including dashboard creation. Retirement responsibilities will include assisting with Adobe’s pension plan audits for designated countries. Time off tasks will include creating Adobe’s global holiday schedules. Ownership of community involvement by researching and planning volunteer events for teams in both San Jose, CA and Lehi, UT. Wellbeing tasks include assistance with educational material development. Produce Global Benefits All Hands presentation, by developing new content for Q3 All Hands meeting. What you need to succeed University student, working towards Degree in Human Resources, Data Sciences, Statistics or Analytics. Ability to effectively balance multiple projects, delegated by manager and team members, with desire to grow and learn new things. Strong communication and presentation capabilities (ie., PowerPoint). Analytical approach, with proficiency in spreadsheets, formulas, and ability to create charts and graphs to illustrate and communicate findings (ie., Excel). Ability to achieve accomplishments within expectations and timescales. Ability to accomplish goals successfully and independently, with delegation coming from multiple leads. Attention to details and accuracy of all work results. Ability to establish relationships across the organization, including working within different time zones globally. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe values being genuine, exceptional, innovative, and involved. These values guide our company —in how we run our business and in the positive impact we strive to make for our customers, and in the communities where we live and work. As an intern on the Adobe Brand Marketing Team, you will help build and measure partnership programs that make consumers fall in love with the Adobe brand, especially with next-generation creators. Programs consist of large multi-channel campaigns with collaboration across multiple teams and global reach. What You'll Do Understand our goals and strategy to best convey Adobe’s core belief in Creativity for All. Collaborate with internal collaborators and channel owners to build the campaign plan. Outline the customer journey and identify any weaknesses to ensure a positive user experience. Set performance targets and prepare a measurement framework. Analyze and interpret campaign metrics such as traffic and engagement rates, in addition to product or feature usage, user demographics, and behavioral patterns. Prepare status updates for leadership, internal collaborators, and external partners. Lead implementation of recommendations working with web production team. What You Need To Succeed Current MBA student graduating between December 2023 - June 2024, Marketing concentration preferred. Experience with consumer marketing, preferably in the ages 18-40 demographic. Understanding of digital content marketing and multi-channel campaigns. Understanding of social, advertising, and web analytics. Experience working in large matrixed organization. Analytical orientation. Excellent at both quantitative and qualitative analysis, with a proven record to tackle problems. Results-oriented, self-starter with a positive, upbeat demeanor.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe values being genuine, exceptional, innovative, and involved. These values guide our company —in how we run our business and in the positive impact we strive to make for our customers, and in the communities where we live and work. As an intern on the Adobe Brand Marketing Team, you will help build and measure partnership programs that make consumers fall in love with the Adobe brand, especially with next-generation creators. Programs consist of large multi-channel campaigns with collaboration across multiple teams and global reach. What You'll Do Understand our goals and strategy to best convey Adobe’s core belief in Creativity for All. Collaborate with internal collaborators and channel owners to build the campaign plan. Outline the customer journey and identify any weaknesses to ensure a positive user experience. Set performance targets and prepare a measurement framework. Analyze and interpret campaign metrics such as traffic and engagement rates, in addition to product or feature usage, user demographics, and behavioral patterns. Prepare status updates for leadership, internal collaborators, and external partners. Lead implementation of recommendations working with web production team. What You Need To Succeed Current MBA student graduating between December 2023 - June 2024, Marketing concentration preferred. Experience with consumer marketing, preferably in the ages 18-40 demographic. Understanding of digital content marketing and multi-channel campaigns. Understanding of social, advertising, and web analytics. Experience working in large matrixed organization. Analytical orientation. Excellent at both quantitative and qualitative analysis, with a proven record to tackle problems. Results-oriented, self-starter with a positive, upbeat demeanor.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands— everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity We have a full-time opportunity in the Adobe Technology Services organization where the candidate will work directly with all levels in the Office of the CIO! Your opportunity includes re-designing, and operationalizing vendor management and software asset management processes. We are growing, and we need to scale & simplify operations and change how we work as a team. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Analyze, design and lead end to end software lifecycle management process improvements and develop a point of view on what can be improved to drive process adoption. You will have an opportunity to share your vision, ideas and influence the future of the team. Additionally, there is a renewed focus on marketing team success, and you will play a role in shaping how people experience us! Work closely with the Team to identify automation and reporting capabilities, and deliver documented process improvements. Develop and drive a data-driven operating model. Develop a reporting format to market team success in achieving goals and objectives, to improve broader awareness of team success. Craft a dashboard of key information to demonstrate optimization, software renewals and savings metrics and other data to enable insights and decision making. Recommend ways we can market value that the team provides. What You Need to Succeed We are looking for a candidate currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in a technical, marketing or business degree. Master’s degree preferred in related field of study. You are encouraged to be yourself with an ability to establish relationships and work as a team. You will demonstrate superb communication dexterity and feel comfortable telling stories to simplify the complex- sell your solutions. You should be adept at working with disparate data sources and simplifying. Ability to work innovatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment. Experience with tools such as MS Office, Power BI, SharePoint, etc. Some practical work or project experience related to improving the user experience or partner engagement Confidence in exploring new ideas and not afraid to fail Results-oriented, with ability and interest in learning new technologies and adapting quickly to new requirements and environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

As part of the Field Readiness & Enablement organization in our Digital Experience business unit, you will have the opportunity to take us to the next level from webinars and communications to creative and compelling activities, sessions, and community driven content. In this role, there is a great mix of strategy development and execution. You will show case your vision, run pilot programs or activities and measure the results. If you are interested in being in front of the video camera, there are opportunities for you to build a portfolio of work to showcase your talents. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Adobe Legal Compliance intern will be part of the Legal Compliance team and will be working on a variety of Compliance-related projects arising around the world, with the focus on anti-corruption/anti-bribery programs. Projects will include assessing conflicts of interest; reviewing gifts and hospitality disclosures; collaborating in the Corporate Policies update process; collaborating in the Compliance metrics preparation; performing investigative analyses of expense report issues; and managing some of the online tools used by the Compliance team. This will be a full-time role during the summer of 2023 (June-August), expanding to part-time (from September 2023 to end of May/beginning of June 2024). What You'll Do Assist with managing Adobe’s Conflict of Interest questionnaire for candidates as well as for existing employees, responding to issues and questions raised by the disclosures; Collaborate in managing the Corporate Policies update process; Reconcile expense reports with government pre-approvals in the Gifts and Hospitality disclosure tool; Collaborate in the quarterly Compliance metrics update process, reviewing the data and helping the metrics lead to create Dashboards in Power BI. Conduct investigative analyses of expense report issues, prepare related data for investigator’s use, and assist with further investigation as needed; Perform other duties and participate in other projects as assigned. What You Need To Succeed Analytical skills (storytelling with data) Strong sense of judgement, attention to detail Excellent communication skills Experience engaging with senior stakeholders Experience with Microsoft suite

The Opportunity The Cyber Fraud Investigations Intern will work with senior investigators to identify and investigate digital fraud affecting the software industry. The successful candidate will have a deep technical and analytical skills set. After working alongside the Cyber Fraud Investigations Team, the individual will have extensive knowledge of technical fraud affecting software companies, technical investigative methods, and anomaly detection within large data sets. The candidate will also work with other business partners to learn to identify gaps in processes and recommend areas for improvement. What You’ll Do Investigate instances of cyber fraud as outlined by the Adobe’s Manager of Cyber Fraud Investigations. Cases will include Bot detection, unauthorized access, hacking, Commerce fraud, Piracy, and Product Abuse. Analyze exception reports to identify fraudulent activity and identify trends. Make recommendations to improve exception reporting program. Utilize technical investigative tools including graph databases and internet monitoring tools Partner with internal business groups to deeply understand vulnerabilities and methods to mitigate fraud and fraud-related risk. Recommend policy changes to mitigate or eliminate fraud and fraud-related risks. Keep up with industry fraud identification techniquesWhat You Need to Succeed Understanding or experience with SQL Internet and social media investigations familiarity Deep understanding of online landscape including IP address, device identification, web hosts, servers, and ISPs Familiarity with dark web infrastructure An inquisitive nature that seeks to understand human behavior & motivation/reaction

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Engineer interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products. Adobe data science engineer interns can work directly on products for our Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, or Experience Cloud teams, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop reliable, robust, and maintainable data models. Participating in all aspects of data science activities, including ETL and data engineering, exploratory data analyses, data validation, data modeling, visualization, machine learning, model deployment and documentation. Collaborate with team members and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Additional responsibilities as needed based on specific role or teamWhat You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s in Data Science, Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience required Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills Previous related experience in data science or analytics (applicable coursework, projects, internships, etc.) Proficiency and experience with at least one or more of the following: SQL, Python, Scala Familiarity with basic statistical concepts Results-oriented, with ability and curiosity about learning new technologies and adapting quickly to new requirements and environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. The Opportunity Adobe Developer Platform (ADP) Zen is to enable developers with modern and cohesive experience across Creative Cloud, Experience Cloud and Document Cloud so they can Discover, Build, Distribute and Consume services across Adobe! ADP provides the vital infrastructure/platform to power developer strategies via a collection of interconnected tools, services, and consistent experience. Our solutions support high traffic, numerous third-party integrations, scalability, and performance. ADP Ecosystem represent these products/services: Adobe App Developer, I/O Runtime - a Serverless platform, I/O Events - Distributed Event Bus, I/O Exchange – Market place for Creative apps, Developer Console, and other services ADP is seeking hard-working and passionate Software Engineer (DevOps) intern who can work directly on the ADP Ecosystem along with other DevOps Engineers who has the responsibility to ensure optimal performance and up-time of ADP’s infrastructure. Using technologies like Kubernetes, Docker, we craft next-gen tools, processes, and workflows to empower application developers and Adobe customers. We're focused on highly scalable, performant, secure, resilient cloud platform along with cost effective. This team is uniquely positioned to make a measurable difference to Adobe's development culture and its bottom line. The successful candidate should have a strong interest in learning new technologies and the ability to drive exciting projects to conclusion. This individual should be self-motivated, quick learner and have a passion for quality. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Build, challenge, and secure our automated, multi-cloud, multi-tenant environments: in software, process, and infrastructure. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation. With an approach of automate everything, quality over quantity, build once, use it every time. Keep high levels of Security and Compliance with Adobe Standards Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Join the team of attorneys and paralegals who provide legal counsel to the business teams at Adobe that develop, market and sell Creative Cloud and Document Cloud (including Adobe Express, Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, Acrobat, Sign) as well as Adobe Stock, Adobe Sensei, Adobe I/O & Partner Ecosystems, Adobe Research, Adobe Design, and Adobe Ethical Innovation. As a Legal Summer Intern at Adobe, experience the atmosphere of corporate life at one of the world’s leading software companies, while learning how each of our legal teams drive the efficiency and effectiveness of our entire organization. You will be exposed to Adobe culture, including our values which play a key role in Adobe routinely being recognized as one of the top global software companies for work experiences. Depending on performance and Digital Media Legal team needs, there will be an opportunity for the Legal Summer Intern to join Adobe as a full-time employee after graduation. What You'll Do Under the supervision of the Adobe in-house attorneys, the Legal Summer Intern will have the opportunity to work with the legal team that supports Digital Media products, including: Participate in meetings regarding trending topics, strategy, and organizational changes Interact with many legal professionals and other staff at Adobe, including product teams and go-to-market teams, who develop and launch Adobe’s products and services Work with different teams within Digital Media Legal on short and long term projects and day-to-day responsibilities, which may include: Supporting Digital Media product development and releases Drafting a wide variety of agreements (ex. consulting agreements, SOWs, inbound and outbound technology licenses) Conducting research to support product development Developing and refining guidelines, processes, templates, and resources for internal use and training Working on projects in areas as diverse as artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML), university collaboration, and developer tools What You Need To Succeed Second-year law student (current 2L) in good standing pursuing the degree of Juris Doctor at an ABA accredited law school Strong academic record as well as experience that demonstrates promise for a successful career in the legal profession Ability to organize, prioritize and handle workloads, as well as have excellent written and oral communication and analytical skills A mentality that you can learn from everyone and they can learn from you Special consideration will be given to candidates who have demonstrated that they meaningfully contribute to the diversity of their law school student body and, upon entering the legal profession, the legal community, by their research, studies, employment or extracurricular activities This is a hybrid position – the Legal Summer Intern must be available to work in Adobe’s Bay Area or Seattle offices Submission To be considered, please submit the following through our application portal: A current resume; Two to three references (please provide name, email and phone), including at least one former manager; Undergraduate and, if available, law school transcripts (unofficial versions are acceptable); A cover letter/personal statement. The cover letter/personal statement should go beyond the resume to describe a unique personal history, perspective or experiences and/or how you plan to contribute to the diversity of the legal profession after graduation. In addition, please explain why you are interested in this position; and A legal writing sample (10-page maximum). Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Digital Strategy Group (DSG) works with C-level leadership at Adobe’s Enterprise customers to craft strategies for customer-experience transformation and digital innovation. Our engagements employ Adobe’s digital benchmarking capabilities, industry trends, customer-journey mapping, organizational assessments, high-level architecture assessments and other techniques to deliver high-impact recommendations. We also bring a deep industry perspective to the organization, delivering vision, published thought leadership, and aligning the ecosystem on an overall industry go-to-market strategy. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols What You’ll Do Take part in multiple strategy engagements (typically 2 to 6 weeks each) for senior customers. For each engagement, you will be part of a robust team that is passionate about developing insights and recommendations! We seek candidates who can contribute in one or more of the following areas: Economic impact analysis — assess how improvements to customer journey and business capabilities will grow revenues, reduce costs, and generate business value. Size potential opportunities to prioritize short- & long-term recommendations. Help customers write business cases to quantify value and rationalize technology investments. Experience design — run ethnographic interviews and journey diagnostics to understand customers’ unmet needs. Build brand-new web and mobile app experiences that delight our customers’ customers and improve performance. Use Adobe XD in hands on workshops to rapidly prototype and test new designs. Analytics and benchmarking — use Adobe’s unparalleled analytics dataset to show customers how their digital business compares within industry. Reveal insights from their own reports and the corresponding actions to optimize performance and customer experience. Experience architecture — assess customers’ technology landscape and data strategy to understand current implementation and usage. Recommend new solutions, integrations, and use cases to enable improved customer experiences. You will also contribute industry leadership in the following ways: Industry perspective – collaborate to define Adobe’s perspective on impactful industry experiences by working with deep subject matter specialists. Apply that perspective by authoring thought leadership assets to drive demand generation, field enablement, etc. Be the voice of the industry within Adobe to inform product strategy. Industry & partner strategy – collaborate on Adobe’s strategy to deepen its customer footprint in core industries. Align the Adobe internal and partner ecosystem on the industry strategy and coordinate go-to-market efforts across functions.' Develop as a customer leader and business leader! You will learn the Cloud business and develop your network as you collaborate with people across Adobe, including from Sales, Marketing, Product, and Professional Services. You will have opportunities to rotate across DSG industry teams to deepen your subject matter expertise as you execute strategy engagements and contribute to industry leadership. You will also engage with Center of Excellence teams that drive core tools and capabilities that fuel DSG engagements, such as experience design and value. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Liberal Arts, Arts, Psychology, or equivalent field required graduating between December 2023 and June 2024 Ability to participate in a full time internship between May-September 2023 Outstanding record of academic achievement Interest in business strategy, technology, analytics or experience design through coursework, extracurricular activities or work/internship experience Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills, including conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work optimally with people at all levels Ability to communicate sophisticated ideas both verbally and in writing Passion for new knowledge and ability to absorb concepts quickly High level of energy, personal drive, and positivity Willingness to travel Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

jobTitle: 2023 Intern - Diversity Talent Acquisition, Program Specialist
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe’s Diversity Talent Acquisition team is seeking a Diversity Talent Acquisition, Program Specialist intern. This is an opportunity for someone that is passionate about diversity and seeking to explore a career in program management. This person will collaborate with various teams to break down silos, define the current state for Diversity & Inclusion programs globally, and develop a recommendation for processes and methods of evaluation. The Diversity Talent Acquisition team is a part of Adobe’s Employee Experience organization. Employee Experience helps drive Adobe’s success by enabling all of our people to do and be their best. Diversity Talent Acquisition is a key area because it has a mission to make Adobe the most inclusive and sought-after employer for a diverse set of candidates. Through strategic partnerships, campus engagement, using sophisticated sourcing tools, and hosting/attending events, Diversity Talent Acquisition is able to connect underrepresented communities with opportunities at Adobe. Read more about Adobe’s Diversity and Inclusion strategy on our website or take a peek into Adobe life in this video . What You'll Do Collaborate with multiple teams to collect insights in order to make effective recommendations Shadow and support planning and execution of Diversity Talent Acquisition events Research diversity trends and infuse standard methodologies into solutions to influence organizational efficiency Present project findings and recommendations to key partners Look for opportunities to streamline efforts and improve processes What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university (undergraduate or master's) and must have at least a quarter or semester left of college after the summer internship. Experience hosting an event or project planning Experience leading a team or committee Partnership or volunteer experience supporting underrepresented communities is strongly preferred Ability to influence without authority, think proactively, and function independently Preferred but not required: Adept proficiency in use of Excel or a Sourcing Tool/ Candidate Relationship Management (CRM) System (for example Salesforce, Oracle, LinkedIn Recruiter, Handshake, Yello etc.) Preferred but not required: Experience using Adobe Spark, Splashthat, and Slack Ability to make informed recommendations based on data in an ambiguous environment Effective and persuasive communication abilities (both written and verbal) Innovative, creative, and persistent Relentless pursuit of progression and advancement of key goals and priorities

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge The ERC Generalist team is the initial point of contact for all employee and manager (director level and below) inquiries across the Americas. This team will be responsible for providing first level Human Resources Generalist support intended to improve manager and employee success by addressing inquiries related to Employee Experience policies, procedures and programs; identifying and clarifying issues through inquiry; evaluating potential solutions; implementing selected solutions; or escalating to a functional consultant if the solution requires on-going interaction or specialized coaching. This team is able to provide resolution for the vast majority of inquires that come through the shared services organization. The role requires a proactive approach in anticipating Employee Experience-related needs and a solutions-oriented mindset to resolving issues. This is a critical role, as it is the face to the customer and will leave the first impression on the capabilities of the Employee Experience organization. What You'll Do Act as initial point of contact for approximately 10,000 employees across the Americas (through the Director level) for all Employee Experience related questions. Areas of support include: Addressing questions related to Employee Experience policies, procedures and programs Identifying and clarifying issues through inquiry Evaluating potential solutions or implementing selected solutions Mitigate escalations as much as possible and focus on quick resolution Responsible for managing, tracking, closing and reporting progress on Employee Experience inquires issue resolution using the case tracking tool Participates on projects as assigned Assisting employees and managers how to utilize and optimize self-service transactions in all Employee Experience related tools Primary executors of voluntary exit tasks who coach and support manager with any queries (e.g. how to communicate employee departure, next steps) and address employee separation related questions Assist Managers with self-service reports and provide basic, one-click reports Provide general catalogue, eligibility, or enrollment related resolutions for learning & development inquiries Answer policy questions on external program qualification or reimbursement Responsible for collecting I-9’s and maintaining the Talx (electronic I-9) database to ensure for compliance What You Need To Succeed Demonstrated problem solving skills Displays commitment to customer service Prior experience in providing client facing consultation Communicates effectively at all levels, including written and oral communications Process oriented and the ability to manage detailed work within constant deadlines/time constraints/SLA environment Maintains highest level of confidentiality Ability to work independently and be part of a team environment Ability to apply judgment and make decisions on escalations Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We’re seeking candidates with strong academic records who demonstrate outstanding performance and have already determined, at this early stage of their law school studies, that they are most likely to engage in corporate transactional work upon graduation. What You’ll Do Projects the Experience Cloud Product Legal Intern will be involved in during the summer are based on the Product Legal team’s needs at the time, but may include: Assist Product Legal with supporting the Marketo and Digital Marketing product teams as they develop and bring to market new technologies and product offerings by helping to identify and resolve privacy, IP, go-to-market, and license compliance issues Conduct legal research on a wide range of issues regarding existing and future products Collaborate with subject matter authorities in Adobe's Legal Department, including litigation, patent, antitrust, copyright, privacy security, and licensing attorneys Contribute to drafting of agreements, including inbound and outbound technology licenses, product documentation, and partnership agreements in support of the Marketo and Digital Marketing product ecosystem. The Opportunity Are you a 2L and curious about what it’s like to work in an in-house legal department? Come join us at Adobe to get experience working on in-house projects. We’re seeking candidates with strong academic records who demonstrate outstanding performance and have already determined, at this early stage of their law school studies, that they are most likely to engage in corporate transactional work upon graduation. As a Legal Intern at Adobe you will experience the atmosphere of corporate life at one of the world’s leading software companies, while learning how each of our legal teams drive the efficiency and effectiveness of our entire organization. You will be exposed to Adobe corporate culture, including our values which play a key role in Adobe routinely being recognized as one of the top global software companies for work experiences. What You’ll Do Projects the Experience Cloud Product Legal Intern will be involved in during the summer are based on the Product Legal team’s needs at the time, but may include: Assist Product Legal with supporting the Marketo and Digital Marketing product teams as they develop and bring to market new technologies and product offerings by helping to identify and resolve privacy, IP, go-to-market, and license compliance issues Conduct legal research on a wide range of issues regarding existing and future products Collaborate with subject matter authorities in Adobe's Legal Department, including litigation, patent, antitrust, copyright, privacy security, and licensing attorneys Contribute to drafting of agreements, including inbound and outbound technology licenses, product documentation, and partnership agreements in support of the Marketo and Digital Marketing product ecosystem. What You Need To Succeed Must be a 2nd-year law student in good standing pursuing the degree of Juris Doctor at an ABA accredited law school. Must have a strong academic record as well as experience that demonstrates phenomenal promise for a successful career in the legal profession. Must meaningfully contribute to the diversity of the law school student body and, upon entering the legal profession, the legal community. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $0 - $0 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Are you interested in learning more about the intersection of language, communication, people, and design? The Adobe Design Content Strategy (ADCS) team is seeking an intern to join us in 2023! ADCS is a centralized group of content design practitioners that spans across all Adobe products. Our content designers work on in-app experiences; we also contribute to Spectrum, our design system, and much more. We‘re continually evolving our processes to work more effectively with each other and with teammates from design, product, marketing, engineering, and more. In this role, you’ll help us update our content guidelines and standards, and get a ground-level look at how to advocate for and execute on content strategy in a large company with a variety of needs. You’ll have ample opportunity to participate in design reviews and workshops, plus craft content for different audiences and formats. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You'll Do: Conduct research to inform your point of view and recommendations Collaborate with other content strategists, as well as people from other teams or departments Design and write content to meet the needs of different audiences Present your work, and give and receive feedback Create frameworks, guidelines, or other resources, such as: A best practice guide for error messages: supplement existing Spectrum guidance with a play-by-play, “fill in the blank” approach that designers can use to draft copy A flow chart for toasts, error screens, and other notification styles: help people determine which style is used when, and what kind of information is required for each A best practice guide for meeting accessibility standards: create a checklist that designers can integrate into their sign-off process What You Need to Succeed: Must-haves: An interest in, an affinity for, taking abstract or complex ideas and turning them into useful, usable, inclusive content A systematic, strategic approach to writing and content creation. You don’t just fill an empty box full of words—you help define the box in the first place Outstanding writing and communication skills, and a sharp attention to detail Ability to present and sell your ideas, create coalition, and build support Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or have equivalent experience) in a related field such as: Writing and rhetoric, Literature, Communications, Information and library sciences, Information architecture, Human-computer interaction (HCI), Content strategy, UX writing, or content design, Linguistics, Strategy and operations Able to participate in a full-time internship between May and September 2023 Nice-to-haves: An interest in user experience (UX), product design, or content design/content operations Experience working as part of a multidisciplinary team Experience with, and a point of view on, digital tools for creativity and expression

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Do you want to help craft the future of 3D and Mixed Reality? Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and work across multiple design directions and workflows? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are both creative and scale Adobe’s products? The 3D and Immersive Design Team at Adobe is looking for a design intern who will help envision and build the future of Adobe's 3D and MR creative tools. With the Adobe Substance 3D Collection and Adobe Aero, we're making big moves in 3D, but it is still early days! This is a huge opportunity space to shape the future of 3D and AR at Adobe. We believe that tools shape our world, and by building the tools that power 3D creativity we can have an outsized impact on our world. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our product looks, feels, and behaves. Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it. Help drive the design process. From strategy to early concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and final delivery, our team does it all. Understand and advocate for our users. Work with researchers and product managers from customer discovery to detailed usability testing, always putting our users first. Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process. Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, product development family that includes products managers, engineers, researchers and other designers. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required A passion for and experience with 3D creation tools. Curiosity and a drive to learn new concepts and domains. Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design or related fields. Experience working in teams with many moving parts. Experience working with or conducting your own research, presenting results, and acting on those results. Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Desire to be part of a fun, tight-knit team. Love for all things design. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and execute across multiple design directions and workflows? Do you have an interest in making creative tools better and helping users find ongoing value in using them? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s design products? This is your opportunity to join a dynamic growing team of Growth Designers. We experiment with different approaches to holistic experiences, uncover product opportunities, and strive to understand user behavior to build the future of creative tools for creative people like you. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our product looks, feels, and behaves. Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it. Help drive the design process. From early vision concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery. Understand and advocate for our users. Work with researchers and product managers from customer discovery to detailed usability testing, always putting our users first. Deliver value to customers in ways that fuel virality. Use system-wide design thinking to find levers to pull to drive substantial growth. Grow. Sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process. Collaborate. You’ll be actively involved with a communicative, healthy, product development team that includes product managers, engineers, researchers and other designers. Focus on experimentation. You’ll have multiple opportunities to brainstorm with growth-minded peers and partners to bring the hypothetical to reality and enjoy seeing your work in the hands of millions. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design, Growth design, or related fields. Experience working in teams with many moving parts. Experience working with or conducting your own research, communicating results, and acting on those results. Passion to understand customer desires and challenges, exploring hypotheses, and approaching them with various design solutions. Deliver improvements and approaches to capture takeaways and insights. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Desire to work with a fun, tight-knit team. Love for all things design! Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September
