We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and execute across multiple design directions and workflows? Are you someone who favors interactive prototypes over flat mockups? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s design products? This is your opportunity to help define and drive efforts to make Adobe’s products more equitable, inclusive, representative, and usable for the broadest possible swath of humanity. As a member of the Product Equity team, you will connect marginalized and underinvested users to the teams that build our products, and help chart paths to more equitable user experiences across race, gender, age, ability, and other forms of human difference. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our product looks, feels, and behaves. Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it. Help drive the design process. From early vision concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery, our team does it all. Understand and advocate for our users. Work with researchers and product managers from customer discovery to detailed usability testing, always putting our users first. Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process. Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, product development family that includes products managers, engineers, researchers and other designers. Ship. We ship. You’ll have multiple opportunities to bring the hypothetical to the actual and enjoy seeing your work in the hands of millions. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Desire to be part of a fun, tight-knit team. Love for all things design. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Are you enthusiastic about mobile app design, and exploring new opportunities for scanning and document creation? The Adobe Document Cloud Design team is seeking an Experience Design Intern to work with the Adobe Scan team! Document Cloud is Adobe’s popular suite of apps and services that center on PDF consumption, conversion, and document exchange services. Adobe Scan is a highly rated, growing app that feeds into the Acrobat ecosystem, allowing its many users to scan a document, then view, edit, share, and do even more with their PDFs. As a member of this team, you’ll help us explore the future of scanning, and discover new possibilities. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What you'll Do Work closely with a designer, product manager, and developers to experience firsthand the process of designing, iterating, developing, and testing new features Research trends and competing products to develop an understanding of user and business needs, then utilize this to explore new ideas for scanning Create and deliver a compelling vision in the form of an experience walkthrough or presentation to communicate your ideas and their benefits to the appWhat you need to succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in interaction design, industrial design, architecture, new media, HCI, a social science such as cognitive psychology or anthropology, or a related field; or equivalent experience required Fundamental research, interaction, and visual design skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate a problem, and present it to a group Experience with mobile apps on iOS and Android devices Intensely curious, humble, and focused on human-centered problem solving. How to apply To be considered for this role, please submit your resume and portfolio. We’d especially like to see strong systems-thinking and a strong narrative about how your work has evolved over time. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Digital Workplace Experience team in our Adobe Technology Services organization, is driven to lay a user-centered and data-driven foundation for how technology supports our Adobe employees. We are seeking an Experience Research Analyst to help improve our workplace digital solutions. Our group builds & enables solutions that empower a global force of Adobe employees to do their best work. The individual for this internship will be encouraged to jump into the weeds of important initiatives & build the right research studies for business needs. They will partner with multidisciplinary Adobe teams, and leverage Infuse, our internal design thinking framework, to ensure that user needs are kept at the forefront of our work. The ideal candidate would be able to clearly understand research methodologies and be interested in the cross section of research, design, business, & enterprise tool solutions. What you'll Do Run employee research studies from start to finish Build research plans and materials, coordinate study launches, and analyze & synthesize data into concrete insights Clearly communicate reasoning to research approach, and insights back to teams Advocate for employees by articulating research findings through clear and insightful presentations Work directly with design and technical teams to realize user-based recommendations Engage with different roles across Technology Services and other internally facing teams to understand and influence business, technical, and user experience needsWhat you need to succeed Working towards a degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Design, Psychology, Cognitive Science, Neuroscience, Social Science, Anthropology, Human Factors or related fields - or shows significant study in these fields from other coursework Some experience conducting user research, design research, or human factors research Some experience using digital whiteboarding tools & remote research tools Ability to analyze qualitative and quantitative data and turn them into insights Curiosity about design thinking and up-leveling skills Clear communication Interdisciplinary approach Creative problem solver Organized work style Dedication to user-centricity Growth mindset At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Are you seeking a summer internship where you can learn how to conduct your own research and take on real strategic problems in the tech industry? Adobe Design Research & Strategy (ADRS) is searching for an experience research intern who will work at the intersection of artificial intelligence and creative software. We are a team of researchers with a wide range of backgrounds, including Psychology, Anthropology, HCI, Computer Science, Design and Management, Linguistics and more. We are excited to learn more about you, your background and your curiosity about human-centered design! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: With the support of a mentor in Adobe Design Research & Strategy (ADRS), you will learn how to conduct research in an area with high business impact. Get up to speed with the topic/problem: You will meet with collaborators to understand their needs, including designers, product managers, developers and other researchers. After reviewing any previous research on the topic, you will propose your own study that will provide net-new insight for Adobe. Run your research: You will develop key artifacts needed to complete a research study, including a research plan, screener, recruiting strategy and moderator guide. Then you will conduct your own research! Communicate findings and recommendations through storytelling: You will work with your mentor to present what you've learned. You will wrap up your internship with a research roadshow with ample opportunities to share your research before you leave Adobe, including meetings with core collaborators, the Intern Project Expo and Adobe Design’s intern showcase. You will leave your internship ready to run your own research study, and Adobe will have new research recommendations and ideas that we can put into action. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing Bachelors, Masters or PhD in psychology (social, organizational, cognitive, applied or experimental), anthropology, sociology, human-computer interaction, strategic design & management, marketing, business or communications. (Coursework on human-centered research practices is a plus.) Previous project, internship or work experience in human-centered research. We are curious about your experience with listening, observing and communicating through reports and slide decks. (Qualitative research and consulting experience are major pluses.) Ability to take initiative and drive projects with strong organizational skills. Experience building open, positive relationships in teams with many moving parts. Experience quickly processing new information and adapting to challenges. Experience leading through ambiguous and complex situations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September.

Ability to take initiative and drive projects with strong organizational skills. Experience building open, positive relationships in teams with many moving parts. Experience quickly processing new information and adapting to challenges. Experience leading through ambiguous and complex situations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge In Adobe finance, we strive to introduce the finance of the future! We seek a data science intern to join the Digital Media finance team to refine and implement ground-breaking, predictive techniques for forecasting revenue and expense. This role is fitting for an individual who enjoys working with, cleaning and manipulating large datasets, and can derive insights using statistical and machine learning models. This position maintains lots of exposure to cross functional organizations and access to senior management. What You'll Do Our 2023 intern will have the opportunity to showcase their main internship project to their fellow cohort and senior leaders. In addition to impressing judges with their work, our intern will participate in the following activities: Drive data science modeling initiatives for forecasting and analysis Automate, enhance, and maintain analytic applications and data structures used for modeling and forecasting Partner with finance, accounting, BU partners, and leadership to develop and enhance existing process Present findings to leadership and maintain dashboards tracking key indicators Demonstrate strong intellectual curiosity towards enhancing current methodologies and processes Be a change agent, ensuring users adopt new and innovative technologies What You Need To Succeed Pursuing a degree in Computers Science, Statistics, Data Science, Information Systems, or a similar field with a 2024 expected graduation Ability to pull and process data in SQL Strong capability in Python or R proven in coursework, work experience or portfolio projects Strong understanding of statistical concepts central to time-series analysis and sequential prediction including regression, probability, and exponential smoothing Experience in ML/AI tools such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or MXNet is a plus Big data processing proficiency in PySpark and Hadoop is a plus Data visualization experience in Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, including mastery of M/DAX is a plus Successful candidate will be assertive, motivated and have excellent communication skills; strong problem solving and analytical / critical thinking skills; and ability to prioritize and apply sound judgment

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! The Challenge We are looking to hire a Financial Analyst to join the Experience Cloud Finance team as we continue to propel growth by providing significant insights! You will seek to understand and model the scalability of the many DX products by examining both GTM initiatives and COGS implications. These models will ultimately assist in business decisions related to sales strategy and technology investments. This role is excellent for an individual who is interested in learning SaaS products at a deeper level and wants to make a lasting impact by establishing critical metrics to evaluate the success of our growth initiatives. Lots of exposure to cross functional organizations and access to senior management. It's an exciting role and part of a pivotal movement in Adobe's finance organization. What You’ll Do: Partner closely with Finance and the business to understand revenue, COGS, and hosted gross margins at a product level Build the reporting and financial framework for repeatable product profitability models Drive adoption of technology and process changes across the Adobe FP&A org Develop processes to systematically pull key financial data in Tableau or PowerBI to support data driven insights Help validate current margin calculators at the product level Accountable for the timely delivery of projects per established roadmaps by working closely with related team members What You Need to Succeed: Bachelor's Degree in Finance/Economics (or equivalent practical experience) required/ MBA preferred Previous experience in strategic business partnership preferred Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel Comfort with ambiguity and a willingness to work with a high degree of autonomy Proficient in working in large data sets and identifying trends / anomalies against expectations PowerBI, Tableau, Anaplan, SAP, experience would be a plus Experience with SAAS companies a plus. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal); ability to translate sophisticated information into concise, and high-quality business requirements that resonate with partners

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Do you love making an impact on people through creativity? As an intern for Workplace Experience at Adobe, you are enthusiastic about your craft and combine creativity and technical knowledge with business skills. We produce meaningful and inclusive experiences while amplifying our values and improving business impact. You bring exceptional innovation skills, a background in events, design, innovation, sociology, psychology, or research! As an integral member of the workplace experience team, you yearn to give a point of view and participate in conceptual thought process and design exploration. As part of this team, experiences for our employees around the globe have never been so engaging! What You'll Do Lead experiments globally that include working with our partners to identify employee needs, guide decisions in conceptual program design, and deliver insights that can help take Adobe forward into the future. Establish close partnership with our cross-functional teams to ensure design solutions meet employee needs, including developing program guidelines that can scale. Guide decisions related to key programs that will improve the future of work at Adobe. Demonstrate a passion for learning and innovation within a team passionate about human-centric design, thinking strategically about our programs, as they connect to the overall human experience Help build and manifest an inclusive and forward-looking experience design approach. What You Need To Succeed Proficient in Microsoft Suite (PowerPoint, Word, Excel) Knowledge of design thinking / human-centered design Understanding of experience design Graphics and visualization skills to successfully communicate ideas when needed Ability to proactively communicate, be an outstanding partner with and navigate critical conversations among multiple partners Experience with crafting a research plan and conducting research Background in research and experimentation from a behavioral science/social sciences standpoint Background in UX, architecture, psychology a plus Knowledge of service design Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite applications (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! The Opportunity The Adobe Policy and Government Intern will work on several projects in the Washington, DC area related to federal government, including Congress, as well as state and select international governments. The successful candidate will have demonstrated interest in government work and public policy at either the federal, state or local level. After working with Adobe’s Policy Team, the individual will have extensive knowledge of how Congress, the legislative process, the inner workings of government policy and administrative actions, and many contacts to help get them started on developing a career that includes government service and involvement, including a network of contacts in public policy and government. Adobe’s Policy and Government Interns are provided with a view of federal, state and international governments that few intern opportunities offer. This internship will be remote and will not be housed in an Adobe Office for the Fall 2022 semester. What You'll Do Projects the Policy and Government Intern will be involved in during the summer are based on the global government relations team’s needs at the time but might include: Create compelling content around Adobe’s policy and advocacy efforts using Adobe’s tools, especially in sustainability, social justice, workplace, community involvement and other related policy areas. Organize and participate in advocacy preparation and policy development meetings. Coordinate advocacy meetings and events with government officials. Research new areas of policy interest in tech and business. Expand internal systems and tools used by Adobe’s global government relations and public policy group to coordinate global advocacy and messaging. Attend and report out on industry and policy discussion events and meetings on a variety of topics that are at the intersection of technology and government policy. Work as part of a larger team to expand Adobe’s presence in several policy areas important to society. Attend policy events, government official speeches, hearings and roundtables on a variety of topics and prepare summaries for use by Adobe’s subject matter experts. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university and actively pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Business, Law, Public Relations, Communications, Political Science, or related field. Special consideration will be given to candidates who have demonstrated an interest in government by their research, studies, employment or extracurricular activities. Desire to learn about government operations, policies and processes. A genuine passion for public policy and politics. Strong written and verbal communications skills and not afraid to network or get to know new people. Computer skills including word processing, researching, database creation, slide preparation, etc.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity This is an Intern role for Adobe’s Technology GRC (TechGRC) group. The role is for Adobe’s Austin (TX) or San Jose (CA) location. This person will be a member of the TechGRC Advisory & Strategy team. The candidate will be responsible to identify security and technology risks and build programs to support risk reduction across Adobe. What You'll Do Work under the supervision and guidance of the TechGRC Advisory & Strategy manager. Perform Information Security related risk assessments to cover domains like User Access management, Network, OS & Application Security, Encryption, Backup Management, Disaster Recovery, Physical Security, Training & Awareness etc. Assist with the continuous improvement of the Adobe Common Controls Framework (CCF). Partner with the CCF Automation team to build and drive compliance automation to reduce compliance fatigue and increase internal efficiencies. Perform Industry research and analysis to identify security and technology best practices. Collaborate and co-ordinate activities across the TechGRC team based in multiple geo-locations. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelors or Masters Degree with a focus in Information Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field 0-3 years of professional or internship experience Be a self-starter that thrives in the face of challenge, clearing obstacles with a resourceful and creative approach to problem-solving. Good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. It is essential that the candidate is a team-player and possesses strong organizational and planning skills. Attention to detail, balanced with the ability to absorb large amounts of information and distill it down to the essentials. Strong technical aptitude for learning new technologies and concepts and understanding how these will help the business. Desire to learn how to assess and manage technology risk across an enterprise organization. Knowledge of Industry and Regulatory frameworks will be useful (e.g., SOC2, FedRAMP, ISO, PCI, HIPAA, NIST, etc.)

The Opportunity Our internal audit organization is on the lookout for undergraduate students who are passionate about working with numbers and thrive in a fast-paced environment to come work on exciting projects and initiatives. What You'll Do Risk Assurance & Advisory Services (“RAAS”) provides independent, objective assurance and consulting services at a global level, with a goal to help improve operations at Adobe. It helps the Company accomplish its objectives by bringing a detailed and risk-based approach to evaluate and improve the efficiency of corporate processes, internal controls, and governance. In this role, you will participate in audits and evaluate adequacy and efficiency of internal controls of key business processes, identify improvement opportunities, and make valuable recommendations to influence change. You will also analyze data to support the audits and build dashboards, if needed. In addition, you will provide assistance to the leadership team, project teams and others as required. You will have the unique opportunity to gain broad exposure to the operations of the company and build close partnerships! The ideal candidate is a proactive individual who works closely with others, has a strong planning and interpersonal approach to his/her work and has excellent communications skills, both oral and written. What You Need To Succeed Prefer Accounting, Business, Finance, or Economics majors Highly motivated and proactive Detail oriented, analytical and finds creative solutions to problems using data Ability to take direction, learn quickly, work independently Must be a team-player and able to interact well with peers and business partners Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel or Tableau with an affinity for learning new systems Good judgment and confidence in resolving matters requiring management attention Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university and actively pursuing a Bachelor’s degree.

jobTitle: 2023 Intern - IT Customer Support Management/Product Management
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Adobe Cloud Technology Product Manager will collaborate with IT and business clients to understand key business goals and IT delivery capabilities to provide fully integrated solutions. The product manager works on defined problems that could be analysis, design, configuration or implementation related. Ability to understand and detail the current state, envision the target state and help build towards that target state. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that we will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns are expected to live in the same state and country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites are expected to follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Collaborate with multiple partners and cross-departmental teams to ensure an accurate implementation approach is in place. Analyze business requirements, explore and evaluate various options, configure the application to meet requirements, and coordinate testing with QA and User acceptance testers. Research and recommend solutions that meet the business needs for new projects. Translate business architecture through the elicitation and definition of functional requirements and develop documentation and data flows. Provide level 3 end-user support as called upon by the Production Support Team. Assist with test data preparation and testing. Ensure documentation is up to date on SharePoint and wiki pages. Help with Jira Hygiene. Learn how call center software like Genesys PureCloud, and Amazon connect work Bring up process and experience improvement ideas and be the idea lead/sponsor and rally the technical teams to rapidly prototype and prove a concept. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business or Technology field 0-3 years of professional or internship experience in the fields of Product Delivery, Product Management, or Product Ownership, preferably in a technology field Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September Be a self-starter that enjoys thrives in the face of challenges, clearing obstacles with a resourceful and creative approach to problem-solving. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Attention to detail, balanced with the ability to absorb large amounts of information and distill it down to the essentials. Ability to work as part of a team and take a leadership role as a subject matter specialist to meet ambitious goals and pre-defined measurement criteria. Maintain high energy and a positive outlook, with a contagious sense of humor that helps you to adapt to the changing needs of the business. Strong technical interest in learning new technologies and understanding how these will help the business. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the significant benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a Machine Learning intern who will apply AI and machine learning techniques to big-data problems to help Adobe better understand, lead and optimize the experience of its customers. By using predictive models, experimental design methods, and optimization techniques, the candidate will be working on the research and development of exciting projects like real-time online media optimization, sales operation analytics, customer churn scoring and management, customer understanding, product recommendation and customer lifetime value prediction. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems with statistical modeling, machine learning, and analytics techniques. Develop and implement scalable, efficient, and interpretable modeling algorithms that can work with large-scale data in production systems Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering; or equivalent experience required Good understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning, or data analytics concepts. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java and C Familiar with one or more machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as R, Matlab and scikit learn Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability. Excellent communication, relationship skills and a team player Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! The Opportunity: Adobe is looking for a Machine Learning intern who will apply AI and Machine Learning techniques to Search, discovery & recommendations problems and help Adobe better understand, lead, and optimize the experience of its customers. By using predictive models, experimental design methods, and optimization techniques, the candidate will be working on the research and development of exciting projects like real-time online media optimization, sales operation analytics, customer churn scoring and management, customer understanding, product recommendation and customer lifetime value prediction. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What you'll Do: Build ML models on large-scale multimodal datasets to address various business problems in Search, Discovery and recommendations problem space. Apply statistical modeling, machine learning, and analytics techniques. Develop and implement scalable, efficient, and interpretable modeling algorithms that can work with large-scale data in production systems Work closely with other Machine Learning engineers and Data Scientists Demo your work to team members. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering; or equivalent experience required Good understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning, or data analytics concepts. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, C++ Familiar with one or more machine learning frameworks such as SciKitLearn , PyTorch , Tensorflow and data analysis tools like NumPy, pandas Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability. Strong collaboration skills and inclination to show over tell. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Search and discovery are a critical part of Adobe’s Cloud offering. Creative professionals and novice users alike need quick access to their documents, digital assets, libraries, and the variety of creative content they work with every day. They need to find and discover what they’ve created, the things that have been shared with them, and even search marketplace such as Adobe Stock or community such as Behance. We are building a new search platform that powers suits of Adobe product lines such as Adobe’s Creative Cloud product, Marketing Cloud, and Document Cloud and the leading marketplace such as Adobe Stock. Search and discovery are at the very core of the service offered to our customers, with 13 languages covered, and millions of users touched every day. The objective is to make search a world class, innovative, differentiating product in terms of effectiveness and experience. We match the pace, innovation, and excitement of a startup, backed by the resources and infrastructure of Adobe! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: Work closely with Machine Learning scientists, Engineers, Designers and Product Managers to conceptualize and build AI & ML features Apply machine learning to improve the search and recommendation workflows Apply data mining using frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark to build insights for product roadmap. Build web services, search indexing and search platform to index billions of images, documents, and other assets in real-time. Use Elastic Search, REST, NoSQL, and Kafka to power some of these. Present concepts, insights, and key findings to key influencers and leaders. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Enthusiastic about technological trends and eager to innovate What you need to succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering; or equivalent experience required Knowledge of in applied machine learning Knowledge of with Elastic Search/Solr and AWS. Knowledge of with Java, Python Knowledge of data science, Hadoop, and Spark. Knowledge of Web services and REST. Experience with embedding based search is highly desirable

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a Machine Learning intern who will apply AI and machine learning techniques to big-data problems to help Adobe better understand, lead and optimize the experience of its customers. By using predictive models, experimental design methods, and optimization techniques, the candidate will be working on the research and development of exciting projects like real-time online media optimization, sales operation analytics, customer churn scoring and management, customer understanding, product recommendation and customer lifetime value prediction. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems with statistical modeling, machine learning, and analytics techniques. Develop and implement scalable, efficient, and interpretable modeling algorithms that can work with large-scale data in production systems Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering; or equivalent experience required Good understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning, or data analytics concepts. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java and C Familiar with one or more machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as R, Matlab and scikit learn Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability. Excellent communication, relationship skills and a team player Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity As an intern with the Communications team, you will help drive broad-scale awareness of Adobe’s product innovation, customer success, and thought leadership across all of Adobe’s portfolio – Experience Cloud, Document Cloud and Creative Cloud. We are looking for a strategic and creative problem solver, storyteller and communicator (both with writing and verbal communication), with a passion for the technology industry. You’ll work cross-functionally with teams at Adobe to support integrated communications campaigns that drive broad awareness through areas such as media coverage, owned content, and social media. What You'll Do Draft written materials including content for key announcements, press pitches, and social copy Daily monitoring for relevant company press coverage, competitor activity, and key industry trends, as well as on-going coverage reporting Assist with both virtual and in-person press tours, including logistics and attending briefings In-depth research around market opportunities, including press engagements, new industry narratives, and messaging exercises Collaborate with an external agency, as well cross-functional Adobe teams to drive integrated campaigns Assist in developing communications plans and strategies Be flexible and have fun being part of a collaborative organization What You Need To Succeed Working towards BA/BS in Communications, Journalism, Business Administration, Marketing or related field Strong written and oral communications skills Strong organizational and critical thinking skills Detail-oriented with ability to follow through and deliver on commitments Ability to multitask, problem-solve and collaborate with partners globally and cross-functionally Coachable, curious and good at taking initiative

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Are you a passionate motion designer ready to imagine, iterate, and bring your designs to life across multiple product areas? Are you someone who can use animation to simplify complex interactions? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s design system and products? This is your opportunity to join a dynamic growing team, think holistically about in-product motion design, and help build the future of creative tools for creative people just like you. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You'll Do: Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions that impact our design systems and in-product branding. Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it. Help drive the design process. From early vision concepts, to storyboards, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery, our team does it all. Understand and advocate for our users. Work with researchers and product managers from customer discovery to detailed usability testing, always putting our users first. Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process. Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, brand and design systems family that includes products managers, engineers, researchers and other designers. Ship. We ship. You’ll have multiple opportunities to bring the hypothetical to the actual and enjoy seeing your work in the hands of millions. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in motion design, interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required Previous project, internship or work experience in motion, graphics, branding, UX/UI design or related fields. Experience working in teams with many moving parts. Experience working with or conducting your own research, presenting results, and acting on those results. Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Desire to be part of a fun, tight-knit team. Love for all things design. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-Septembe Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

jobTitle: 2023 Intern - Product Manager, Applied Data & Analytics
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Data grows at an exponential rate across all industries and sectors! Governing that data is becoming increasingly critical to the success of nearly every company. Adobe is advancing our Applied Data and Analytics model which requires alignment at the critical nexus between people and systems. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do The data analytics intern will be in a pivotal role of assisting sophisticated analytics teams shift to a data driven operating model with unified definitions and data sources. You will straddle the business world to define and align on definitions and the technical world to build and understand the data lineage. This role requires the vision to see the forest as well as the trees in helping build out the journey data takes from source system through metrics and reporting. The ideal candidate must have a curiosity about data and data governance and will require an outstanding combination of adaptability, personality, and the skills vital to implement the data governance tools in Adobe’s arsenal. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or other quantitative fields; or equivalent experience required A positive can-do, go-getter mentality! SQL data query knowledge SQL data types and schema design experience Build relationships with the ability to work well with a wide range of individuals. Creative and proactive problem solver Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and multi-faceted environment Organized with strong attention to detail and effective documentation skills Communicate on day-to-day activities to business partners Must have excellent interpersonal skills with all levels, strong writing skills Deliver on your promises – You demonstrate a can-do attitude and you aim to overcome obstacles, because you’re passionate about what you do! Your tendency to put customers first in all that you do by understanding their needs and striving to achieve effective solutions. Collaboration and communication – Your ability to forge lasting relationships which are built upon mutual trust, open communication and sharing of information and success. Creativity and innovation – Possessing a passion for driving continuous improvement through spotting opportunities and seeking the views of others. Impact and influence – You listen to many perspectives, evaluate, persuade and carefully craft your work to deliver truly impactful results. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Are you a forward-thinking product manager? Do you have a passion for customer delight? The Provisioning and Administration team is looking for an intern Product Manager, who will play a pivotal role in defining and delivering post-purchase experiences for Adobe’s enterprise, mid-market, government, and education solutions. In the business platform, we enable company administrators to setup and provision accounts for our business customers. You will lead the charge in understanding market requirements, defining and crafting key platform capabilities for value realization across our B2B customers, and working with groundbreaking teams who are driving the next phase of Adobe’s growth! You will drive the personalization, testing, and user experience optimization strategy with a growth-oriented approach for post-purchase experiences used across all Adobe cloud solutions. Specifically, you will deliver platform capabilities, optimize and automate user experiences that enable customers to administer their organizations' users and groups, delegate licenses, use cloud storage and understand the usage of Adobe products within their organizations. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Define and champion product vision and strategy for your products. Develop hypotheses, validate them, socialize insights, forecast impact, build a product roadmap, work with cross-functional teams to build a long-term roadmap, measure impact and capture & analyze user feedback to further evolve the roadmap. Write detailed product specifications as epics and user stories that allow for efficient development and prioritization. Own the collaboration with cross-functional teams, e.g. engineering, shared technology teams, project planning, and delivery of the user experience design. Be the customer advocate every step along the way, help the entire product team to see what makes the difference between just another feature and a customer delightWhat You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time in Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or other quantitative fields ; or equivalent experience required Proven track record of working with others to advance sophisticated product initiatives and projects. A collaborative, creative and business-friendly teammate with exceptional interpersonal skills, a great sense of humor and commitment to professionalism Demonstrated ability to communicate with all levels of the organization. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills; experience with metrics and developing proposals driven by data. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Provisioning and Administration team is looking for an intern Product Manager, who will play a pivotal role in defining and delivering post-purchase experiences for Adobe’s enterprise, mid-market, government, and education solutions. In the business platform, we enable company administrators to setup and provision accounts for our business customers. You will lead the charge in understanding market requirements, defining and crafting key platform capabilities for value realization across our B2B customers, and working with groundbreaking teams who are driving the next phase of Adobe’s growth! You will drive the personalization, testing, and user experience optimization strategy with a growth-oriented approach for post-purchase experiences used across all Adobe cloud solutions. Specifically, you will deliver platform capabilities, optimize and automate user experiences that enable customers to administer their organizations' users and groups, delegate licenses, use cloud storage and understand the usage of Adobe products within their organizations. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Define and champion product vision and strategy for your products. Develop hypotheses, validate them, socialize insights, forecast impact, build a product roadmap, work with cross-functional teams to build a long-term roadmap, measure impact and capture & analyze user feedback to further evolve the roadmap. Write detailed product specifications as epics and user stories that allow for efficient development and prioritization. Own the collaboration with cross-functional teams, e.g. engineering, shared technology teams, project planning, and delivery of the user experience design. Be the customer advocate every step along the way, help the entire product team to see what makes the difference between just another feature and a customer delightWhat You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time in Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or other quantitative fields ; or equivalent experience required Proven track record of working with others to advance sophisticated product initiatives and projects. A collaborative, creative and business-friendly teammate with exceptional interpersonal skills, a great sense of humor and commitment to professionalism Demonstrated ability to communicate with all levels of the organization. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills; experience with metrics and developing proposals driven by data. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands— everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity As a Program Manager, you will join the Digital Video and Audio organization, which is at the center of Adobe's elite products, Premiere Pro, Premiere Rush, After Effects, and Audition. In this role, you will partner with development, product, design, data, and marketing teams to drive the end-to-end goals and success of your product. You will provide visibility and increase the predictability of delivery to drive processes to scale. We are looking for someone with passion, energy, and drive that can bring creative ideas, critical thinking, and an appetite for execution. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols What You’ll Do Manage all enablement data and KPI reporting across business segments Manage all enablement logistics including workshop scheduling, communications, and evaluations Write communications that is elegant, clear, concise, and persuasive that excites and encourages learners Build learning program/project briefs in partnership with business partners ensure learning outcomes reflects the needs and requirements of our learnersWhat You Need to Succeed Experience in agile software development processes. Experience in Program Management, Business Administration, communications, marketing, or education. Excellent interpersonal communication, teamwork, and presentation skills. Skilled in collecting, prioritizing, and responding to input from multiple sources (Data Science teams, Development teams, Leadership teams, etc.) Effective written & verbal communication skills and proven record to communicate sophisticated technical concepts to a non-technical audience. Ability to influence and align efforts of disparate groups to achieve a common goal. Self-motivated and not afraid to tackle unknowns, demonstrate a strong bias to action. 0-2 Number of years of experience in in a Project or Program Management type role Exposure to conducting analysis to provide recommendations to business partners Ability to communicate complicated analysis in a simple way to influence individuals Great interpersonal communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Skilled in collecting, prioritizing, and responding to input from multiple sources (field sales, business partners, product marketing, sales operations, etc.) Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The OpportunityThe Digital Experience Cloud Customer Engineering Strategy, Intelligence, and Operations team is looking for an Associate Program Manager Intern to lead Voice of the Customer and Support Experience projects. You will work with internal cross-functional partners and Customer Engineering Delivery, who provides support services to our customers, to build upon our strategy. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess risks, confirm requirements, develop scopes, and work on resource requirements to build the delivery plan. You will coordinate and lead all aspects of delivery from project initiation through planning, implementation, and testing to closing. We are looking for this intern to help our organization reach out Customer Satisfaction and Case Deflection Fiscal Year 2023 goals. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocolsWhat You’ll Do Lead distributed teams in prioritized project activities to identify, collect and analyze requirements, define key business drivers, and deliver an effective and innovative solution. Strong sense of accountability and management of projects from end-to-end: Effort estimation, scope management, planning, monitoring, and reporting of project execution (risks management, timeline, etc). Write communications that is sophisticated, clear, concise, and persuasive that excites and encourages your audience Build learning program/project briefs in partnership with business partners ensure learning outcomes reflects the needs and requirements of our delivery team. Report on important metric effects across business segments Active participation in improving and refining our best practice methodologies within the group. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelors degree in Communication, Business, or similar field required and graduating betweenDecember 2023 and June 2024 Ability to participate in a full time internship between May-September 2023 0-2 Number of years of experience in in a Project or Program Management type role Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September Exposure to conducting analysis to provide recommendations to business partners Ability to communicate complicated analysis in a simple way to influence individuals Great interpersonal communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Skilled in collecting, prioritizing, and responding to input from multiple sources (Support Delivery, Product Management, Customer Success Operations, Retention Marketing, Customer Engineering Operations, etc.) Demonstrates an understanding of the Customer Engineering Delivery Service Role Outstanding problem-solver and skills in risk management Background in Voice of the Customer or Deflection Strategy is an advantage, but not required A professional project management qualification, e.g. PMI is an advantage, but not a requirement. Ability to work with virtual internal teams across geographies and time zones If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. Colorado Starting Salary: $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: We are seeking a Design Program Management intern to join the Adobe Design team! This is an opportunity to be part of the creative organization that is responsible for Adobe's Creative Cloud, the team that brings you our beloved professional creative products from Photoshop to Premiere Pro. Are you looking to learn how to be an advocate for design-led innovation and explore the role design plays in a large, multi-disciplinary organization? If so, then our team wants to speak with you! Design Program Managers within Adobe Design are leaders within our teams and trusted partners to our cross-functional peers. We work across various product teams to understand, communicate, and manage the delivery of design and customer experiences. We interface directly with executives, product managers, and engineering leadership to bring our products to life. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: Collaborate with designers, content strategists, researchers, and prototypers Balance multiple inputs of priorities and needs across your team Capture requirements and goals Prioritize design and development efforts with multiple dependencies Craft and manage schedules Communicate project and program status What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field; or equivalent experience required Interest or experience in leading projects with a strong organizational mindset An interest in the field of design operations and working within a creative team Strong verbal, presentation, and written communication skills Ability to operate in an environment of ambiguity with diverse partners Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).
