Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and execute across multiple design directions and workflows? Are you someone who favors interactive prototypes over flat mockups? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s design products? This is your opportunity to join a dynamic growing team, think holistically about design, and help build the future of creative tools for creative people just like you. We are a unique team that sits at the intersection of design and product engineering. We work during the early product stages to craft fun and intuitive user experiences. Join us for an opportunity to invent new technologies and contribute to brand new and existing Adobe products! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: We are a group of fun, hard-working engineers who are really passionate about the process of prototyping and believe in building outstanding user experiences in collaboration with designers and user researchers. As part of our team, you will help shape the future of creative tools using emerging technologies focused on Adobe Substance Products ecosystem. You will build new and innovative user interactions and interfaces geared towards our customers unique needs, test and refine those interfaces in collaboration with user researchers and product teams. You will work with remote developers and designers in a highly agile and fun environment to quickly iterate on products, helping increase our customers’ efficiency as well as amplify their creativity. Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our product looks, feels, and behaves. Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it. Help drive the design process. From early vision concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery, our team does it all. Understand and advocate for our users. Work with researchers and product managers from customer discovery to detailed usability testing, always putting our users first. Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process. Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, product development family that includes products managers, engineers, researchers and other designers. Ship. We ship. You’ll have multiple opportunities to bring the hypothetical to the actual and enjoy seeing your work in the hands of millions. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required Passion for 3D & immersive in all of its forms. Experience building sophisticated interactions. 3D math skills Experience using a version control system (Git preferred) Experience in C-based programming languages (C, C++, C#) or Web technologies. Experience with Unity or Unreal game engines. Knowledge with WebGL, WebGPU, Vulkan or Metal Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design or related fields. Experience working in teams with many moving parts. Experience working with or conducting your own research, presenting results, and acting on those results. Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Desire to be part of a fun, tight-knit team. Love for all things design. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September Bonuses: Experience with Pixar USD related technologies & workflows. Experience in Machine Learning Experience with 3D creative tools such as Adobe Substance Products, Blender, Maya, C4D.

jobTitle: 2023 Intern - Research Computer Vision, ML, & Computational Photography
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge Adobe's EPG (Emerging Product Group) is seeking graduate students in Computer Science or related fields to join a team here at HQ in San Jose, California. This is a new team, lead by VP and Fellow Marc Levoy, that is exploring next-generation product opportunities centered around the concept of a universal camera app, and empowered by machine learning, computer vision, and computational photography. If you are passionate about mobile photography and AI, this is your opportunity to work with a great team who will be changing the camera industry. Publication is encouraged. What You’ll Do Our team works like a startup inside Adobe, making this a unique "best of both worlds" opportunity. If you'd love the flexibility and personal impact of joining an exciting startup but also dream of having the deep resources, cool perks, and global launch stage that only an industry leader like Adobe can offer, this is where you belong. You'll have strong input on the direction of this new product and technology direction, while working directly with the experienced startup entrepreneurs leading the project. Research and develop new computational photography algorithms. Build technologies that can be used in other Adobe products, such as Lightroom and Adobe Camera Raw. Collaborate with our designers, product managers, other researchers, and visual effects engineers. Make an impact while building the foundation for a rewarding career at a new growing division within Adobe. What you need to succeed Current graduate student (MS or PhD). Strong programming skills (such as C/C++ and Python). Strong prototyping skills and interests to explore new technical ideas. Experience with deep learning tools (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow, Caffe) is a plus. Experience in programming on GPUs or other hardware accelerators is a plus. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

The Opportunity We are looking for an enthusiastic and focused individual to join the Adobe 3D & Immersive Tech Transfer team in creating exciting new technologies to delight Adobe’s creative customers. We will work together with Adobe Research scientists and product engineers to design, develop, and evaluate state-of-the-art algorithms targeted at geometry, materials, lighting, compositing, and rendering workflows for Adobe creators. Your work will have a direct, tangible impact on Adobe customers! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols What You’ll Do You will lead a research or engineering project, with the goal of developing new technology for production software! You will have the opportunity to collaborate with engineers, product managers, researchers, and artists. What You Need To Succeed Experience working with machine learning techniques, particularly deep learning Education or experience in Computer Graphics and Computer Vision Excellent verbal and communication skills A flexible and curious approach to solving technical challenges will prove indispensable. Proficiency with Python or C++ and either PyTorch or Tensorflow. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Job Description The Opportunity Adobe Research is looking for brilliant minds who are excited about developing research areas that impact Adobe’s products and future endeavors. Research and Engineering internships for Spring, Summer, and Fall of 2023 are now open to applicants pursuing PhD and master’s degrees (exceptional undergraduates will also be considered). Working directly with a manager and a mentor, you will have access to robust computational resources and world-class product and design teams, empowering you to see your work reach millions of users across the globe. Summary Adobe Researchers are developing the next generation of advanced technologies and user experiences, inventing a future where Adobe enables new forms of creativity, frees people from routine tasks, and allows enterprises to understand and act quickly on customer and business insights. Our research labs are actively published in leading journals and conferences, work with product teams on high profile features, and explore new product opportunities across various domains. We are especially interested in fostering ongoing collaborations that last beyond the internship and become part of your PhD thesis. Adobe Research focuses on the following research areas: Data Science Machine Learning Computer Graphics (2D&3D) Document Intelligence Computer Vision Imaging and Video Audio Systems and Languages Natural Language Processing Large Scale Distributed Systems Multimedia Systems Human Computer Interaction AR, VR & 360 Photography Research Engineering What you will do Under the direction of an Adobe Research mentor, you will: Pursue a research problem to apply to Adobe’s products and with the possibility of academic publication Develop new algorithms, run experiments, and produce demonstration prototypes Document and present your work, both verbally and in writingWhat you will need Current PhD or master's student in computer science, or related field (exceptional undergraduates will also be considered) Sufficient research skills and background in your chosen subject area Strong communication skills and teamwork experience Passion for solving real-world problems with web-scale data using and inventing state-of-the-art Machine Learning algorithms. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Are you a 2L and curious about what it’s like to work in an in-house legal department? Come join us at Adobe to get experience working on in-house projects. We’re seeking candidates with strong academic records who demonstrate outstanding performance and have already determined, at this early stage of their law school studies, that they are most likely to engage in corporate transactional work upon graduation. As a Legal Intern at Adobe, you will experience the atmosphere of corporate life at one of the world’s leading software companies, while learning how each of our legal teams drive the efficiency and effectiveness of our entire organization. You will be exposed to Adobe corporate culture, including our values which play a key role in Adobe routinely being recognized as one of the top global software companies for work experiences. What You'll Do This Legal Intern will be handling complex commercial contracts, including enterprise software & SaaS licensing agreements. This Legal Intern must be prepared to work on negotiating and driving strategic transactions, including a variety of license, professional services and other commercial agreements and documents, including non-disclosure agreements, pre-release agreements, services agreements as well as statements of work, resale, distribution, sales and licensing agreements. What You Need to Succeed Must be a 2nd-year law student in good standing pursuing the degree of Juris Doctor at an ABA accredited law school. Must have a strong academic record as well as experience that demonstrates extraordinary promise for a successful career in the legal profession. Must have a can-do attitude, be able to provide solutions that balance legal and business concerns, be customer-focused, and an excellent teammate. Desire to learn about Adobe products and services and a genuine passion for innovative and influential technologies. Confidence providing advice to business partners of multiple levels, including a highly developed ability to provide such advice in a non-disruptive manner. Strong written and verbal communications skills and not be afraid to network and get to know new people. Digital literacy skills including word processing, researching, database creation, slide preparation, etc. Ability to self-start and work independently. This internship opportunity is anticipated to last up to three months between the months of May and July in 2022. jobTitle: 2023 Intern - Sales Platform Engineering - Computer Scientist Intern
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity As a Computer Scientist Intern – you will work directly with architects and developers within the Adobe Technical Services (ATS) organization. ATS Enterprise Solution Services (ESS) develops and maintains a portfolio of applications that enables Adobe enterprise business to run day to day operations from marketing to customer support. The position will focus on picking an exciting enterprise problem and building a prototype to address it. The challenges range from performance optimization of existing Sales Platform systems, integrating with sales and partner systems, automating provisioning of complex cloud-based products and many others. What you'll Do Work with internal business operations partners and technology teams to understand business and technical requirements Collaborate with architecture and engineering teams to brainstorm and document a high-level design Select a technology mix based on Adobe stack that includes AWS, Azure and other vendor and internally developed frameworks then follow through to implementation of a prototype Demonstrate the developed prototype to team members and assess its performance and fitWhat you need to succeed Graduate student pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Information Technology with some technical experience Ability to generate and implement designs while making necessary assumptions when faced with incomplete requirements Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment A proficiency in any one of the popular languages Java, C#, Python, JS Experience integrating with REST based cloud services Ability to drive actions while working independently Willingness to try new technologies Candidate should have excellent leadership and interpersonal skills to work across various levels Superb communication skills (written & oral) At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Engineer interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products. Adobe software engineer interns can work directly on products for our Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, or Experience Cloud teams, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation. Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Additional responsibilities as needed based on specific role or teamWhat You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer, or equivalent experience required Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills Previous related experience in software engineering (applicable coursework, projects, internships, etc.) Proficiency and experience with at least one or more of the following: Java, C++, JavaScript, Python Familiar with the software development lifecycle - designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining web and mobile apps Results-oriented, with ability and interest in learning new technologies and adapting quickly to new requirements and environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Engineer interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products. Adobe software engineer interns can work directly on products for our Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, or Experience Cloud teams, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation. Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Engineer interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products. Adobe software engineer interns can work directly on products for our Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, or Experience Cloud teams, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site What You’ll Do Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation. Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Additional responsibilities as needed based on specific role or team What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer, or equivalent experience required MS/bachelor programs for MIS (Management Information System), Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science curriculums Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills Previous related experience in software engineering (applicable coursework, projects, internships, etc.) Proficiency and experience with at least one or more of the following: Java, C++, JavaScript, Python Some tools and languages that would be helpful are SQL, Python, SAS, R, PowerBI, Tableau and Visio Familiar with the software development lifecycle - designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining web and mobile apps Results-oriented, with ability and interest in learning new technologies and adapting quickly to new requirements and environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $0 - $0 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Adobe is looking for a Machine Learning intern who will apply AI and machine learning techniques to big-data problems to help Adobe better understand, lead and optimize the experience of its customers. By using predictive models, experimental design methods, and optimization techniques, the candidate will be working on the research and development of exciting projects like real-time online media optimization, sales operation analytics, customer churn scoring and management, customer understanding, product recommendation and customer lifetime value prediction. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do: Develop predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems with statistical modeling, machine learning, and analytics techniques. Develop and implement scalable, efficient, and interpretable modeling algorithms that can work with large-scale data in production systems Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to develop new products and features. What You Need to Succeed: Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering; or equivalent experience required Good understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning, or data analytics concepts. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java and C Familiar with one or more machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as R, Matlab and scikit learn Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability. Excellent communication, relationship skills and a team player Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands— everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity The Services Sales Excellence team’s mission is to create positive business impact by simplifying and continuously improving Adobe sales motions while empowering and activating our sellers with proven best-in-class strategies and tools. As a Services Sales Operations Manager (SSOM) intern, you are able think analytically and drive data and insights critical to the business. You would be a trusted business advisor, driving operational rigor, go-to-market planning, and execution. Joining the Sales Excellence team you will participate in programs that impact our Services Sales Business including: Analytics of Account Plans to Action Deep dive into account plan analytics to then match specific op needs to our internal eco-system, Marketing, SA, delivery. With emphasis on Sales Innovation Cohorts Business Impact: Proactive deal acceleration and maturing sellers to continuous account plan. The more proactive the sellers are the more we can support them. Content Interface & Tagging (Tied to Analytics of Account Plans to Action) Improve interface and tagging on seller assets. Aggregate content from disparate locations where possible. Take every customer success story and tag with consumable components. Business Impact: Reduce the time for sellers to find assets will increase adoption and improve the ability to create a POV and establish sellers as thought leaders. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a bachelors degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Operations Management or relative degree graduating December 2023 or May/June 2024 Ability to participate in a full time internship between May-September 2023 0-5 years of exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills, including conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations Ability to participate in a full time internship between May-September Demonstrated passion for digital experiences and/or cloud technology Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with people at all levels Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas both verbally & in writing Advanced knowledge of Excel Attention to detail and pride in delivering your best work Nice to have skill-sets in documentation, literacy, process improvement, investigatory analysis, and educational explanation If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge The Adobe Social team is looking for a university-level who is talent interested in growing their understanding and knowledge of creative strategy in the ever-evolving landscape that is social media, as well as producing original visuals and videos that speaks to our growing community of both new and professional users. This is an opportunity to learn the how and why different creative content is development for social channels. This person will be immersed in a team that identifies creative opportunities on social, as well as produce quick-turn, in-house social content across platforms such as TikTok, Instagram, Reels, Facebook and Twitter. This person will work closely with the social creative strategist to learn how creative strategy comes to life, and to take ideas from concept to finished product every week. What You'll Do Produce graphics and short videos for various Adobe social channels and platforms Work with a team of creatives and strategists to brainstorm ideas for social-first content, and to identify social opportunities and bring marketing objectives to life on social What You Need To Succeed A portfolio that showcases visual design and production skills. We want to see that you’ve been experimenting and having fun with graphics or videos. Ability to turn insights into engaging visual concepts A sense of humor and love for all things social media and Internet Ability to set your own timeline, communicate your needs to the team, and follow through on deliveries and deadlines Ability to collaborate across various functions in the social team Eagerness to learn and grow your creative and strategic skills Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop and/or Illustrator; bonus if experienced in Premiere Pro or After Effects a plus; Love for illustration, collaging, typography, or photography a plus

Position: 2023 Intern - Software Engineer Req ID: R131681 Business Unit: Adobe Stock Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands— everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create breathtaking and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity The Behance team is looking for a product-minded Software Engineering Intern to help us deliver more experiences to our users! As a part of the Behance team, your work will affect the creative world every day. You'll play a role in improving the lives of millions of creatives and the industry through our product, the Behance Network. Our hardworking team of designers, developers, and community managers work hand-in-hand to create products that connect and empower the creative world. Our front-end developers are tasked with delivering appealing and highly usable interactions in our products. As part of this role, you'll work directly with designers, community managers and other developers to implement new features and improvements within our products. We focus on using standard methodologies and innovative tools to create maintainable, modular and impactful code. Being focused on building features that encourage creators to showcase their best work and easily discover the creations of others, you'll be involved in gaining insights about how our products are actually used and participate in investigating new ways to deliver more to our users. Do you get excited about solving complex problems and enjoy the freedom of going as deep in the stack as the feature calls for? Are you a curious developer who loves to learn and experiment? From working closely with designers to solving interesting technical problems, this role is all about finding creative solutions to real world problems. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation. Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Additional responsibilities as needed based on specific role or team If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. Position:2023 University Intern- Software Engineer Req ID: R131736 Business Unit: Creative Cloud Services Location: Seattle Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We’re passionate about empowering people to create appealing and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. The Opportunity Adobe is seeking versatile and passionate Software Engineer interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products. Adobe software engineer interns can work directly on products for our Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, or Experience Cloud teams, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless! All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office, so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation. Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. Additional responsibilities as needed based on specific role or team What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer, or equivalent experience required Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills Previous related experience in software engineering (applicable coursework, projects, internships, etc.) Proficiency and experience with at least one or more of the following: Java, C++, JavaScript, Python Familiar with the software development lifecycle - designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining web and mobile apps Results-oriented, with ability and interest in learning new technologies and adapting quickly to new requirements and environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills; can effectively articulate complex ideas and influence others through well-reasoned explanations. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking a versatile and passionate Software Engineering Intern to help build the next generation of experience cloud products. Working with data scientists, engineers, and product managers, you will participate in the design, development, and deployment of full-stack applications for various machine learning and AI products in Adobe Experience Platform. These applications will help businesses understand, handle, and optimize their customers’ experiences. We work in a collaborative environment that has the flexibility of a startup but also benefits from the structure and resources of one of the most successful companies in the world. You are an excellent fit if you have keen eye for details and high standards for code quality as well as a passion for building scalable and sophisticated web applications. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You'll Do Help craft and implement new applications and features for ML and AI services Work with engineers and Data Scientists to provide a highly scalable and robust model management infrastructure that supports all major machine learning service in the Experience Platform. Chip in to cross-team internal and open-source libraries that will encourage and improve code reusability Work closely with product managers to prototype new customer facing products and features. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, or related fields within the next year Proficiency and experience with at least one or more of the following: JavaScript, C++, Java, Python Familiar with the software development lifecycle - designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining web or mobile apps Proven experience with Front End frameworks/libraries (e.g., React, Angular, Vue) Strong sense for and foundation in software design principles Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability Excellent communication skills and ability to work with multiple engineers across different locations Knowledge of machine learning and/or data-mining techniques is a plus Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Adobe Document Cloud's AI & Innovation Team is looking for Software Engineer in Machine Learning Intern to help with a variety of Machine Learning (ML) related projects. The Adobe Document Cloud is responsible for technologies for building, manipulating and consuming PDF files across a range of services, mobile apps and desktop products. The flagship PDF application within DC is Adobe Acrobat, which is installed on over a billion devices and opens billions of PDFs every year. Our offerings extend beyond Acrobat to Adobe Sign, Document Cloud Platform, and Adobe Scan. The team’s mission is to use ML to build new experiences with documents, across our entire suite of offerings. Our most recent public features are Liquid Mode, allowing a seamless reflow experience for PDFs phones and tablets; PDF Extract API for unlocking the structure and content elements of any PDF; and Table Decomposition feature in Liquid Mode. All products are driven by ML. Our team’s solutions are deployed on mobile devices, in the cloud, and on desktop. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You'll Do We are looking for a Software Engineer in ML to own and drive different tasks including system design, ML model assessment, building data pipelines, data analytics, visualization, system deployment, and the creation of prototypes to help validate our ideas. If you have a passion for shipping groundbreaking data-driven customer-facing features, learning new technologies every day, and working on high visibility projects with ample room for creativity, this might be a good fit for you. On the team you will join a diverse, lively group of engineers and scientists. The work is dynamic, fast-paced, creative, collaborative and data-driven. What we are looking for: Experience with Python and Python based ML/DL and Data Science frameworks including PyTorch or TensorFlow. Excellent coding, analysis, and problem-solving skills. Knowledge of ML Ops. Familiarity with ML services is a plus Strong communication and collaboration skills Enrolled full time in a Master's or PhD program with a degree in computer science or a related technical field. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

The Opportunity The Solution Consulting group sits within Adobe’s Digital Strategy and Solutions organization and works directly with Adobe’s customers to uncover people, process and technology challenges that are preventing organizations from achieving priority business objectives. Solution Consulting plays a hybrid role of business consultant and technology expert. We become trusted advisors for our customers as they embark on digital transformation initiatives. Throughout their journeys, we collaborate to create customer-centric experiences that are powered by Adobe technology and that transform their business, operations, and customer experience. Our responsibilities include identifying and defining business challenges and objectives through discovery, solution mapping, dream-state vision setting and storytelling, product demonstrations, architecture modeling, and proof of concept creation. Through these engagements we demonstrate that value of adopting Adobe Experience Cloud technology. As a Solution Consulting Analyst Intern, you will support projects that will help you to gain an understanding of the Adobe Experience Cloud, the Solution Consulting organization, and the way in which we engage with our customers. You will develop fundamental key business, analytical and technical skills while learning the cloud software business in collaboration with a peer-based team. By the end of the summer, you will have completed multiple projects that make an impact on our organization while apprenticing customer-facing Solutions Consultants. We aim to develop your skillset across storytelling, presenting and client-engagement. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’; you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols What You’ll Do Actively participate in customer engagements on topics such as customer-centric business discovery, vision mapping and storytelling, technology roadmap development, hardware sizing, technology architecture planning, and proof of concept execution Work with cross-organizational partners including sales, customer success, digital strategy, product marketing, product management, enterprise architects and solutions architects to develop solid customer pitches. For customer engagements, you will learn to connect the dots between the customers’ business problem and Adobe’s solution offering to demonstrate value for the customer and their business Help brands to fully capitalize on the era of digital transformation, so they can deliver personalized and meaningful experiences across all devices and channels for their customers through Adobe’s solutions. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Business, Marketing, Information Systems, or technology field preferred with interest in customer facing capacity graduating between December 2023 and June 2024 Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September Demonstrated interest in business strategy, digital marketing, technology, analytics or experience design through coursework, extracurricular activities, or work/internship experience Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills including conducting research, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively both verbally and in writing Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Passion for new knowledge, resourceful and able to absorb concepts quickly You enjoy challenges and learning about industry and technology trends You are energetic, driven and bring a positive, can-do attitude to your work Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge Our Talent Management Team in the Employee Experience Organization is looking to hire undergraduate students who are passionate about crafting engaging and exceptional experiences for our employees who fuel Adobe’s success! Our mission in Talent Management is to look at the end-to-end employee lifecycle and build processes and programs to increase employee engagement and business results. We are looking for individuals who are excited to learn more about existing programs and processes in place as it relates to the employee lifecycle: hiring, developing, retaining and exiting, and challenge the way we do things, bring in new insights and share your unique perspective to improve the overall experience for our employees at Adobe. What You’ll Do As a Talent Management Intern, you will have the opportunity to work on a project(s) that will entail cross functional collaboration with other teams in Employee Experience, work closely with the Talent Management Team and other employees. Depending on your skills, interest and business need at the time of your start-date, we will have you drive and support initiatives around technology, data & insights, or communications as it pertains to our team’s programs. You will have plenty of opportunity to network with other interns, employees, and leaders during your summer. At the end of your internship, you will have the opportunity to present your project to our Global Talent & Diversity and Inclusion Leadership Team. What You Need To Succeed Prefer Human Resources, Business or Communications major. Excellent professional communication skills. Must be highly motivated, meticulous, and organized. Ability to work both individually and as a team-player; and interact well with peers and business partners. Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university and actively pursuing a Bachelor’s degree. Must have at least a quarter or semester left of college after the summer internship. Past internship experience is a plus. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Experience a day in the life at Adobe At Adobe, we believe in hiring the very best and are committed to creating exceptional work experiences for all. We realize that great ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. Do you want to work in a fun, fast-moving creative group? If so, this opportunity is for you! We are a small but nimble group within the HR and Global Talent Operations team that works across all groups to look for ways we can collectively complete our critical initiatives. This internship will provide exposure to Interview coordination, offer creation and delivery to the hire process. This exciting internship will focus on providing recommendations for improvements to increased performance and candidate experience. At the end of your internship, you will have the opportunity to present your project to our Global Talent Operations Leadership Team. What You'll Do Work under the supervision of the Senior Manager, Talent Operations, partner with Talent Acquisition, Employee Resource Center, IT and Global Workspace to improve Onboarding Workflows Present Talent data insights Engage with team members to understand and map out process and systems Look for opportunities to streamline efforts and improve processes. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to achieve optimal work production Be instrumental in how we streamline process and improve the onboarding workflows for our new hires What You Need To Succeed Self-motivated and have an enthusiastic “can-do” attitude with passion for learning and growing Analytical skills and attention to detail Proficiency with Excel and Word Ability to collaborate with other teams across the organization Excellent problem-solving skills Strong oral and written communication skills

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Dynamics Transformation Program is a digital transformation of Adobe’s end-to-end processes with the purpose of supporting Adobe’s ability to scale and unlock future innovation while improving employee, customer, and partner experience. The program re-imagines Adobe’s end-to-end processes, consolidating systems, including CRMs, and creating consistencies in technologies to support a forward thinking, digitized transformation aligned with Adobe’s strategic priorities and revenue goals. We will embody this purpose by bringing leading practices in innovation to each phase of the program, enabling the consolidation and automation of Adobe technologies and processes, supporting a more seamless acquisition integration process, and enhancing our ability to attract, sell to and serve customers. What You'll Do The Program Manager intern will work across all business functions, designing improvement strategies, implementing new operations, and supporting the execution of the company’s goals within the Digital Transformation Program. As a program manager reporting into this team, you will: Drive project delivery process with key contributors to help handle scope Build efficiency in communication and development process and guide the team to use project delivery processes to scope work effectively Efficiently multi-task, working across multiple client engagements at the same time as well as key internal initiatives. Work on exciting and relevant projects within the overall group Keep a pulse across all facets, transfer knowledge and the connect dots with appropriate team members across various functions Provide data driven status reports for broader audience, including program team members and senior leadership while identifying, highlighting, and providing solutions to exposure and risk on the program This is a very multi-functional program and will interlock with teams from security, engineering, privacy, and many other internal partners. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree or higher (Computer Science, Engineering, Systems Analysis, Information Technology, or related field is a plus) Strong verbal and written communication skills – includes excellent reporting and forecasting skills. Attention to detail is critical Analytical Thinking - capable of harnessing quantitative and qualitative data, you’re a born analytical problem solver who has experience of designing and implementing frameworks to unstructured problems. Strong problem-solving skills: ability to come up with innovative solutions to tackle difficult problems. Be proficient in excel skills with ability to build and manipulate spreadsheets, and financial or accounting experience to include analysis, auditing, budgeting, and resource allocations. Cross-functionality - a good understanding of the cross-functionality of business units – this will allow you to identify and prioritize areas for operational transformation, as well as create new business solutions. Experience of agile software development practices Effective change manager, attention to detail (without getting stuck in the weeds), problem solver, hardworking, aggressive, and willing to be hands on At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

The Challenge The Adobe Finance & Operations Organization is looking to hire undergraduate students to join our Treasury team! The Treasury organization manages Adobe's $5B of cash and investments, capital structure strategy, foreign exchange hedging, financial risk management, and credit. This is an exciting opportunity to collaborate with a senior Treasury team, develop technical skills, and capture valuable experience including, but not limited to banking, cash forecasting, investment management, partner strategy, and risk management. The role will provide an excellent training platform with exposure to the Corporate Finance functions of a global company, including our product business divisions, accounting, tax, legal and financial planning, and analysis group. This position is based in San Jose, CA. What You’ll Do Maintain and improve Adobe's treasury technologies such as Kyriba treasury management system ("TMS"), ServiceNow automated workflow process, and RPA/bot processes. Participate in ad hoc projects to improve current treasury processes and technologies that facilitate operational efficiencies. Work with the broader Treasury team on capital markets and analytical projects Lead projects to drive automation and operational improvement, reducing time to deliver, while improving accuracy. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled full-time and pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a relevant field required Past internship accounting and/or finance experience is a plus! Highly motivated and proactive Able to prioritize workloads and effectively demonstrate time management. Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel with an affinity for learning new systems Proven confidence and flexibility in multifaceted environments with the ability to adapt to shifting priorities Strong written and oral communication skills, as well as good interpersonal skills and self-awareness to work effectively with other team members and departments.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Are you a 2L and curious about what it's like to work in an in-house legal department? Come join us at Adobe where you will get to experience working on in-house projects at one of the world's leading software companies! We're seeking candidates that have a strong academic record and genuine desire to work on cutting-edge legal issues at the intersection of law and technology. As a Trust & Safety Legal Intern at Adobe, you will get to learn more about an area of critical importance for Adobe as we continue to expand into creative, professional and enterprise markets worldwide. You will also be exposed to Adobe workplace culture, including our values which play a key role in Adobe routinely being recognized as one of the top global software companies for work experiences! What You’ll Do Under the mentorship and supervision of Trust & Safety Counsel and other Adobe attorneys, this Legal Intern will work on a variety of complex projects during their summer, which may include the following: Assist with compliance efforts for new domestic and international regulations relating to content moderation, product and child safety, among other areas. Research emerging legislation and case law, and assess their applicability to Adobe products and services. Develop and update internal templates, policies and playbooks. Assist with special projects and initiatives, as needed by the broader Adobe legal department. What You Need To Succeed A 2nd-year law student in good standing pursuing the degree of Juris Doctor at an ABA accredited law school. A strong academic record as well as experience that demonstrates outstanding promise for a successful career in the legal profession. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, including a can-do attitude and an excellent sense of humor. A self-starter who is able to work independently. Be able to meaningfully contribute to the diversity of the law school student body and the legal community at large.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and execute across multiple design directions and workflows? Are you someone who favors interactive prototypes over flat mockups? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense, a curiosity about data, and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s products? This is your opportunity to join a dynamic growing team, think holistically about design, and help build the future of creative tools for creative people just like you! What You'll Do Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our data products and tools look, feel, and behave. Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it. Help re-imagine the design and data visualization process. From early vision concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery, our team does it all. Understand and advocate for our users. Work with researchers and analysts from discovery to detailed usability testing, always putting our users first. Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process. Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, product development family that includes analysts, engineers, and other designers. Ship. We ship. You’ll have multiple opportunities to bring the hypothetical to the actual. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Master’s in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required and graduating between December 2023 and June 2024 Ability to participate in a full time internship between May-September 2023 Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design or related fields. Experience working in teams with many moving parts. Experience working with or conducting your own research, presenting results, and acting on those results. Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Desire to be part of a fun, tight-knit team. Love for all things design. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September
