What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design or related fields. Experience working in teams with many moving parts. Experience working with or conducting your own research, presenting results, and acting on those results. Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Love for all things design. Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Are you a passionate designer ready to imagine, iterate, and execute across multiple design directions and workflows? Are you someone who favors interactive prototypes over flat mockups? Perhaps someone who also has a keen business sense and the ability to craft design directions that are creative and scale Adobe’s design products? This is your opportunity to join the Content Authenticity Initiative, a dynamic growing team with a mission to address misinformation and creator attribution by developing provenance-based user experiences. We aim to make online content more trustworthy through data transparency. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You’ll Do Have meaningful ownership. You’ll make important decisions about the way our product looks, feels, and behaves. Critique and be critiqued. We value a positive personality who can give and take healthy feedback, encourage and develop the team’s ideas, and generally leave ego out of it. Help drive the design process. From early vision concepts, to wireframes, to visual design and on to pixel-perfect delivery, our team does it all. Understand and advocate for our users. Work with researchers and product managers from customer discovery to detailed usability testing, always putting our users first. Grow. You’ll sharpen your skills, take ownership of important aspects of the design, and help evolve our team as we continue to learn and tune our process. Collaborate. You’ll be part of a communicative, healthy, product development family that includes products managers, engineers, researchers and other designers. What You Need to Succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s in interaction design, new media design, HCI, or a related design field; or equivalent experience required Previous project, internship or work experience in UX/UI design or related fields. Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Love for all things design. jobTitle: 2023 MBA Intern – Product Marketing Manager, AI/ML Services
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Interested in working on market leading AI innovations? We are looking to hire for our team in AI/ML services! The Product Marketing Manager is a key member of our go-to-market organization and will drive success of Adobe Experience Cloud solutions by embedding AI across applications. This individual contributor role will work with cross-functional teams, including field & partner teams, product management & engineering, business development, corporate marketing and other application teams to drive product marketing activities that is paramount to growing market share and innovation. The environment is very team orientated, highly collaborative and results driven. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What You'll Do Develop and implement go-to-market strategies integrating AI in collaboration with cross-functional application teams, with a primary focus on bringing to market Adobe’s next-gen marketing planning and measurement solution Work with business development and product management to influence product roadmap and integrations based on changing market dynamics and emerging opportunities Develop go-to-market collateral, sales material, and competitive intelligence to enable sales organization success Develop thought leadership collateral, messaging, and presentations for internal executives, industry analysts and customers What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in an MBA program graduating between December 2023 – June 2024 Strong ability to frame issues, drive appropriate analyses, and make clear, impactful recommendations Experience working in cross-functional multidisciplinary teams to launch impactful business initiatives in a fast-paced environment Proven success in dynamic and matrixed environments Outstanding analytical, verbal, and written communication skills Highly collaborative work style

Our ideal candidate will bring passion, fresh ideas and focus on strategy and operations. What You’ll Do Manage high impact projects to deliver recommendations and insights to leaders and cross functional stakeholders Analyze large and diverse sets of data to deliver insights and recommendations Present findings and recommendations to enable decision-making and prioritization Collaborate with product management, program management, and engineering to understand current challenges and develop analyses to improve our processes and execution Assess resource investment across the portfolio and provide insights into capacity constraints and recommendations for optimization What You'll Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in a full-time MBA program and graduating between December 2023 - June 2024 Background in strategy, operations, program management or consulting; especially in SaaS or Digital environments Track record of applying creative thinking and analysis to tackle complex business problems Proven experience analyzing, synthesizing, and summarizing data to develop strategy and recommendations Strong leadership, communication, and presentation skills Intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb concepts quickly

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Digital Strategy Group (DSG) works with C-level leadership at Adobe’s Enterprise customers to craft strategies for customer-experience transformation and digital innovation. Our engagements employ Adobe’s digital benchmarking capabilities, industry trends, customer-journey mapping, organizational assessments, high-level architecture assessments and other techniques to deliver high-impact recommendations. We also bring a deep industry perspective to the organization, delivering vision, published thought leadership, and aligning the ecosystem on an overall industry go-to-market strategy. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols What You’ll Do As a Digital Strategy Associate Intern, you will take part in multiple strategy engagements (typically 2 to 6 weeks each) for senior customers. For each engagement, you will be part of a robust team that is passionate about developing insights and recommendations! We seek candidates who can contribute in one or more of the following areas: Economic impact analysis — assess how improvements to customer journey and business capabilities will grow revenues, reduce costs, and generate business value. Size potential opportunities to prioritize short- & long-term recommendations. Help customers write business cases to quantify value and rationalize technology investments. Experience design — run ethnographic interviews and journey diagnostics to understand customers’ unmet needs. Build brand-new web and mobile app experiences that delight our customers’ customers and improve performance. Use Adobe XD in hands on workshops to rapidly prototype and test new designs. Analytics and benchmarking — use Adobe’s unparalleled analytics dataset to show customers how their digital business compares within industry. Reveal insights from their own reports and the corresponding actions to optimize performance and customer experience. Experience architecture — assess customers’ technology landscape and data strategy to understand current implementation and usage. Recommend new solutions, integrations, and use cases to enable improved customer experiences. You will also contribute industry leadership in the following ways: Industry perspective – collaborate to define Adobe’s perspective on impactful industry experiences by working with deep subject matter specialists. Apply that perspective by authoring thought leadership assets to drive demand generation, field enablement, etc. Be the voice of the industry within Adobe to inform product strategy. Industry & partner strategy – collaborate on Adobe’s strategy to deepen its customer footprint in core industries. Align the Adobe internal and partner ecosystem on the industry strategy and coordinate go-to-market efforts across functions. Develop as a customer leader and business leader! You will learn the Cloud business and develop your network as you collaborate with people across Adobe, including from Sales, Marketing, Product, and Professional Services. You will have opportunities to rotate across DSG industry teams to deepen your subject matter expertise as you execute strategy engagements and contribute to industry leadership. You will also engage with Center of Excellence teams that drive core tools and capabilities that fuel DSG engagements, such as experience design and value. What You Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in a fulltime MBA graduating between December 2023 and June 2024 Outstanding record of academic and professional achievement Demonstrated passion for digital experiences and/or cloud technology Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills, including conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work effectively with people at all levels Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively verbally and in writing High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb concepts quickly Willingness to travel up to 30% (actual amount may be less) Desirable But Not Essential Work or internship experience in a leading technology company, strategy consulting organization, digital agency, or marketing department Experience in UX/UI design, user research and design-thinking methodologies Experience creating digital/brand/media strategies along with a practical understanding of the technologies and tactics necessary for execution Knowledge of one of the following industry groups: Retail, Travel & Hospitality, Media & Entertainment, Financial Services, Healthcare, High Tech, Manufacturing, Auto, Public Sector  Experience with the following languages and concepts: AI, web services and APIs, HTML, JavaScript, Java, relational databases, SQL scripting Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity Are you good at piecing together narratives from behavioral and attitudinal data? We're looking for a forward-thinking and curious intern in Brand Strategy and Customer Insights. We help improve Adobe's marketing via in-depth evaluation of marketing concepts and experiences overlaid with a thorough analysis of behavioral data. We assess marketing journeys across channels and devices. We do this by talking to prospects and comparing that feedback to their observed behavior. We take these findings and map it into marketing strategy recommendations. In this role you will gain an understanding of how marketing impacts key campaign performance indicators like branded traffic and view through rates. Your work will guide partners on how to adjust content and channel strategy. What You'll Do Collaborate with product managers, marketing managers, and data scientists to understand what's working and what's not. Discern where behavioral data alone is insufficient to show efficacy. Leverage prospect research to fill in the gaps and explain the why's. Identify and quantify the best opportunities for improving marketing. Recommend changes to marketing strategy and executions. What You Need To Succeed Effective collaborating, triangulating, and dot connecting. Being naturally curious and having the tenacity to find the right kinds of information to unearth a solution. Piecing together a story from varied data and packaging key insights and recommendations in a creative, compelling way. Knowledge of digital marketing techniques and channels (e.g., TV ads, sponsored social media posts, website merchandising). Familiarity with marketing analytics (e.g., website analytics, last touch attribution models) An in-progress MBA degree with prior marketing experience. A desire to be part of a team tackling big business questions and having fun along the way.

At the end of your internship you’ll have experienced the PM lifecycle from performing competitive analysis, exploring the educator user journey, forming product hypotheses, identifying metrics of success, and bringing the proposed solution to life with design & engineering team members on prototypes and A/B testing on the Education Exchange. You’ll have the opportunity to partner with designers, engineers, other product managers, product marketing managers and our curriculum team. Project work may include, but is not limited to: Identify an area of opportunity on our roadmap to dive into, and how success will be measured. Build market expertise through market research, exploring competitive solutions to understand how we differentiate what the Education Exchange offers, in order to better serve educators. Demonstrate customer compassion & curiosity. Conduct user interviews, use on-demand user testing services, etc. Understand what a customer wants, particularly identifying their unspoken, unmet needs. Demonstrate creative problem solving through design thinking and brainstorming with design partners to identify possible solutions. Test solutions with users. Drive day-to-day product management, including detailed feature definition. Have fun and feel fulfilled by building on the success of our free Adobe Education Exchange platform, serving the needs of hard-working teachers everywhere. What You'll Need to Succeed Currently enrolled in a full-time MBA program and graduating between December 2023 - June 2024 Cross-functional management – You know how to effectively lead across and connect with all roles. You enjoy working collaboratively and excel at communication. Grit – You have proven perseverance toward a lofty goal through serious obstacles and adversity. Resourceful and imaginative – You are the person who always finds a way to get things done. Energetic – You bring energy and passion to your job and to your team. People want to work with you and hang out after the work is done. Strong analytical abilities – An uncanny ability to synthesize information from a variety of sources to make thoughtful real-time decisions Excellent Communication skills – You can clearly and compellingly communicate a point of view to executives and peers alike through written documentation or verbal presentations. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning assigned to an Adobe office location but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols.

jobTitle: 2023 MBA Intern - Product Manager, Creative Cloud Extensibility
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Creative Cloud Extensibility team is building the web-based framework to enable add-ons and integrations that connect to SaaS services and unlock new product use cases for the next generation of Adobe's creative applications, redefining the future of collaborative creativity at scale. We're seeking a technically minded Product Manager intern with experience building or working with javascript-based platforms to join a multi-functional group of product managers and developer advocates to re-imagine the future of extensibility for the web. We do it all in service of delivering useful and powerful plugins, add-ons and integrations to creative users around the world. What You’ll Do Work with cross-functional thought partners and stakeholders within Adobe, and with 3rd party developers to define the problem space and opportunity for key initiatives related to our next gen Web Extensibility Platform (WXP). Build comprehensive justification to drive product requirements definition, product planning and prioritization, and product design of key integration categories, extensibility workflows, and platform capabilities. Translate customer feedback and insights into prioritized product requirements with detailed user stories. Partner with product teams across Adobe to enable access existing cloud services and machine learning capabilities. Act as internal and external evangelist for the CC Web Extensibility platform, and advocate for a delightful developer experience. What You’ll Need To Succeed Currently enrolled in a full time MBA program and graduating between December 2023 - June 2024. Comfort in the “problem space” with a willingness to challenge assumptions, solicit diverse perspectives, and understand the "why" and not just the "what". Ability to ingest a wide variety of source materials like research, analysis, metrics, and customer interviews, and synthesize it into practical product & market insights. Able to translate creative thought into practical action with the team and tools at your disposal. You are the person who always finds a way to get things done. Can clearly and compellingly communicate a point of view to executives and peers alike through written documentation or verbal presentations. Enthusiastic curiosity about the latest technology and innovation trends. A passion for working with developers, learning about new technologies, and evangelizing amazing developer tools. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $0 - $0 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity The Digital Imaging team (Photoshop, Lightroom, etc.) is looking for a Data Science Analyst who is passionate about data and is driven to give customers the best experience possible. Tapping into our extensive product usage data sets, you will work directly with product managers, researchers, and engineering teams to harness our data, derive meaningful insights, and help lay the foundation for robust and reliable data-centric decision-making. You will have the opportunity to exercise creativity in problem solving by delivering inventive new solutions within our data ecosystem. All 2023 Adobe Interns will be ‘co-located hybrid’, meaning that you will be assigned to an Adobe office location, but in-office schedules will be flexible (2-3 days per week). All interns must live in the same state, country, and within commuting distance of their assigned Adobe office so they can be on-site as needed. Interns visiting Adobe sites must follow all applicable COVID-19 health and safety protocols. What you'll Do Extract and analyze data to understand the customer product life cycle and value realization from the product Analyze usage patterns to better understand customer behavior including acquisition, engagement, conversion, and retention Develop dashboards/reports that provide useful insights to business leaders Automate data pipelines using SQL or Python based ETL FrameworksWhat you need to succeed Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Master’s in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering is desired; or equivalent experience required Solid understanding of SQL and R/Python Understanding of statistical modeling/machine learning/ data mining concepts, and a track record solving problems with these methods. Ability to apply statistical/machine learning techniques such as hypothesis testing, time series forecasting, linear and logistic regression, random forests, etc. Knowledge of relevant tools in this field such as Hive, Tableau, Excel (Charting and Pivot-Tables), and PowerBI Ability to participate in a full-time internship between May-September

Role in Adobe Research Adobe Research is an ideal balance of academic discovery and industry impact. Our passion to invent the future and impact the present is what drives our groundbreaking work. Adobe Research is looking for brilliant minds who are excited about pushing the state of the art in future-looking real-time and edge AI technologies to impact Adobe’s products and future endeavors through next-generation experiences. We are looking for new college grads with a passion for developing the next generation of ML algorithms, inventing a future where Adobe enables new forms of creativity, frees people from routine tasks, and allows enterprises to understand and act quickly on customer and business insights. Our scientists and engineers are exploring how we can leverage big data to automate decision-making for intervention strategies and to ultimately understand the causal structure within our world. Our technologies help enterprises better understand and strengthen large-scale digital marketing systems. Responsibilities include working closely with other researchers and engineers from product teams to invent the next-generation real-time and edge AI solutions and develop prototypes that showcase new research technologies. Some of our research topics include: Real-time ML, online Learning, Edge AI Reinforcement learning, bandits at the Edge Deep learning, deep reinforcement learning, and representation learning Causal Inference, counterfactual reasoning What you will do Pursue a research problem with applicability to Adobe’s products, and with the possibility of academic publications. Develop new algorithms, run experiments, and produce demonstration prototypes Document and present your work, both verbally and in writing What you will need PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, or related field Strong peer-reviewed publication track record Desire to do world-class publishable research and develop advanced features for Adobe’s experience and creative products. Sufficient research skills and background in your chosen subject area Solid programming skills Strong communication and teamwork skills Working collaboratively with other researchers, you will have access to robust computational resources and world-class product and design teams, empowering you to see your work touch millions of screens across the globe. We are looking for world-class Research Scientists . In particular, we seek individuals with a passion for innovation through a mix of academic publication, collaboration, and the development of real systems that can be deployed into product.As a Researcher at Adobe, you will be joining a dynamic team of individuals to build the future of digital experiences. You will have the opportunity to develop creative ideas suitable for academic publication, to mentor interns, and to participate in our university collaboration program. You will also work with product teams to implement those ideas as advanced features in Adobe's world-class products, thereby reaching millions of people worldwide.

Job Description Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Role Adobe Research is seeking a research scientist who is a newly or upcoming PhD graduate in computer-human interactions with systems, algorithms, machine learning or NLP expertise. You will have expertise in the field, as evidenced by peer-reviewed academic publication, combined with hands-on research experience. As a research scientist at Adobe, you will be joining a dynamic team of computer systems, machine learning and deep learning researchers to build the future of digital experiences. You will have the opportunity to develop creative ideas suitable for academic publication, to mentor interns, and to participate in our university collaboration program. You will also work with product teams to implement those ideas as advanced features in Adobe's world-class products, thereby reaching millions of people worldwide. What You'll Do Initiates the design, development, execution and implementation of technology research projects. Investigates the feasibility of applying scientific principles and concepts to potential inventions and products. Plans and executes applied research. Maintains substantial knowledge of state-of-the-art principles and theories, and may contribute to scientific literature and conferences. May participate in development of patent applications. May coordinate interdepartmental activities and research efforts. What You'll Need To Succeed Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical field Strong peer-reviewed publication track record Solid programming skills, including C++, Python, Java, Javascript Desire to do world-class publishable research and develop advanced features for Adobe’s imaging, video, and analytics products

The Opportunity Workfront, an Adobe company, is the leader in enterprise work management. Together, Adobe and Workfront provide companies a single system to support planning, collaboration, and governance to unlock organizational productivity and create exceptional experiences. Workfront helps people do their best work so companies can thrive in a digital world. We are seeking an experienced Strategic Enterprise Account Executive – to engage with Adobe’s top accounts – who will be responsible for exceeding sales targets through the sale of Workfront. The Strategic AE will drive net new revenue as well as grow existing customer relationships within an assigned territory. The individual will be comfortable navigating through an enterprise organization to demonstrate cross selling opportunities. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, driven individual with a “hunter” mentality who will take ownership of a territory to drive significant growth. Successful candidates will have a proven track record of overachievement from closing complex enterprise deals. Come join the team! What You'll Do Drive specific product revenue within named vertical industry Accounts. Build strong, lasting relationships with customers by understanding their needs and business objectives. Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of Adobe's Digital Marketing solutions. Convert customer problems into sales & revenue opportunities. Maintain an active pipeline of forecasted sales to meet and exceed monthly, quarterly and annual quota objectives. Improve overall customer satisfaction in assigned customer accounts. Formulate and execute a sales strategy within the assigned territory, develop and maintain strategic account plans. Work with field marketing to drive awareness and attendance for webinars, seminars, trade shows and other marketing related events. Acquire and integrate industry and geographic knowledge related to general trends, emerging technologies, and competitors. What you need to succeed Minimum 7+ years of solution sales experience selling CRM, ERP, HCM, or web/digital marketing technologies to large, complex organizations (SaaS experience preferred). You should have the ability to forge and maintain good business relationships. You will need effective analytical and computer skills. We are looking for candidates with excellent communication and presentations skills with best-in-class customer service approach. Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/opportunities and recommending an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities. Ability to work well in a team environment, acting as a liaison with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Production & Marketing. Strong understanding of web technologies and the digital marketing landscape. Knowledge of marketing operations, resource management, project management and portfolio management market spaces, competitors and related industries (preferred) Demonstrated ability to sell enterprise solutions in a 100% remote environment through strong digital selling skills including effective written communication, social selling, and engaging online presentations. Discipline – skill in managing time and resources and a sound approach to qualifying opportunities are essential May require travel up to 40% depending upon the pandemic situation At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $226,200 - $293,800 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $234,200 - $304,100 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity Workfront, an Adobe company, is the leader in enterprise work management. Together, Adobe and Workfront provide companies a single system to support planning, collaboration, and governance to unlock organizational productivity and create exceptional experiences. Workfront helps people do their best work so companies can thrive in a digital world. We are seeking an experienced Strategic Enterprise Account Executive – to engage with Adobe’s top accounts – who will be responsible for exceeding sales targets through the sale of Workfront. The Strategic AE will drive net new revenue as well as grow existing customer relationships within an assigned territory. The individual will be comfortable navigating through an enterprise organization to demonstrate cross selling opportunities. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, driven individual with a “hunter” mentality who will take ownership of a territory to drive significant growth. Successful candidates will have a proven track record of overachievement from closing complex enterprise deals. Come join the team! What You'll Do Drive specific product revenue within named vertical industry Accounts. Build strong, lasting relationships with customers by understanding their needs and business objectives. Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of Adobe's Digital Marketing solutions. Convert customer problems into sales & revenue opportunities. Maintain an active pipeline of forecasted sales to meet and exceed monthly, quarterly and annual quota objectives. Improve overall customer satisfaction in assigned customer accounts. Formulate and execute a sales strategy within the assigned territory, develop and maintain strategic account plans. Work with field marketing to drive awareness and attendance for webinars, seminars, trade shows and other marketing related events. Acquire and integrate industry and geographic knowledge related to general trends, emerging technologies, and competitors. What you need to succeed Minimum 7+ years of solution sales experience selling CRM, ERP, HCM, or web/digital marketing technologies to large, complex organizations (SaaS experience preferred). You should have the ability to forge and maintain good business relationships. You will need effective analytical and computer skills. We are looking for candidates with excellent communication and presentations skills with best-in-class customer service approach. Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/opportunities and recommending an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities. Ability to work well in a team environment, acting as a liaison with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Production & Marketing. Strong understanding of web technologies and the digital marketing landscape. Knowledge of marketing operations, resource management, project management and portfolio management market spaces, competitors and related industries (preferred) Demonstrated ability to sell enterprise solutions in a 100% remote environment through strong digital selling skills including effective written communication, social selling, and engaging online presentations. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, driven individual with a “hunter” mentality who will take ownership of a territory to drive significant growth. Successful candidates will have a proven track record of overachievement from closing complex enterprise deals. Come join the team! What You'll Do Drive specific product revenue within named vertical industry Accounts. Build strong, lasting relationships with customers by understanding their needs and business objectives. Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of Adobe's Digital Marketing solutions. Convert customer problems into sales & revenue opportunities. Maintain an active pipeline of forecasted sales to meet and exceed monthly, quarterly and annual quota objectives. Improve overall customer satisfaction in assigned customer accounts. Formulate and execute a sales strategy within the assigned territory, develop and maintain strategic account plans. Work with field marketing to drive awareness and attendance for webinars, seminars, trade shows and other marketing related events. Acquire and integrate industry and geographic knowledge related to general trends, emerging technologies, and competitors. What you need to succeed Minimum 7+ years of solution sales experience selling CRM, ERP, HCM, or web/digital marketing technologies to large, complex organizations (SaaS experience preferred). You should have the ability to forge and maintain good business relationships. You will need effective analytical and computer skills. We are looking for candidates with excellent communication and presentations skills with best-in-class customer service approach. Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/opportunities and recommending an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities. Ability to work well in a team environment, acting as a liaison with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Production & Marketing. Strong understanding of web technologies and the digital marketing landscape. Knowledge of marketing operations, resource management, project management and portfolio management market spaces, competitors and related industries (preferred) Demonstrated ability to sell enterprise solutions in a 100% remote environment through strong digital selling skills including effective written communication, social selling, and engaging online presentations. Discipline – skill in managing time and resources and a sound approach to qualifying opportunities are essential May require travel up to 40% depending upon the pandemic situation At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $226,200 - $293,800 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $234,200 - $304,100 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Sr. Accounts Receivable Staff Accountant will perform various AR activities such as: posting incoming customer payments across multiple currencies and payment methods, processing customer account adjustments, and issuing customer refunds. This position requires cross functional collaboration. To be successful in this role, the Sr. Staff Accountant will have intermediate MS Excel skills (v-lookups, pivot tables, etc.). The candidate should be able to work in a dynamic team environment. Recent SAP experience is strongly preferred but not required (specifically, AR/cash-posting/doc clearing/etc. t-codes). Keen attention to detail, initiative, and ability to work to deadlines is essential. The Sr. Accounts Receivable Staff Accountant will also be involved in a variety of projects (of varying length, complexity). This role may also be involved any future business acquisitions and related e-commerce system/process integrations. Relevant prior experience is strongly desired. This role will be required to work with other business units within the company to resolve potential ecommerce-related issues, such as: duplicate entries or errors, missing or closed orders, missing credit card provider files, etc. The business units that this role would work with include (but are not limited to): customer service, Credit, GL accounting, revenue, and IT. Exceptional written and verbal communication is required. What You'll Do Daily payment application across a variety of systems, payment methods, and currencies. Process customer refunds and adjustments (write-offs, offsets). Journal entry preparation. Adhere to daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual deadlines. Be attentive to detail with an ability to work in an environment where compliance with processes, procedures & SLA’s is paramount. Investigate discrepancies/reconciling items and follow up to conclusion. Document processes and ensure documentation is kept up-to-date. Adhere to a strict control environment within the Accounts Receivable department. Additional AR tasks will also be assigned based on business needs & requirements. Complex GL & bank reconciliation preparation. Analysis and review of subscription customer accounts, including managing required clearings, adjustments, and investigations to conclusion. Assist with Mergers & Acquisitions, as needed. Has an integral part in our AR close monthly and quarterly close process. What you need to succeed Demonstrated ability in a similar or equivalent role for 3 or more years. Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related subject, strongly preferred Recent SAP experience (within the last 24-months) - specifically, AR/cash-posting/doc clearing/etc. T-Codes. S4H experience is extremely desirable. Intermediate+ Excel ability (v-lookups, pivots, etc.) Adaptability to changing procedures and growing environment. Other Requirements: Strong work ethic, a problem solver with a desire to improve current processes, self-motivated, highly organized and deadline driven. Exercises judgment within general defined company procedures and practices to figure out appropriate action Enthusiastic and excited to be a part of a high-performing team! Initiative to work independently and build strong productive internal and external working relationships. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Strong numerical and analytical skills At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Adobe Research Scientist Visit Adobe Career page to find open roles: https://research.adobe.com/careers/ . Apply below if you would like to be considered for future opportunities.    Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft alluring and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  Role in Adobe Research  Adobe Research is an ideal balance of academic discovery and industry impact. Our passion to invent the future and impact the present is what drives our groundbreaking work. Our research advances the state of the art across a range of 12 research areas:  Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning  AR, VR & 360 Photography  Audio  Computer Vision, Imaging & Video  Content Intelligence  Data Intelligence  Document Intelligence  Graphics (2D & 3D) \ Human Computer Interaction  Intelligent Agents & Assistants  Natural Language Processing  Systems & Languages  We are looking for world-class Research Engineers. In particular, we seek individuals with a passion for innovation through a mix of academic publication, collaboration, and the development of real systems that can be deployed into product.  As a Researcher at Adobe, you will be joining a dynamic team of individuals to build the future of digital experiences. You will have the opportunity to develop creative ideas suitable for academic publication, to mentor interns, and to participate in our university collaboration program. You will also work with product teams to implement those ideas as advanced features in Adobe's world-class products, thereby reaching millions of people worldwide.    What you'll need to succeed:  ·      Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical field  ·      3+ years of experience  ·      Strong peer-reviewed publication track record  ·      Solid programming skills  ·      Desire to do world-class publishable research and develop advanced features for Adobe’s experience, imaging and video products  Please send in your application with the attachments listed below: Resume List of Publications Reference check letters (if any) Call out your Research focus area on your resume

The Opportunity: Are you curious about cybersecurity adversaries and want to understand them? Are you passionate about data and the potential it offers? Would you like to use that potential in innovative ways to help Adobe get ahead and stay ahead of our adversaries? Join our newly formed Adversary Intel team in Adobe’s Vulnerability Labs! What you'll do: Build meaningful understanding of our adversaries by collecting active and passive intel Ingest, process, correlate and enrich data from internal and external sources to understand adversary activity Build a negative list of adversary infrastructure to help our products avoid adversaries and stay clear of them while providing a delightful experience to our customers Build ML models to detect adversary infrastructure not yet present in external intel feeds Research emerging adversary trends, exploits, and threats Help Adobe products understand how their decisions improve or hamper their resiliency against adversaries Publish blog articles and present talks at conferences What you need to succeed: 5+ years of experience with adversary intel and data engineering Bachelor’s or Master's degree in computer science, cybersecurity or data science Creative problem-solving skills Excellent data-driven storytelling skills Experience with data analytics and BI tools Databricks experience, a big plus Graph database experience, a plus Proficiency in Python or Java Ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced team Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $150,200 - $195,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Love to innovate while helping customers meet their online business goals? The Analytics/CJA Consultant is a customer-facing team member requiring extensive digital marketing and analytical skills. Analytics/CJA Consultant works to gather and understand their customers’ business goals. In addition, consultants help their customers realize product value by performing analyses, highlighting key insights and opportunities, providing specific direction to improve online metrics. They also help develop customer analysis and optimization teams, provide ad hoc enablement, build analytic reporting and dashboards as needed, and help Adobe customers develop their analytics strategy, governance, and operations. What You'll Do Develop relationships at all levels within client digital marketing teams and maintain regular and appropriate communication with them. Gain an in-depth knowledge of a client’s online business model and online marketing strategy and drive digital marketing success rooted in customer's business drivers. Lead customer discovery sessions and help guide client's use cases, business requirements and key performance indicators, and assist as part of a team to deliver against those objectives. Work collaboratively with a team of technical and business focused consultants to configure and deliver an analytics solution customized to the client’s needs. Provide measurable insights and recommendations to improve online business and marketing strategies. Help customers further understand and fully utilize product capabilities and the transformative power of digital marketing. Analyze marketing campaign attribution and provide recommendation for optimizing marketing spend Lead multiple client engagements at a time and establish expectations appropriately to keep projects on schedule and within scope. Engage directly with customers via phone, email, and/or in-person through the project lifecycle. Including interaction with marketers, analysts, web developers, IT, partners and executives. Become an authority in the use of Adobe products and the methods by which they can be used to efficiently optimize online businesses. Create thought leadership, write blogs, build training videos to enable Adobe and customers. Elevate and encourage fellow team members through caring, effective leadership, regular shared feedback, and mutual mentoring; drive continuous improvements in our ways of working. Keep accurate daily and weekly records of client billable time. What You Need To Succeed 7+ years’ experience in digital analytics or a related field Intermediate to advanced experience using Adobe Analytics, specifically Analysis Workspace Experience working with multi-channel customer-level data analysis Comfortable interpreting a data schema, querying data using SQL, and performing data validation Familiar with writing and executing API’s Proven experience leading unscripted live working sessions and demos Self-motivated, responsive, professional and dedicated to customer success Exceptional interpersonal, presentation, and soft skills – both verbal and written Ability to learn quickly, be an excellent teammate, and handle change efficiently Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience Up to 50% travel required Special Consideration given for: Experience with Adobe Experience Platform Understanding of other analysis packages/languages (R, Python, or SPSS, etc.) Web and mobile app optimization consulting experience Deep vertical industry experience Master’s-level studies in e-business, digital marketing, statistics and relevant analytics fields, or digital transformation. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $139,800 - $181,600 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $150,200 - $195,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Love to innovate while helping customers meet their online business goals? The Analytics/CJA Consultant is a customer-facing team member requiring extensive digital marketing and analytical skills. Analytics/CJA Consultant works to gather and understand their customers’ business goals. In addition, consultants help their customers realize product value by performing analyses, highlighting key insights and opportunities, providing specific direction to improve online metrics. They also help develop customer analysis and optimization teams, provide ad hoc enablement, build analytic reporting and dashboards as needed, and help Adobe customers develop their analytics strategy, governance, and operations. What You'll Do Develop relationships at all levels within client digital marketing teams and maintain regular and appropriate communication with them. Gain an in-depth knowledge of a client’s online business model and online marketing strategy and drive digital marketing success rooted in customer's business drivers. Lead customer discovery sessions and help guide client's use cases, business requirements and key performance indicators, and assist as part of a team to deliver against those objectives. Work collaboratively with a team of technical and business focused consultants to configure and deliver an analytics solution customized to the client’s needs. Provide measurable insights and recommendations to improve online business and marketing strategies. Help customers further understand and fully utilize product capabilities and the transformative power of digital marketing. Analyze marketing campaign attribution and provide recommendation for optimizing marketing spend Lead multiple client engagements at a time and establish expectations appropriately to keep projects on schedule and within scope. Engage directly with customers via phone, email, and/or in-person through the project lifecycle. Including interaction with marketers, analysts, web developers, IT, partners and executives. Become an authority in the use of Adobe products and the methods by which they can be used to efficiently optimize online businesses. Create thought leadership, write blogs, build training videos to enable Adobe and customers. Elevate and encourage fellow team members through caring, effective leadership, regular shared feedback, and mutual mentoring; drive continuous improvements in our ways of working. Keep accurate daily and weekly records of client billable time. Working hands-on with customers, you will drive roadmap creation, provide best-practices guidance, impact execution and growth, and help Adobe customers develop their digital strategy, governance, and operations. What You’ll Do Gain an in-depth knowledge of a client’s website and mobile architecture, online business model, and online marketing strategy Support customer discovery sessions and help guide client's business requirements and key performance indicators Design customized solutions and technical tag implementation strategies Generate customized digital analytics collection code and assist with its implementation and deployment Support client’s developers and third parties throughout the implementation process Validate and debug implementation and follow through on issues until resolved Light manipulation of JavaScript as needed to customize digital analytics solutions Guide key partners and drive client success based on clients most significant business drivers and Adobe's standard methodology Engage directly with customers via phone, email, and/or in-person through the project lifecycle. Including interaction with marketers, analysts, web developers, partners and executives Lead multiple client engagements at a time, and establish expectations appropriately to keep projects on schedule and within scope Become an authority in the use of Adobe products and the methods by which they can be used to efficiently optimize online businesses Self-enablement on all the latest internet technologies broadly and acquire deeper expertise on the technology that is unique in the team. Create thought leadership, write blogs, build training videos to enable Adobe and customers. Keep accurate daily and weekly records of client billable time Some technical writing and presentation creationWhat you need to succeed Bachelor’s degree required. Have solid command of how Adobe’s technology and other digital marketing technologies and platforms work together to deliver 10+ years’ experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (Analytics, Target, Audience Manager and/or Campaign), background in Adobe Experience Platform (Customer Journey Analytics, Real-time CDP and/or Adobe Journey Optimizer) or comparable products related to personalization, analytics, CDP/DMPs, and/or campaign management. We’re looking for an experienced antitrust and competition law attorney to join our global legal team! You’ll be responsible for leading and advising on a wide range of competition issues around the world. This is an outstanding opportunity to join an inquisitive, creative and highly collaborative group of world-class legal professionals. This role reports to Adobe’s Sr. Managing Counsel, Antitrust. What You'll Do Advise on a wide range of antitrust/competition law matters related to Adobe’s business activities including product and marketing, sales and distribution, partnerships and strategic ventures, acquisitions and investments, and other commercial relationships Coordinate responses to inquiries from competition regulators around the world Support all aspects of Adobe’s antitrust compliance program including trainings, communications, investigations, and audits Hire and manage outside counsel as needed What You Need To Succeed A passion for antitrust and competition law, a keen sense of curiosity, and a “yes starts here” approach JD plus active license to practice law in the jurisdiction where based 5+ years of antitrust/competition law experience with an in-house legal department, top-tier law firm, and/or government agency, preferably including experience advising technology companies on US and/or European antitrust law Excellent written and verbal communication skills and demonstrated ability to build cross-functional networks, collaborate and influence up, down and across the matrix, and gracefully balance priorities in a dynamic environment A global mindset, a sense of humor and the ability to thrive under pressure At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . jobTitle: Associate Senior Legal Counsel, Privacy DX
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We're looking for great legal minds to help us shape and drive the debate on privacy, marketing and advertising technology, big data, and AI. This is your chance to work for a global brand with an unparalleled culture where privacy really matters. This role will report to the Senior Director, Privacy , who supports Adobe’s Digital Experience (DX) business unit. What You'll Do Partner with Product Legal , Engineering, Product, Security, and Marketing team s to drive the development and implementation of Privacy-By-Design strategies for digital marketing products and technologies to address privacy and security risks while supporting product innovation. Serve as a strategic advisor to business leaders to help make privacy a competitive differen tiator for Adobe . Develop, implement and review privacy impact assessments for Adobe products and technologies. Drive projects to streamline and optimize t he privacy assessment process. Support Sales Legal and other legal teams on customer , partner, and vendor negotiations related to privacy , including by providing regular training , developing privacy templates and playbook s , and providing direct deal support for strategic negotiations . Identify and drive initiatives to streamline privacy negotiations with customers, partners, and vendors . Be a privacy brand ambassador on enterprise customer calls and in meetings with external stakeholders . Be a privacy evangelist inside Adobe to help grow our culture of privacy (e.g., conduct trainings, represent the privacy team in product strategy and design sessions). Assist with evaluating and implementing global self-regulatory and digital marketing requirements (e.g., NAI, DAA ). What You Need To Succeed J.D. degree and membership in at least one state bar. Minimum 5 + years of relevant privacy experience (whether in a dedicated privacy role or in product legal or sales legal role working on privacy matters) , including prior in-house or law firm experience. Strong interest in privacy law . Desire to dive deep on technical aspects of digital marketing products and technologies. Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization. Strategic problem solver with excellent legal and business judgment including demonstrated experience assessing information for risk mitigation opportunities . A meticulous, business-friendly teammate who can think creatively. Strong understanding and experience with both domestic and international privacy requirements . Exceptional interpersonal skills with a great sense of humor and commitment to professionalism . Experience working collaboratively and effectively with cross-functional teams .

The Opportunity Adobe’s Risk Advisory and Assurance Service (RAAS) function formally Global Audit is seeking an experienced Information Security professional. The candidate must have a good insight and understanding of the Technology and Cyber Security risks in line with regulatory and other compliance requirements. This position will be based in Adobe's San Jose Office working with the Manager, Risk Advisory & Assurance Services. What You'll Do Work under the supervision of the RAAS Manager to plan, scope, and evaluate the design and efficiency of the internal security and compliance controls (On-prem and Public Cloud). Support the delivery and scaling of the SOX program. Hands-on with design and testing of IT General Controls (ITGC) & IT App Business controls. Plan and deliver on technology operations audits, system implementation & integration reviews, M&A compliance efforts, and applicable advisory initiatives with full involvement in planning, fieldwork & reporting. Ensure successful collaboration and alignment with key business leaders (IT, Security, Engineering, Internal Audit, and Legal) for all Technology audit efforts. Perform Information Security related assessments to cover domains like User Access Management, Network, OS & Application Security, Encryption, Backup Management, Disaster Recovery, Training & Awareness, etc. Stay abreast of Security trends, emerging technology, and cybersecurity field developments. Prepare insightful dashboards and reports to demonstrate overall risk posture to the management. Prepare quarterly Audit Committee meetings/presentations/newsletters and other supporting documentation; prepare other CAE/CIO meeting presentations, as needed. What You Need To Succeed B.E./B.Tech/MBA in Information Technology, Information Systems, or similar. Minimum 3-5 years of technology audit experience with an accounting firm or large global public company internal audit. CISA, CISSP, CIA, CPA, or similar certification preferred. Experience with implementing and auditing security controls for Cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc. is a must! Knowledge of GRC tools like SAP GRC and RSA Archer is a plus. Exposure to engagements like Wireless Security audits, Network & Firewalls security reviews, OS & Infrastructure audits, API Security, DLP audits, Ransomware audits, etc. Knowledge and experience with information security standards (ISO 27001), governance frameworks (COBIT, NIST), and regulatory compliance (SOX, SOC2, GDPR, PCI-DSS, etc.) Capable of interpreting these requirements and translating them into relevant considerations for GRC processes, risks management, and controls. Strong organizational and management skills; ability to deliver multiple projects efficiently & prioritize tasks to meet project requirements. Outstanding interpersonal, oral, written, and presentation skills with the ability to comfortably communicate with all levels of management. It is essential that the candidate be an excellent teammate, self-motivated, and positive can-do demeanor. Ability and willingness to travel (approx. 20%). Strong EQ to effectively collaborate with people on shared goals. Demonstrated ability to navigate in a matrixed organization and to lead through change. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and to work independently and within a team. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to an always-evolving search industry

The Opportunity The Commerce team is responsible for driving Adobe’s worldwide commerce strategy & roadmap. The B2B product team’s mission is to enable world-class user experiences for B2B customers, make transacting and managing subscriptions with Adobe seamless. We’re looking for a seasoned and passionate Product Manager to join the team. As a Product Manager, you will work on delivering requirements for B2B commerce projects working cross-functionally across the organization. You’ll collaborate with a wide range of teams including other product mangers across Adobe product teams — as well as partners in design, engineering, program management, business, finance and legal to name a few. You are expected to define and build secure, end-to-end solutions. Possess a data driven and customer-centric approach to balance long term strategies versus short term tactical optimization opportunities. We are looking for an individual experienced in subscription commerce with an excellent track record of influencing and driving execution of complicated technical product requirements through multi-matrixed organizations. What you'll Do Articulate projected impact for each initiative to be prioritized on the roadmap Align key team members on vision, roadmap and prioritization of platform capabilities Write clear and concise product requirements that capture the vision and goals of new features to be used by engineering & design teams. Work to clear ambiguity, think holistically with an eco-system view and anticipating future needs for a long-term platform that needs to scale Work across many teams at Adobe to communicate requirements, aspiring for the best customer experiences and willing to make trade-offs when needed Collaborate with Engineering, UX designers to create innovative and streamlined customer experiences Evangelize and test new business ideas with team members; drive implementation to completion with key success metrics and business impacts Generate effective platform strategies to dramatically decrease time-to-market and increase value to Adobe and our customers based on insights and data What you need to succeed 5+ years of experience with subscriptions commerce software that serves SMB and Large Enterprise customer segments encompassing pricing, quoting, payment methods, invoicing, metering and billing capabilities Understands all the user personas & customer journeys involved in B2B Commerce and their unique needs Strong customer empathy, product ownership, bias for action and sense of urgency Excellent verbal and written communication skills in order to influence all stakeholders BS or MS in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent program from an accredited University/College is required; MBA is a plus Based at the Adobe headquarters in San Jose, CA. #BusinessPlatform-ALL1

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We are looking to hire an experienced Business Change Manager! Join the team responsible to improve the technology platform used by Adobe's field selling organization. This role will work with cross-functional teams to manage the execution of technical programs and help our customers understand and adopt changes that these improvements create. If you have a balance of people, organization, and technical skills and have a strong background in organizing or change then this role may be for you. What you'll Do Work with business owners and product managers to understand business processes; employee roles in those processes; and interpret the impact of the technology solution on the processes and roles. Develops and maintains Project Change Strategy (Communications, Alignment, Training, Reinforcement and Resistance) and detailed plans Executes program level communications for broad audiences Leads Change Agent Strategy and Meetings Authors materials to be distributed for particular interest groups' meetings, emails, newsletters to ensure messaging aligns with Program status and brand Provides Change Coaching to program leaders Align with the Product Owners and Service Owners for Project business goals/drivers Works with vendors on overall program change plan Responsible for onboarding of new project team members Work internally within a matrixed, Sales Operations organization, as well as with various cross-functional teams at Adobe to execute and implement the plan. Aggregate, organize, and communicate project information with internal customers and extended teams. Convert technical team documentation into cohesive process driven user documentation and enablement materials. What you need to succeed Bachelors in Business or Technology or 7 years of equivalent practical experience in leading organizations through change Be a self-starter that thrives in the face of challenge, clearing obstacles with a resourceful and creative approach to problem-solving. Ability to operate with guidance on new projects. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Attention to details, balanced with the ability to absorb large amounts of information and distill it down to the essentials. Focus on doing what’s right for the business. Ability to work as part of a team, and act in a lead role as a subject matter specialist, within a team environment to meet results-oriented goals and pre-defined measurement criteria. Maintain a high energy and positive outlook, with a contagious sense of humor that helps you to adapt to the changing needs of the business. Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how these will help the business.
