The Opportunity Adobe Consulting are building deep and impactful partnerships with customers by investing our best thinking and resources to offer prescriptive, original tools and thought leadership to help them navigate their digital trajectories. Business Development Strategists have ownership for the development and delivery of inspiring and thought-provoking workshops and other collateral to help customers on their digital transformation journeys, whilst generating new Adobe Professional Services opportunities and business. This is a truly unique role for the right individual! Workshop & Thought Leadership Development: Accountable for development of new workshops to drive new sales bookings, pipeline, cultivate cross functional partnerships, and help customers mature and transform their digital trajectory. Workshop material will include development of original assets to spark customer’s imaginations, and ultimately entice them to invest in actions vital to realize the vision forged during the workshops. Work outputs may include POVs, strategy tools and methodologies, maturity models, or whatever is needed to develop a compelling framework to entice customers to take the next step. Expansion of existing repeatable industry-specific pre-sales workshops to new industries, including the associated data harvest, data analysis, collateral, and asset production Harvesting of insights from business development workshops to help Adobe Consulting understand the first-hand changing needs of customers to ensure that our pre-sales offerings resonate with compelling, relevant, up to date messaging and narratives Responsible for creating new thought leadership on specialist subjects related to key sales topics to attract customers and drive leads for workshops. Thought leadership will include white papers, blogs, videos, and other media to help promote our brand and workshopsWorkshop & Thought Leadership Execution: Lead high-quality pre-sales workshops with exceptional executive presence Engage with C-Suites and Senior Executives with a compelling story to drive action and change, drawing out what’s in their hearts and minds, to influence the creation of new business Leverage storytelling techniques to draw customers into an engaging narrative and lead them to potential solutions to business challenges Cultivate a cross solution, cross-discipline, entrepreneurial mentality to jump between topics, and adapt conversations Harvest and track insights and attributable results to generate new pipeline and assist ACS Sales in closing new business Engage with ecosystem leaders and participants to promote workshops to build a sustainable pipeline of customersWhat you need to succeed: Experience with marketing technologies or MarTech strategy highly desirable, especially Adobe products. Experience driving digital transformation initiatives as a trusted adviser Experience in crafting digital or marketing strategies, along with an understanding of the tactics needed to operationalize them Minimum of 3-5 years in a similar role Strong executive presence and interpersonal skills, with ability to engage, encourage, and persuade senior executives, while navigating complex business topics A forward-thinking, adaptable self-starter with an entrepreneurial mentality to attract organic ‘pull' Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills including talent for conducting research, analyzing and finding patterns in data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb new concepts quickly Big 4 or Strategy Consulting background preferred, but not essential At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Workshop & Thought Leadership Development: Accountable for development of new workshops to drive new sales bookings, pipeline, cultivate cross functional partnerships, and help customers mature and transform their digital trajectory. Workshop material will include development of original assets to spark customer’s imaginations, and ultimately entice them to invest in actions vital to realize the vision forged during the workshops. Work outputs may include POVs, strategy tools and methodologies, maturity models, or whatever is needed to develop a compelling framework to entice customers to take the next step. Expansion of existing repeatable industry-specific pre-sales workshops to new industries, including the associated data harvest, data analysis, collateral, and asset production Harvesting of insights from business development workshops to help Adobe Consulting understand the first-hand changing needs of customers to ensure that our pre-sales offerings resonate with compelling, relevant, up to date messaging and narratives Responsible for creating new thought leadership on specialist subjects related to key sales topics to attract customers and drive leads for workshops. Thought leadership will include white papers, blogs, videos, and other media to help promote our brand and workshopsWorkshop & Thought Leadership Execution: Lead high-quality pre-sales workshops with exceptional executive presence Engage with C-Suites and Senior Executives with a compelling story to drive action and change, drawing out what’s in their hearts and minds, to influence the creation of new business Leverage storytelling techniques to draw customers into an engaging narrative and lead them to potential solutions to business challenges Cultivate a cross solution, cross-discipline, entrepreneurial mentality to jump between topics, and adapt conversations Harvest and track insights and attributable results to generate new pipeline and assist ACS Sales in closing new business Engage with ecosystem leaders and participants to promote workshops to build a sustainable pipeline of customersWhat you need to succeed: Experience with marketing technologies or MarTech strategy highly desirable, especially Adobe products. Experience driving digital transformation initiatives as a trusted adviser Experience in crafting digital or marketing strategies, along with an understanding of the tactics needed to operationalize them Minimum of 3-5 years in a similar role Strong executive presence and interpersonal skills, with ability to engage, encourage, and persuade senior executives, while navigating complex business topics A forward-thinking, adaptable self-starter with an entrepreneurial mentality to attract organic ‘pull' Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills including talent for conducting research, analyzing and finding patterns in data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb new concepts quickly Big 4 or Strategy Consulting background preferred, but not essential At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the significant benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $140,500 - $182,500 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $149,200 - $193,800 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

jobTitle: Business Intelligence Analyst/ Power BI developer
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more significant. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the elegantly designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight, and from insight to action by delivering content that people crave most. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world by numerous “best places to work” awards. We are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where open feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to build your career, Adobe’s the place for you. Every day, we get to work with some of the most creative, analytical, authentic and inspiring people in the world. We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you are passionate about leading from where you sit, join us. The opportunity We are looking for an enthusiastic Business Intelligence developer to join the Enterprise Digital Media Business Intelligence team. Adobe’s Enterprise Digital Media business is growing rapidly and represents over $2B+ across Adobe’s flagship Creative Cloud and Document Cloud offerings. The Business Intelligence Team plays a crucial role in driving the growth and success of this business by providing the critical systems, tools, and insights that our Sales and Post-Sales Field teams need to make our customers successful. The ideal candidate for this position is part developer, part analyst and part influential leader. As a BI analyst and developer, you will lead development of comprehensive dashboard solutions that provide our business leaders with the data and insights they need to make decisions and service our customers with excellence. What you'll do: Create sophisticated and intuitive business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI dashboards) which provide insights and direction to field representatives, management, and executives Effectively utilize the navigation features in Power BI (e.g. bookmarks, drill-through) to guide users through a compelling data-driven story Utilize SQL to curate and query large data sets, perform analyses, and create custom views Synthesize analytic findings into clear communications to share with key stakeholders What You Need To Succeed Degree in CS, IT, Statistics, or related fields; and coursework or job experience with advanced data and analytics 5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence and Analytics with a proven track record of creating complex dashboards and ability to conduct analytics At least 2+ years of experience in the Power BI platform specifically Exceptional ability to design and create data visualizations at speed that are intuitive, informative, and impactful and deliver insight to the business Advanced experience using SQL to extract data, understand data structures, run queries and analyze data in a data warehouse environment Strong communication skills and the ability to synthesize findings from analyses into clear, concise communications for business leadership Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel Team player attitude and strong ability to collaborate with colleagues across the globe Record of consistently meeting deadlines while working in a fast-paced environment and juggling multiple projects Experience with Microsoft Power Apps is a plus Any experience with advanced analytic techniques (e.g., predictive models, regression models, cluster analysis etc) is a plus Strong alignment with Adobe's Core Values: Genuine, Exceptional, Innovative, and Involved Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $110,000 - $142,800 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the elegantly designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight, and from insight to action by delivering content that people crave most. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world by numerous “best places to work” awards. We are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where open feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to build your career, Adobe’s the place for you. Every day, we get to work with some of the most creative, analytical, authentic and inspiring people in the world. We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you are passionate about leading from where you sit, join us. The opportunity We are looking for an enthusiastic Business Intelligence developer to join the Enterprise Digital Media Business Intelligence team. Adobe’s Enterprise Digital Media business is growing rapidly and represents over $2B+ across Adobe’s flagship Creative Cloud and Document Cloud offerings. The Business Intelligence Team plays a crucial role in driving the growth and success of this business by providing the critical systems, tools, and insights that our Sales and Post-Sales Field teams need to make our customers successful. The ideal candidate for this position is part developer, part analyst and part influential leader. As a BI analyst and developer, you will lead development of comprehensive dashboard solutions that provide our business leaders with the data and insights they need to make decisions and service our customers with excellence. What you'll do: Create sophisticated and intuitive business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI dashboards) which provide insights and direction to field representatives, management, and executives Effectively utilize the navigation features in Power BI (e.g. bookmarks, drill-through) to guide users through a compelling data-driven story Utilize SQL to curate and query large data sets, perform analyses, and create custom views Synthesize analytic findings into clear communications to share with key stakeholders What You Need To Succeed Degree in CS, IT, Statistics, or related fields; and coursework or job experience with advanced data and analytics 5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence and Analytics with a proven track record of creating complex dashboards and ability to conduct analytics At least 2+ years of experience in the Power BI platform specifically Exceptional ability to design and create data visualizations at speed that are intuitive, informative, and impactful and deliver insight to the business Advanced experience using SQL to extract data, understand data structures, run queries and analyze data in a data warehouse environment Strong communication skills and the ability to synthesize findings from analyses into clear, concise communications for business leadership Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel Team player attitude and strong ability to collaborate with colleagues across the globe Record of consistently meeting deadlines while working in a fast-paced environment and juggling multiple projects Experience with Microsoft Power Apps is a plus Any experience with advanced analytic techniques (e.g., predictive models, regression models, cluster analysis etc) is a plus Strong alignment with Adobe's Core Values: Genuine, Exceptional, Innovative, and Involved Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $110,000 - $142,800 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The challenge Are you a data-driven leader who is energized by the opportunity to design new products and analytics to power strategic decision making for a high growth business? This high impact role is for you. We are looking for an enthusiastic Product Manager to join the Enterprise Digital Media Business Intelligence team. Adobe’s Enterprise Digital Media business is growing rapidly and represents over $2B+ across Adobe’s flagship Creative Cloud and Document Cloud offerings. The Business Intelligence Team plays a crucial role in driving the growth and success of this business by providing the critical systems, tools, and insights that our Sales and Post-Sales Field teams need to make our customers successful. In this role you will work closely with key leaders throughout the Enterprise Digital Media field organization to deeply understand business needs and identify insights needed to accelerate growth. You will use this deep business understanding to design data visualization products and analytics that will enable our organization to capture these insights and accelerate growth. You will then partner with the Business Intelligence engineers and analysts who will build these solutions and execute on your vision. What you'll do: Work closely with key leaders in the Enterprise Digital Media field organization to understand business needs and identify additional opportunities for data solutions to accelerate growth and organizational efficiency Drive vision and strategy for the business intelligence and analytics tools and systems Dig into our data and deeply understand what data is available and how it is organized and identify new data sources to bring additional insight to the organization Lead the design, development, and implementation of Business Intelligence solutions across both data visualization systems and advanced analytics Define product requirements and provide detailed written specifications for each solution to guide the development process Work closely with the Business Intelligence engineers and data analysts to oversee implementation and ensure that product requirements are successfully met Coach and mentor other product and program manager within the team What You Need To Succeed 10+ years of industry experience in data driven roles and 3+ years of experience in product management in data and analytics Strong analytical and business problem solving skills Strong communication skills and proven ability to work successfully with cross functional stakeholders Knowledge of databases, SQL and business intelligence tools Highly motivated, with a resourceful, "figure-it-out" approach Curiosity, open-mindedness, and an unfailingly positive attitude Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Global Accounting Office (CAO) Organization is responsible for Adobe’s revenue assurance and accounting operations, technical accounting, reporting of Adobe’s financial results and the payroll and equity teams. It also leads all aspects of the global procure-to-pay operations, travel and expense, tax and supports the finance organization to drive innovation through the CAO Strategic Operations Team. We are looking to recruit a Business Programs Manager to be a key contributor and catalyst to our organization. They will ensure that high priority projects in the broader Finance organization are executed on time and within budget while achieving the desired business objectives! The successful candidate will be part of a diverse, multinational, globally distributed team, will learn how a fast-paced work environment operates and be in an outstanding position to “network” through exposure to the team’s experience and cross-functional connections with senior leadership and executives across the organization. They collaborate in driving project and organizational change initiatives. They will also help to build a strategy, implementing and delivering training to ensure all teams optimally accept the change and training on Adobe’s Internal systems and processes. These improvements will contribute to adding value to business processes, system improvements and initiatives impacting cross-functional teams. What you'll Do Provide end-to-end change and project management services in line with outstanding industry standards and partner with various functions across Finance, HR, IT, Legal, Sales among other teams, to design and deliver high-quality business solutions. Design, develop, and deploy cross-functional operational improvement initiatives. Collaborate and handle workstreams in large scale business ground-breaking programs. Ability to understand the business strategic direction and translate it into functional and operational change and improvement plans. Research market trends and industry-standard methodologies to augment functional operating models. Proven record to build strong business cases for projects and work with the organization leaders on prioritization. Influence growth to drive key decisions for project execution. Map and re-engineer business processes to ensure that operations are streamlined. Collect business and technical requirements, build project plans, continuously oversee projects, and ensure that objectives and key critical metrics are met. Drive business change management services, crafting communications such as e-mail, video, newsletters, and awareness campaigns. Facilitate in-person training, proactively identify areas of resistance, and ensure all affected people are on board with the change. Work within a large team and on individual tasks. Work with different MS tools, PPT, Excel, Sway, Word, Visio, SharePoint, PowerBI and Teams as well as Workfront and various ERP tools. What you need to succeed Undergrad degree required; MBA preferred but not mandatory. 5+ years of relevant program/project management experience. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to craft executive level communications. Ability to develop new insights and influence business decisions. Strong attention to detail with an ability to handle multiple high-reaching priorities. Great interpersonal and presentation skills. Flexible and willing to learn innovative approaches. Ability to adapt and operate in a fast-paced and evolving business landscape. Ability to work independently and integrate within a team. Approach work with energy and a “Can do” positive ­attitude. IT literate with strong Microsoft office skills, sophisticated presentation skills a plus. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We are looking for a Business Process and Change Analyst to join our group! We are business advocates for creating a customer centric culture through transformational change and continuous process improvement within the team and across the organization. We engage in complex, cross-functional, high-visibility system, process and integration projects, or other process improvement and/or risk mitigation projects that align with the Company’s strategic goals. What You'll Do This is a highly visible and influential role, driving organizational change, change management and business user testing. This is achieved by providing hands-on team leadership, developing strong working relationships and credibility with functional and IT business partners at all levels. You will be a coach and mentor for functional change agents and managers leading the people side of change, bringing your experience and expertise to develop and be responsible for execution of project specific change strategies, change management and training plans. Leading successful business user acceptance testing is another strength you'll need, from pre-planning through to execution and launch. You will have a good understanding of the end-to-end business processes to assess testing scope, identify, onboard and train testers as well as anticipate and manage risk. During execution, you will be the conduit between business and IT, managing bug resolution and escalation, supporting users and preparing daily status reports. You may also partner with and facilitate multi-functional project teams to analyze business processes to identify, document and drive policy, process and system improvements, defining the end state vision for new or acquired business models and leading projects to implement recommendations. What You Need To Succeed BA/BS, or equivalent practical experience, with 1-3 years of proven experience in Business Operations, Strategy, or Change management at a top management consulting firm, SaaS organization, or financial services institution Excellent communication, listening and interpersonal skills at all levels of the organization Strong ability to influence and partner with key stakeholders, generating credibility and trust Comfortable with different and challenging personalities; ability to handle difficult or sensitive situations with tact and professionalism Proven confidence and flexibility in dynamic environments with ability to adapt to shifting priorities Strong organizational, analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills with great attention to detail Must be passionate about process re-engineering, process improvement, influencing teams to become customer oriented. Looks for continuous improvement, challenges the status-quo Prosci or other change management certification a plus

The Opportunity Adobe purchases products and services from thousands of suppliers each year. We aim to accelerate Adobe's continued commercial success through outstanding strategic sourcing. You will have the chance to lead sourcing projects while you partner with internal teams and suppliers to optimize spend across Adobe's indirect categories. What You'll Do Serve as a liaison with internal business partners and external suppliers in the strategies and execution of sophisticated and impactful sourcing projects related to Adobe’s consumption of 3rd party software. Build strong trusted relationships with senior internal partners through understanding their objectives and bridging them with those of Global Strategic Sourcing (GSS) Proactively seek value-creating opportunities across spend categories Oversee the process of disseminating and following contract obligations, and instituting a complete strategy to approach renewal. Demonstrates expertise in software trends and commercial models, and apt to train others on the same across the organization. Develop, issue, and coordinate RFx activity and lead commercial negotiations to find the best sourcing solution for Adobe. Ensure proper risk mitigation through liaising and contributing with Legal. Help internal partners obtain robust Service Level Agreements (SLAs) to ensure reliable performance. Report progress on a weekly basis, indicating work planning and work in progress. Add agreements, service details and payment forecasts into procurement systems in a complete and timely manner. Drive continuous improvement and organizational change initiatives. Key contributor to the strategic direction of Sourcing/Procurement initiatives. What You’ll Need Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Economics, or similar (preference: MBA, or JD). Strategic Sourcing/Procurement-related industry certification(s) a plus. Preference: 5-9 years’ experience in Strategic Sourcing with an emphasis in software/SaaS. Deep market knowledge software contracting trends, licensing models, and business models. Familiarity with fiscal planning cycles and ad hoc financial analysis. Exemplify excellent emotional intelligence (EQ) and positively influencing various partners, and improving business dynamics both within Global Procurement and broadly across Adobe; evidence of continuous positive customer feedback. Growth mentality: aware of personal strengths and weaknesses; great at receiving, applying, and giving useful feedback. Mastery of MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Familiarity with BI reporting and spend analysis. High attention to detail and the exercise of sound judgment and decision-making. Has exceptional written and verbal communications, time management and interpersonal skills. Able to synthesize and present complex matters and data analysis in executive presentation views with insightful commentary. Must be willing to train and educate users in new processes, policies, and procedures or technologies. Handles own workload and priorities effectively. Flexible working times based on company requirements and should be expected at various times through the business year and quarter. As an Adobe Client Partner, you will have the combined Adobe Services Sales and Delivery ownership for a top, named Pharma/ Healthcare Adobe Services customers. You will be accountable for all Adobe Services activity with those customers, and lead all aspects of the strategy, execution, and growth of Adobe’s Services business in those accounts. You will execute across the entire people, process and technology change/transformation fabric with an industry or customer practitioner lens for your assigned account(s) and drive quantifiable, aligned external customer value. What You'll Do Holistic Services Account Ownership Accountable for bookings, revenue, growth, and margin execution and forecasting for one of Adobe’s top Pharma/ Healthcare customers Drive and be accountable for all Adobe Services business growth of the install based within assigned account(s) via identification of key digital transformation, expansion, and situational opportunities Executes and accountable for all Adobe Services engagements within assigned account(s) via delivery of customer commitments to value and Adobe Services revenue and profit margin Act as focal point for customer executive alignment and with any customer partners as part of the customer’s broader ecosystem (as applicable) Be a practitioner within your assigned account(s) through an external and industry-informed lens on how to position, execute, and optimize a digital transformation across people, process, and technology Accountable for customer value delivery, opportunity identification, and building a sustainable pipeline of new opportunities Accountable for internal Adobe Services strategy, communications, and execution while aligning with broader Adobe License strategy to support a One Adobe front Build on the foundation and trust furthered through successful Adobe Services delivery to drive perennial renewal and expansion of Adobe’s Services relationship with existing customers, grounded in deep understanding of the customer’s objectives and familiarity with the scope, activities, and resources needed to fulfill those objectives Partner with the Adobe Services sales support team (Solution Architecture, Delivery, Customer Success, etc.) and Adobe Services Sales Operations ecosystem to drive the end-to-end deal process including opportunity identification, proposal creation, contracting, and closure of all opportunities Services Delivery & Project/Program Execution Ownership Ensure successful execution and delivery of high-quality Adobe Services, resulting in measurable business impact aligned to customer priorities and objectives Owns revenue management and forecasting for a set of top, named Adobe Services customers inclusive of all projects within the assigned account(s), including revenue acceleration, backlog burn, expiration/extension management, and alignment with Adobe Finance and Operations teams for ongoing cadence of recognizing, invoicing, and quarterly closing activities Manages Adobe Services team inclusive of team staffing assembly, personnel transition management, personnel or process change management, etc. throughout the life of all projects supporting the assigned account(s) Responsible for consistent (monthly/quarterly) check-ins with customers to review (1) what has been accomplished to date, (2) current priorities and any changes, (3) unlocked capability and value realization, (4) alignment on key goals and priorities Responsible for scheduling, staffing, onboarding & transitions executed by the project team(s) and Adobe Resource Management team Accountable for customer health reporting and intervention management, including ownership and management of account and project-specific issues either directly or indirectly affecting Adobe Services Partners with Adobe Delivery practice leaders on resourcing needs, technology gaps, solution-specific pre-sales support, and Adobe Product team engagement Individual Contribution to the Adobe Services Business Deliver on individual bookings and revenue quotas based on assigned account(s) inclusive of forecasting accuracy Generating industry vertical thought leadership, driving Adobe’s focus on customer executives and public audiences, and supporting Adobe’s ecosystem of industry expertise Break new ground and take initiative to work in coordination with specified partners to build a balanced pipeline and grow and evolve the business Be a leader, champion, and mentor (as needed) to the Adobe Services ecosystem supporting your assigned account(s) What You Need To Succeed 5 to 15+ years of previous consulting experience or customer delivery experience of large programs, including value or results delivery (e.g., sales, revenue, ROI, contribution margin etc.) Prior experience in business development or services sales, including a consistent record for attaining and exceeding annual quota Strong organizational and leadership capabilities with ability to lead and empower high-caliber teams across people, process and technology transformation Experience collaborating and leading in a matrix-organization with a focus on team building and leadership Strong business acumen with ability to speak to value drivers and use cases in customer's context via experience-based story telling Ability to effectively navigate complex client situations and expansive partner ecosystems Ability to gather and analyze client situations to generate hypotheses acting as a change agent for our clients and within Adobe Services Strong executive presence with the ability to influence without authority Excels and adept in all forms of communication skills: verbal, written and presentation Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving abilities Bachelor’s degree with a preferred MBA Digital marketing experience is preferred Adobe is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Adobe's Cloud Engineering team is looking for a Software Engineer to help build the Kubernetes based cloud infrastructure that spans across the world and on 2 different cloud providers. This individual will work closely with teams in Document Cloud engineering, TechGRC, CloudTech, and others to provide reliable, secure impactful services to our customers. We are passionate about what we do and are looking for experienced, motivated people to join a hardworking team. We believe in diversity and encourage all to apply. The successful candidate should have a strong interest in learning new technologies, working independently, and the ability to drive complex and ambitious projects to conclusions. Strong collaboration with the engineering teams and an ability to thrive under pressure are key skills required to succeed in this role. This individual should be self-motivated and have a passion for quality. What You'll Do Build, challenge, and secure our automated, multi-cloud, multi-tenant environments: in software, process, and infrastructure. Help with designing features and architectural decisions Dive into system and latent reliability issues service performance and capacity modeling of distributed systems at scale Help improve the availability, performance, scalability, and security of the product. Improve our tools for continuous integration, continuous deployment, automated testing, and release management. Keep elevated levels of Security and Compliance with the Adobe Standards. Work in a Lean-Agile environment. What You Need To Succeed Desire to participate in the full lifecycle of a project from concept to completion. Knowledge of Kubernetes, Istio, Spiffe (good to know). Serve as a hands-on technical contributor to the evolving architecture Experience with cloud service providers: Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS. Good understanding of DevOps practices and the Cloud Tech stack Knowledgeable (or eager to learn) in distributed systems architecture. Effective communication skills. Align with our values: Genuine, Exceptional, Innovative, and Involved. Qualifications B.Sc. or higher in related field, or equivalent experience. Deep understanding of both software engineering and technical operations Experience in modern cloud-based, SaaS (Software As A Service) delivery technologies: AWS, Azure, Jenkins, Git, Atlassian Jira and Confluence, Linux, DNS (Domain Name System), E-mail, containers, log analysis, monitoring, Java, Apache, Nginx, Tomcat, Memcached, Qpid, and MySQL on Linux Expertise with containerization orchestration engines (Kubernetes) Programming skills, particularly with Go, Python, Java, and Ruby Excellent communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills Familiarity with Prometheus, Grafana, NewRelic, and Splunk We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! What You’ll Do Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code. Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation. Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings. Develop reporting dashboards and analytical tools to help Adobe teams manage their AWS & Azure Cloud resources. Build and automate data sets to answer key business questions using data and data visualizations. Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you. Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication. What You Need to Succeed Bachelor's or Master’s in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science or equivalent experience required. Proficient in programming languages such as JavaScript, Python & SQL. Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong proficiency with Business Analytics tools like Power BI & Tableau. Extensive experience with cloud hosting technology, including Azure and AWS infrastructure. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge Passionate about mobile photography and AI? This is your opportunity to work with a team that will be changing the camera industry. Adobe's EPG (Emerging Product Group) led by VP and Fellow Marc Levoy, is seeking a Computer Scientist to join our team in San Jose, California. You will be a member of the core team that is exploring next-generation product opportunities centered around the concept of a universal camera app -empowered by machine learning, computer vision, and computational photography. The effort will begin as part of our Photoshop Camera app, growing its photographic collection capabilities. If successful it will grow to become a technology platform for other Adobe products, with the opportunity for broad impact. Publication is allowed and encouraged, especially when validated by product impact. What you’ll do This team will work like a startup inside Adobe, making this is an outstanding “best of both worlds” opportunity. If you love having the creative flexibility and personal impact of joining a startup, but also dream of having the rich resources, cool perks, and global launch stage that only an industry leader like Adobe can offer. Your impact will include technical leadership at a level that is material to the success of the overall company, by owning the strategy of the future EPG products. Your actions will have a positive impact on customers, employees, and shareholders. As a domain specialist for camera software and/or hardware, you will provide critical analysis of potential improvements in these areas. As a specialist in computational photography, computer vision, image processing or computer graphics, you will lead cross-functional working groups or initiatives and provide consultative insights to other departments or groups within the company. Advocate adoption of new technologies and standards to the broader Adobe developer community. Research and build standard methodologies and share them with the organization. Mentor & coach junior technical contributors & aspiring principals. Develop groundbreaking image processing algorithms in C++. What you need to succeed M.S. or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or related technical fields. 0-5 years of relevant industry experience Interest in consumer cameras and photography. Expertise in research on computational photography and related topics such as computer vision or image processing. Experience in developing camera, computing hardware, optics and lens is a plus. Bonus - Experience in array cameras, or depth sensing cameras. Track record of setting strategy, defining roadmaps & executing on the priorities. We are passionate about product excellence Ability to influence & direct multi-functional teams without formal authority - demonstrating leadership to efficiently implement a sophisticated product or technical roadmap. Ability to serve as a respected advisor and counselor to senior executives. Can effectively and convincingly communicate ideas and objectives to audiences of all levels. Be an entrepreneur: It’s about making ideas happen; predict the future by inventing it.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. The Opportunity Are you interested in a chance to work on software used by millions of customers working with billions of documents? If so, the Document Cloud team is looking for a passionate C++ developer to join our team. Adobe Document Cloud is responsible for technologies for building, manipulating and consuming PDF files across a range of services, mobile apps and desktop products. The flagship PDF application within Document Cloud is Adobe Acrobat, which is installed on over a billion devices and opens billions of PDFs every year. Adobe Document Cloud is pushing the boundaries of Document Intelligence using machine learning. We are the team behind Acrobat Liquid Mode, which made Fortune’s Change the World list 2020 and is used by millions of users across the world! As we continue to expand our portfolio of products and services, we are increasingly investing in our core C++ libraries that power these experiences. We are looking for a senior software engineer to drive development of several new areas. A successful candidate will become a key contributor on a creative, inventive, and collaborative team with high technical standards and attention to detail. If this excites you, we'd love to hear from you! What You'll Do Build libraries that power Document Cloud products and impact millions of users Use C++ to develop powerful PDF engine technology to support a broad range of clients Design, build, test, debug, and maintain modern C++ code that is secure, multi-threaded, and performant Create library interfaces that are compatible with a multitude of use cases across clients and platforms Partner with client teams to integrate our technology What You Need To Succeed A minimum of 7 years of professional software development experience Strong experience coding in modern C++, with an emphasis on quality and engineering excellence Passion for writing efficient, secure, highly performant code Demonstrated results working in a diverse, global, team-focused environment Background in writing secure and robust C++ code Passion for collaborating with multiple engineering teams which are clients using your software Excellent written and verbal communication skills BS or MS in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent practical experience CPP-All1

jobTitle: Corporate Development and M&A, Program Manager
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe (NASDAQ: ADBE) achieved record annual revenue of $15.79 billion in fiscal year 2021, which represents 23 percent year-over-year growth. The company completed ~$10B in strategic & transformative acquisitions since 2018 including Marketo (B2B Marketing Automation), Magento (Commerce), Workfront (Marketing Workflow Management), Frame.io (Video Collaboration), ContentCal (Social Media Workflow & Calendaring), Abstract Notebooks (Collaboration) and Brio (3D&AR for ecommerce). Adobe makes bold acquisitions based on strategic conviction like the creation of the Experience Cloud with Omniture and Day Software. Adobe’s recent Direct Investments (Corporate Venture) include Skillshare (Learning Platform), LucidLink (Video Storage), Vidmob (Creative Analytics), Truepic (Content Authenticity), and Tiled (Interactive Content). This continues Adobe rich history of making 'around the corner' investments that can lead to strategic exits like Allegorithmic. What You’ll Do The program manager will support the business operations of CDMA by running cadences across business, talent, portfolio company / acquired company reviews for VP, Corp Dev, Executive Team and Board of Directors. This includes supporting the creation and maintenance of annual, integrated planning calendar, clear milestones, templates, and deliverables. This individual will also support Corp Dev & Adobe’s corporate reputation by coordinating external “outside-in” learning sessions with industry leaders and portfolio companies. This may include understanding the cadence of key industry conferences and facilitating portfolio / theme conversations with banks/VC/PE/Growth Equity. This individual will also be called upon to program manage confidential deal-related projects. This will include coordination across multiple x-functional, time-sensitive workstreams, including management meetings, event management and project coordination. There will be growth opportunities to also grow project management skills in a deal and post-merger integration context. What You Need To Succeed 3+ years of proven experience providing project and program coordination support Experience prioritizing multiple projects Interest in gaining project management experience (PMP or similar certification) Ability to succeed in a fast paced, ambiguous environment. Excellent written & interpersonal communication skills. Expertise in Microsoft Office Tools, including Sharepoint Previous M&A or Business Operations experience preferred.

The Opportunity The Creative Cloud SMB GTM team is passionate about aligning company priorities with strong day-to-day operations and help evolve early-stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. We drive the strategy and execution that delivers growth and sales success for Creative Cloud within the SMB segment. You will partner with Marketing, Sales, Finance, Operations and Product teams to lead cross-functional initiatives that result in improved customer experiences and increased new customer acquisition. Team members are collaborative, analytical, and strategic, with a pragmatic sense for how to get things done. And we have a lot of fun doing it! Reporting to the Category Leader, your focus will be Adobe’s growing SMB customer base, using data and market insights to find the best ways to engage with customers. We are looking for someone who can combine analytics and insights to drive data-driven programs and opportunities. The ideal candidate should have experience working in a large data environment and shown success developing, synthesizing, and communicating business and customer analysis. Areas of specialty should include digital marketing practices, data analytics, subscription acquisition and retention, and direct and indirect route to market sales models. What You'll Do Partner with cross functional teams to establish and implement business plans that deliver quarterly sales goals Drive efforts to drive customer acquisition and retention, measuring outcomes and course-correcting when necessary Work with analytics on the use of data-driven business models to optimize acquisition funnels across all routes to market Review all buy customer experience journeys, find opportunities for improvement, and drive cross-functional teams to deliver What You Need To Succeed Experience working with SMB customer segment Success in dynamic environments requiring significant collaboration, rapidly anticipating, and adapting to shifting priorities Ability to rapidly assess a problem, define options, evaluate, and implement solutions to address critical business issues Proven excellence in conceptual thinking and analytical problem-solving The desire and ability to take a stand and advocate a course of action, presenting supporting facts and data to back up your position Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, at all levels 5+ years software, high tech, or management consulting experience

What You'll Do Partner with cross functional teams to establish and implement business plans that deliver quarterly sales goals Drive efforts to drive customer acquisition and retention, measuring outcomes and course-correcting when necessary Work with analytics on the use of data-driven business models to optimize acquisition funnels across all routes to market Review all buy customer experience journeys, find opportunities for improvement, and drive cross-functional teams to deliver What You Need To Succeed Experience working with SMB customer segment Success in dynamic environments requiring significant collaboration, rapidly anticipating, and adapting to shifting priorities Ability to rapidly assess a problem, define options, evaluate, and implement solutions to address critical business issues Proven excellence in conceptual thinking and analytical problem-solving The desire and ability to take a stand and advocate a course of action, presenting supporting facts and data to back up your position Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, at all levels 5+ years software, high tech, or management consulting experience

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe Experience Cloud's Retention Marketing team mission is to engage customers throughout their entire journey to drive adoption and retention, ignite advocacy, and ultimately create Adobe customers for life. What you'll do This Customer Marketing Manager role will be responsible for one of our most strategic global customer advocacy initiatives, the Adobe Champion programs for Adobe Marketo Engage and Adobe Analytics. Success can be achieved with a customer-first mentality, attention to detail, organization, and effective communication and relationship building skills. [PROGRAM MANAGEMENT] Engage Adobe Champions and cross-functional teams globally to uncover new opportunities for collaborating with these best-in-class product experts for thought leadership, product adoption, content creation and ongoing feedback. [CUSTOMER ENGAGEMENT] Collaborate with Adobe Champions around the globe daily to drive overall engagement among members, address questions, and collect feedback on how to improve the program [STRATEGY & EXECUTION] Identify new ways to innovate and elevate the program, drive value for the program participants, and create opportunities for engagement between Adobe customers and internal product teams [EVENT COORDINATION] Create and implement Champion activation plan for Adobe Summit, schedule and host quarterly Champion office hour webinars, sessions with Adobe product teams, and the annual Champion Forum event, including driving and owning all aspects of agenda creation, securing speakers, event registration, communication, and day-of coordination and planningRequirements 3+ years of experience in Customer Marketing, Customer Advocacy, Customer Success, or Community building BA/BS Degree preferred Consistent track record of creating and/or leading high impact customer engagement programs that drive both external and internal value (e.g., ambassador programs, customer advisory boards, user groups, etc.) Customer-first approach and ability to understand customer needs to develop programs that support and align to the customer journey Strong program and project management background, including the ability to multi-task and work on several projects, often under tight parallel timelines Self-starter with ability to work independently and consistently deliver results Ability to synthesize data, derive insights, and use those insights to drive program improvements Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to effectively connect with customers and influence internal counterparts to an aligned position Strong attention to detail and commitment to driving high quality execution Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $84,700 - $110,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Customer Reliability Engineering TDO The Opportunity We are looking for an individual with a strong incident and problem management background to join the Customer Reliability Engineering team. This individual should be self-motivated, detail oriented, and curious, always looking to dig deeper and ask the uncomfortable questions in pursuit of improving reliability and the customer experience. What You’ll Do Work across Adobe product and operations teams to facilitate and lead incident response and problem management, ensuring that incidents are resolved quickly, the root cause analysis is timely, and cross-team coordination is successful. Break down complicated issues into core concepts and insights and communicate them to a wide variety of individuals, including engineering, support, operations, and product teams. Identify and classify problems and their root causes, supporting timely resolution to prevent recurring incidents in accordance with established process. Provide recommendations for improvement to services with the purpose of increased availability, improved service levels, and improved customer experience by reducing the number of operational issues. Look for opportunities to apply best practices to improve reliability. Perform incident trend analysis to identify problems and perform proactive problem management activities. Provide guidance for conducting Root Cause Analysis (RCA), evaluate the RCAs provided, and conduct trend analysis. Operate, maintain, and enhance problem management system and tools. Work an alternating shift schedule. Participate in an on-call rotation. What You Need To Succeed BS degree in IT, computer science, or a related technical field is preferred or 4+ years of experience in incident and problem management or equivalent practical experience. Excellent information management practices, such as detailed documentation, usage of wikis, and other collaboration tools. Advanced written and verbal communication skills, demonstrating the ability to effectively break down complex issues into simple concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to multitask in high-pressure situations. Curiosity with a willingness to dive deeper, ask difficult questions, and pursue all paths of investigation.

Position Summary Adobe Customer Solutions is looking for a full time Data Engineer with experience in building data integrations using AWS technology stack as part of the team's Data as a Service portfolio for Adobe’s Digital Experience enterprise customers. Customer facing Engineers who enjoy tackling complex technical challenges, have a passion for delighting customers and who are self-motivated to push themselves in a team oriented culture will thrive in our environment What You’ll Do Collaborate with Data architects, Enterprise architects, Solution consultants and Product engineering teams to capture customer data integration requirements, conceptualize solutions & build required technology stack Collaborate with enterprise customer's engineering team to identify data sources, profile and quantify quality of data sources, develop tools to prepare data and build data pipelines for integrating customer data sources and third party data sources with Adobe solutions Develop new features and improve existing data integrations with customer data ecosystem Encourage team to think out-of-the-box and overcome engineering obstacles while incorporating new innovative design principles. Collaborate with a Project Manager to bill and forecast time for customer solutions Requirements Experience as an enterprise Data Engineer from a consulting background 3+ years experience experience in building/operating/maintaining fault tolerant and scalable data processing integrations using AWS 3+ years experience in Python programming language preferably using PySpark Software development experience working with Apache Airflow, MongoDB, MySQL Strong capacity to manage numerous projects are a must Experience using Docker or Kubernetes is a plus BS/MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience Ability to identify and resolve problems associated with production grade large scale data processing workflows Excellent communication skills (we’re a geographically distributed team) Experience creating and maintaining unit tests and continuous integration. Passion for creating Intelligent data pipelines that customers love to use. Special Consideration given for Experience & knowledge with Web Analytics or Digital Marketing Experience & knowledge with Customer Data Platform (CDP) or Data Management Platform (DMP) Experience & knowledge with Adobe Experience Cloud solutions

The challenge This position is part of Royalty Operations and Data Management team and is a role that is responsible for creating and managing the material master records in SAP. The Material Master Specialist is responsible for the governance of the SKU data to ensure order transactions, financial analytics, and SOX controls are accurate and certified.This person will process a variety of material master requests daily to support product launches, project go-lives, and ad-hoc business requests. What You’ll Do Collect and manage implementation of system and mapping requirements for new Material Master attributes Maintain and provide reporting and mapping documentation to business partners Process Material Master requests in a timely manner Perform audits to ensure data integrity of all processed requests Support all UAT efforts related to Material Master record product launches, projects, and programs Manage SOX control evidence related to Performance Obligation (POB) and new Product Configurations Working independently on defined set of daily tasks with little need for direction or supervision Ability to take on multiple projects simultaneously Collaborate with cross functional teams such as Pricing Operations, Revenue Accounting Operations, and IT Should be comfortable working in the Microsoft Windows environment as well as an ERP system such as SAP What You Need To Succeed BA/BS and/or 5+ years operational experience preferred Expert in MS Excel Analytical problem solver Great attention to detail Proven flexibility in dynamic environments and ability to adapt to shifting priorities Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. The Opportunity Adobe Advertising Cloud is looking for a Data Operations professional who will be responsible for the development and maintenance of comprehensive dashboards, source data logic, and performing analysis to identify and resolve potential issues. The ideal candidate is an effective communicator across technical and business teams, and has hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL, SAP HANA, and SFDC. Success is this role is dependent on being organized and solution focused, motivated by operational efficiency, and energized by interaction with key collaborators. What you'll Do Enhance and maintain existing Power BI reports and data sources in support of multiple functional teams and leaders. Design, develop, and drive adoption and utilization of new dashboards and automation tools to streamline workflows and processes, and deliver actionable insights. Assist with logic development for source data, complex joins, and ongoing integrations and migrations of data platforms. Relationship management of internal data source owners to ensure alignment, adaptability, and appropriate access levels. Prepare and maintain documentation for current processes, model structures, and system update processes for existing reports. Plan, review and implement roadmap for improving current dashboards & systems integrations. What you need to succeed Ability to communicate and collaborate at all levels; translating complex information into concise, and high-quality insights that resonate. Expert at working with PBI, SQL, and data modeling. Some knowledge of working with Snowflake, SAP HANA and SFDC. Proficient in connecting to data sources, understanding application security layer models, and making queries in Power BI desktop. Strong problem solving and analytical approach; and ability to prioritize and lead multiple ongoing projects. Degree, certificate coursework, or 4+ years of equivalent practical BI and/or systems experience supporting GTM & Finance functions. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $105,600 - $137,100 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Degree, certificate coursework, or 4+ years of equivalent practical BI and/or systems experience supporting GTM & Finance functions. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Adobe Document Cloud Data Science team is looking for Data Science Engineers who can apply Data engineering techniques and help us build solutions that will drive the success of our Document Cloud business. The ideal candidate is an expert data pipeline builder with strong analytical and technical skills who enjoy optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. We’re looking for a candidate who is passionate about tapping into product usage data sets to derive impactful business insights and to support machine learning use cases at scale. One must be self-directed, comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams and projects, and passionate about designing a scalable data architecture to support our next generation of products and initiatives. What You’ll Do Architect, build, and maintain scalable, automated, and reliable data pipelines. Be an expert at maintaining data quality while stitching data from many different data sources Work with Adobe’s data ingestion, data platform, product, and machine learning teams to deeply understand and validate instrumentation, data flow, and processes Apply solid software engineering principles and tools for the pipelines you create, lead the data engineering lifecycle end to end, develop new features and improve integrations for data sources Support regular ad-hoc data querying and analysis to diagnose issues, understand customer behavior, and support maintenance Create a winning culture built on teamwork and shared accomplishments- have fun along the way! What You Need To Succeed Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field is required, master’s preferred Proven experience in building and maintaining data pipelines at scale using technologies like Apache Hadoop, Apache Kafka, Hive, and Presto/Trino Strong proficiency with software engineering tools like Git, Docker, Jenkins or Apache Airflow Programming experience in Python or a similar language Strong capacity to lead numerous simultaneous projects with a geographically distributed team Passion for creating robust, fault-tolerant, and redundant data infrastructure at scale Solid attention to detail, be a self-starter, able to diagnose and resolve problems with production grade systems.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge We're looking for a database reliability expert who loves building large scale highly available infrastructure. Adobe Stock is a service that provides designers and businesses with access to over 100 million high-quality, curated, royalty-free photos, vectors, illustrations, templates, and 3D assets, for all their creative projects. The Adobe Stock service is built right into Adobe desktop apps to search, browse, and add images to Creative Cloud Libraries, and get instant access to assets across desktop and mobile devices. What You'll Do You’ll be joining an engineering team who manage cloud hosted microservices and databases, primarily Postgres. You will provide technical expertise and data persistence standard methodology guidance to engineering teams as we create our platform of the future. The right candidate will need a keen eye for details and will play an integral role in the service with a pride of ownership for the stability and scalability of the data persistence layer. Candidates should enjoy tackling complex technical challenges with strong communication skills to coordinate changes across various and be self-motivated to push themselves in a team-oriented culture will thrive in our environment. What Your Responsibilities Will Be Provide senior technical leadership and expertise in operating the data persistence layer PostgreSQL management Contribute in all aspects of planning, modeling, design, implementation, support, and performance optimization of Adobe Stock data services Develop tools to automate the deployment, administration and monitoring of data services Coordinate upgrades with the engineering and management and applying standard methodologies for minimizing impacts on service uptimes Administer the database services, ensuring daily/weekly maintenance routines are successful, optimizing application level SQL queries Oversee back-ups and audits to ensure that databases remain accessible, secure, and stable Enforce the highest levels of security and privacy are in place Work closely and cooperatively with engineering, security, technical operations, product management, program management, and all other partners Be available alongside your peers, off-hours, to support the production environment What You Need To Succeed Bachelor’s in computer science or information systems equivalent four-year degree 5+ years overall IT experience, with 5+ years relational database management with a focus on PostgreSQL 11 and above Hands on experience with AWS hosted Aurora PostgreSQL / RDS Have solid knowledge of SQL and PL/pgSQL Expert at SQL database design, administration, performance tuning, clustering, and replication Ability to self-manage tasks and projects Excellent written and verbal English communications Excellent documentation Strong knowledge of database security concepts, capacity planning and disaster recovery Deep knowledge and experience with Linux systems Experience with NodeJS or PHP based application stacks Knowledge of config management systems like Chef and infrastructure as code tools like Terraform Have experience working in a distributed production environment Have a proactive attitude, when you see something broken, you can’t help but fix it At Adobe, you will enjoy an extraordinary work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. New York Starting Salary $154,000 - $200,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

design, implementation, support, and performance optimization of Adobe Stock data services Develop tools to automate the deployment, administration and monitoring of data services Coordinate upgrades We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! As a Deal Desk Analyst, you will work in a fiduciary capacity to manage first line approvals for Adobe's Deal approval process. This role includes analyzing and structuring sales transactions to further Adobe goals while reducing sales cycles in an effort to accelerate deal closure. This will be accomplished by meeting with Sales teams to identify Customer's critical business issues and assist in structuring transaction that meet both Adobe's requirements and Customer needs. You will act as the initial point of contact for Sales reps requiring non-standard deal structures and be the first line Controller review for all enterprise sales deals. You will manage the day to day contract creation and deal approval processes, meet with sales teams, communicate via detailed business case with various corporate partners (Finance, Product Business Units, Professional Services, Legal, Licensing, Credit, Order Management, and Revenue Assurance) to articulate deal value in a consistent manner, meet with customers during the deal creation and negotiation process, forecast deal status and communicate to FP&A and executive sales management. Performance will be based on an identified set of metrics and Service levels.
