Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The opportunity Do you have a passion for crafting enterprise product experiences that are innovative and fun to use? Are you driven to form partnerships that make them a reality? Adobe Design, our nearly 300-person product design group, is seeking an Experience Designer to help imagine how profiles and audiences across Adobe Experience Cloud can enable intelligent, predictive and personalized experiences. Join the team to build an outstanding, self-served application for our customers to understand and communicate with their own customer ecosystems. Sitting on the highly scalable Adobe Experience Platform the Audiences capability is people and privacy-first, intelligent and assistive. This role will be essential in making that happen! The ideal candidate is driven by all these activities: a passion for creating useful and beautiful design artifacts to convey visual narratives, gaining an understanding of our user-practitioners, and a curiosity about the technical structures that enable our applications. What You'll Do Produce sketches, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and build interactive prototypes to communicate design concepts for product and engineering teams Support the product design team’s charge of crafting the future of Experience Cloud audiences as the currency powering a suite of marketing, data science, and analysis tools. Collaborate with other designers to define design patterns and contribute to design systems Participate in qualitative and quantitative user testing to validate design hypotheses Review product builds to improve the user experience and collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout the product cycle. What You Need To Succeed A portfolio that showcases user-centered design process with an emphasis on visual and interaction examples at a high level. Exceptional design skills, production value, and attention to detail Ability to share design rationale persuasively and concisely for cross- functional teams A minimum of 2 years of proven experience in UX design How To Apply BS degree in interaction design, or equivalent practical experience To be considered for this role, please submit a resume and portfolio. We’d especially like to see strong design examples and a clear About Adobe Design narrative about how your work has evolved over time. Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers, content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer . We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination and/or harassment against applicants or employees on the basis of sex, age, race, color, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. The Opportunity : We are looking for a Senior Digital Strategist with an expert-level background in Content Strategy to join our Digital Performance Strategy team. This individual will have a high degree of initiative, a strategic approach, and a deep understanding of how content is the key to personalizing user experiences. This senior consultant will be working with a wide variety of B2B & B2C customers across industry verticals. This individual will have a very broad range of consultative skills: to persuade and educate at executive levels, to collaborate and tackle problems at the mid-level, while still being able to get involved at the finest level of detail when it comes to migration planning, tagging strategies, and defining production processes. What you'll Do The right person will have a well-developed point-of-view on how context, content, and personalization come together across the Adobe platform. Have a strong executive presence and interpersonal skills, with ability to engage and inspire senior executives. Be an inspiring leader and educator on cross-functional teams, delivering clear, effective guidance, with a focus on customer value delivery. Possess an informed vision for effective content organizations – people, process, and governance – to help Adobe’s customers align their teams toward business objectives, and recommend roadmaps and component programs to accomplish that vision. Synthesize client findings into presentations of strategic narratives and conclusions appropriate for all levels of client leadership. With the UX team, drive discovery, research, and analysis for the role content plays in the overall user experience, identifying and supplying prescriptive design recommendations to improve and deliver value to the customer. Develop strategies and experiences in the following functional areas: content marketing, channel strategy, content assessment, content development and syndication, content operations and velocity, componentizing content and optimizing sites, content creation and asset storage processes. Own the evolution of our content strategy practice by defining and refining internal process, creating reusable templates, and mentoring team members. Ability to negotiate quickly through technical or other challenges during development, in deep partnership with our cross-functional AEM technical teamWhat you need to succeed Relevant BA/BS degree in a related field or 6+ years of progressive experience in content strategy and content production Work experience in a digital agency, strategy consulting organization, content-or ecommerce-focused organization, marketing department, or leading technology company. Strong proficiency in AEM and content management tools and workflows In-depth experience within Adobe Creative Cloud or comparable User Experience Tools, Adobe Marketing Cloud experience is a plus. Experience working in Agile environments. Willingness to travel based on client needs, pandemic considerations are in place at Adobe. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $113,200 - $147,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

processes and defines how the two organizations intersect to work together Manages resource capacity across Program and Change Management to ensure resources are optimized and key programs are fully staffed Attracts and selects top global talent in the three areas of responsibility Establishes the tools and automation needed for teams to be productive Contributes to development and succession plans of the organization Ensures the team and any cross-functional dependent teams have clarity on goals and priorities Leads through change by inspiring others and encouraging action toward a vision communications, and quarterly leadership updates Drive and develop standard methodologies across all 3 subject areas to ensure consistency and scalability Make final decisions on operational matters Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Team Do you aspire to become a COO or GM someday? If yes, we would love to talk to you. We are the central Business Strategy and Operations team reporting to the Digital Media BU President. Our scope is across all functions, all customer segments and all product categories with the goal of building the business for the next decade and beyond. We operate around 3 pillars: Business Strategy & Insights, Business Operations and Operations Excellence. What you'll Do Run the business: Architect and optimize the business cadence and metrics that matter. Set goals around headcount, budget and OKRs while driving accountability and visibility across the organization. Set the vision, plan and deliver on key forums such as QBRs, OKR reviews, and All Hands. Strategy planning: Lead the strategic and operations planning process across the portfolio. You will define the framework, cadence, calendar and executions. Strategic Projects: Identify, structure and champion key critical initiatives to drive the business and partner with cross-functional teams across the organization to deliver them. Thought leadership: Influence senior collaborators and the business strategy by providing key insights. Drive alignment across leadership. Be a change agent: Challenge the status quo by finding new, better ways operate and lead the charge in setting up DME’s strategy and operations for the next decade. What you'll need to succeed Background: 10+ years of experience in business operations or management consulting Strategic Problem Solver: You are a strong strategic problem solver that can zoom out to see the big picture and then zoom in to deep dive into the details. You can quickly identify the problem to solve, create a framework around it and then set it in motion. You have enough product depth to understand our customer journeys, and are “dangerous” enough on the business side to glean insight from our Sales outlook and financial metrics. Analytical: You are comfortable building / being in financial models. You are not afraid to dive into a data set and can tease apart MAUs, funnel metrics or churn rates equally. Storytelling: you can easily take strategy and insights and craft a narrative around it that brings others along for the ride. Get stuff done: You don’t stop at framing up the problem and the data. You know that ideas are worth nothing without execution, so you create aggressive, yet realistic plans. You collaborate with key partners to ensure we are considering all the right inputs. Communications and influence: You create crisp, clear and concise communication - both written and verbal. You can influence without direct authority Leadership: Ability to work with Sr. leaders. You build relationships, set a roadmap and shepherd others to follow it, and while making it a fun journey. Thrive in ambiguity: You are flexible and agile. You welcome ambiguity as an opportunity to give shape and scope to problems. Get to know the team At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hard working individuals, regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here . We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Storytelling: you can easily take strategy and insights and craft a narrative around it that brings others along for the ride. Get stuff done: You don’t stop at framing up the problem and the data. You know that ideas are worth nothing without execution, so you create aggressive, yet realistic plans. You collaborate with key partners to ensure we are considering all the right inputs. Communications and influence: You create crisp, clear and concise communication - both written and verbal. You can influence without direct authority Leadership: Ability to work with Sr. leaders. You build relationships, set a roadmap and shepherd others to follow it, and while making it a fun journey. Thrive in ambiguity: You are flexible and agile. You welcome ambiguity as an opportunity to give shape and scope to problems. Get to know the team At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hard working individuals, regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here . We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The challenge The Director of Customer Success will be responsible for the Americas Digital Media for Enterprise business, including Adobe’s flagship Creative Cloud and Document Cloud solutions. The Director of Customer Success will be responsible for the whole post-sales customer experience, including driving solution usage, adoption, and value realization. Reporting to the Senior Director of Customer Success, the Director of Customer Success will be accountable for developing a comprehensive strategic customer success business plan based on a substantial understanding of modern creative workflows and operational field dynamics. The Director of Customer Success will lead their team to deeply understand Adobe’s customers’ business goals to help them make the most out of their Adobe solution investments supported by superior execution across customer success specialty roles. This role includes leading regular and extensive C-Level executive presentations. What You’ll Do Management responsibility for a team of passionate Customer Success professionals to achieve aggressive usage, adoption, and value realization targets while continually evolving Adobe’s customer success methodology and deliverables. Responsible for building and delivering C-Level executive presentations, including RTBs, QBRs, and regular deep-dive sessions. Hire and nurture talent across specialty roles, including the creative production workflow, video production, 3D and immersive design, and user experience design. Responsible for developing engagement models and methodologies that ensure customer adoption and value realization of Adobe solutions. Develop thoughtful and strategic customer success offerings and repeatable deliverable templates which engage customers at crucial points in the customer lifecycle. Lead bringing new products to market by developing and executing an end-to-end post-sale customer success plan, including defining customer success motions, deliverables, KPI development and tracking, enablement, and a rigorous inspection cadence. Develop and action productivity and performance reporting of customer success management, individuals, and account opportunity. Oversee customer success team productivity and track and report critical customer success KPIs. Conduct historical reviews of account performance, account segmentation, and prioritization, and oversee win/loss analysis and other predictive analytics. Drive customer success annual planning, including determining account segmentation, usage and adoption targets, organizational design, account coverage, capacity model, and compensation plans. Effectively partner and across sales, product, and consulting teams. What You Need To Succeed Proven experience managing best-in-class, customer-facing teams at a top management consulting firm, SaaS organization, or financial services institution supporting aggressive revenue growth. Capable of managing a centralized customer success team responsible for supporting $1B+ of revenues. Strong C-Level executive presence and communication skills, with the ability to engage and inspire senior executives, including communicating your vision. Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills, including a talent for conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations. Candidates must have a proven track record of success in providing strategic guidance and operational oversight in customer-facing teams. Proven ability to successfully bring new products to market and drive change management initiatives across a large Field organization. Proven ability to develop tactical initiatives that improve team productivity and performance. Background of introducing innovative performance metrics, improvement programs, and compensation enhancements. Ability to utilize combined industry benchmarking information with a robust analytical capability to identify market trends and test alternative strategy approaches that yield superior performance. Experience researching, developing and deploying software tools, technologies, and automation solutions/strategies in a Field organization. High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb new concepts quickly. Highly entrepreneurial and able to operate independently with minimum supervision. Heavily results-oriented; strong track record in meeting and exceeding revenue targets. Experience in subscription revenue environment. Adobe’s Worldwide Field Operations Adobe’s Worldwide Field Operations provides customers with the products, services, solutions, and support they need to make, manage, measure and/or monetize their digital assets. Worldwide Field Operations includes Worldwide Sales, Reseller Partnerships, Partner Sales, Adobe Global Services, Sales Operations and the Adobe Worldwide eCommerce organizations. Take a peek into Adobe life in this video . When you join Adobe, you can look forward to collaborating with the most genuine people in the industry, working on projects with real purpose, and having immense pride in the products we create and the customers we support. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, cultural background or religious beliefs. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here . Come create experiences that matter at a company that is recognized around the world and hear what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog .

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Digital Experience is a major growth area for Adobe. To gain the significant opportunity ahead, Adobe Customer Success needs to own the post-sales customer experience, driving adoption and value realization for our customers. We represent the customers' interest in realizing value with Adobe! Our Digital Experience division is a high growth area for Adobe, and we are looking for a Director of Customer Success to lead our Data, Insights, Profiles and Audiences team. The primary focus of this role is to cultivate the Customer Success practice around Adobe’s Data solutions. The members of the practice work with our customers to build strong partnerships, drive adoption of our solutions, and ultimately ensure our customers realize value from their investment in their Adobe solutions. We are looking for a strategic leader to inspire a senior Customer Success team working our customers using Adobe’s Experience Cloud. The goal is not just retention and growth—it's about thinking like the customer—understanding their goals and consistently delivering value. We are seeking a problem solver and organization developer —someone creative enough to design compelling programs that will scale, with management and organization change skills to put those programs into effect, and with business and operational savvy to bring together and report on efficiency. You will have individuals on your team with responsibility for outcome driven engagements determined by customer needs, helping us achieve our Customer Success mission of accelerating value for our customers Do you have the experience, drive, and passion to make customers successful at Adobe? What You’ll Do Develop the Customer Success strategy for our Data and Audiences Customer Success practice across the Americas region Manage a team of 30-40 advisors passionate about helping customers get the most from their investments in Adobe technology. Ensure their teams deliver efficiently via strong operational focus, capability development, and alignment with key partners in sales, product, and consulting teams Responsible for the development of engagement models, methodologies, and offerings that ensure the adoption of Adobe Digital Experience products at our customers Develop thoughtful and strategic offerings which engage customers at key points in the Customer life cycle that drives product adoption and value realization Attract, recruit, inspire and retain the best talent Develop relationships and have frequent interaction with customers, including VPs, and C-level executives of Fortune 500 companies What You Need To Succeed 8+ years of Director or above level experience in growing Software or SaaS organization scaling for Enterprise customers Demonstrates solid understanding of Data, Customer Profile and Audience solutions, specialization in digital analytics, customer data collection, and personalization Strong track record of leading customer relationships centered around digital transformation through strong partnerships Be an inspiring leader and shown success in large-scale transformations. Strong change agent Self-motivated, accountable, and passionate about exceeding customer expectations Exceptional organizational, presentation, and communication skills both verbal and written in English Ability to convey sophisticated ideas and influence customers and colleagues at an executive level Collaborate with other senior leaders to achieve shared business outcomes Technical expertise to constructively engage with product leadership to help shape the product roadmap At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $208,200 - $270,400 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $233,000 - $302,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Are you interested in helping lead design in the world's leading design company? Adobe is seeking a Director of Design Operations to partner with the centralized design organization and its leadership team to complete strategic objectives. You will be a key partner to the Vice President of Adobe Design! The individual will operationalize the running of the Adobe Design organization as a business including completing critical initiatives, focusing on aligning and enabling teams to efficiently scale the business and deliver customer value. This individual will define and run programs that incorporate standard methodologies and the highest degree of operational rigor, while closely partnering with senior leaders across Adobe. This is a highly influential role across the organization and requires someone with a true passion for business strategy and operations, flawless execution of strategic objectives, and delivering the best experiences for users. What You’ll Do Lead organizational planning initiatives Partner closely with the VP of Enterprise Design as a trusted advisor and thought partner (Chief of Staff), to craft the design strategy, vision and operational excellence within Digital Experience (DX) design org Work the senior leaders to identify forward-thinking initiatives to grow the business Develop strategic and user-centric product development frameworks in partnership with Design, Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Corporate Strategy teams Annual Plan: Lead the quarter and annual business planning process that culminates in a presentation to Adobe's Executive Staff. This involves working closely with the Product, Engineering, GTM, and other key partners on the Strategic and Operating teams Coordinate operational execution of any M&A projects in the group Be a leader with vision to help advance Adobe Design’s Business strategy globally and challenge others in the organization to change. Amplify the voice of Design! Grow and lead a group of program managers to successfully achieve product and user goals while building a best-in-class team that attracts the best, develops employees, and has an inclusive, winning culture Partner with Design Managers and Sr/Directors to complete and streamline portfolio and resource planning What You Need To Succeed Demonstrated experience leading and scaling operations for critical business units in SaaS or Digital environments Experience understanding the needs of business and end customers and translating them into the right solutions Experience working with creative teams, including collaborating with designers, content strategists, researchers, prototypers , engineers, and product management. Passion for user experience and design with an understanding of the design process Consistent track record of applying creative thinking and analysis to tackle business needs in ambiguous environments. Must have experience implementing operational rigor and programs across organizations Lead logically and predictably, with a high degree of drive towards action and outcomes Communication – Work with a variety of people/personalities; respectfully hold people accountable. Frame business challenges for executive consumption Organized, structured, systems thinker who can translate symptoms into root causes and identify appropriate, scalable solutions Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, environment where you must take on multiple responsibilities and do what it takes to get things done Ability to establish credibility and rapport with senior executives and technical and non-technical team members Experience building and fostering a robust, collaborative, inclusive team environment Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hardworking individuals, regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative, and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here.

jobTitle: Director, FP&A - Americas Enterprise Sales Finance
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company At Adobe, we’re changing the world. We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most. We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about leading our next level of growth with your commercial expertise, this could be the opportunity for you! The Challenge As a senior member of the enterprise sales finance organization, you will play two important roles to the end of Adobe achieving its strategic objectives and financial targets for the Americas enterprise business. First, you will be the finance business partner to leaders of the Americas Digital Experience sales team, specifically within the solution-led go-to-market segment, where you will shape decisions to drive profitable growth. Second, you will provide Americas-wide FP&A leadership, particularly by maturing and streamlining financial frameworks to enable increased management rigor across the various dimensions of the business. You will report to the senior director of Americas enterprise sales finance and manage a geographically dispersed team of finance professionals. What You’ll Do Serve as finance business partner to the VPs of the solutions and growth businesses which comprise Adobe’s solution-led GTM segment Lead and develop a team of four US-based finance professionals Direct financial planning/budgeting in a manner that supports business strategic objectives and prioritizes GTM motions with highest return on investment Drive weekly bookings/revenue forecasting and sales team accountability to targets Advise on deal structuring approaches for large/complex opportunities Manage headcount and operating expenses to budget by identifying and actioning expense efficiencies and/or investment tradeoffs Analyze business dimensions, conduct scenario modeling, provide data-driven insights, and influence action on identified opportunities and risks Question the status quo – assess current business practices and identify/implement innovative ways to drive increased standardization and effectiveness Collaborate with finance peers and the support functions including sales operations, employee experience, and legal What You Need To Succeed 10+ years of FP&A experience; software industry and sales team partnering experience preferred Self-motivated with strong work ethic, desire to learn, attention to detail, and dedication to quality Track record of driving a high-performance culture and developing talent Advanced analytical abilities with high standards for accuracy Ability to sort through high complexity and present upshots in easily digestible formats Experience with deal structuring Confidence, awareness, and interpersonal skills to build relationships at all levels and drive impact Effective communicator – strong executive presence and verbal/written communications Ability to multi-task in a highly matrixed, fast-paced environment BS in finance or accounting; MBA or advanced degree preferred At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog (http://blogs.adobe.com/adobelife/) and explore the meaningful benefits (http://benefits.adobe.com/) we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $140,500 - $182,500 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. jobTitle: Director, FP&A - Americas Enterprise Sales Finance
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company At Adobe, we’re changing the world. We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most. We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about leading our next level of growth with your commercial expertise, this could be the opportunity for you! The Challenge As a senior member of the enterprise sales finance organization, you will play two important roles to the end of Adobe achieving its strategic objectives and financial targets for the Americas enterprise business. First, you will be the finance business partner to leaders of the Americas Digital Experience sales team, specifically within the solution-led go-to-market segment, where you will shape decisions to drive profitable growth. Second, you will provide Americas-wide FP&A leadership, particularly by maturing and streamlining financial frameworks to enable increased management rigor across the various dimensions of the business. You will report to the senior director of Americas enterprise sales finance and manage a geographically dispersed team of finance professionals. What You’ll Do Serve as finance business partner to the VPs of the solutions and growth businesses which comprise Adobe’s solution-led GTM segment Lead and develop a team of four US-based finance professionals Direct financial planning/budgeting in a manner that supports business strategic objectives and prioritizes GTM motions with highest return on investment Drive weekly bookings/revenue forecasting and sales team accountability to targets Advise on deal structuring approaches for large/complex opportunities Manage headcount and operating expenses to budget by identifying and actioning expense efficiencies and/or investment tradeoffs Analyze business dimensions, conduct scenario modeling, provide data-driven insights, and influence action on identified opportunities and risks Question the status quo – assess current business practices and identify/implement innovative ways to drive increased standardization and effectiveness Collaborate with finance peers and the support functions including sales operations, employee experience, and legal What You Need To Succeed 10+ years of FP&A experience; software industry and sales team partnering experience preferred Self-motivated with strong work ethic, desire to learn, attention to detail, and dedication to quality Track record of driving a high-performance culture and developing talent Advanced analytical abilities with high standards for accuracy Ability to sort through high complexity and present upshots in easily digestible formats Experience with deal structuring Confidence, awareness, and interpersonal skills to build relationships at all levels and drive impact Effective communicator – strong executive presence and verbal/written communications Ability to multi-task in a highly matrixed, fast-paced environment BS in finance or accounting; MBA or advanced degree preferred At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. Colorado Starting Salary: $140,500 - $182,500 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The opportunity We are looking for exceptional talent to serve as HR Business Partners to help us on our mission to change the world through digital experiences. Our HR Business Partners are on the front lines every day making things happen across the organization so that we can continue to transform how people and brands tell their stories. We work together as One Team, embrace our differences, and have fun along the way. This is not an easy job but if you’re up for some challenging and meaningful work that impacts our customers, our communities, and everyone who experiences our products, this is absolutely the coolest HR job on the planet. What You'll Do Serve as a trusted business partner and coach to senior leaders in the organization. Work on big problems from critical organizational and people issues to identifying and developing our key leadership talent to culture and change management to putting Adobe for All into action Lead Employee Experience for the teams you support – you are the “Chief People Officer” for your business Be a leader throughout Adobe – speak up, keep it real, and agitate when necessary Connect dots across organizations to create outstanding experiences for our leaders and employees at scale. What You Need To Succeed A positive, can-do, attitude with a willingness to roll up your sleeves Ability to establish relationships at all levels of the organization Understand our business and how what you do will help us accelerate Adobe’s growth Creativity in your DNA– this is Adobe after all. We love to challenge the status quo, especially in HR! Strong leadership and influencing skills When you think you are done, make it better. Be you! Being someone else all day is just plain exhausting. Ability to remain flexible and agile in an ever-changing environment along with a willingness to always be learning BA/BS degree (that is a “Bachelor of Science”) or equivalent practical experience HR or relevant experience (we value talent over experience) Leadership experience (we value talent and proven leadership) Sense of humor helps – ability to laugh at yourself is important especially in the world of HR 😊 A burning passion to want to accomplish what most people might call “unreasonable expectations”

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The inside sales business development (BDR) motion seamlessly ties into the teams and business processes supporting Adobe’s Digital Media (DMe) enterprise organization. Working closely with GTM, product strategy teams, and sales leadership, the ideal candidate will bring expertise in account-based sales development strategies to optimally deliver pipeline growth across the DMe Americas enterprise business. This leader will develop close collaboration across the ecosystem to align planning, sales and marketing strategy, target setting, demand gen, and customer support to the organization. The director will have multiple BDR teams reporting up through front-line managers (FLM) with responsibility of 40+ business development reps (BDR) responsible for all marketing and BDR sourced business pipeline across DMe's Strategic Commercial, Corporate Enterprise, and Public Sector regions and accounts. What You’ll Do Own the team that builds sales pipeline for Adobe DMe Document Cloud and Creative Cloud enterprise business accounts Mentor and coach front-line managers to establish rigor in their businesses, develop BDR talent, and deliver cross-functional improvements to DMe sales growth Lead sales development messaging and campaigns with product marketing, sales strategy, and demand gen teams Own headcount, quota, and business planning for the Digital Media Enterprise BDR teams Manage sales pipeline qualification process to improve BDR cross-sell pipeline quality, working with sales to deliver consistent & predictable close rates Establish trust, rhythm, and alignment with the corresponding sales & extended ecosystem sales players What You Need To Succeed Experience working with multiple sales partners, developing effective BDR processes across multiple systems, and with the Adobe digital media portfolio Track record of developing managers to improve team performance Ability to empower and energize a diverse sales team to hit quota Data-driven and data-informed leadership; excellent at SFDC and Outreach reporting and Excel modeling Able to proactively diagnose and address gaps in pipeline creation with tactical plans & campaigns cross-functionally with demand gen and field marketing teams Able to measure and diagnose strategic efficacy and recommend course correction/shifts to business plans At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The inside sales business development (BDR) motion seamlessly ties into the teams and business processes supporting Adobe’s Digital Media (DMe) enterprise organization. Working closely with GTM, product strategy teams, and sales leadership, the ideal candidate will bring expertise in account-based sales development strategies to optimally deliver pipeline growth across the DMe Americas enterprise business. This leader will develop close collaboration across the ecosystem to align planning, sales and marketing strategy, target setting, demand gen, and customer support to the organization. The director will have multiple BDR teams reporting up through front-line managers (FLM) with responsibility of 40+ business development reps (BDR) responsible for all marketing and BDR sourced business pipeline across DMe's Strategic Commercial, Corporate Enterprise, and Public Sector regions and accounts. What You’ll Do Own the team that builds sales pipeline for Adobe DMe Document Cloud and Creative Cloud enterprise business accounts Mentor and coach front-line managers to establish rigor in their businesses, develop BDR talent, and deliver cross-functional improvements to DMe sales growth Lead sales development messaging and campaigns with product marketing, sales strategy, and demand gen teams Own headcount, quota, and business planning for the Digital Media Enterprise BDR teams Manage sales pipeline qualification process to improve BDR cross-sell pipeline quality, working with sales to deliver consistent & predictable close rates Establish trust, rhythm, and alignment with the corresponding sales & extended ecosystem sales players What You Need To Succeed Experience working with multiple sales partners, developing effective BDR processes across multiple systems, and with the Adobe digital media portfolio Track record of developing managers to improve team performance Ability to empower and energize a diverse sales team to hit quota Data-driven and data-informed leadership; excellent at SFDC and Outreach reporting and Excel modeling Able to proactively diagnose and address gaps in pipeline creation with tactical plans & campaigns cross-functionally with demand gen and field marketing teams Able to measure and diagnose strategic efficacy and recommend course correction/shifts to business plans At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Director of Design, Spectrum Design System
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The o pportunity We are looking for a Director of Design for Spectrum, Adobe’s design system. You will lead a group of outstanding design systems problem-solvers and drive one of the most well-respected design systems in the world. You’ll partner closely with leaders from design, product, and engineering to build high-quality experiences at scale across many dozens of products. You will be at the center of all product development at Adobe and play a central role in building our next generation of products. What You’ll Do Coach and mentor designers, hire and attract talent to the team, and cultivate an environment where the designers grow, learn , and do their best work Build a collaborative culture and encourage deep partnership with cross-functional teams, setting a high bar for design craft, and define and implement design strategy across releases on multiple platforms Lead the Spectrum team through strategy, creative direction, and collaboration with product teams and other partners Provide a strong system design perspective, crafting scalable models which improve the quality and set the future direction for all Adobe experiences  Collaborate across product areas to diplomatically advocate for the Spectrum Design system, exploring new product opportunities, promoting standards, and integrating feedback and changes into design system as appropriate Be part of a larger team covering horizontal aspects of product design for the entire Adobe portfolio, including brand, icons, content, illustration, animation, and our public presence. This is a fun t eam full of exceptionally talented people doing exciting and impressive work. W hat you’ll need to succeed Deep knowledge, passion, and practical experience producing inclusive, accessible, beautiful, multi-platform design systems at scale High design craft and experience in multiple design fields (UX, UI, design systems, prototyping) and prior work demonstrating a strong design process, clear insights, and problem solving. Experience building and nurturing an inclusive and empowering environment for a design team to do innovative and impactful work Experience delivering high-quality experiences in close partnership with engineering , product management, and executive stakeholders Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to articulate design strategy through well-crafted, strategic presentations Embody a learner and mentor mentality; curiosity and ongoing self-education in the field of design systems Experience in design operations across a matrixed organization and governing a design system at scale About Adobe Design Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers , content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $195,000 - $253,300 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

jobTitle: Director of EDX Legal Strategy & Innovation
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! What You'll Do Work collaboratively and cross-functionally with leaders across the broader Legal, Security & Policy organization to develop, drive and implement critical initiatives. Build and lead analyses to generate business insights into trends impacting EDX Legal and the businesses it supports. This includes: establishing and reviewing team performance metrics, benchmarking competitors, assessing industry developments, evaluating potential new business, and exploring the implementation of new technologies to achieve strategic objectives. Develop workplans and convene cross-functional teams to build and implement strategic initiatives. Serve as project leader representing EDX Legal to lead cross-departmental initiatives. Support the overall EDX Legal strategy and innovation planning with focus on future increases in efficiency and scalability. Apply critical legal analyses to myriad sophisticated legal matters, such as software licensing, data privacy and security, product support and contract operations. Develop and communicate key messages and conclusions to internal leadership and partners. Proactively address operational issues and collaborate with team members to address problems quickly and thoughtfully. Run annual planning activities, including translation of organizational goals and objectives into initiatives, timelines and plans. Support budget, headcount and organizational management and optimization. What You Need To Succeed Law degree/JD and at least 10 years of relevant in-house legal experience required, with a predominant focus in the tech industry. Significant experience supporting online/SaaS services, e-commerce, marketing, and consumer protection matters across many jurisdictions around the world. 3+ years of firm experience preferred. Strong leadership abilities, effectively with experience handling multi-layered orgs. Expert at negotiating and drafting all types of technology licensing agreements including in-bound licenses, outbound licenses, online services agreements, and terms of use for online services. Ability to succinctly frame sophisticated legal issues and communicate effectively with multiple levels of management, including in support of product development and innovation. CIPP and CISSP certifications are a plus. Must work well on a team and with people at all levels. Commitment to providing clients with high-quality and timely legal advice in a fast-paced work environment, with a strong customer focus. Proven ability to think and act strategically, be a creative problem solver, have excellent business instincts, and aim to provide practical solutions. Exceptional interpersonal skills with a sense of humor, intellectual curiosity, and a dedication to professionalism. Seek to make an impact and build an exciting career with our Legal team!

jobTitle: Director of Product Management, Business Platform Integrations
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We are looking for an exceptional, solution-focused product leader who will be a key driver in accelerating the integration of acquired company products with the Adobe Business Platform. Adobe Business Platform powers the end-to-end customer lifecycle across discover, try, buy, use, and renew phases, for every product and all Adobe customers. In partnership with the acquired company’s leaders, you will create the vision, strategy, and integration plans for the Adobe Business Platform integration. You will champion the prioritization of platform capabilities needed for powering these integrations within the broader organization. You will develop and implement repeatable frameworks and standard methodologies to drive outstanding integration execution results and increased business value from the acquisition. This is a very high visibility role in the organization. What You’ll Do Work cross-functionally to integrate acquired entities efficiently with minimal disruption, and to achieve business goals Partner with engineering and product managers across the organization to build integration playbooks and SDKs to make future integrations self-serviceable. Develop and maintain trusted advisor relationships with acquired product/engineering leadership teams Translate and proactively communicate roadmap and innovation initiatives to M&A teams Deeply understand all potential and active integrations with the Adobe Business Platform with an eye toward building repeatable frameworks for future integrations Define platform capabilities needed to accelerate integration efforts and partner with engineering and program management to deliver them Identify potential commonalities, develop success metrics, and communicate to cross-functional business leaders and executives Lead a team of technical product managers to build out self-service capabilities and improve the velocity of integrations Who You Are You have 8 years of product management experience defining, delivering, and growing highly successful API-enabled products in B2B or B2C; You’ve been involved in end-to-end product process from conceptualization, building, shipping, and scaling products You are thorough, strategic, and able to foster and build strong relationships across the organization. You use your excellent interpersonal and communication skills to inspire change across multiple cross-functional partners You have the ability to think creatively and critically in a fast-paced and ambiguous work environment As a Director, you bring a strategic toolkit to contribute as a thought partner and advisor to senior leaders You can facilitate consensus and listen well but also drive hard decisions You have a track record of leading with complex strategic initiatives, working through technical, operational, policy, and business issues You can balance multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment You are able to establish credibility and rapport with senior executives as well as technical and non-technical team members You have prior experience working with SaaS products and developer ecosystems You have a degree in Computer Science or engineering #BusinessPlatform-ALL1

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Our broad portfolio of Digital Media products and solutions enables our customers to create, deliver, and measure personalized experiences that their users can access from virtually any device. Our solutions include: Adobe Creative Cloud, which offers the most innovative tools and cloud-based services for creating digital media; and Adobe Document Cloud, which provides a modern way to handle documents at home, in the office and across devices. The Adobe Corporate Partnerships team is passionate about delivering material growth and market share expansion into new markets through strategic partnerships. Responsibilities include sourcing, evaluating, negotiating, and implementing partnership deals and initiatives across Adobe’s Digital Media business units. As the Director of Strategic Partner Development, you will incubate and deliver partnerships across the Creative Cloud and Document Cloud business with leading technology platforms globally, with a particular eye toward opportunities in emerging markets (China, India, Brazil, etc). You will build and lead a strategic partnerships team and partner closely with product, engineering, product marketing, legal, and executive leadership to implement partner deals aligned with Adobe's critical initiatives. What You'll Do Lead and grow a team of strategic deal makers with responsibility to drive incremental growth through product partnerships across Adobe’s professional creativity, productivity, and digital experiences business / product areas Invest in and enable the team’s success by modeling best-in-class negotiation and partnership development capabilities (including fluency in working on first-of-its kind agreements), driving internal alignment with key stakeholders, and delivering on strategic priorities Become an essential business thought partner to the product, engineering and product marketing orgs by encouraging deep relationships with executive partners, staying abreast of evolving partner landscapes, communicating untapped opportunities to internal decision-makers, and delivering value to the org through transformational partnerships What You’ll Need to Succeed A minimum of fifteen years of proven experience in leading key strategic product partnerships in technology, media, or similar industries Proven success in growing a best-in-class team of distributed partnership development individuals, including leading with candor, humility, and a general “roll up your sleeves” attitude Ability to influence C-level executives and senior internal stakeholders in a complex, matrixed organization, including balancing competing priorities between external partners and internal teams Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $196,300 - $254,900 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
