What You'll Do Lead and grow a team of strategic deal makers with responsibility to drive incremental growth through product partnerships across Adobe’s professional creativity, productivity, and digital experiences business / product areas Invest in and enable the team’s success by modeling best-in-class negotiation and partnership development capabilities (including fluency in working on first-of-its kind agreements), driving internal alignment with key stakeholders, and delivering on strategic priorities Become an essential business thought partner to the product, engineering and product marketing orgs by encouraging deep relationships with executive partners, staying abreast of evolving partner landscapes, communicating untapped opportunities to internal decision-makers, and delivering value to the org through transformational partnerships What You’ll Need to Succeed A minimum of fifteen years of proven experience in leading key strategic product partnerships in technology, media, or similar industries Proven success in growing a best-in-class team of distributed partnership development individuals, including leading with candor, humility, and a general “roll up your sleeves” attitude Ability to influence C-level executives and senior internal stakeholders in a complex, matrixed organization, including balancing competing priorities between external partners and internal teams Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $196,300 - $254,900 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Our broad portfolio of Digital Media products and solutions enables our customers to create, deliver, and measure personalized experiences that their users can access from virtually any device. Our solutions include: Adobe Creative Cloud, which offers the most innovative tools and cloud-based services for creating digital media; and Adobe Document Cloud, which provides a modern way to handle documents at home, in the office and across devices. The Adobe Corporate Partnerships team is passionate about delivering material growth and market share expansion into new markets through strategic partnerships. Responsibilities include sourcing, evaluating, negotiating, and implementing partnership deals and initiatives across Adobe’s Digital Media business units. As the Director of Strategic Partner Development, you will incubate and deliver partnerships across the Creative Cloud and Document Cloud business with leading technology platforms globally, with a particular eye toward opportunities in emerging markets (China, India, Brazil, etc). You will build and lead a strategic partnerships team and partner closely with product, engineering, product marketing, legal, and executive leadership to implement partner deals aligned with Adobe's critical initiatives. What You'll Do Lead and grow a team of strategic deal makers with responsibility to drive incremental growth through product partnerships across Adobe’s professional creativity, productivity, and digital experiences business / product areas Invest in and enable the team’s success by modeling best-in-class negotiation and partnership development capabilities (including fluency in working on first-of-its kind agreements), driving internal alignment with key stakeholders, and delivering on strategic priorities Become an essential business thought partner to the product, engineering and product marketing orgs by encouraging deep relationships with executive partners, staying abreast of evolving partner landscapes, communicating untapped opportunities to internal decision-makers, and delivering value to the org through transformational partnerships What You’ll Need to Succeed A minimum of fifteen years of proven experience in leading key strategic product partnerships in technology, media, or similar industries Proven success in growing a best-in-class team of distributed partnership development individuals, including leading with candor, humility, and a general “roll up your sleeves” attitude Ability to influence C-level executives and senior internal stakeholders in a complex, matrixed organization, including balancing competing priorities between external partners and internal teams Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $196,300 - $254,900 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The opportunity Are you passionate about leading products that impact enterprise users? Adobe is looking for Director of Design for Adobe Journey Optimizer (Experience Cloud). You will lead a group of passionate and hard-working designers and managers who craft experiences that deliver the ability for our users to create meaningful and personal experiences for users of their brand. Working closely with Product and Engineering executives, you will provide strategic design direction, feedback to the design and engineering teams to up-level craft, and find resolution to ambiguous problem spaces. You will have a tremendous impact on how people work with enterprise experiences at large. What you’ll do Coach and mentor designers and design leaders across the globe, hire and attract top-notch talent to the team, and foster a culture where the designers grown, learn and do their best work. Build a collaborative environment and encourage deep partnership with cross-functional teams, setting a high bar for design craft, and define and execute design strategy for redesigns, 1.0s, and lead all aspects of design execution across frequent releases. Work with peer design leaders to provide strategy and execution support. Help the teams contribute to the product strategy discussions through vivid and inspiring design visions the further continuity in our experiences. Incite action in cross-functional partners to deliver better user and business outcomes. Guide the teams in weekly, monthly and quarterly product releases What you need to succeed 10+ years of equivalent practical experience of managing large design organization of designers and managers. Lead empathetically, fostering an inclusive and empowering environment for the design team to do innovative and impactful work. Phenomenal oral and written communication skills are a pre-requisite. Be an effective facilitator across product-design-engineering teams in early stages of key projects. Deep expertise in strategic problem framing and solving problems through high design craft Embody a learner and mentor mentality About Adobe Design Adobe Design builds tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers, content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The challenge Adobe’s Digital Strategy Group works with C-level leadership at leading Media, Entertainment & Communications companies to advise on digital strategy and transformation for customer-centric experiences, audience monetization and digital innovation. Adobe has long been at the forefront of enabling customers on digital transformation and new experience and data-led business models across industries. As an Engagement Manager in the MEC practice, you will lead strategy consulting engagements for the world’s leading communications, entertainment, and sports brands. For each engagement, you will lead a team of experts to conduct analyses, develop insights, and deliver impactful recommendations. You will advise senior industry leaders and utilize your experience to become a trusted advisor to clients and a thought leader on trends, digital innovation, use cases for Adobe technology, and relevant research in your industry. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world by numerous “best places to work” awards. We are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to build your career, Adobe’s the place for you. Every day, we get to work with some of the most creative, analytical, authentic and inspiring people in the world. What You Need To Succeed Experience managing engagements with a structured problem-solving approach (like you would get from working in a top management consulting firm or digital agency) Expertise in creating digital experience, marketing or monetization strategies in the Media, Entertainment or Communications space along with a high-level understanding of technologies and tactics needed for execution Executive presence and client communication skills, with ability to engage and inspire senior leaders Outstanding structured problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills including talent for conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and crafting effective recommendations focused on the highest-value opportunities High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb new concepts quickly MBA or equivalent degree 4+ years in the Media, Entertainment or Communications space strongly preferred Willingness to travel up to 30% Get to know the team Adobe’s Digital Strategy Group Adobe’s Digital Strategy Group is a team of consultants responsible for setting the vision and strategy for high priority industries based on a deep understanding of the trends and business challenges facing these, and for advising senior client executives at leading companies on how they can digitally transform. Take a peek into Adobe life in this video . Adobe believes in hiring the very best and that’s why our dynamic working environment has received awards throughout the globe. Recognizing that employees are at the core of our success, Adobe recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, builds an environment where they can innovate and achieve their best, and rewards them for their performance by giving them an opportunity to share in the company’s success. When you join Adobe, you can look forward to collaborating with the most genuine people in the industry, working on projects with real purpose, and having immense pride in the products we build and the customers we support. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hardworking individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, cultural background or religious beliefs. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here . We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Come create experiences that matter at a company that is recognized around the world and hear what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $139,700 - $181,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Adobe Experience Cloud Sales Position Description The Challenge We are looking for an energized Account Executive to sell Adobe Experience Cloud solutions into State and Local Government accounts! These solutions include AEM (Sites, Forms, Assets), Target, Analytics, Campaign and Audience Manager, Workfront and Adobe Sign. Responsibilities include the sales and acquisition of software licensing/subscription revenue through net-new logo accounts, as well as cross-sell and up-sell into existing accounts, within a large geographic area. Development of long-term relationships with customers as well as the development of account plans for new relationships are key priorities. This role will achieve this through solution selling capabilities and direct, face-to-face contact with the customer. You will navigate through various State and Local Government organizations to cross sell opportunities and will be responsible for selling complex technical products and/or services. The Role Driving incremental revenue in new and existing accounts by hunting within a territory. This role consists of net-new and install base business. Find, develop, and close opportunities within a geographic territory structure Collaborate with other team members on complex multi-solution sales opportunities as equal partners – ego is in check Develop positive relationships with Business Unit team's and provide clear feedback Maintain an accurate forecast for current quarter, following quarter (Q+1), top deals, and overall pipeline health. What You Need To Succeed Strong working knowledge of digital marketing solutions. Prior experience selling into both CMO/Marketing and IT departments is highly desired. Experience in selling SaaS. Experience selling enterprise solutions into large, complex customer accounts. Strong understanding of enterprise sales and process as well as the ability to forge and maintain good business relationships. We'd like to see strong experience in analytical and computer skills. Proven communication and presentations skills with outstanding customer service approach. Looking for experience in using quantitative and qualitative analysis to assess partnership performance and make recommendations for each account. Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/opportunities and recommending an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities. Ability to work in a highly matrixed team environment, partnering with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Production & Marketing. Strong understanding of Web and Marketing technologies. Creative problem-solving approach. Ideal Candidate will have Minimum 7+ years of enterprise level direct sales expertise. Prior success in carrying a $1M + quota also preferred Deep understanding of email & other types of marketing, including opposing technologies. Broad experience in running $1M + sales cycles. Challenger attitude / hunter profile. Hungry and motivated to build a pipeline vs. expectation of having leads handed served up. Proven record of top performance that requires little to no enablement around sales execution. Coverage: State and local Government accounts in the North East Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $231,400 - $300,500 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Senior Named Account Executive - Digital Media Account Manager to ensure that the needs of our Enterprise clients are being supported. The Account Manager is responsible for the sourcing and closing of new customers, and for the end-to-end management of Adobe's existing client relationships. Measures of success include revenue delivered vs. targets, up-sell and optimization effectiveness, client satisfaction and retention levels, and contribution to overall sales team and business unit. We are looking for a hunter in the West region who can demonstrate a history of quota over-achievement and deep customer relationships. This role is to ideally be staffed in the West Region. There will be a defined set of enterprise accounts with greater than $1B in annual revenue. What you’ll do Maintain and grow existing client base including expansion of new offerings. Drive specific product revenue in the territory. Build strong, lasting relationships with customers by understanding their needs and business objectives. Perform outbound contact to existing customers to sell additional solutions. Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of our solution offerings. Convert customer challenges into new opportunities Maintain an active pipeline of forecasted opportunities to meet monthly, quarterly and annual quota objectives. Improve overall customer satisfaction in assigned customer accounts. Work with various groups within Adobe (Product, Marketing, Finance and Engineering) to provide customer feedback and drive revenue opportunities in the region. What you need to succeed Minimum 10+ years proven track record of field account management/account executive experience. Proven Track record selling Complex Enterprise Solutions. Ability to forge and maintain good business relationships. Demonstrated analytical and computer skills. Excellent communication and presentations skills with top-notch customer service approach. Proven experience in using quantitative and qualitative analysis to assess customer relationships and make recommendations for each account. Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/ opportunities and recommending an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities Ability to work successfully in a team environment with your Adobe ecosystem including Renewals Specialists, Product Specialists, CSM’s, Solution Consultants and Field Marketing. Creative problem-solving approach. Experience in selling technology

Creative problem-solving approach. Experience in selling technology

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The challenge Adobe Digital Experience is seeking a hardworking, experienced, and technically adept sales professional to join our sales team in the US. The role supports major accounts in the Travel and Hospitality vertical. Experience in managing accounts with a variety of stakeholders is important, as well as developing a pipeline across multiple accounts and LOBs. In addition, you can expect to be working with the existing teams to lead all aspects of the sales cycle, from qualification of opportunities, development of a market strategy, coordination of all sales team resources, final negotiation and closing of business. Ideally, we are seeking individuals with experience selling digital experience products with a consistent track record of selling to large enterprises in North America. Travel & Hospitality vertical background is an added bonus. This position reports to the AVP, Vertical Sales. If you are passionate about what you do, have an entrepreneurial flair, and are excited by leading-edge online marketing technology, we want to hear from you. This role will ideally be staffed from a home office near a major airport. What You’ll Do Annual Revenue - Exceed quota targets Sales strategies - You will develop effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and balanced growth. Develop relationships in new and existing customers and drive strategy through organization Trusted adviser - You will establish strong relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and commitment to value (value of counsel and expertise, value of solutions, value of implementation expertise) Customer Acumen - You will actively understand each customer's technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and the competitive landscape. Review public information (e.g. new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the customer Territory and Account Leadership - You will lead account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles. Inspire all accounts to become Adobe references Business Planning – Develop and deliver comprehensive business plan to address customer's priorities and business issues. Utilize Strategic Value Assessments, bench marking and return on investment data to support the customer’s decision process Pipeline planning - Follow a focused approach to maintaining a rolling 4Q pipeline. Keep pipeline current Pipeline partnerships – Collaborate with support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory. Adobe Solutions – Be proficient in and bring all Adobe offers to bear on sales pursuits Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and road map Support all Adobe promotions and events in the territory. What You'll Need To Succeed A minimum of 5+ years' prior experience in selling digital marketing and customer experience solutions Digital analytics, data platforms, and marketing solutions sales is a plus Carried a personal annual target of at least $3M USD for new business Proven record of achieving/exceeding sales quota and market share goals Shown success in selling to executives, VP and/or "C" level Able to identify, cultivate and close deals in new areas Technically adept, skilled solution seller with shown ability to create outcomes where everybody wins Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills (verbal and written). Collaborative teammate with excellent organizational and time management skills

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Adobe is looking for a rare Account Director who is responsible for achieving sales targets through the sale of Adobe’s Digital Experience Cloud. You will be part of our savvy sales team, working with Adobe customers across our Media and Entertainment vertical.. This includes the development of long-term relationships with M&E customers as well as crafting account plans for new relationships. The Account Director will achieve this through solution selling capabilities and direct, face-to-face contact with the customer. The individual will be responsible for navigating through the customer's organization from the top to the bottom of each organization. Your team will guide and assist customers in achieving a success with Adobe solutions and help them expand the value realized from our solutions. This is a high profile role with some of the best companies in M&E vertical! The right fit will be, a high energy, data-minded, and tech-savvy person with prior sales experience. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $257,200 - $334,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity  By building strong relationships with the executives and team members at Adobe, you’ll be a major contributor in the Digital Experience Design Organization. Your role will complement and support the leaders for our team’s overarching goals and objectives. You will face ever-changing schedules and demands but with the support and cooperation of other executive assistants you will forge bonds of camaraderie in an enjoyable environment. Required attributes include the desire to build relationships, a strong willingness to help and support, and ability to be decisive and thrive in a fast- paced, ever-changing environment. Key responsibilities include diverse administrative tasks and coordinating special projects as outlined below. Organize senior leadership and department communications Organize quarterly all hands meetings and semi-annual team building events. Compile and publish weekly senior staff minutes and group updates. Maintain up to date organizational charts, contact lists and email alias lists. Extensive executive calendar management for VP and Senior Directors Seamlessly manage calendar and travel for VP and Senior Directors to help drive maximum effectiveness, all while coordinating complex travel arrangements and successfully handling last minute changes. Regularly interfacing with cross-functional C-level EAs. Coordinate reoccurring meetings for managers and cross- functional partners. Manage staff meetings and commitments Coordinate all arrangements for seminars, workshops, and meetings. Coordinate special projects including team onsites/offsites, team building activities and all hands meetings. Coordinate special projects and large meetings with internal and external individuals Arrange job candidate interviews and ensure smooth transitions for all new hires by obtaining office space, computer systems and accounts and managing all related work requests. Administrative coordination Team space planning and floor moves, and potentially other types of projects  Process forms including expense reports, change of status, employment requisitions, contractor time cards and IS and Facilities work requests. Assist with audio, visual and video and web conferencing when needed. Support budget management and processes  Submit and maintain expense and travel reports for VP Work with vendors and project managers to ensure billing occurs in timely manner and that project scope changes are considered and accounted for. Prepare, process, and track purchase order requisitions and recommend purchases of office supplies. Comply with Adobe policies and procedures and utilize Adobe Contracts Management system for all departmental purchases. What You Need To Succeed  BA/BS degree preferred  4-6 years’ administrative experience for executive leadership  Proactivity in a fast-paced, ever-changing global environment  Positive, can-do attitude even in stressful situations  Desire to constantly look for opportunities to create systems, checklists, and approaches to make things run more smoothly. Willingness to follow through and do what it takes to get the job done  Clear and concise communication  Strong business acumen and eloquent communicator  Ability to foresee challenges with calendar, travel needs, etc.  Ownership of the outcome – even when there is a lack of full control, ability to see it through until it is completed. Ability to remain flexible, embrace change and manage expectations in situations where you have little control  Exceptional ability to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlines with little direction  Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and timely follow- through  Effective time management skills and proven ability to prioritize when there are conflicting priorities to ensure key projects meet deadlines. Proven ability to assess and prioritize conflicting demands  Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills  Ability to interact with all levels of internal and external contacts with diplomacy and professionalism  Must handle confidential information with integrity and exercise discretion  Confidence and strong decision-making skills  Proven mastery of MS Office applications including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel. Willingness to learn additional tools including AirTable, Confluence, Trello, Workfront and others Resourcefulness: Ability to find creative solutions independently  Eagerness to network with other executive assistants at Adobe and cooperate as a worldwide team  Ability to travel occasionally to provide on-site support at events/conferences

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge As a member of the enterprise sales finance organization, you will play a critical role in Adobe achieving its strategic objectives and financial targets for the Americas Digital Experience business. Reporting to the director of Solution-Led Sales FP&A, you will be the finance business partner to the leader of the Corporate Solutions sales team, where you will provide insights and shape decisions to drive profitable growth. What you'll Do Serve as finance business partner to the VP of the Corporate Solutions sales team within Adobe’s Solution-Led GTM segment Execute financial planning/budgeting in a manner that supports business strategic objectives and prioritizes GTM motions with highest return on investment Drive weekly bookings/revenue forecasting and sales team accountability to targets Engage on deal structuring approaches for large/complex opportunities Manage headcount and operating expenses to budget by identifying and actioning expense efficiencies and/or investment tradeoffs Analyze business dimensions, conduct scenario modeling, provide data-driven insights, and influence action on identified opportunities and risks Represent the business’ financial position through crisp presentation and storytelling in both written and verbal communications Collaborate with finance peers and the support functions including sales operations, employee experience, and legal What You Need To Succeed 8+ years finance experience; software industry and sales team partnering experience preferred Advanced analytical abilities with high standards for accuracy Self-motivated with strong work ethic, desire to learn, attention to detail, and dedication to quality Ability to sort through high complexity and present upshots in easily digestible formats Experience with deal structuring Ability to multi-task in a highly matrixed, fast-paced environment Comfortable in a fluid environment that changes as the business evolves Effective communicator – strong executive presence and verbal/written communications Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field or equivalent practical experience At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity This is an exciting opportunity to join the Finance FP&A team supporting the Chief Legal, Chief Security Officers as well as Adobe’s Cloud Center of Excellence group. This is a dual role spanning FP&A support and analytical skills to manage a complex but highly strategic spend. The successful candidate will be the end to end Finance owner for this organization, including: forecasts, analyzing and presenting results, and driving projects to completion. You will engage and provide recommendations to senior leaders and their teams. Adobe is the leader in moving from traditional software delivery to cloud delivery. This role will be at the forefront of our cloud growth and how Adobe inspects cloud spend. You will work cross-functionally to bring the data points and story together. If you’re ready to dig in and if you’ve got the passion, expertise, and desire – we should talk! What You Will Do Responsibilities include, but not limited to: Legal, Security, and Policy Deliver Executive level (VP+) content, analysis, and recommendations; including HC and T&E bridges Partner with LSP colleagues on project specific forecasts, planning, and benefits to Adobe. Own quarterly outlooks, future quarter (re)forecast, provide visibility into rest of year R&O. Lead the AOP process. Ensure a smooth monthly close across all spend categories including Legal Fees, Pro Fees, T&E, Comp & Ben. Manage headcount modeling end to end. Deliver Flux, con margin, and variance analyses. Own and improve financial models that measures performance. Perform ad-hoc analysis. Bring it all together with the right financial cadence. Identify opportunities to automate and improve existing processes. Ability to prioritize multiple deliverables under tight deadlines. Cloud COE Primary finance contact who will partner with cloud operations on managing and delivering the efficiency program. Consolidate financial information for monthly, quarterly, and long-range forecasts. Provide analysis substantiated by key performance indicators. Engage with other Finance and Operations teams to understand key drivers in business models. What You Will Need To Succeed Positive attitude, collaborative, and comfortable in a fluid environment that changes as the business and as the day evolves. Ability to understand key business drivers, communicate financial implications, business impact, and recommendations efficiently. High attention to details with excellent organizational skills and ability to take charge, set objectives, drive to results. 5-9 years of Finance or related experience. Strong problem solving, analytical and accounting skills. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills are essential, experience in Tableau and Anaplan are preferred. SFDC, SAP, or TM1 is a plus. Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field; CPA or MBA preferred, but not required. Creative, adaptive, and eager to learn new ways and skills At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. The Opportunity Adobe’s Digital Media Finance organization is seeking a Finance Operations Lead. We're looking for someone to help keep things running efficiently in partnership with all areas of the business through coordination, cooperation, and collaboration. Your main "North Star" will be to work across the organization as well as cross-functionally to coordinate and orchestrate key projects and initiatives which drive the success of Digital Media Finance. You will embody operational excellence, break down silos, and influence teams all across Finance. What You'll Do As Adobe is growing quickly, every day will be different from the next, but below are a few things in particular that you'd independently own and drive: Develop a cadence for operational syncs and communications, keep a pulse on major projects Manage logistics, operations, and scheduling for major deliverables, end of quarter activities, and annual financial planning Connect with stakeholders and manage dependencies, clearly articulate downstream impacts of changes Coordinate quarterly DME Finance All Hands including information gathering, prep meetings, brainstorm key topics, guest speakers, gather feedback Drive enablement activities across Finance community such as organizing technical trainings, mentorship opportunities, automation idea-thons Manage roadmaps for ARR, Revenue, Expense, and Automation teams, to be shared out on a regular cadence Build shared resource site for DME Finance Represent DME Finance in Business Operations meetings Chief Morale Officer for DME FinanceWhat you need to succeed Positivity and agility in response to shifting priorities depending on business needs Proven experience in business manager or operations type roles General knowledge of FP&A Comfort communicating to and working directly with senior executives Dedication to accuracy and quality

What You'll Do As Adobe is growing quickly, every day will be different from the next, but below are a few things in particular that you'd independently own and drive: Develop a cadence for operational syncs and communications, keep a pulse on major projects Manage logistics, operations, and scheduling for major deliverables, end of quarter activities, and annual financial planning Connect with stakeholders and manage dependencies, clearly articulate downstream impacts of changes Coordinate quarterly DME Finance All Hands including information gathering, prep meetings, brainstorm key topics, guest speakers, gather feedback Drive enablement activities across Finance community such as organizing technical trainings, mentorship opportunities, automation idea-thons Manage roadmaps for ARR, Revenue, Expense, and Automation teams, to be shared out on a regular cadence Build shared resource site for DME Finance Represent DME Finance in Business Operations meetings Chief Morale Officer for DME FinanceWhat you need to succeed Positivity and agility in response to shifting priorities depending on business needs Proven experience in business manager or operations type roles General knowledge of FP&A Comfort communicating to and working directly with senior executives Dedication to accuracy and quality

jobTitle: Financial Data Scientist, Systems and Automation
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity This is an exciting opportunity to join the Digital Media Finance team as we continue to propel the business through data-driven forecasts and provide influential insights. We are looking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about using big data to deliver key insights for critical business decisions, improve forecasting accuracy, automate financial planning and budgeting processes. You will focus on driving data science and analysis across strategic projects to improve customer engagement & retention. The position will report to the Group Manager, Business Intelligence and Visualization and will provide an outstanding opportunity to drive timely insights for growth across Digital Media (DMe) Business at Adobe. The ideal candidate for this role will have hands-on experience with analytics and data science applied to subscription business, outstanding quantitative analysis and technical skills, superb communication, and experience working across cross-functional teams What you'll Do Partner with finance, accounting, BU partners, and leadership to develop and enhance forecasting methodologies Drive data science modeling initiatives for forecasting and analysis Automate, enhance, and maintain analytic applications and data structures used for modeling and forecasting Present findings to leadership and maintain dashboards tracking key indicators Accountable for ad-hoc support & participation in critical business analytics and key project support as directed by management Demonstrate strong intellectual curiosity towards enhancing current methodologies and processes Be a change agent, ensuring users embrace new and innovative technologiesWhat you need to succeed BS/BA with preferred focuses in areas of Business, Finance, or Information Systems 3+ years of relevant experience in data science and analytics in creating/maintaining financial models for a subscription/SaaS business a plus. Proficient in data querying and coding in SQL, Python, R or similar languages Strong understanding of predictive analytics and machine learning techniques Proficient in data platforms/systems (such as SQL, Hadoop, Snowflake, Databricks), ETL tools (such as Alteryx, SnapLogic), process automation, and standardization Experience exploring large amounts of information, extracting insights, and achieving real-world results. Self-starter with high attention to details, excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to take charge, set objectives, and deliver results Strong team orientation with great customer focus

We are looking for an adaptive and highly collaborative industry executive to lead one of Adobe’s largest global accounts. What you'll Do Establish and lead 3+ year joint account strategy and roadmap with the assigned account Define and build an effective joint governance model ensuring alignment and sponsorship across the account Develop and maintain strategic relationships with customer and Adobe executives to support priority initiatives and long-term account growth Lead the communications of business performance and associated value to the business and IT team members Drive the adoption of Adobe products and innovations within the account through thoughtful development of business cases that map back to customer priorities and the detailed strategy Grow revenues across the business (software, services, and support) Lead and mentor a global account team of 20+ people with a goal of ensuring the customer is realizing value from their investment in Adobe Orchestrate the account life cycle globally from vision setting and strategy development through sales and post-sales implementation, and ultimately consumption Establish an account-specific framework to identify, evaluate, and complete opportunities to co-innovate in order to address emerging market needs Coordinate critical customer-facing activities including executive engagement, company visits, briefings, and ideation workshops Ideate with, and support, Adobe marketing functions to drive engagement and events for the accountWhat you need to succeed Successful engagement will be defined by long-term retention of the base, growth in global revenues, increasing customer satisfaction, and successful execution of co-innovation initiatives. of proven track record directly leading a successful team of at least 5-10 people Outstanding executive presence and presentation skills, with the ability to converse with, encourage and engage jobTitle: Group SEO Manager, Adobe Express Growth
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity As the head of Adobe Express SEO team, you will be accountable for deeply understanding business priorities, setting SEO strategies, and implementing those strategies with proven business impact. You have an extensive hands-on SEO experience (technical, back-linking and content) but are also able to think at strategic level. In this position, you’ll work closely with web product managers, product marketing, paid/SEM teams, our content writers, and agency partners to advance a comprehensive, scalable, and impactful SEO program. Our team: We are a fast-paced group with multiple global and international collaborators. You will lead a growing team of individual contributors and managers with a substantial budget, helping to make decisions that impact our resources, timelines, web experiences and traffic goals. What you'll Do Own SEO strategy and execution across content, technical and back-linking pillars to achieve traffic targets. Balance several initiatives efficiently and in parallel, and shift priorities as needed. Continuously identify new SEO growth opportunities by analyzing existing content architecture, keyword constructs, and data/traffic metrics. Educate business collaborators and help distill down complex SEO concepts to provide more understanding of the SEO “black box”. Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure new site designs, feature launches, A/B tests align with SEO standards. Collaborate with data scientists to analyze sophisticated data sets to find opportunities, forecast results, and implement strategies, as well as prepare and present executive-ready reports with insights about SEO performance. Mentor a data-driven, innovative, best-in-class, and inclusive SEO team. Stay current on global SEO and search landscape and emerging trends and identify tools and reports to automate processes. What you need to succeed 8+ years of SEO experience, with strong focus on content and back-linking. 4+ years of proven experience managing SEO teams, including in-house and contingent staff Obsessed with SEO. You know the landscape of industry tools to audit, research, and analyze search data, and how to derive valuable insights. Deep expertise of technical, content and back-linking optimizations; in this role, you’ll do it all, but with a focus on scale and impact. Entrepreneurial- You're a hardworking and creative self-starter. You have the ability to learn quickly, adapt in a constantly evolving environment and focus on getting things done. Excellent communicator- you’ll be presenting across all levels and influencing several executive members to align on common goals. You can speak to technical concepts in a non-technical way. A problem solver- You can break down complex business issues, identify resolutions and take quick actions. Fact-based and data-driven- You are always willing challenge your own assumptions and lead with hard facts. Results- oriented- You are holding yourself and your team accountable to quarterly traffic goals. Empathetic- You are leading with emotional intelligence and driving a team culture where everyone learns, grows, and supports one another.

jobTitle: Growth Manager - App Store Optimization, Lightroom Mobile
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Adobe’s mobile apps serve hundreds of millions of users across the globe helping fulfill Adobe’s mission of "Creativity for All". We are searching for an ASO growth leader who will focus on making our mobile app store pages and their journeys into our outstanding products into a world class experience for all visitors. Working in close partnership with team members across growth, product marketing, design, and engineering, you will drive the future direction and strategy for our mobile app store presence for flagship Lightroom Mobile, through high velocity experimentation and analysis. The Opportunity: In this role, you will craft an action driven roadmap that meets or exceeds targets. Work with cross-functional teams and agencies to deliver product releases, optimize our app store presence relentlessly, and ensure that your projects accomplish their business objectives. And partner closely with ASO leaders across other business lines on shared learnings across Adobe's mobile portfolio. Key Contributions: Leverage data, customer and competitive insights, and industry-leading ASO practices to deliver compelling user experiences that power performance. Design and implement product discovery and optimization experiments across keyword, metadata, creative, in-app event, and custom product pages using quantitative (A/B tests) and qualitative research inputs. Prioritize and execute against targeted geos, providing localized experiences for our global audience. Prioritize (and re-prioritize) work against roadmap, resolve issues and mitigate risks through deep customer empathy and understanding of core app store performance drivers. Assess and report on the results of initiatives against key performance indicator targets. Consistently ensure that product positioning is best attracting our target audience within current market conditions to grow Share of Voice. The Ideal Candidate: Has 4+ years of global ASO or related experience in an analytical marketing function (ex. search, SEO, mobile user acquisition, etc.), focused on growing mobile audiences - or is eager to be an industry leading authority on mobile growth. Is experienced in A/B testing techniques for keyword, creative, and using data driven insights analysis to drive consistent business results. Has excellent communication skills. Ability to succinctly communicate results and tell compelling stories with data. Is experienced with App Store Optimization tools such as App Annie, AppTweak, and Sensor Tower. Is a self-starter who is results driven, pairs a high attention to detail with follow-through, and has proven success working cross-functionally with partners and executives. Has the ability to craft clear, compelling recommendations supported by strong analysis and business logic, and articulate them to the organization to gain support for recommendations. Above all - is enthusiastic, innovative, and driven to succeed! MBA preferred or BA/BS At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity As the head of Digital Performance Strategy Services – Value Realization, you will lead a team of highly skilled strategists as a direct leader , manager , and coach . You will support strategy consultants , and the teams they work with , by providing guidance on critical customer deliverables, ensuring that they are providing high impact strategy recommendations at the right levels of customer seniority, and ensuring clear and measurable outcomes. You will assist in the continued growth of the strategy practice by recruiting the best of the best strategists as we continue to expand this critical skillset. You will work with your fellow leaders a nd be accountable for productivity goals to ensure target achievement. You will support client success through direct and indirect client engagement. In addition to your people leadership, you will be the lead of Value Realization globally. You will be responsible to take the Adobe value realization methodology to a whole new level complete with frameworks, templates, calculator s , engagement best practices, and execution strategies (in partnership with our business consulting teams) and partner with global peers to roll it out across Adobe’s core consulting regions – Americas, EMEA, APAC, and India. C ritical to the success is the ability to gain the right audiences at the customer and partner (where applicable), to do efficient and deep discovery , provide a strong roadmap around KBOs and KPIs, partner with the product specialist and technical teams to drive outcomes, and deeply engage with marketing and business teams to drive ROI-producing end customer results . What You’ll Do Lead a team of 10-15 Digital Strategists focused on value realization with Adobe Experience Platform and related data services across America’s largest programs and world famous brands Work with top strategist s globally to accelerate and built upon value realization methodologies, tools, frameworks, calculators, and best practices and drive global adoption and consistency Fully partner with Adobe Business Consultants on the execution of the strategy as laid out by the strate gist across our programs and continue to enhance and build upon the dynamics o f this important partnership. Provide full lifecycle business outcome and value realization advisory Engage team members to expertly define and manage value realization engagements at large and growing customers , not all of whom start with a “strategy-first” mindset Build best practices for all aspects of engagement methodologies and tool sets Provide analytical expertise to help assess and prioritize accounts and strategies Lead a team to create high-quality deliverables that communicate strategic alignment, value achieved and opportunities to optimize investments to create more value – consistently and repeatably Expertly communicate and advise in 1:1 and 1: many environments – both internally and externally Thought leadership in sales conversations and alignment on large deals and go-to-market enhancements Identify, lead and contribute to the creation of new IP (best practices, white papers, workshops, etc. ) Collaborate with and enable the Adobe Professional Services and Customer Success teams on a consulting approach to support renewals and new sales Manage critical customers escalations Partner with the Director, Digital Performance Strategy Services to lead and guide this critical team through dynamic change Manage operational components – customer facing utilization, productive time on internal initiatives, revenue targets, etc Exert strategic internal influence to drive outcomes during times of conflict with customers and within our large matrixed organization The Ideal Candidate 15 + years working within digital, including 10+ years focused on value realization for digital marketing technologies and platforms, especially related to customer data and insights 7+ years direct management experience of consultants within the digital marketing and value realization space , having guided a team to drive successful digital projects with large enterprise customers Excels and brings strong thought leadership and clear recommendations to customer engagements Substantive experience at a top tier consulting firm with highly technical cloud or data technologies , or within the professional services arm of a leading digital marketing technology vendor Adept at navigating cross functional business processes and Industry trends Experience developing team members to establish and grow C-Level relationships with an ability to simplify and communicate complex topics to an audience with various functional knowledge Excellent presentation skills including public speaking, meeting facilitation and white boarding Exemplary analytical and financial acumen Enjoy working in a highly collaborative, fast- paced and often ambiguous environment Willing to travel Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $158,900 - $206,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

New York Starting Salary $158,900 - $206,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Position The Frame.io team is looking for a senior engineering executive to lead the product and infrastructure engineering teams through a period of rapid growth. We have a vision to accelerate through our innovations in online collaboration across a wide range of use cases and end market while working across the broader Adobe platform. You will spearhead the development of Frame.io, in partnership with the CEO, product management, and design leaders. You will lead a hard-working engineering team at the forefront of delivering Adobe’s “Creativity for All” mission that draws on our decades of experience working with the creative community. You will recruit, develop, manage, and lead a globally dispersed engineering team responsible for building and delivering Frame.io to the masses by working across internal and external ecosystems. We are looking for someone who holds high standards and is technical, driven, and creative. We are also seeking an individual who through their leadership, clear communication skills, can-do attitude, resourcefulness, and collaborative approach can work effectively with their team and other product teams across Adobe. The goal is to deliver on the short and long-term strategy and roadmap. You will be responsible for maintaining a high bar of quality, stability, and performance across mobile and web platforms as we quickly scale users and revenue. This is a role with significant executive visibility. The successful candidate will need to implement the high-level business strategy for the platform by integrating with other creative tools in Creative Cloud. We are a team with the energy, pace and dynamic of a start-up, while having the larger support of Adobe, to go bigger and do ambitious things. Key responsibilities include: A passion for building the industry’s go-to collaboration platform for content creation at scale Lead a globally distributed team of 80+ engineers that has gone through significant growth, which is expected to continue in a big way. Single-threaded leadership: coordinate leaders of product management, engineering, architecture, operations, and architecture Own product technical roadmaps, backlog, and team financials. Develop long-term scalable architectural direction, with a focus on system design, team velocity, and user experience. Influence internal and external partnership commitments Establish processes and methods that ensure a high level of productivity, quality, performance and reliability. Work with designers and product management to set roadmaps, planning the development and delivery of technology at an enterprise level of quality and a consumer level of engagement. Work across the executive team to deliver on Adobe’s business goals and create tight cooperation and coordination between matrixed, x-functional teams. Cultivate an engineering culture that supports innovation and creativity while delivering high quality products with predictability and reliability. Ensure engineering excellence and rigor in architecture, execution, and delivery. The Person You have deep people leadership & management experience in full-stack (product + infrastructure) software development and cloud-native/SaaS businesses. Have led a team of 100-200+ engineers on a global basis for a SaaS, collaboration, or workflow apps company. You have provided technical guidance, career development, and mentoring to senior technical managers and architects. Communication: the ability to lead a team that is geographically distributed is important. Strong executive presence with fully-developed oral, written, and presentation skills. Relationship management: build deep partnerships with teams inside the company to support their needs. Need to influence commitments, solicit platform feedback for ecosystem and organization fit. People development and leadership: expansive mature team covering a variety of skills, each looking for their next big career step. Leaders work to empower the team and get each member to their best. Technical Ownership: work alongside senior team members to define and implement a vision, weigh major architectural decisions that impact some of the largest cloud provider accounts. B.S. or above degree in Computer Science or related technical field. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hard working individuals, regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $237,100 - $324,800 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Adobe Research ( research.adobe.com ) is pleased to announce an opening for an Imaging Research Scientist in the Creative Intelligence Lab (CIL) in Seattle or San Francisco. Responsibilities include working closely with researchers, engineers, user experience designers, and product managers to build a software platform for generative image modeling, develop prototypes that showcase new research technologies, and to help integrate those technologies into Adobe’s products. Other important responsibilities include keeping up to date with the latest research advances and integrating these into our platform. CIL plays a key role in creating next-generation applications and features in Adobe’s flagship products, including Photoshop, Premiere, After Effects, Illustrator, Lightroom, and Acrobat. We have worked on banner features such as Photoshop’s Content-Aware Fill, Smart Portrait and other Neural Filters; Lightroom’s Upright Photo; Content Aware Fill for Video in After Effects; Premiere’s Multi-Camera Sync; Characterizer for Character Animator; Audition’s Remix; Illustrator’s latest Pencil tool; and an array of forthcoming mobile apps and desktop features. We’re looking for exceptional candidates with expertise in computer science or software engineering. For this position, we will give preference to candidates with hands-on experience in deep generative models, e.g., GANs, for image and video generation tasks. For successful candidates, nearly all of the following will be true: You have hands-on experience in deep generative models and image processing. You have significant experience in building and training robust, complex machine learning systems. You are excellent at collaborating with a team to get work done. You are comfortable both building prototypes from scratch and writing maintainable code inside large existing codebases. You have strong software development skills that encourage code reuse among researchers. You can understand and prototype ideas from research papers independently. You have some experience in developing interactive systems and user interfaces Requirements for this position include: 1+ years of experience with deep learning and generative models such as GANs PhD in computer vision, computer graphics, machine learning or related fields or a master’s degree with 2+ years hands-on experience in generative models Ability to write efficient, clean, and reusable code in Python Familiarity with modern deep learning frameworks Strong communication and collaboration skills Ability and willingness to learn new technologies quickly The research engineer will work with world-class researchers and other research engineers across the entire Adobe Research organization to build a platform that will influence the next generation creative workflow.

The Opportunity As a member of Workplace Operations Team, you will be responsible for supporting the global AV infrastructure. Your home location will be San Jose Headquarters. Working to resolve sophisticated technical challenges affecting our video conference solutions. Work closely with partners, vendors, and support business organizations to ensure exceptional digital experiences with all collaboration tools and services. Project management skills are required in leading deployments, upgrades, and changes to our AV environment. Develop detailed project plans, lead implementation processes including resource allocation, progress tracking, testing, documentation, training. You will have the opportunity to globally support collaboration tools, services, and software. Understanding how they work in a hybrid work environment. Ensure that software upgrades and rollouts are efficiently delivered with no downtime, globally. Work closely with collaboration front & back-end infrastructure, networking, for a multi-deployment of AV technologies. Specific focus will be on level 4 AV technical and operational support for a diverse portfolio of video conference solutions and technologies. Work independently in a fast-paced environment. Appling your excellent troubleshooting skills, diagnose, resolve, recognize and priority issues, raising them accordingly. Responsible for resolving complex technical challenges affecting our video conference solutions. Work closely with partners, vendors, and business organizations to ensure exceptional digital experiences with all collaboration tools and services. Requirements B.A. or B.S. degree – Engineering or related field Five plus years of field experience; delivering, supporting and troubleshooting AV solutions. Proven verbal and written communication skills. Communicate technically and or at an Executive level, knowing your audience. Have a clear understanding of Microsoft applications: Teams, Excel, PowerPoint and Word for documentation and reporting requirements. Understand the end-to-end process flow of an AV global deployment. Knowledge of AV software, architecture, and diverse environments in which they are located. Possesses the ability to design, propose, setup and test AV IT solutions for conference rooms, custom specialty spaces, auditoriums, and varying environments. Ability to diagnose and resolved issues with a wide array of hardware and software challenges in a corporate office environment. Ability to access a situation. prioritize the severity and responding appropriately. Capable of learning and understanding new technologies quickly and developing a proficiency that establishes confidence and provides results Qualifications Experience in large corporations with locations globally. Ability to operate and travel between different sites and locations, up to 15% travel. Extraordinarily responsive to customers, services, and satisfaction oriented. Flexible work hours to provide vital services as needed Working with teams globally, North America, EMEA, Asia Pac and India Ambitious, self-starter with a positive, upbeat demeanor With limited direction, run with tasks, projects, and challenges while delivering on tight schedules Ability to work in high pressure, multifaceted and accelerated environment Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

The Challenge Are you passionate about guiding teams on how to improve experience in today digital workplace? The Enterprise productivity organization is seeking an enthusiastic, autonomous and multifaceted Product Analyst to drive the establishment of an experience management program that will help Adobe teams realizing their vision. You will design and deliver solutions for the technology platform with a team of engineers and technical experts. What You’ll Do Work with cross-functional partners to drive consensus across teams and advocate for solutions that balance the needs of our users with our business goals Provide support to internal partners, this may include survey/assessment design, change management consulting, post-survey data analysis and interpretation, executive presentations, action planning consulting Be the voice of the employee and customer Drive research and requirements capturing to influence product opportunities and value propositions. Use analytics and data to refine the product strategy and plan Partner with global teams to collaborate on common processes to support shared and initiatives are rolled out globally where applicable Develop dashboards and key performance metrics to monitor project and operational health Participate in one or more scrum teams as a product owner to define goals, set priorities and help manage the backlog Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related technical field 2-4 years of experience at a Technology Software as a Service (Saas) company 2-4 years of experience with project management Proficient with HTML/CSS and Javascript Experience configuring SaaS software solutions or conducting technical trainings Superb communicator and problem-solver Demonstrated success in working with digital product teams – leading collaboration between external and internal engineering, UX, project management & product teams; shipping products that deliver results. Strong analytical skills and a drive to experiment; ability to use data to drive decision making in product development Ability to manage complex builds through thoughtful prioritization and disciplines that drive towards delivery Agile/Scrum experience is preferred. Experience in technologies such as Medallia is preferred “At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.”
