What you'll Do Communicate with leaders across Adobe to analyze and understand enablement needs, and design curriculum to meet those needs Design, develop and maintain on-demand enablement, including but not limited to eLearning, labs, job aids, assessments Support presenter-led virtual events, with instructional expertise and engaging learning experiences Lead complex training development projects independently and with minimal guidance Ensure content quality as it relates to effective learning design, consistency, accuracy, instructional language, and relevance to audience requirements Mentor instructional team members regarding learning design, development tools, processes and product/business knowledgeWhat you need to succeed 5-plus-years of instructional design experience in software and/or sales. Masters / Bachelors / Certification in instructional design a plus. In-depth knowledge of instructional methodologies, strategies, processes and standards. Proficient in e-learning development tools, preferably Adobe Captivate, Articulate Rise and Storyline Understanding of SCORM and experience with learning management systems Excellent consultancy skills to engage with individuals cross-organizationally Ability to work in and coordinate with multicultural and virtual teams. Strong verbal communication, listening, writing and presentation skills. Good knowledge of international English and content development standards. Proficient in MS Office - Word, PowerPoint, Excel, OneNote Desirable: Basic understanding of digital marketing, sales principles and methodologies, and/ or cloud-based services. Adobe creative tools skills. What you'll Do Communicate with leaders across Adobe to analyze and understand enablement needs, and design curriculum to meet those needs Design, develop and maintain on-demand enablement, including but not limited to eLearning, labs, job aids, assessments Support presenter-led virtual events, with instructional expertise and engaging learning experiences Lead complex training development projects independently and with minimal guidance Ensure content quality as it relates to effective learning design, consistency, accuracy, instructional language, and relevance to audience requirements Mentor instructional team members regarding learning design, development tools, processes and product/business knowledgeWhat you need to succeed 5-plus-years of instructional design experience in software and/or sales. Masters / Bachelors / Certification in instructional design a plus. In-depth knowledge of instructional methodologies, strategies, processes and standards. Proficient in e-learning development tools, preferably Adobe Captivate, Articulate Rise and Storyline Understanding of SCORM and experience with learning management systems Excellent consultancy skills to engage with individuals cross-organizationally Ability to work in and coordinate with multicultural and virtual teams. Strong verbal communication, listening, writing and presentation skills. Good knowledge of international English and content development standards. Proficient in MS Office - Word, PowerPoint, Excel, OneNote Desirable: Basic understanding of digital marketing, sales principles and methodologies, and/ or cloud-based services. Adobe creative tools skills. The Opportunity The Internal Auditor will be a key member of Adobe’s Risk Advisory Assurance Services (RAAS) team in Adobe's Lehi, Utah office, reporting to the Senior Manager, Internal Audit. As a team member of RAAS, they will support SOX Finance Compliance and Audit & Advisory projects and reviews at Adobe. What you'll Do Participate in the execution of activities to support the objectives established for SOX compliance including an understanding of SOX processes, conducting and participating in the walkthroughs, conducting tests of design, and tests of operational effectiveness for key processes and controls. Conduct innovative audit and advisory projects of key business and finance focus areas to evaluate financial, technology, and operational risk management. Develop a detailed understanding of business processes, looking for both control gaps and opportunities to gain process efficiencies. Ensure accurate identification and disposition of internal control issues that have potential financial, technology, operational, and/or compliance risk implications to the company and that they are well-defined, documented and the root causes are analyzed, discussed, and agreed with Management. Document accurate, logical, and detailed work papers clearly describing the tests, the result of work performed, and conclusions reached in the RAAS audit management tool. Act as a trusted advisor with international and domestic office management for the purpose of conducting audits, develop improvement opportunities, build consensus and support the implementation of solutions, and provide advice on risk mitigation and internal controls management. Travel can be up to 5-10%, requires flexible work hours, as needed. What you need to succeed Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance preferred. Professional certification such as CPA/CA, CIA, CISA or CFE is a plus but not required Minimum 1-5 years of proven ability, including Financial Audit/Technology/Attestation/Enterprise Risk Services in a Big Four firm or large global public company internal audit or Finance environment. Knowledge and experience in SOX 404 documentation and testing and/or financial auditing required. Experience in technology and operational auditing desirable. Experience in the software industry is desirable with a confirmed understanding of software revenue recognition a plus. Experience in evaluating technical areas (i.e. logical and physical access, change control, application controls, etc.) and conducting fraud reviews is a plus. Good leadership, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, and ability to interact with all levels of management. Highly motivated and proactive, with strong organizational and project management skills to prioritize tasks and lead workload to timely completion. Ability to take direction, learn quickly, work independently, and maintain a level of professional skepticism.

Lead Financial Analyst Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. The Challenge This is an exciting opportunity to join the enterprise sales finance team and help Adobe achieve its strategic objectives and financial targets for its Americas enterprise business. You will play an instrumental role in providing insights into the business and offering recommendations to drive profitable growth. Reporting to the director of Americas enterprise sales FP&A, your responsibilities will include maturing and streamlining financial frameworks to enable increased management rigor across the various dimensions of the business. What You'll Do Seek a deep understanding of data and metrics and establish/scale high standards for accuracy Improve existing financial frameworks and flow of information through innovation and optimization and establish consistent use across the business – planning/budgeting, weekly forecasting, and reporting/analysis for bookings/revenue, headcount, and expenses Use data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks in the business and present recommendations to leadership Support quarterly business reviews with crisp, succinct analysis and storytelling across a complex business covering a wide surface area Build financial scenario models to evaluate business cases for profitable growth Conduct ad hoc financial analysis to support key initiatives Collaborate with leadership, finance peers, sales operations, and employee experience on improving data-based run-the-business routines and ways of workingWhat You Need to Succeed 10+ years professional experience in finance, business intelligence, or related field – software industry and sales finance experience preferred Advanced analytical abilities with large/complex data sets with high standards for accuracy Strong Excel, SQL, and PowerPoint skills; experience with SFDC, PowerBI, and Anaplan a plus Self-starter with an inquisitive mind, eager to challenge the status quo and provide recommendation Ability to sort through high complexity and present upshots in easily digestible formats Effective communicator – strong verbal/written communications Ability to multi-task in a highly matrixed, fast-paced environment Comfortable in a fluid environment that changes as the business evolves Strong collaborator Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field or equivalent practical experience “At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the important benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.” Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $111,700 - $145,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. The Challenge This is an exciting opportunity to join the enterprise sales finance team and help Adobe achieve its strategic objectives and financial targets for its Americas enterprise business. You will play an instrumental role in providing insights into the business and offering recommendations to drive profitable growth. Reporting to the director of Americas enterprise sales FP&A, your responsibilities will include maturing and streamlining financial frameworks to enable increased management rigor across the various dimensions of the business. What You'll Do Seek a deep understanding of data and metrics and establish/scale high standards for accuracy Improve existing financial frameworks and flow of information through innovation and optimization and establish consistent use across the business – planning/budgeting, weekly forecasting, and reporting/analysis for bookings/revenue, headcount, and expenses Use data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks in the business and present recommendations to leadership Support quarterly business reviews with crisp, succinct analysis and storytelling across a complex business covering a wide surface area Build financial scenario models to evaluate business cases for profitable growth Conduct ad hoc financial analysis to support key initiatives Collaborate with leadership, finance peers, sales operations, and employee experience on improving data-based run-the-business routines and ways of workingWhat You Need to Succeed 10+ years professional experience in finance, business intelligence, or related field – software industry and sales finance experience preferred Advanced analytical abilities with large/complex data sets with high standards for accuracy Strong Excel, SQL, and PowerPoint skills; experience with SFDC, PowerBI, and Anaplan a plus Self-starter with an inquisitive mind, eager to challenge the status quo and provide recommendation Ability to sort through high complexity and present upshots in easily digestible formats Effective communicator – strong verbal/written communications Ability to multi-task in a highly matrixed, fast-paced environment Comfortable in a fluid environment that changes as the business evolves Strong collaborator Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field or equivalent practical experience “At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the important benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.” Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $111,700 - $145,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity The Legal Counsel will be based in our San Jose / San Francisco Office and will be working on a team supporting a broad range of outbound enterprise licensing and sales matters for cloud based services, on premise software, and professional services – areas that are significant to Adobe's success. What you'll do 75-80% of this role will focus on negotiating customer contracts for Adobe's enterprise Digital Experience and Digital Media clients. This attorney will need to have experience negotiating sophisticated enterprise software, SaaS/Cloud, and professional services contracts. This attorney will lead, co-lead or participate in a handful of projects. For example, a project to improve deal velocity by promoting "Low Touch/No Touch" contracting resources to allow sales teams and other partners to engage in self-help for contract negotiations. Provide legal counsel to Sales and Sales Management (and possibly other internal groups, such as the Product teams, Privacy/Security team, and Consulting Services teams) on a variety of licensing topics including intellectual property, commercial terms, and privacy law. What you need to succeed J.D. from an accredited law school and an active bar membership required 2-5 years of relevant experience Subject matter knowledge in key areas like Privacy (ex. CCPA and GDPR compliance), Information Security protocols, and key contract provisions (ex. IP infringement indemnity, warranties, data privacy, data security) Dexterity in advising a sales team Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, often multi-tasking Great communications skills

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The M&A Integration Manager is a forward-thinking professional, responsible for helping to drive the strategy, timing and orchestration of integration motions in Adobe as part of the Corporate Controllership organization reporting to the Finance Integration Director. They will ensure the success of the M&A Integrations by partnering with the Finance Integration Director and cross functional members of the integration teams across Procure to Pay (P2P), Record to Report (R2R) and Quote to Cash (Q2C), as well as Tax and Treasury, to drive alignment on priorities, budget, launch timing and systems integration timing. The ideal candidate will engage with partners, stakeholders and leadership, to ensure our customers are supported, and ensure M&A Integrations are planned for across the organization in an efficient and repeatable way through the application of repeatable frameworks and standard processes that drive increased business value. What you'll Do Ensure Integrations are completed in accordance with planned timing, funding, and designated scope Drive accountability for delivering M&A integration activities, driving cross-functional alignment, generating clarity and partnering with business and team members to remove barriers. Work hand in hand with Senior Leaders, business and functional leaders to ensure alignment across the operating model, integration approach and organizational structure for each deal to drive execution and efficiencies. Develop and maintain integration-related key performance indicators to measure the efficiency of transaction-value drivers. Drive integration plans, coordinate cross-functional teams, run regular integration meetings and drive proactive issue resolution. Proactively identify areas for improvements throughout the deal lifecycle and implement best-in-class practices. Help ensure repeatable process strategy and finance integration toolset (e.g., playbooks, process flows, work plans) incorporating prior experience and industry-leading practices across all key workstreams are set up and maintained up to date. Build trusted and strong working relationships with all stakeholders. What you need to succeed Experienced Professional with a bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of operational experience and relevant industry expertise, exposure to Global M&A and large-scale integrations, handling a range of cross-functional teams, and experience leading multiple priorities at once. Strong consultative approach to problem-solving ability and ability to deliver with minimal direct supervision. Ability to build project goals, messaging, communication, and overall plans. Strong Acumen, hands-on approach and confident communicator with good executive experience and excellent interpersonal skills, able to clearly communicate to non-technical and technical audiences and establish relationships across all levels. Work effectively in a fast-paced environment with contending priorities and establish clarity when faced with uncertainty.

The Opportunity Adobe’s Digital Media Sales Strategy & Execution team seeks to achieve operational excellence and efficiency for our B2B sales. The team’s key objectives include driving the planning behind our biggest strategic programs, and increasing our sales velocity through our Sales Systems & Tools, whilst implementing sales efficiency across our Global support functions. The Sales Strategy Manager opportunity will focus on our large, corporate wide, annual sales planning initiatives and will be a key member driving initiatives from ideation to execution. What You'll Do Partner with Sales & PMM leadership to drive alignment on planning, strategy, objectives and execution for our biggest annual sales initiatives Develop an aligned cross-functional and quantified view of our Sales opportunity and drive territory coverage optimization, sales resource and quota planning. Drive metric creation to measure the impact of our initiatives, ultimately increasing our sales productivity, and uncover new revenue growth levers Collaboration with wider Strategy, Sales, Product, Marketing, Biz Ops, Analytics, Enablement teams to develop effective strategic alignment and operating models across the teams What You’ll Need To Succeed +8 years experience in Strategy, Operations, Analytics, consulting/software preferred Ability to build a vision, strategy & plan that can scale quickly in a large B2B business Track record designing business process, capacity modelling & territory planning. Proactive & self starter with experience driving strategic initiatives Experience building cross-functional partnerships at senior level Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to tell a story relevant to the audience, at all managerial levels.

This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to lead Adobe’s Enterprise Resilience program. As the Manager, Enterprise Resilience, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to lead and mature the program, which is dedicated to improving the continuity capability of the organization, ensuring continued compliance with business continuity certifications/standards and representing Adobe in continuity assurance activities with current and prospective Adobe enterprise customers The role will require a leader with proven experience in cross-functional collaboration, consensus building, relationship management and proven results. Reporting to the Director of Technology Governance, Risk and Compliance (TechGRC), the role will be based in San Jose, CA. Responsibilities Build and drive the strategic vision for a mature enterprise resilience program across the company Partner with the business to facilitate the annual resilience program lifecycle (e.g. business impact assessments, continuity plan creation/update, testing) Lead the expansion of Adobe’s business continuity planning strategies to meet the needs of emerging risks Drive disaster recovery compliance across Adobe’s products, services and internal functions Collaborate with key business areas to provide domain expertise to initiatives across the organization Ensure the enterprise resilience program’s continued compliance with relevant frameworks (e.g. ISO 22301, SOC 2, FedRAMP, HIPAA, etc.) Liaise with internal and external auditors on annual recertification efforts Serve as a customer-facing point for business continuity and disaster recovery inquiries supporting existing customers and new business prospects Lead and develop a geo-dispersed team of professionals to build a culture of resilience across the organizationRequirements 8-12 years in Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, Crisis Management or related experience in high technology environments CBCP/MBCI or higher certification 3-5 years people management experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of higher education and achievement - preferably in business, information systems or related fields Strong understanding of cloud technology environments (e.g. AWS, Azure) Strong MS Office skills (Excel, Word, SharePoint, etc.) Familiarity with emerging regulatory frameworks which may impact Adobe’s resilience program Open to travel internationally across various Adobe Locations Experience with JIRA/Confluence preferred At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We are on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe, is the leader in enterprise experience management. We are seeking an expert Strategic Enterprise First Line Sales Manager, Financial Services – to engage with Adobe’s top FSI accounts – who will be responsible for formulating and carrying out a strategy to drive net new revenue as well as expand existing customer relationships within an assigned territory. You will lead a team of Specialists that will sell AEM. This role works in partnership with Sales, Solutions Consulting, Field Marketing, Business Development, Partner Managers, and Services, therefore cross-company engagement and orchestration is critical. The candidate will be a high-impact individual capable of driving outstanding business results & best-in-class employee development. Successful candidates will have a demonstrated track record of overachievement from closing complex enterprise deals. The Sales Leader is fully responsible for developing and leading the team to generate revenue and achieve individual and team quotas. Are you looking for an exciting job to make a difference and make a significant impact? Come join the team! What You’ll Do Talent development - Will recruit, coach, mentor and lead an accomplished team of sales professionals to achieve annual sales targets. Sales strategy - Will develop effective and specific territories and drive your team to develop account strategies and plans to ensure revenue target delivery and long-term growth. Trusted executive advisor - Will establish strong executive relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and commitment to value (value of counsel and expertise, value of solutions, value of implementation expertise). Territory and account leadership - Lead executive account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles. Encourage all accounts to become Adobe references. Business planning – Will develop and deliver a comprehensive business plan to address customers' priorities and problem areas. Apply Strategic Value Assessments, benchmarking and return on investment data to support the customer’s decision process. Pipeline planning - Follow a strict approach to maintaining a rolling 4Q pipeline and keep pipeline current. Develop and maintain strategic account plans to acquire new customers and grow existing customer revenue. Solution Expertise – Be proficient in Adobe Experience Manager to drive sales pursuits. Understand the AEM landscape, trends, partners, and competitors to help drive success. What you need to succeed 5+ years of successful sales leadership experience as measured by sales performance against goals, as well as proven ability to lead a sophisticated strategic enterprise sales cycle. 8+ years overall experience in enterprise level software selling required. Consistent record of accomplishment driving deals through prospecting, discovery, solution proposal, and closing new business. Excellent presentation, executive engagement, and negotiation skills, with best-in-class customer service approach. Ability to work successfully in a team environment acting as the leader and liaison with all organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Product, Marketing, Ops, Finance, Legal and Partners. Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/opportunities and recommending an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities. Knowledge of large, complex sales models is a big plus as well as prior experience selling innovative technologies. Senior sales leadership experience at best of breed tech company a plus. Ability to build, lead and develop a highly motivated sales team. BA/BS degree required. Adobe is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $263,000 - $341,500 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

THE OPPORTUNITY Adobe is looking for a Manager of Business Development who will lead a team of inside sales reps focused on building sales pipeline and contributing to revenue growth in the Americas Enterprise segment. In this role, this manager will encourage people to bring their best to Adobe as they learn and deliver sales excellence through account-based sales development practices. This leader will be a mentor in helping reps develop their sales skills, build pipeline and prepare for a future field sales role. What You Will Do Lead and develop the sales development team to create top sales pipeline opportunities Run day-to-day inside sales operations to ensure processes, policies and procedures are maintained and improved as needed to drive business efficiencies to the next level Carry and drive an individual pipeline quota with your team on a quarterly basis Orchestrate inbound and outbound prospecting activities and programs to deliver quality sales pipeline in enterprise target accounts Mentor and coach the team with standard methodologies in modern sales prospecting tactics Partner with management to drive strategic direction and alignment with sales organization Work cross-functionally across the sales and marketing ecosystem to align sales development messaging, plays, and lead qualification standards that ensure lead conversion quality Responsible for reporting and communicating to sales management, operations, and marketing organization on key performance metrics, lead conversion trends, and Quarterly Business Reviews on overall program and team performance What You Need To Succeed Passion, Grit and a desire to WIN! 5+ years of lead generation and/or sales experience, with carrying a quota Develop a "Best in Class" Business Development team that exceeds targets Strong leader who is self-motivated and able to develop employees Ability to identify key trends in winning employees and replicate success across the group Strong understanding of Business-to-Business customer buying cycles and how to penetrate organizations Strong ecosystem management with remote Sales, Sales Operations, and Demand Generation Drive consistent lead/meeting qualification increasing overall sales pipeline Strong team orientation and ability to build cross-functional relationships Focus on career development of individual team members, helping position them for career advancement Ability to innovate within a growing business unit

What You Will Do Lead and develop the sales development team to create top sales pipeline opportunities Run day-to-day inside sales operations to ensure processes, policies and procedures are maintained and improved as needed to drive business efficiencies to the next level Carry and drive an individual pipeline quota with your team on a quarterly basis Orchestrate inbound and outbound prospecting activities and programs to deliver quality sales pipeline in enterprise target accounts Mentor and coach the team with standard methodologies in modern sales prospecting tactics Partner with management to drive strategic direction and alignment with sales organization Work cross-functionally across the sales and marketing ecosystem to align sales development messaging, plays, and lead qualification standards that ensure lead conversion quality Responsible for reporting and communicating to sales management, operations, and marketing organization on key performance metrics, lead conversion trends, and Quarterly Business Reviews on overall program and team performance What You Need To Succeed Passion, Grit and a desire to WIN! 5+ years of lead generation and/or sales experience, with carrying a quota Develop a "Best in Class" Business Development team that exceeds targets Strong leader who is self-motivated and able to develop employees Ability to identify key trends in winning employees and replicate success across the group Strong understanding of Business-to-Business customer buying cycles and how to penetrate organizations Strong ecosystem management with remote Sales, Sales Operations, and Demand Generation Drive consistent lead/meeting qualification increasing overall sales pipeline Strong team orientation and ability to build cross-functional relationships Focus on career development of individual team members, helping position them for career advancement Ability to innovate within a growing business unit

jobTitle: Manager of Business Development (Inside Sales) - Creative Cloud
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! THE OPPORTUNITY Adobe is looking for a Manager of Business Development who will lead a team of inside sales reps focused on building sales pipeline and contributing to revenue growth in the Americas Enterprise segment. In this role, this manager will encourage people to bring their best to Adobe as they learn and deliver sales excellence through account-based sales development practices. This leader will be a mentor in helping reps develop their sales skills, build pipeline and prepare for a future field sales role. What You Will Do Lead and develop the sales development team to create top sales pipeline opportunities Run day-to-day inside sales operations to ensure processes, policies and procedures are maintained and improved as needed to drive business efficiencies to the next level Carry and drive an individual pipeline quota with your team on a quarterly basis Orchestrate inbound and outbound prospecting activities and programs to deliver quality sales pipeline in enterprise target accounts Mentor and coach the team with standard methodologies in modern sales prospecting tactics Partner with management to drive strategic direction and alignment with sales organization Work cross-functionally across the sales and marketing ecosystem to align sales development messaging, plays, and lead qualification standards that ensure lead conversion quality Responsible for reporting and communicating to sales management, operations, and marketing organization on key performance metrics, lead conversion trends, and Quarterly Business Reviews on overall program and team performance What You Need To Succeed Passion, Grit and a desire to WIN! 5+ years of lead generation and/or sales experience, with carrying a quota Develop a "Best in Class" Business Development team that exceeds targets Strong leader who is self-motivated and able to develop employees Ability to identify key trends in winning employees and replicate success across the group Strong understanding of Business-to-Business customer buying cycles and how to penetrate organizations Strong ecosystem management with remote Sales, Sales Operations, and Demand Generation Drive consistent lead/meeting qualification increasing overall sales pipeline Strong team orientation and ability to build cross-functional relationships Focus on career development of individual team members, helping position them for career advancement Ability to innovate within a growing business unit

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Marketers are increasingly relying on Adobe to help them resolve their biggest challenges and increase loyalty, retention, acquisition, and revenue. As a Manager within the Client Delivery Management Team, your primary responsibility will be to support, mentor and guide program and project managers as they help our customer realize these goals using Adobe's Marketing Cloud platform. You will support program and project managers who will work directly with customers and lead teams who will resolve sophisticated technical and business challenges such as integrating multiple data systems via multiple protocols, implementing a solution that can provide real-time decisions for millions of customers, and connecting customers to all the products in the Adobe Marketing Cloud. Your knowledge of software development, differing delivery methodologies and strong project management principles including experience in supporting large consulting practices will be the key to your success. What you'll Do Lead, recruit, mentor, a team of Adobe Project Management Consultants, ensure customer success through quality in consulting management and delivery. Drive continuous improvement of consulting delivery processes, standards, and practices driving customer excellence. Run client escalations, by guiding and coaching the team to ensure proper communication, vitality, prioritization, and ownership throughout the experience. Meet and exceed targets around: customer satisfaction, billable utilization, consulting revenue and margin as well as driving operational excellence. Proactively champion collaboration with Customer Care, Engineering, Product Management, Technical Operations, and other internal Adobe teams. Organize and conduct enablement sessions to strengthen team with respect to both technical- and soft-skill proficiencies. Lead and inspire team with positivity and optimism, creating a culture of high expectations and achievement. What you need to succeed Executive leadership skills including the ability to develop, influence and empower a diverse team to maximize results. Ability to communicate, coordinate, and drive optimal revenue, team productivity and margin performance. Previous experience in a delivery and consulting project management role. Experience leading and running a large team of remote based technical consulting teams, within software vendors is preferred. Minimum of 5-years’ experience leading Consulting teams. Ability to interact and communicate for impact with all levels of an organization both internally and externally, including business and technical. Confident ability to lead, collaborate, triage, and make decisions in a fast-paced, changing environment. Shown strength in EQ (emotional intelligence) as well as analytical and problem-solving skills. Expert-level experience in negotiation and conflict resolution. In-depth knowledge of Digital Marketing and Cross Channel Campaign Management required. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with meticulous attention to detail. Bachelor’s Degree in related field of the technical industry, or equivalent experience. Ability to travel up to 35% At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

The Opportunity Marketers are increasingly relying on Adobe to help them resolve their biggest challenges and increase loyalty, retention, acquisition, and revenue. As a Manager within the Client Delivery Management Team, your primary responsibility will be to support, mentor and guide program and project managers as they help our customer realize these goals using Adobe's Marketing Cloud platform. You will support program and project managers who will work directly with customers and lead teams who will resolve sophisticated technical and business challenges such as integrating multiple data systems via multiple protocols, implementing a solution that can provide real-time decisions for millions of customers, and connecting customers to all the products in the Adobe Marketing Cloud. Your knowledge of software development, differing delivery methodologies and strong project management principles including experience in supporting large consulting practices will be the key to your success. What you'll Do Lead, recruit, mentor, a team of Adobe Project Management Consultants, ensure customer success through quality in consulting management and delivery. Drive continuous improvement of consulting delivery processes, standards, and practices driving customer excellence. Run client escalations, by guiding and coaching the team to ensure proper communication, vitality, prioritization, and ownership throughout the experience. Meet and exceed targets around: customer satisfaction, billable utilization, consulting revenue and margin as well as driving operational excellence. Proactively champion collaboration with Customer Care, Engineering, Product Management, Technical Operations, and other internal Adobe teams. Organize and conduct enablement sessions to strengthen team with respect to both technical- and soft-skill proficiencies. Lead and inspire team with positivity and optimism, creating a culture of high expectations and achievement. What you need to succeed Executive leadership skills including the ability to develop, influence and empower a diverse team to maximize results. Ability to communicate, coordinate, and drive optimal revenue, team productivity and margin performance. Previous experience in a delivery and consulting project management role. Experience leading and running a large team of remote based technical consulting teams, within software vendors is preferred. Minimum of 5-years’ experience leading Consulting teams. Ability to interact and communicate for impact with all levels of an organization both internally and externally, including business and technical. Confident ability to lead, collaborate, triage, and make decisions in a fast-paced, changing environment. Shown strength in EQ (emotional intelligence) as well as analytical and problem-solving skills. Expert-level experience in negotiation and conflict resolution. In-depth knowledge of Digital Marketing and Cross Channel Campaign Management required. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with meticulous attention to detail. Bachelor’s Degree in related field of the technical industry, or equivalent experience. Ability to travel up to 35% At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is looking for an experienced Engineering leader to take Adobe's Customer Experience Services function to the next level. Your focus is to be a strong people leader managing the development team, partnering with business stakeholders to understand business problems, develop and deliver the right technology solutions and maintaining existing technologies for B2C and B2B customers. You will also be responsible for implementing engineering best practices and in evaluating newer technologies that will help us deliver a world-class Customer Support experience for our customers. Your knowledge of the customer support experience landscape and industry trends will be vital for this role. Your experience and proven record of delivering SaaS and on-premise solutions will be necessary to be successful in this dynamic, high-impact position. What You'll Do First be a customer advocate. Look at every problem and our solutions in the eyes of our customers, be it internal or external. Interact with key business stakeholders, BSAs, Architects, Program Managers, and other IT teams to develop strong working relationships Be a strong people leader and manage a team of U.S based employees Collaborate and work closely with your offshore peer engineering managers as well as offshore teams to deliver projects Leads one or more Agile scrum teams in the successful design, development, implementation, and maintenance of software applications Manages performance; attracts and retains talent; leads team that results in high-impact project deliverables. Ensure projects meet time and budget constraints while ensuring the specifications are met Keeps up to date on industry trends in the Customer Experience technology space especially in the SaaS technologies. Manage technology vendor relationships and hold them to Adobe standards of performance Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies quicklyWhat you need to succeed Must have 5+ years in a managerial/leadership role within the software industry and experience building and directly managing teams of individual contributors Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar field Experience managing and delivering business and technology transformation initiatives in a matrix environment. Experience with CRM technologies (preferably Microsoft Dynamics CRM) and other Customer Support technologies. Experience in delivering AI/ML based projects Working knowledge of the following technologies: CRM (preferably Microsoft Dynamics), MS Power Platform, JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, REACT.js, Node.js, middleware, REST APIs A great sense of self-awareness, accountability, and the drive to succeed Ability to multi-task and drive parallel projects and distributed teams with tight deadlines Instilling and maintaining total commitment to quality and operational excellence in every area you impact. Strong degree of comfort presenting to and working with executives and their teams Ability to see the big picture while focused on short-term objectives and deliverables (strategic focus) Proven ability to manage external partners and vendors

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Adobe BDR Center of Excellence works with sales & marketing to build effective Outreach, email, and enablement content that helps BDRs get to quota faster. You’ll be integral in the rollout of strategic sales processes for the BDR teams across the entire Adobe DX and DMe business, working closely with the other members of the cross-functional COE team to roll out content & training together for BDR teams! We will partner with Marketing, BDR Leadership, Sellers, Operations, and others to identify and coordinate COE priorities and lead projects to completion. You’ll optimize our go-to-market strategy with a focus on onboarding, product, process, and sales tools/technology in a measurable and repeatable way. You’ll be an integral part of the Outreach/Dynamics integration, working with internal and external stakeholders to be a voice for the BDR organization. You’ll need to have a strong understanding of BDR workflows when prospecting inbound & outbound leads/contacts and be able to problem-solve and test new processes for the BDRs within Dynamics. Your work will have immediate, measurable impact, and you’ll help report on progress and the state of the business to senior leadership! You’ll listen to BDR feedback and always be looking for ways to keep improving the GTM tools we provide our BDRs with. The ideal candidate has a degree in business, communications, or a related field, and experience on a sales or marketing team at a B2B SaaS company. Responsibilities: Develop new go-to-market strategies for existing & additional Adobe products and work with internal and external partners to develop onboarding and continual development for those products. Specifically focus on the DMe business – creating, implementing, and testing new GTM strategies. Align COE Resources to support the needs of specific organizational challenges through small group trainings, manager trainings, and larger enablement sessions. Build out DMe resources and content strategy to supplement what’s already been created for DX. Assign and collaborate with DMe content creators (BDRs) to identify content needs and work collectively with FLM’s to define goals, track accordingly, and ensure BDR adoption. Lead the Onboarding experience for new BDR’s in tandem with Adobe Sales Academy across all Adobe Commercial Products (Adobe Story, Product Training, Tools and Process Training, etc.) Measure the qualitative and quantitative progress of new BDRs Decrease Time to First MQO, SQO by building processes that decrease the time it takes for new BDRs to be productive and acquire their first MQO/SQO Possess extensive knowledge of Adobe products Ensure consistency of process, use of technology, and BDR tools across Adobe DX teams and regions Align with sales leadership for ongoing feedback on process, tools, technology and training. Identify gaps, define requirements, and gain alignment on solutionsRequirements 2+ years of Enterprise selling experience Degree in marketing, communications, or a related field encouraged Experience on a sales or marketing team at a B2B SaaS company Technical expertise of SFDC required, Dynamics encouraged Technical expertise with a Sales Engagement Platform (Outreach, Salesloft, or Groove) Former sales or business development representative or managers encouraged At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog (http://blogs.adobe.com/adobelife/) and explore the meaningful benefits (http://benefits.adobe.com/) we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $84,700 - $110,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Marketo Engage team is looking for an exceptional Marketing Automation Expert, who has a real passion for driving clients to implement new technologies to improve their marketing effectiveness. You will be part of our consulting team, working with Marketo Engage customers across all markets. You will guide and assist customers in achieving a successful start with Marketo and help them expand the value realized from our solution. We are looking for high energy, tech-savvy people with marketing and/or marketing automation knowledge who can provide strategic and tactical advice based on real-life experience. This role reports to the Manager, Consulting Services. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. What will you do? You will work directly with customers to implement or optimize their instance of Marketo Engage based on best practices in marketing automation. Collaborate with clients to capture requirements, get feedback on designs and present results Help customers with marketing automation, cross-channel marketing, personalized email marketing and data management Lead marketing and sales alignment discussions Participate in developing service delivery offerings and methodologies Spot new services opportunities and work with sales to close new services business Help advance Marketo Engage ecosystem, by working on ground-breaking projects and driving thought leadership Facilitate onsite and virtual workshops with individuals and groups Collaborate and direct cross-functional teams internally and externally to successfully deliver a project end-to-end Is this you? 3+ years marketing experience Hands-on experience using Marketo or other marketing automation solution (i.e., Eloqua, Marketing Cloud, etc.) Problem solver with an attention for data to measure results Excellent client management skills, strong written and verbal communications, executive level presence Self-starter, high energy, positive attitude with good organization and time management skills Consulting experience is strongly preferred but not required Hands-on expertise with CRM applications such as Salesforce.com or Microsoft Dynamics preferred Bachelor's Degree Required Ability and willingness to travel up to 40-50%

You will guide and assist customers in achieving a successful start with Marketo and help them expand the value realized from our solution. We are looking for high energy, tech-savvy people with marketing and/or marketing automation knowledge who can provide strategic and tactical advice based on real-life experience. This role reports to the Manager, Consulting Services. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. What will you do? You will work directly with customers to implement or optimize their instance of Marketo Engage based on best practices in marketing automation. Collaborate with clients to capture requirements, get feedback on designs and present results Help customers with marketing automation, cross-channel marketing, personalized email marketing and data management Lead marketing and sales alignment discussions Participate in developing service delivery offerings and methodologies Spot new services opportunities and work with sales to close new services business Help advance Marketo Engage ecosystem, by working on ground-breaking projects and driving thought leadership Facilitate onsite and virtual workshops with individuals and groups Collaborate and direct cross-functional teams internally and externally to successfully deliver a project end-to-end Is this you? 3+ years marketing experience Hands-on experience using Marketo or other marketing automation solution (i.e., Eloqua, Marketing Cloud, etc.) Problem solver with an attention for data to measure results Excellent client management skills, strong written and verbal communications, executive level presence Self-starter, high energy, positive attitude with good organization and time management skills Consulting experience is strongly preferred but not required Hands-on expertise with CRM applications such as Salesforce.com or Microsoft Dynamics preferred Bachelor's Degree Required Ability and willingness to travel up to 40-50%

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! THE OPPORTUNITY Adobe is looking for an Engineering Manager to lead a critical UI team for Adobe Analytics, Adobe’s industry-leading analytics platform. The Adobe Analytics platform processes billions of web visits resulting in petabytes of rich data just waiting to reveal business insights. You will work on the Analysis Workspace product that unlocks those insights for customers via a sophisticated data visualization interface. Your work will impact a large, passionate user base that is employed by many of the world's largest companies. You will partner closely with product management and design to perform product discovery, ensuring the work of your team delivers value to the customers. This position within the Experience Cloud business unit is based in our Lehi, UT offices and allows remote work up to 50% of the time. What You'll Do Lead and manage a team of engineers through the research, technical design, implementation, delivery, and maintenance of software Maintain effective communication and collaboration with partner teams, both local and remote, in completing interdependent work items Influence design decisions and technical direction for engineers, QE, product managers, user experience designers, and senior leaders Ensure transparency of project status to partners Manage each team member’s performance, employing ongoing performance feedback and coaching Work with each team member in identifying and making progress toward career development goals Incentivize quality code and effective communication Partner with designers and business leaders to provide a best-in-class customer experience Engage with customers to understand problems, test ideas, and refine workflows What You Need To Succeed A minimum of five years of software engineering, with at least 1 year of managing software engineers Proficiency developing world-class HTML, CSS, & JavaScript Consistent record of successful execution of the complete software development lifecycle Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and to maintain a high degree of technical involvement with your team Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work cooperatively with people at all levels Experience leading or participating in agile software development BA/BS in computer science, or equivalent work experience, strong computer science fundamentals knowledge React proficiency preferred Excellent communication skills

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Adobe Development Platform team is looking for an Engineering Manager for its Extensibility team. We have a vision to simplify the adoption and customization of Adobe products. We are innovating on our extensibility technology stack to improve developer experience and expand usage of Adobe integrations. We work with a wide range of technologies and clouds including Node JS, Kubernetes, AWS and Azure. We build pre-integrated toolkits and services to improve ease of use for Adobe extensibility. We operate a high-availability custom event & FaaS platform relied on by businesses for millions of executions every single day. We're globally distributed but remain tight-knit. The Adobe Developer Platform group is in Switzerland, India, New York, Canada, Utah, and California just to name a few. Our product and team is in growth mode. There are plenty of challenges to overcome, decisions to be made, and new development to do. Some of the technologies we build on: Ecosystem: Linux, Docker, Kubernetes Open-source software: OpenWhisk, Akka, React, Nginx, Envoy Languages: NodeJS, Java, Python, Go Providers: AWS, AzureResponsibilities: Lead and support a strong engineering team that will develop and maintain highly scalable, reliable services and applications. Partner with Product Management, DevOps, and other key collaborators to create and implement the product roadmap. Guide and empower the development team on decisions for features, technology, architecture, designs, time & budget estimates, and test strategies. Mentor a diverse team of engineering talent. Partner with other teams across Adobe to collaborate on interdependent technologies. Work in a fast-paced, agile processWhat you need to succeed: Excellent and effective communication skills; on our geographically distributed team, sometimes it takes extra effort to connect. Experience leading software development teams Experience working with and operating high-availability cloud native systems Experience working in multi-functional environment and building partnerships with key teams Experience with pragmatic application of Agile methodologies. B.S. or above degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent experience. Knowledge of cloud and container technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS or Azure is a plus. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely . If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $144,500 - $187,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: Adobe’s Tech Partners team is looking for a full-time Partnership Development Manager to help build, lead, and grow Adobe’s global partnership with Microsoft. Adobe’s partnership with Microsoft continues to be a highly strategic and significant relationship, and this role represents an outstanding opportunity to shape the direction of one of our most meaningful global partnerships. This is an exciting and highly transparent opportunity to cut horizontally across the entire Adobe organization making a true impact on the business. The Challenge: The Microsoft Partnership Development Manager is an outstanding leadership role for a partnership, business development, or strategy leader that uses both a strategic and programmatic approach to build, lead, and drive Adobe’s growth objectives with and through our Microsoft partnership. The PDM will work in close alignment with Adobe and Microsoft partner teams, executives, sales leaders, product leaders, and others to continue building and driving incremental success for Adobe and Microsoft. Purpose of Role: Own and lead the growth agenda for the Microsoft partnership by evaluating and seeking out new opportunities to expand the value proposition as well as unlocking new routes to market Help define the priority, success criteria, and key programs that will drive the success of the Adobe and Microsoft partnership Serve as trusted advisor and valued partner to Adobe and Microsoft team members as well as executive leadership on both sides Understand and supervise all executive-sponsored initiatives, activities, and work streams related to Adobe’s partnership with MicrosoftResponsibilities: Develop a case framework to evaluate new opportunities from both internal Adobe sources, and from Microsoft, and help be responsible for the launch of the most promising new business areas Collaborate closely with, and provide leadership direction to, internal solution development teams to set and secure the co-innovation priorities, projects, and joint partner engagements. Plan, establish and implement forums for conceptualization to develop new and improve existing pivotal initiatives with Microsoft. Own and drive a semi-annual business planning and target-setting process with Microsoft and ensure alignment across Tech Partners Sales and Microsoft Global Partner Solutions (and PDM) teams Ensure the achievement of joint sales and consumption targets by working across multiple teams: sales, partner sales, partner marketing, and operations Be responsible for the executive level communications strategy and success metrics dashboarding programs across the Microsoft partnership globally Proactively identify key gaps or dependencies to our partnership success plan and consistently handle and find solutions to those challenges Act as a critical partnership point of contact for other Adobe and Tech Partners teams to scale the relationship across the globeRequirements: 5+ years of partner management, business development, corporate strategy, or management consulting in the technology industry Master's Degree in Business Administration (MBA) preferred Leadership and experience working across teams to drive defined business strategy, and sales goals Demonstrated executive level (VP level and above) oral and written communication skills Exceptional decision-making, conflict resolution, problem solving and negotiation skills Strong understanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers and emerging trends as well as the impact of these on the SaaS marketing technology landscape Ability to work in a sophisticated, cross-organizational boundary and cross-discipline manner Ability to work successfully in ambiguous work environments Ability to develop positive relationships and inspire change Ability to prioritize and complete tasks in a fast paced environment Consistent record developing and scaling partnerships preferred Motivated high-performance individual Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

The Opportunity Adobe’s IT team is looking for an experienced network security engineer who can use technical knowledge to analyze/implement and respond to business related change requests from internal users on multiple security technologies. We are looking for someone who can review and perform changes on multiple security platforms in an organized manner. Should understand configuring/reviewing relevant alerts on security platforms and be able to take appropriate actions based on alerts seen. Someone who can learn quickly about our existing environment, serve as contact for implementing critical and complex user requests, document the changes and troubleshoot issues when required. The person would also be responsible for developing and documenting work processes and train other members of the team when required. Always willing to lean new skills and areas to expand knowledge and effectiveness in supporting business. A problem solver who thrives in handling multiple priorities. What you'll Do Support, troubleshoot, configure, manage, and upgrade FW, WAF and a wide variety of other security products. Review requests related to new firewall policy requests. Implements approved firewall policy change requests. Perform network troubleshooting to isolate and diagnose common network problems, using strong TCP/IP networking skills. Respond to inbound requests via phone and other electronic means for technical assistance with managed devices. Respond in a timely manner (within documented SLA) to configuration, maintenance, incident management, and other requests. Document actions in ticketing system to effectively communicate information internally and to customers. Respond to needs and questions of customers concerning their access to network resources through their managed device. Troubleshoot and resolve connectivity problems independently and understand escalation procedures. Resolve issues related to: Firewall policies NAT policies Routing VPN Application identification issues [App-ID] Logging and Monitoring Network performance Would need to extract logs related to various platforms from Splunk. Create custom documentation for internal needs. Attend vendor-specific meetings and conferences for business and professional development. Responsible for testing and configuring new products and technologies. Perform other duties as assigned. What you need to succeed A minimum of 5-6 years recent experience on Information Security teams in a large-scale enterprise environments, preferably in a High-Tech and cloud facing company like Adobe. At least 3 of these years must include hands-on technical support responsibility. Work experience must include working in a complex environment including global 24X7 and multi-geographical environment. Significant experience with Network Firewalls, Routers and Switches, Linux and Windows OS, and other Network Operating Systems required Bachelor's degree in MIS, Computer Science, or Engineering Strongly preferred Skills PCNSE CCIE [Security] Security+ Preferred Skills: Hands-on exposure to Juniper Networks [SRX Firewalls], Palo Alto Firewalls, F5 WAF, IKE/IPSec SSL/Certificate Management [Digicert, Symantec], IDP Providers (Okta, RSA SecureID etc.), End-Point Security solutions like CloudStrike Cisco ISE NSX

The Opportunity We collaborate with strategic ISVs and technology partners in architecting, scoping and delivering unique integrated solutions. We seek engaged team members that understand how to design data solutions, have a solid understanding of Adobe Experience Cloud technologies, and prefer modern web technologies and web service APIs. What We Do We manage multiple simultaneous technical projects with partner organizations in Adobe's exciting ISV ecosystem! We think creatively to design elegant and efficient data transfer processes and assist Adobe partners to document integrations, processes and standard methodologies for our mutual customers. We communicate effectively with all technical and non-technical colleagues and schedule, attend and engage on regular partner status calls. We align with product management and engineering teams to raise issues, report bugs and drive outcomes. We understand and articulate the business goals for strategic integration partners and continuously train ourselves to build and maintain expertise with new Adobe product developments and use cases. What You Need To Succeed BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience 2+ years experience with digital marketing or e-commerce technologies 2+ years experience with Adobe Experience Cloud and/or Experience Platform preferred Excellent creativity, critical thinking, analytical problem solving, and decision making skills Solid verbal and written communication skills to both technical and non-technical audiences Ability to lead a project to completion and set appropriate expectations Familiarity with the following technologies Javascript / JSON / HTML API and Web Service technologies (REST, SOAP, Oauth2, JWT, etc.) Data Transfer technologies (HTTP, SSL, FTP, AWS-S3, Azure Blob, etc.) Data organization and Schemas Martech implementation and tag management iOS & Android development frameworks (preferred) SQL (preferred) At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you.
