jobTitle: Partner Strategy and Business Operations Manager
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! As a Partnerships Strategy & Business Operations manager, you will lead the definition of the strategy for key Partnerships initiatives, ensure their implementation, and document standard methodologies. You are a general athlete, who is able to solve constantly evolving challenges and is comfortable operating not only at a strategic level, but also getting hands dirty with execution and operational excellence. You will be at the center of the definition and implementation of highly visible Partnerships initiatives, and you will have ample opportunities to collaborate with other teams and to have executive visibility. As such, strong collaboration and communication skills - including top-down communications, prioritization and an eye for impact are essential for your success in this role. What You’ll Do Shape Adobe’s growth partner strategy and plans, through data-driven analyses. Gather and synthesize relevant data, lead analyses and develop recommendations around strategic and operational partner initiatives. Persuasively communicate practical strategy recommendations to key partners across Adobe, including at the executive level. Develop and lead a robust operating model to ensure partner strategy is implemented and its expected impact is realized; this includes periodically report to Adobe's leadership the status of the implementation and bring your insights and recommendations on how to continuously improve value creation. Establish a collaboration network across different Adobe teams, working side-by-side with multiple teams and being the "connector" that enables a well-oiled cross-functional partnership strategy and execution. What skills needed to succeed BS/BA with 5+ years software, high tech or management consulting experience, MBA preferred Experience in a top 5 management consulting firm, ideally with technology experience Strong experience influencing cross-functional multidisciplinary teams to launch high-impact business initiatives Successful in dynamic environments, rapidly anticipating and adapting to shifting priorities Ability to rapidly assess high-level & ambiguous problems, define scope and options, then evaluate and recommend partnership strategy to address critical business issues Exceptional conceptual thinking and analytical problem-solving A strong sense of self, balanced with the aim to put team first Familiarity with and regular use of Adobe's products strongly preferred. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Since opening up our platform, Frame.io has built a vibrant developer ecosystem that delivers fully connected workflows to some of our largest customers. In this role, you’ll collaborate with our established Cloud Devices Partnerships and Developer Relations teams to bring our top hardware and software partnerships to life. As the Partnerships Integrations Specialist we're excited for you to support innovative opportunities to engage our community and partners, so they can quickly ramp up on our platform, technology, and vision for the future of all workflows. You'll be an advocate on behalf of the Partnerships team and will help lead a successful endeavor in continuing communications with our 3rd party integrators. We’re looking for an organized individual who is an effective communicator, strong writer, data centric futurist, and workflow technology enthusiast to continue the charge in ensuring the success of our Camera to Cloud program. Along the way, you will have the opportunity to shape, lead, and facilitate the most sophisticated and monumental workflows in the industry today as a member of our growing Innovation Team. What you'll Do Identify strategic partnership opportunities to grow our developer ecosystem Work cross-functionally to drive success of the Camera to Cloud Partnerships Platform and community Act as the subject matter authority and represent Frame.io externally, encouraging connections and relationships with developers and leaders in the community Work with internal teams to craft strategies for communicating the value of new features and introducing products to the company and community Establish and strengthen technical partnerships with key companies in conjunction with our Developer Relations team by writing technical content, working on joint dev projects, and being an active member of their communitiesWhat you need to succeed Demonstrated ability in developer relations, platform evangelism, or customer, or partner-facing, technical role. Effective and strategic communicator. You have strong verbal and written skills and can adapt your communication style and tone to suit different audiences. Highly organized and able to prioritize efficiently. You can pioneer new program management platforms, wrangle partners, vendors, and customers with ease and integrity. Biased toward action. You develop feedback and ideas into features, workflows, and products that benefit the community at large. Technically skilled. You can speak to previous work experience in the entertainment and cinema technology space and are proficient in bug testing groundbreaking technologies. Excellence in opportunity. You’ll be an active participant in helping explore/gauge interest with current and prospective partners across all of our trade shows. Programming skills are not required, but are a bonus. Frameio-All1 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $112,700 - $146,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.   We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  Skills  We are looking for an individual with high initiative, a strategic approach, and customer experience strategy talent. Principal Digital Strategist is a digital-native professional with experience crafting and executing consumer experiences for Adobe customers. This role will focus on driving Telecommunication digital transformation strategy with an emphasis on leveraging complex change management processes and technologies for the telco industry. Strong executive presence and interpersonal skills, with ability to engage and encourage senior executives via change management and org design capabilities. Thought leader in the future of telecommunication , fourth industrial revolution, and the future of marketing for large Fortune 500 companies Comfortable focusing on one complex telecommunication customer, operating across a matrixed organization, balancing leaders from Adobe and the client. Lead and drive sophisticated cross-functional teams towards clear, efficient, and accountable decision making and customer value delivery . Regularly connect with telco customer to identify customer needs and requirements. Synthesize findings into tests.  Collaborating across multiple functional domains (Adobe and customer) fluently and easily, and leading difficult conversations to logical and objective conclusions with an action plan to move forward.   Evaluate measurement criteria to identify trends and drive improvements in organizational performance,  including:  customer happiness, operating efficiency, org design, operating models, and change management delivery outputs Develop and implement tailored change management programs that provide continued value to the customer, ensure renewals and drive long-term account growth for broader telecommunication customers.   Evolve Adobe Customer Solutions capabilities to remain a relevant offering and deliver customer value. Lead, coach , and mentor Digital Performance Strategy team members highly skilled with telco strategy into broadening into the "how does this get done" (people/process). Experience  Must be based in Seattle and /or on client site 4 out of the 5 days of the week 7- 10+ years’ with digital strategy for a top management consulting firm, top digital agency or top digital marketing consultancy. 7+ years as a strategist focused on Telco industry and related data services across America’s largest programs and world famous brands  within the telco industry. 5+ years of experience leading customer success, relationship management or management consulting organization with validated, quantifiable experience delivering on significant business value, large transformation activity or material portfolio of business  Willingness to travel (amount will depend on your location and industry specialization)

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The challenge Adobe’s Digital Strategy Group works with C-level leadership at leading travel and hospitality companies to advise on digital strategy and transformation for customer-experience transformation and digital innovation. Adobe has long been at the forefront of enabling customers on digital transformation and new experience-led business models in industries such as retail, travel, and banking. This has translated into a stock price appreciation of over 5X over the past five years. As a Principal Strategist, you will be a leader within the travel and hospitality practice, leading multiple strategy engagements, driving partnerships across Adobe’s ecosystem, and serving as a coach and mentor to colleagues. For each engagement, you will quarterback a team of experts to conduct analyses, develop insights, and deliver actionable recommendations. You will advise C-Suite industry leaders and utilize your experience to become a trusted advisor and thought leader on trends, digital innovation, use cases for Adobe technology, and relevant research in your industry. What You Need To Succeed Deep Experience leading multiple engagements in a top management consulting firm Outstanding people leadership skills, managing teams, and mentoring colleagues Deep Expertise in the travel and hospitality industry, with knowledge in airlines, cruises, hotels, dining, or online travel agencies. Strong preference to airlines and cruises Experience influencing and collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders, including sales and technical partners A strong track record of leading go to market strategy formulation and translating strategy into plans that deliver topline growth Stellar executive presence and communication skills, with ability to engage and inspire senior leaders Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills including talent for conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and crafting effective recommendations focused on the biggest opportunities Demonstrated ability to lead through influence and achieve results in a cross-functional environment High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to absorb new concepts quickly Willingness to travel up to 50% Get to know the team Adobe’s Worldwide Field Operations Adobe’s Worldwide Field Operations provides customers with the products, services, solutions, and support they need to make, manage, measure and/or monetize their digital assets. Worldwide Field Operations includes Worldwide Sales, Reseller Partnerships, Partner Sales, Adobe Global Services, Sales Operations and the Adobe Worldwide eCommerce organizations. Take a peek into Adobe life in this video . Adobe believes in hiring the very best and that’s why our dynamic working environment has received awards throughout the globe. Recognizing that employees are at the core of our success, Adobe recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, builds an environment where they can innovate and achieve their best, and rewards them for their performance by giving them an opportunity to share in the company’s success. When you join Adobe, you can look forward to collaborating with the most genuine people in the industry, working on projects with real purpose, and having immense pride in the products we build and the customers we support. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire hardworking individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, cultural background or religious beliefs. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here . We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. The Opportunity In joining Adobe’s Consumer & Business Finance organization, you will have the opportunity to help drive Adobe’s pivotal initiatives by partnering with the World-Wide Go to Market Teams, operations, and finance organization, to drive retention forecasts. The position will report to the Director, FP&A, retention planning. This position will provide an outstanding opportunity to drive timely insights across Digital Media (DMe) Business at Adobe. The ideal candidate for this role is a well-rounded top performer with excellent data science and forecast modeling skills, who will be a catalyst for growth in a fast-paced environment. You should be a strong partner, who enjoys forming cross-functional relationships within Adobe. You will drive data science initiatives to create complex financial models for forecasting retention and engagement. What you'll Do Drive data science modeling initiatives for retention forecasting and analysis. Ensure accuracy of the models and conducting scenario analysis to derive range of outcomes. Automate, enhance, and maintain analytic applications and data structures used for modeling and forecasting. Partner between the go to market and technology teams to ensure clear communications among stakeholders Demonstrate strong intellectual curiosity and is constantly looking to enhance the current methodologies and processes. Be a change agent, ensuring users embrace new and innovative technology. What you need to succeed MS or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field; Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Operational Research, etc. 10+ years of relevant experience in data science and analytics in creating/maintaining models for a subscription/SaaS business. Knowledge and understanding of econometric and statistical techniques. Ability to code efficiently in Python, R and SQL like languages. Proficient in data platforms/systems (such as SQL, Hadoop, Snowflake), ETL tools (such as Alteryx, SnapLogic), process automation and standardization. Experience working with large and complex data structures and develop efficient queries to create calculated fields. Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating leaders and partners to act on recommendations. Self-starter with high attention to details, excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to take charge, set objectives, and deliver results. Proactive, hardworking team player with strong communication skills and business intuitions

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe Acrobat Sign is on the forefront of digital transformation for businesses large and small. We redefine the way the world is signing documents with digitized workflows, from preparing and crafting requests to sign, managing the flow and participation, collecting the information, handling the signed documents, and much more. Are you passionate about interacting with the teams empowered to address business needs, usage, and digital transformation? The UX platform team is responsible for modernizing the Acrobat Sign product line by crafting new and appealing experiences and solving for customers’ problems and needs. This job responsibility will involve prioritizing and ultimately scheduling new experiences and capabilities for Acrobat Sign. Alongside immediate feature work, you will lead longer projects which require identifying and prioritizing incremental steps for long term new initiatives. You will collaborate with designers, researchers, engineering, architects, customers, marketing, CSMs and fellow PMs. This role will be empowered to meet our roadmap and strategic goals, engaging regularly with collaborators, handling delivery expectations across the organization, supporting product roadmap, and driving long term initiatives to define and improve user experience, product usage and customer satisfaction. We are looking for a highly motivated and forward-thinking Principal Product Manager who is passionate about customers and their experiences to help drive our growth and success. What you'll Do Write detailed product briefs and requirements that clearly articulate the needs and prioritize the details to build a solution Outline the product roadmap for your areas of responsibility through partnership with engineering and design Manage roadmap and backlog and balance trade-offs between investments and scope while meeting users’ expectations and business goals Collaborate with Design, research, engineering and customers to validate requirements, concepts and solutions Handle and analyze customer feedback, understand the market trends and competitive gap,s and transform into product requirements Develop product documentation, product presentations and other content assets to describe the work Collaborate and connect with cross-functional and cross-business product team members and leadership to ensure product readiness and resolve blocking issues. Own success metrics to monitor the business goals Demonstrate product mastery through engagement with Design, Customer Success, Engineering and Support What You Need To Succeed B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent technical degree 5+ years of product management experience and 3+ years of experience with SAAS products in a product manager role Obsession for great user experiences and experience working with design teams from ideation to delivery Strong attention to details and high empathy towards user centric design Experience with design thinking, user experience design, prototyping software, user research, testing and validation Experience with driving product adoption and critical metric-based performance measures Experience leading exciting and changing priorities. Experience of agile software development practices Shown understanding of Enterprise SaaS architecture and solutions Ability to influence cross-functional teams and work towards desired outcomes Strong communication and interpersonal relationships Familiarity with Atlassian Jira

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity As a Principal Product Marketing Manager with Adobe Analytics, you are a key member of the DX Product team, influencing the success of Adobe Experience Cloud solutions. In this role, you will work with cross-functional teams, including product management, sales, finance, business development, global marketing and corporate communications to drive product marketing activities necessary for growing market share for Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics. The environment is fast-paced, upbeat, and highly collaborative. You will lead efforts to drive new Adobe Analytics logo growth and help enterprises understand, measure and optimize journey experiences for their customers who interact across digital and offline channels. You will actively participate in the strategic development and execution of analytics product go-to-market, as well as marketing programs to enable effective selling, align product positioning with industry trends and product advancements, and increase brand and product awareness through thought leadership activities. You seek opportunities to be strategic, produce results, and receive recognition for outstanding work. Responsibilities Develop, lead & implement Adobe Analytics go-to-market strategies. Critically evaluate new growth opportunities for the Adobe Analytics business. Develop go-to-market collateral, sales material, and competitive intelligence information to enable sales organization success Work closely with Adobe’s Global Marketing organization to develop strategic programs that drive demand and pipeline. Collaborate with PR, AR, corporate marketing, and events teams on product launches and partner integration activities to drive awareness and demand. Broaden Adobe’s position as an industry leader with vision through the creation of white papers, blog posts, and articles. Work with business development and product management to influence product developments and integrations based on changing market dynamics and emerging opportunities. Present Adobe Analytics use cases and value propositions at industry events, conferences, analyst and media briefings, and critical customer meetings. Requirements: BS/BA with 8+ years of marketing experience, technology company and SaaS experience, MBA preferred. Data driven, with a strong test and learn demeanor and ability to think out of the box to determine new growth opportunities Knowledge of the digital marketing landscape and the ability to stay current on the changing market Proficient in market research and how to utilize research and data to advise marketing strategies Proven success in dynamic and highly matrixed environments Strong experience leading cross-functional multidisciplinary teams to launch high-impact business initiatives Strong ability to frame issues, drive appropriate analyses, and make clear, impactful recommendations Outstanding analytical, verbal, and written communication skills Excellent program management skills Highly collaborative work style Global cultural awareness and experience with global teams

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Position Summary The Principal Project Manager’s focus is to work directly with our largest and most challenging customer relationships and services programs across multiple verticals. Principal Program Director will drive customer’s enterprise solution development and implementations by means of the Adobe Experience Cloud. The PM partners with Adobe’s customers to understand their priorities and objectives and lead a multi-disciplined delivery team from Adobe to design, implement and scale the solutions to drive value for the customer across the intersection of people, process and technology. PMs will work at multiple levels with the Adobe team, including Project Managers, Sales, Finance, Engineering and Systems Integrator Partners. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess and manage risks, plan the program-wide implementation, support the program delivery, and manage it’s overall success. You will oversee delivery and acceptance of the program scope as defined in one or many statement(s) of work using our consulting methodology including program tasks, deliverables, milestones, and resources, all the time coordinating with project managers and delivery teams as needed. You will ensure successful customer outcomes based on program defined objectives. You will govern overall standards across the program teams to achieve these results. The PM is the senior-most delivery leader and “owns the consulting business” for that engagement. Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams. Responsibilities Act as Lead Consultant on large, complex customer engagements that may involve multiple project managers and teams from Adobe, Client, or partner organizations Strong executive presence, including ability to partner with and effectively influence client managers, directors, VPs, and CXOs Clearly understand and communicate customer requirements and integration points in the context of the statement of work and support mutual understanding of Adobe’s unique and transformational business capabilities and evangelize how those capabilities create long-term value for the customer across various customer business units & organizations Oversee program delivery process with key contributors to help manage scope and prepare change requests, including tasks, deliverables, milestones, resources, and estimated costs. Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions. Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations. Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics. Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel. Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required. Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects. Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice. Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements 10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations Innovative thinker. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. Willingness to travel up to 60% Desired MBA Experience as a consulting manager in a top-tier management consulting firm OR as an accountable and practitioner manager / director from a customer organization is preferred 6 or more years managing Agile development projects Well versed in multiple delivery methodologies such as water-fall, Six-Sigma, Agile, Kanban, Scrum Certified ScrumMaster, PMP Certification Adobe Experience Cloud implementation experience Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $133,700 - $173,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission

Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements 10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations Innovative thinker. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. Position Summary The Principal Project Manager’s focus is to work directly with our largest and most challenging customer relationships and services programs across multiple verticals. Principal Program Director will drive customer’s enterprise solution development and implementations by means of the Adobe Experience Cloud. The PM partners with Adobe’s customers to understand their priorities and objectives and lead a multi-disciplined delivery team from Adobe to design, implement and scale the solutions to drive value for the customer across the intersection of people, process and technology. PMs will work at multiple levels with the Adobe team, including Project Managers, Sales, Finance, Engineering and Systems Integrator Partners. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess and manage risks, plan the program-wide implementation, support the program delivery, and manage it’s overall success. You will oversee delivery and acceptance of the program scope as defined in one or many statement(s) of work using our consulting methodology including program tasks, deliverables, milestones, and resources, all the time coordinating with project managers and delivery teams as needed. You will ensure successful customer outcomes based on program defined objectives. You will govern overall standards across the program teams to achieve these results. The PM is the senior-most delivery leader and “owns the consulting business” for that engagement. Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams. Responsibilities Act as Lead Consultant on large, complex customer engagements that may involve multiple project managers and teams from Adobe, Client, or partner organizations Strong executive presence, including ability to partner with and effectively influence client managers, directors, VPs, and CXOs Clearly understand and communicate customer requirements and integration points in the context of the statement of work and support mutual understanding of Adobe’s unique and transformational business capabilities and evangelize how those capabilities create long-term value for the customer across various customer business units & organizations Oversee program delivery process with key contributors to help manage scope and prepare change requests, including tasks, deliverables, milestones, resources, and estimated costs. Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions. Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations. Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics. Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel. Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required. Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects. Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice. Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Position Summary The Principal Project Manager’s focus is to work directly with our largest and most challenging customer relationships and services programs across multiple verticals. Principal Program Director will drive customer’s enterprise solution development and implementations by means of the Adobe Experience Cloud. The PM partners with Adobe’s customers to understand their priorities and objectives and lead a multi-disciplined delivery team from Adobe to design, implement and scale the solutions to drive value for the customer across the intersection of people, process and technology. PMs will work at multiple levels with the Adobe team, including Project Managers, Sales, Finance, Engineering and Systems Integrator Partners. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess and manage risks, plan the program-wide implementation, support the program delivery, and manage it’s overall success. You will oversee delivery and acceptance of the program scope as defined in one or many statement(s) of work using our consulting methodology including program tasks, deliverables, milestones, and resources, all the time coordinating with project managers and delivery teams as needed. You will ensure successful customer outcomes based on program defined objectives. You will govern overall standards across the program teams to achieve these results. The PM is the senior-most delivery leader and “owns the consulting business” for that engagement. Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams. Responsibilities Act as Lead Consultant on large, complex customer engagements that may involve multiple project managers and teams from Adobe, Client, or partner organizations Strong executive presence, including ability to partner with and effectively influence client managers, directors, VPs, and CXOs Clearly understand and communicate customer requirements and integration points in the context of the statement of work and support mutual understanding of Adobe’s unique and transformational business capabilities and evangelize how those capabilities create long-term value for the customer across various customer business units & organizations Oversee program delivery process with key contributors to help manage scope and prepare change requests, including tasks, deliverables, milestones, resources, and estimated costs. Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions. Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations. Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics. Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel. Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required. Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects. Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice. Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements 10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations Innovative thinker. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. Willingness to travel up to 60% Desired MBA Experience as a consulting manager in a top-tier management consulting firm OR as an accountable and practitioner manager / director from a customer organization is preferred 6 or more years managing Agile development projects Well versed in multiple delivery methodologies such as water-fall, Six-Sigma, Agile, Kanban, Scrum Certified ScrumMaster, PMP Certification Adobe Experience Cloud implementation experience Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $133,700 - $173,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission

Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Position Summary The Principal Project Manager’s focus is to work directly with our largest and most challenging customer relationships and services programs across multiple verticals. Principal Program Director will drive customer’s enterprise solution development and implementations by means of the Adobe Experience Cloud. The PM partners with Adobe’s customers to understand their priorities and objectives and lead a multi-disciplined delivery team from Adobe to design, implement and scale the solutions to drive value for the customer across the intersection of people, process and technology. PMs will work at multiple levels with the Adobe team, including Project Managers, Sales, Finance, Engineering and Systems Integrator Partners. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess and manage risks, plan the program-wide implementation, support the program delivery, and manage it’s overall success. You will oversee delivery and acceptance of the program scope as defined in one or many statement(s) of work using our consulting methodology including program tasks, deliverables, milestones, and resources, all the time coordinating with project managers and delivery teams as needed. You will ensure successful customer outcomes based on program defined objectives. You will govern overall standards across the program teams to achieve these results. The PM is the senior-most delivery leader and “owns the consulting business” for that engagement. Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams. Responsibilities Act as Lead Consultant on large, complex customer engagements that may involve multiple project managers and teams from Adobe, Client, or partner organizations Strong executive presence, including ability to partner with and effectively influence client managers, directors, VPs, and CXOs Clearly understand and communicate customer requirements and integration points in the context of the statement of work and support mutual understanding of Adobe’s unique and transformational business capabilities and evangelize how those capabilities create long-term value for the customer across various customer business units & organizations Oversee program delivery process with key contributors to help manage scope and prepare change requests, including tasks, deliverables, milestones, resources, and estimated costs. Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions. Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations. Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics. Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel. Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required. Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects. Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice. Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements 10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations Innovative thinker. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. Willingness to travel up to 60% Desired MBA Experience as a consulting manager in a top-tier management consulting firm OR as an accountable and practitioner manager / director from a customer organization is preferred 6 or more years managing Agile development projects Well versed in multiple delivery methodologies such as water-fall, Six-Sigma, Agile, Kanban, Scrum Certified ScrumMaster, PMP Certification Adobe Experience Cloud implementation experience Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $133,700 - $173,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission

Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions. Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations. Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics. Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel. Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required. Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects. Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice. Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements 10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations Innovative thinker. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. Willingness to travel up to 60% Desired MBA Experience as a consulting manager in a top-tier management consulting firm OR as an accountable and practitioner manager / director from a customer organization is preferred 6 or more years managing Agile development projects Well versed in multiple delivery methodologies such as water-fall, Six-Sigma, Agile, Kanban, Scrum Certified ScrumMaster, PMP Certification Adobe Experience Cloud implementation experience Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $133,700 - $173,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Position Summary The Principal Project Manager’s focus is to work directly with our largest and most challenging customer relationships and services programs across multiple verticals. Principal Program Director will drive customer’s enterprise solution development and implementations by means of the Adobe Experience Cloud. The PM partners with Adobe’s customers to understand their priorities and objectives and lead a multi-disciplined delivery team from Adobe to design, implement and scale the solutions to drive value for the customer across the intersection of people, process and technology. PMs will work at multiple levels with the Adobe team, including Project Managers, Sales, Finance, Engineering and Systems Integrator Partners. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess and manage risks, plan the program-wide implementation, support the program delivery, and manage it’s overall success. You will oversee delivery and acceptance of the program scope as defined in one or many statement(s) of work using our consulting methodology including program tasks, deliverables, milestones, and resources, all the time coordinating with project managers and delivery teams as needed. You will ensure successful customer outcomes based on program defined objectives. You will govern overall standards across the program teams to achieve these results. The PM is the senior-most delivery leader and “owns the consulting business” for that engagement. Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams. Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions. Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations. Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics. Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel. Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required. Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects. Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice. Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements 10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations Innovative thinker. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Principal Project Manager’s focus is to work directly with our largest and most challenging customer relationships and services programs across multiple verticals. Principal Program Director will drive customer’s enterprise solution development and implementations by means of the Adobe Experience Cloud. The PM partners with Adobe’s customers to understand their priorities and objectives and lead a multi-disciplined delivery team from Adobe to design, implement and scale the solutions to drive value for the customer across the intersection of people, process and technology. PMs will work at multiple levels with the Adobe team, including Project Managers, Sales, Finance, Engineering and Systems Integrator Partners. You will evaluate the proposed solution, assess and manage risks, plan the program-wide implementation, support the program delivery, and manage it’s overall success. You will oversee delivery and acceptance of the program scope as defined in one or many statement(s) of work using our consulting methodology including program tasks, deliverables, milestones, and resources, all the time coordinating with project managers and delivery teams as needed. You will ensure successful customer outcomes based on program defined objectives. You will govern overall standards across the program teams to achieve these results. The PM is the senior-most delivery leader and “owns the consulting business” for that engagement. Project Managers are accountable for the successful execution of services programs, acting as a primary point of accountability for the customer, and building relationships with both customer stakeholders and internal teams. Responsibilities Act as Lead Consultant on large, complex customer engagements that may involve multiple project managers and teams from Adobe, Client, or partner organizations Strong executive presence, including ability to partner with and effectively influence client managers, directors, VPs, and CXOs Clearly understand and communicate customer requirements and integration points in the context of the statement of work and support mutual understanding of Adobe’s unique and transformational business capabilities and evangelize how those capabilities create long-term value for the customer across various customer business units & organizations Oversee program delivery process with key contributors to help manage scope and prepare change requests, including tasks, deliverables, milestones, resources, and estimated costs. Creative problem-solving skills, including the ability to understand the impact of technical & process changes and to articulate high-level technical solutions to address business problems Build and leverage relationships within Adobe to solve very complex customer problems, including working with product teams to enhance solutions. Accountable for all foundational activities of the program from inception to closure including solid governance, communication and change management with customer teams and internal Adobe teams Lead regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and tie back our execution to customer expectations. Achieve customer satisfaction through successful delivery of defined program scope successful realization of key business objectives and metrics. Accountable for collating customer requests and deployment issues, and feedback into core products channel. Support work tracks that may involve third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required. Act as the central client point of contact throughout the life of the program, including supporting sales in change control support for scope changes, and onboarding of Project Managers and technical teams for new work tracks or projects. Facilitate capturing and communicate experiences in formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice. Provide oversight for services engagements to ensure adherence to governance standards and support customer success by means of Adobe Consulting’s tools and processes Accountable for escalation leadership across Adobe including sales, services, and product organizations. Partner with our Sales organization to strategize new consulting opportunities or grow a defined account based on current engagement. Elevate and encourage your team through caring, effective leadership Apply Adobe’s Service Governance and Delivery Methodology, apprentice others in the methodology and drive practice and process improvements. Requirements 10 to 15 years of experience leading projects in a consulting and/or technology professional services organization, including delivering enterprise-scale implementations Innovative thinker. Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead teams identifying issues, solve them quickly and well, and rely on internal resources to assist, when needed. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe, and communicating with client managers, directors, and VPs including CXOs. Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated programs with multiple projects at a business or solution level. Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual and dispersed teams. Prior experience with the launch and operation of a highly available, high traffic internet or mobile service. Proven ability to understand the impact of technical changes, and to articulate high level technical solutions to address business problems as well as guide business and technical teams to solve complex project challenges. Solid understanding of custom software development processes and engagement methodologies. Practical experience in managing Agile development projects. Familiarity with the following languages and technologies: HTML, HTML5, XML, Java, WCM, Web analytics, content targeting Solid understanding of and experience with one or more of the following: Web Content Management, Rich internet applications, Web & Social Analytics, online ad targeting and content personalization. Ability to manage yourself and others in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders both internal and external. Ability to build strong relationships and generate opportunities for repeat business. Proven ability to support practice and program development within a Consulting organization. Proven experience managing off-shore teams. Willingness to travel up to 60% Desired MBA Experience as a consulting manager in a top-tier management consulting firm OR as an accountable and practitioner manager / director from a customer organization is preferred 6 or more years managing Agile development projects Well versed in multiple delivery methodologies such as water-fall, Six-Sigma, Agile, Kanban, Scrum Certified ScrumMaster, PMP Certification Adobe Experience Cloud implementation experience Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City.
