We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Skills We are looking for an individual with high initiative, a strategic approach, and customer experience strategy talent. Principal Digital Strategist is a digital-native professional with experience crafting and driving consumer experiences for Adobe customers. This role will focus on driving both large change management and organizational design transformation programs with an emphasis on demonstrating Adobe enterprise technologies across public and private sector industries. Strong executive presence and interpersonal skills, with ability to engage and encourage executives via organizational change and org design capabilities. Growth mindset in approaching problems and new opportunities. Inspiring leader in the future of org design , change management, the fourth industrial revolution, and the future of marketing for large Fortune 500 companies Comfortable focusing on multiple complex customers, operating across a matrixed organization, balancing leaders from Adobe and the client. Lead and drive sophisticated cross-functional teams towards clear, efficient, and accountable decision making and customer value delivery. Excited to help scale a new digital strategy consulting practice with new Adobe specific methodologies and tool kits and can function between delivery and business development support. Collaborating across multiple functional domains (Adobe and customer) fluently and easily, and leading difficult conversations to logical and objective conclusions with an action plan to move forward. Evaluate measurement criteria to identify trends and drive improvements in organizational performance, including: customer happiness, operating efficiency, org design, operating models, and change management delivery outputs Develop and implement tailored organizational change programs that provide continued value to the customer, ensure renewals and drive long-term account growth for broader telecommunication customers. Evolve Adobe Customer Solutions capabilities to remain a relevant offering and deliver customer value. Lead, coach, and mentor Digital Performance Strategy team membersExperience Must be based in USA and be comfortable with being onsite at the customer request / be open to hybrid working arrangements Adobe Product implementation experience beyond the Creative Cloud. 7-10+ years’ with digital strategy for a top management consulting firm, top digital agency or top digital marketing consultancy with a focus in Org Design and Change Management Building practices, operating in a start up like environment, a track record with SOW creation and Business development Strong power point skills and presentation skills. PROSCI or any other Org Design / Operating model certifications proven experience leading customer success, relationship management or management consulting organization with validated, experience delivering on business value, transformation activity or portfolio of business Willingness to travel (amount will depend on your location and industry specialization) Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $176,300 - $228,900 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is not your average tech company, and we're way more than Photoshop and PDFs. We develop the tools and technologies that empower creative people to tell their stories. At Adobe, we believe in Creativity for All. Therefore, there could not be a more impactful role than helping us craft and drive our approach to privacy when it comes to students and younger users. If you are a great legal mind, this is your chance to work for a global brand with an unparalleled culture where privacy really matters. As we engage the future generation of creators, this role will have a front row seat in influencing some of the most pressing privacy issues of the moment. What you'll do Coordinate and help drive cross-stakeholder alignment regarding privacy and data protection on all matters related to global children’s privacy and student data privacy laws. Partner with Adobe’s Education, engineering, product, and marketing teams, to develop and maintain applicable policies, standards, and practices. Conduct privacy reviews of new and innovative tools and technologies that will be used in schools and by younger users. Act as subject matter authority for our public policy and government relations teams on matters related to student and children’s privacy. Proactively implement changes to processes and procedures in anticipation of regulatory and business developments. Build, refine and scale all aspects of Adobe's privacy compliance program with a special focus on students and younger users. Work closely with our EU and international teams to track, plan for, and align with global laws impacting privacy matters for students and younger users. Respond to internal and external privacy inquiries. What you need to succeed J.D. degree and active membership in at least one state bar. Minimum 3+ years of relevant privacy experience, including prior in-house, government, or law firm experience. Familiarity with children’s and student privacy laws, including U.S. state student privacy laws, COPPA, FERPA, the UK’s Age-Appropriate Design Code, and other similar requirements. Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization. Understanding of and curiosity about technology products used in classrooms. Strategic problem solver with excellent legal and business judgment. Exceptional interpersonal skills with a great sense of humor and dedication to integrity. Experience working collaboratively and successfully with cross-functional teams. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $127,100 - $165,000 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $146,600 - $190,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is not your average tech company, and we're way more than Photoshop and PDFs. We develop the tools and technologies that empower creative people to tell their stories. At Adobe, we believe in Creativity for All. Therefore, there could not be a more impactful role than helping us craft and drive our approach to privacy when it comes to students and younger users. If you are a great legal mind, this is your chance to work for a global brand with an unparalleled culture where privacy really matters. As we engage the future generation of creators, this role will have a front row seat in influencing some of the most pressing privacy issues of the moment. What you'll do Coordinate and help drive cross-stakeholder alignment regarding privacy and data protection on all matters related to global children’s privacy and student data privacy laws. Partner with Adobe’s Education, engineering, product, and marketing teams, to develop and maintain applicable policies, standards, and practices. Conduct privacy reviews of new and innovative tools and technologies that will be used in schools and by younger users. Act as subject matter authority for our public policy and government relations teams on matters related to student and children’s privacy. Proactively implement changes to processes and procedures in anticipation of regulatory and business developments. Build, refine and scale all aspects of Adobe's privacy compliance program with a special focus on students and younger users. Work closely with our EU and international teams to track, plan for, and align with global laws impacting privacy matters for students and younger users. Respond to internal and external privacy inquiries. What you need to succeed J.D. degree and active membership in at least one state bar. Minimum 3+ years of relevant privacy experience, including prior in-house, government, or law firm experience. Familiarity with children’s and student privacy laws, including U.S. state student privacy laws, COPPA, FERPA, the UK’s Age-Appropriate Design Code, and other similar requirements. Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization. Understanding of and curiosity about technology products used in classrooms. Strategic problem solver with excellent legal and business judgment. Exceptional interpersonal skills with a great sense of humor and dedication to integrity. Experience working collaboratively and successfully with cross-functional teams. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The challenge Adobe purchases products and services from thousands of suppliers each year. We aim to accelerate Adobe's continued commercial success through outstanding strategic sourcing. You will have the chance to lead sourcing projects while you partner with internal teams and suppliers to optimize spend across Adobe's indirect categories. What You'll Do Collaborate with internal business customers and suppliers on the strategy and execution of sourcing projects. Actively partner with Adobe teams on strategic supplier performance initiatives to improve financial and operational performance. Build trusted relationships with senior internal leaders. Jointly or solely lead cross-functional management to plan sourcing strategies and supplier management programs aligned with business objectives. Pro-actively seek value/savings and efficiency opportunities across category spend; negotiate and report in appropriate format. Demonstrate assigned category expertise and business sense by defining category standards and operating procedures. Develop, issue and lead RFx activity to find the best sourcing solutions that meet business and commercial requirements; lead commercial negotiations to ensure Adobe receives the best value and associated cost savings. Collaborate with Adobe Legal for negotiations of large/high risk agreements; ensure favorable commercial terms and mitigate risk. Report progress on a weekly basis, indicating work planning and work in progress. Add agreements, service details and payment forecasts into procurement systems in a complete and timely manner. Drive continuous-improvement initiatives. Use and maintain procurement tools according to Global Procurement standards and expectations. Process contracts according to Adobe Legal Playbook and policies. Apply supplier relationship management techniques to ensure the supply base is providing required level of services, including but not limited to supplier business reviews, spend analytics, etc. What You Need To Succeed A bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience; MBA or JD preferred. Strategic Sourcing/Procurement-related industry certification(s) preferred. Familiarity with fiscal planning cycles and ad hoc financial analysis. Preference: 3-5 years’ experience in Strategic Sourcing, Procurement, Supply Chain, or Program Management in a sophisticated, global, procurement environment or similar business-related experience. Strong interpersonal skills in building trusted partnerships; ability to read a room and influence emotionally, socially, and logically Sound understanding of procurement practices and techniques. Ability to read and interpret contract specifications within the Procurement process. Purchasing systems and order management software knowledge. Aware of personal strengths and weaknesses; receives, applies, and gives useful feedback. Familiarity with BI reporting and spend analysis. High attention to detail and the exercise of sound judgment and decision-making. Exceptional written and verbal communications, time management and interpersonal skills. Excellent presenter of complex concepts and dense data (an Excel and PowerPoint wiz). Inclination to train and educate users in new processes, policies, and procedures or technologies. Self-motivated to achieve results without requiring constant follow-up. Ability to reorder priorities on short-notice and adapt to changing requirements. Effective management of workload and priorities. Flexible working schedule based on company requirements at various times through the business year and quarter. When you join Adobe, you can look forward to collaborating with the most genuine people in the industry, working on projects with real purpose, and having immense pride in the products we create and the customers we support. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Come create experiences that matter at a company that is recognized around the world and hear what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire dedicated individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, cultural background or religious beliefs. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All.

The Opportunity Adobe Business Platform builds platforms and client services that are foundational building blocks for all Adobe products and services. Areas of focus include commerce, identity, provisioning, administration, consumer communications, and web. We strive to build highly scalable, available, and resilient services to enable Adobe's business. Adobe is seeking a Product Operations Manager to partner with Adobe Business Platform leaders and program managers. The focus of this role is to drive delivery against commitments for the Cloud Tech portfolio by providing transparency into execution and risk, increasing predictability of delivery and to drive processes to scale for our future. We are looking for someone with passion, energy, and drive that can bring creative ideas, critical thinking, and a strong appetite for execution. The ideal candidate will be able to coach teams as well as drive key operational processes in a fast-paced agile environment. This includes having a strong ability to collaborate across all functions and connect with peers, outside teams and executive staff. The near term focus is on enabling agile ways of working and iterate development. What you’ll do: Design and refine a set of standardized and repeatable portfolio management processes to tackle complex and cross-company initiatives and drive execution. Identify gaps, dependencies, and bottlenecks in the product development pipeline by participating in project milestone reviews and providing solutions to improve the organization’s effectiveness. Use Jira and Jira portfolio to meet the different demands from the various organizations to improve productivity. Monitor health and performance for Cloud Technology platform Initiatives. Identify patterns, flag risks early and provide solutions to improve delivery. Identify gaps, dependencies, and bottlenecks in the product development pipeline by participating in project milestone reviews and providing solutions to improve the organization’s effectiveness. Play the role of an advisor to the community of program managers in the company and advocate new, existing and best practices. What you need to succeed: Minimum of 5 years’ experience in cloud, SaaS and/or related industry. Some combined history of product portfolio management, development or engineering. Effective written & verbal communication skills and proven ability to break down complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience. Excellent interpersonal skills required in order to build success in a matrix management organization. Ability to influence and align efforts of disparate groups to achieve a common goal. Self-motivated and not afraid to tackle unknowns, demonstrate a strong bias to action. BS technical degree or equivalent. #BusinessPlatform-ALL1

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing team that provides consulting services for Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) products and solutions. AEM helps customers organize and manage the delivery of creative assets and other content across digital marketing channels, including web, mobile, email, social media, and video. The AEM consulting team is responsible for providing expert skills in the implementation of the Adobe AEM s olution offering as well as integrating complementary Adobe enterprise solutions and interfacing with clients' existing IT infrastructure. Adobe Consulting engagements involve full life-cycle project delivery, in-depth product and technical consulting as well as mentoring and knowledge transfer to customers. We are looking for experienced and dedicated Digital Marketing Business Consultants to join the Adobe Consulting Delivery team. These key Business Consultants will work with our multi-functional solution teams to deliver incremental high-quality solutions. The ideal candidate will bring confirmed experience in delivering AEM solutions helping to lead large and sophisticated multi-technology agile projects, while possessing the skills to interact, and work with a broad range of personalities and functions, including the client, business owners, engineers, project operations, quality assurance, project managers and product management. Responsibilities: Deliver high-quality consulting services to our growing client base and lead ambassadorship in our client relationships Function as a lead Product Owner for our enterprise projects Deliver services with deep understanding of AEM platform and best implementation practices Lead with deep expertise in the Content and Web Experience domain in general Effectively analyze complex project issues, identify gaps and the possible solution options and facilitate the presentation and review of the options along with our recommended solution with the client Mentor and guide others on the team, from new hire on-boarding to complex implementation issues Lead the team in identifying, capturing, and distributing knowledge and standard methodologies with clients, partners and colleagues via direct interaction and Adobe communities Requirements : 5-10 years’ experience in the Web and/or ECMS technologies 3+ years of direct client consulting experience Previous experience as a Product Owner, Product Manager or Business Analyst and as a Scrum Master or Project Manger Understanding or experience in using productized APIs, SaaS, SOA, Cloud Services, and Content Management Systems Experience with Agile Scrum process along with Backlog Management and Wiki systems such as Jira and Confluence Experience with enterprise software implementation Experience reviewing and elaborating business and technical requirements Experience with developing requirements for interfaces, integrations, and production data migrations Strong problem-solving skills Superb communication skills Ability to optimally collaborate in a multi-functional team environment Development or product testing experience a plus AEM Business Practitioners certification a plus Position may require up to 15 % travel Adobe is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $150,200 - $195,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Content & Commerce Product & Go-to-Market (GTM) Operations function is seeking a senior program manager to lead the Content GTM program, run critical initiatives in support of the product-led growth operating model implementation and drive key end-to-end business operations processes. As critical team member, you will work in tight partnership with Content Product Marketing Management (PMM) leaders and their teams delivering product marketing strategy and supporting plans and activities. As owner of the GTM program, you will establish and champion strong engagement with more than 30 cross-functional leads and regional counterparts to orchestrate the development and delivery of their respective functional plans. In parallel, you will run pivotal initiatives from inception to post launch involving a combination of new GTM approaches, product innovations, re-designed operating models and alignment across business units. Finally, you will support Content & Commerce business operations by driving key business programs to ensure the highest level of collaboration and efficiency in execution. By nature of the role, you will champion discipled program management practices, processes simplification, problem solving, pro-active communications and well-defined change management game plans! What you'll Do Facilitate Content GTM semi-annual planning cycle from messaging definition to kickoff presentation package to functional and regional teams. Drive GTM requirements definition and communication. Ensure delivery readiness for GTM announcements, industry and enterprise events, and product releases. Take a portfolio view of all plans to prioritize activities in order to optimize outcomes and accelerate delivery. Host weekly GTM program meetings building quarterly calendar of topics, developing agenda, communicating outputs, monitoring execution, and reporting on outcomes. Run critical initiatives by setting up program structure, goals, timeline, milestones, and key collaborators' contribution. Facilitate planning and execution. Conduct signoff, and own reporting. Build working relationship across the ecosystem to address business issues, define solutions, and facilitate approval. Design, deploy and own collaborations spaces for efficient engagement, progress visibility, and act as information hub for all collaborators. What you need to succeed 5 + years of experience leading complex programs with track record of successful launch. Exceptional program management skills, PMP or similar certification preferred. Experience in tech-industry, working with product marketing, product management, and engineering teams. Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodology. Exposure to product-led growth and product-led adoption framework and operating models. Experience designing processes and driving adoption. Foundation knowledge of business change management frameworks Excellent analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills with bias towards data-based decision-making approach. Strong presentation and social skills Exceptional verbal and written communications skills with shown capabilities of engaging with people at all levels of the organization. Demonstrated history of being a focused self-starter, resourceful, and able to prioritize in a fast-paced environment with multiple, changing objectives Strong proficiency in Wiki, Jira, SharePoint, Workfront, and MS Office tools.

The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a Sales Operations Analyst to join our organization. You will be a key member of the Adobe Programmatic Upsell team with responsibilities including strategic support of senior sales leaders. You'll be tasked with understanding and driving key initiatives for their organization. The ability to lead projects as well as deliver measurable results will be a crucial aspect. Internal sourcing to complete complex projects and the capability to drive projects across a broad spectrum of team members is fundamental to the role as well as analyzing and dissecting data in a conclusive manner. What You'll Do Understanding the strategies of the organization and bringing data and perspectives to the leader Build reporting and analyze business performance applying SQL, PowerBI, and Excel Optimize ways to communicate findings and insights to partners in the field operations organization Proactively identify and mitigate issues with data that may impede the progress of business objectives or inhibit the measurement of performance Prioritizing and completing cross-functional projects on a consistent basis Owning initiatives coming out of meetings and driving to completion Leading multiple short-term project from envision to completion Supporting individual contributors and front-line managers on a day-to-day rhythm What You Need To Succeed Sophisticated skills with Salesforce.com or other CRM technology, Excel, PowerBI, Tableau Advanced knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and transformation in joined data sets Expertise in using business analytics and sales data to make decisions and find trends to validate or invalidate existing GTM strategy Very strong Project Manager skills Ability to multitask and lead many projects at one time Able to thrive in a highly dynamic, flexible work environment and switch rapidly from strategy to execution 3 - 5 years of work experience in sales operations, finance, strategy, or management consulting Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required Bonus Points Analytics experience in B2B software sales MS Analytics, Statistics, Applied Economics Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $105,600 - $137,100 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity The Programmatic Upsell Team is looking for an individual who will work on identifying, building and driving all programmatic upsell specific to Adobe Workfront. What You'll Do Partner with the Workfront ecosystem to document, build and run programmatic upsell motions. Supervise customer usage trends, distribute data at scale, provide cadenced analysis, and guide sales motions across the Workfront organization. Collaborate with account teams to determine roles and responsibilities for any given deal, and in some cases personally drive deals to closure. Report on the total state of the business on a weekly basis, identify gaps, and provide direction and analysis to leadership. Supervise upsell pipeline as they progress through sales stages. Identify areas for new opportunities, and drive pilot programs. Establish relationships and trust across the various departments required in an upsell sales motion. What You Need To Succeed Proven track record to identify, build, and scale processes. Familiarity with various business systems such as Salesforce, SAP, PowerBI, etc. Ability to manipulate and interpret data sets to identify areas of potential upsell value. Proficient problem solver with the ability to work through sophisticated problems. Skilled customer facing communicator. Strong ability to navigate a highly matrixed environment. Familiarity with basic sales cycle and adobe processes. Proficient Excel and project management skill. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $110,600 - $143,600 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $124,300 - $161,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Proficient problem solver with the ability to work through sophisticated problems. Skilled customer facing communicator. Strong ability to navigate a highly matrixed environment. Familiarity with basic sales cycle and adobe processes. Proficient Excel and project management skill. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $110,600 - $143,600 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $124,300 - $161,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity The Sales Operations team is responsible for helping define the strategy and operations of a best-in-class sales force for Adobe, and support superior execution by the sales organization. Reporting into Specialist Operations for DX; you drive sales strategy, analytics, and programs that impact the entire Americas business. As a Renewal Sales Operations Specialist, you are able think analytically and drive data and insights critical to the business. You would be a trusted business advisor that serves as critical member of our field organizations, driving operational rigor, go-to-market planning and execution. The ideal candidate will have a background in data & analytics, building complex Excel models and leveraging BI reporting while being able to effectively communicate with executive leaders to inspire change and performance to company targets. Must be located in SF, San Jose, or Lehi. What You'll Do Work as a key member of the Renewal Specialist Operations team, providing timely sales analytics including Renewal Book of Business (RBOB) analysis, weekly pipeline analysis, forecasting, and sales results Drive business change by developing a keen understanding of the business, identifying core focus areas through data driven insights, and building trust with business partners Partner with the field to craft and establish GTM strategy, own the modeling and implementation of sales territories and quota setting Actively identify operational issues and design solutions to make business flow better for the sales teams Work closely with other SOMs to share knowledge, methodologies and facilitate standardization across the field organizationWhat you need to succeed 5+ years of experience working in sales operations with a focus in retention and/or renewals Bachelor's degree in business, finance, data science or related field Strong strategy, planning, organizational and multitasking skills; Systems thinker Solid mathematical aptitude and ability to turn data into insights & actions A problem solver with the ability to identify solutions to complex business issues Must be self-managed, responsive and able to work in a virtual team environment Advanced Microsoft Office skills required, especially Excel & PowerPoint Intellectual curiosity, hands-on mentality, and phenomenal attention to detail At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We believe AI will revolutionize the next generation of creative tools, automating repetitive tasks while leaving creative agency with the user. This is your opportunity to join a world-class team of researchers, engineers, and software developers who are inventing the next generation of creative tools powered by machine learning. In this role you will work with a team at Adobe Research that incubates new product experiences at the intersection of ML, interaction, and video. You will use your versatile engineering skills and experience building interactive ML systems to code, test, maintain, and improve prototype and product releases. What you’ll do : Write high-quality code with a team across the stack of web-based creative tools. We use TypeScript, React, and Node.js for full-stack web development, and Python for backend ML development. Write code across various stages of research development, from early prototyping and exploration (quick hypothesis testing) to building product releases (high-quality, efficient, robust code). Evaluate and integrate novel ML algorithms with an emphasis on the user experience. You will consider usability, explainability, robustness, and ML fairness. Carefully evaluate ML models. This may involve collecting datasets by designing tasks and guidelines for human judgment jobs to annotate media. Carefully document all experiments, failure cases, and outcomes. Build the next generation of creative tools with a multi-disciplinary team of extraordinary engineers and researchers. This is a “best of both worlds” opportunity where you’ll have the flexibility, scope, and personal impact of joining a startup, but also the deep resources, cool perks, and global launch stage that only an industry leader like Adobe can offer. What you’ll need to succeed: A PhD in Computer Science or related field with a focus at the intersection of human-computer interaction and ML or computer vision. Interest and experience with creative tools. A strong record of solving challenging user problems demonstrated in scientific publications or other research output. Experience with both TypeScript and Python. A passion for high-quality software engineering. Experience working with teams and code review. Hand-on experience collecting and labeling datasets using human raters. Understanding of issues around ground truth and training/evaluation data for ML, including human judgment, A/B testing, and ML fairness. Ability to effectively and convincingly communicate ideas and objectives to audiences of all levels.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Documents have been integral part of our day-to-day business for centuries. Today’s enterprises leverage documents to drive all essential and business critical processes and functions. In the new era of AI-powered digital business, the documents of the future will be an intelligent interface for business management where people build agreements and relationships to conduct business together in more effective and automated manner at scale. We are looking to hire a Research Scientist with a background in the intersection of machine learning, computational game theory, discrete optimization and decision science to re-invent the future of document for intelligent business at scale As a research scientist in Document Intelligence Lab (DIL), you will provide technical leadership in research, architect and develop theoretical or data-driven models and solutions at scale regards intelligent business optimization, intelligent negotiation for building agreements and document-driven workflow automation that will drive the next generation of digital business transformation. You will leverage Adobe’s unique data sources and customer relationships which include not only content (such as images, videos, texts, voices, contracts), but also how the customers interacting with those contents (such as authoring, sharing, viewing, retrieving, and collaborating) in the context of diverse verticals (e.g. financial services, healthcare, government and etc.). In addition, you will do: Demonstrate technical proficiency in state-of-art methods of computational game theory, decision science and discrete optimization, and strong expertise and skills in related machine learning algorithms Initiate, lead and execute research initiatives by collaborating with researchers and engineers in cross-disciplinary and cross-functional environment Keep abreast of the latest developments in the fields by continuous learning and proactively championing new ideas and new problem definitions Required Qualifications PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or relevant majors with research specialization in decision science, discrete optimization, game theory, artificial intelligence and machine learning. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, R, Java and C/C++ Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability. Demonstrated track record of innovation and creativity in the decision science, optimization and machine learning domains. Excellent communication, relationship skills and a strong team player. Preferred Qualifications Strong publication records in relevant areas

The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a Sales Operations Manager (SOM) to join our Americas Sales Operations team, supporting our Growth organization mid level individual contributor as a mid level individual contributor. SOMs work directly with field leadership teams, providing timely analytics and business insights to drive successful performance against established business metrics. We are trusted business advisors that serve as critical members of our field organizations, driving operational rigor, go-to-market planning and execution. The ideal candidate will have a background in data & analytics, building complex Excel models and leveraging BI reporting while being able to effectively communicate with executive leaders to inspire change and performance to company targets. What you'll Do Work as a key member of the field leadership team, providing timely sales analytics including weekly pipeline analysis, forecasting, and sales results Drive business change by developing a keen understanding of the business, identifying core focus areas through data driven insights, and building trust with business partners Partner with the field to craft and establish GTM strategy, own the modeling and implementation of sales territories and quota setting Actively identify operational issues and design solutions to make business flow better for the sales teams Work closely with other SOMs to share knowledge, methodologies and facilitate standardization across the field organizationWhat you need to succeed Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field; MBA preferred, but not required At least three years of experience working in an enterprise SAAS company 5+ years related work experience in Sales, Sales Operations, Sales Strategy, Go-to-Market or interlinked functions, ideally in the software industry Foundational excel modeling capabilities like advanced formula writing (vlookup, xlookup, nested IF statements, IndexMatch, etc), pivot tables, etc Strong strategy, planning, organizational and multitasking skills; that can be proven through a case interview Solid mathematical aptitude and ability to turn data into insights & actions A problem solver with the ability to identify solutions to complex business issues Must be self-managed, responsive and able to work in a virtual team environment Advanced Microsoft Office skills required, especially Excel & PowerPoint Intellectual curiosity, hands-on mentality, and phenomenal attention to detail

The Challenge Adobe is looking for an account executive who is responsible for achieving sales targets through the sale of Adobe’s Digital Marketing and Digital Media product lines! You will be part of our savvy sales team, working with Adobe customers across our Manufacturing vertical. This includes the development of long-term relationships with customers as well as developing account plans to expand relationships. The Account Director will achieve this through solution selling capabilities and direct interaction with customers. The individual will be responsible for navigating through the customer’s organization. Your team will guide and assist customers in achieving a successful start with Adobe and help them expand the value realized from our solutions. This is a key role at one of the hottest technology companies in Silicon Valley – and the entire US! The right fit will be, high energy, data-minded, and tech-savvy people with prior software sales experience. What You’ll Do Meet or exceed quota targets Develop effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and balanced growth. Develop relationships in new and existing customers and demonstrate to drive strategy through organization Become a trusted advisor by establishing positive relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and dedication to value (value of counsel and expertise, value of solutions, value of implementation expertise) Develop customer acuity to understands each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and the competitive landscape. Review public information (e.g. new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the customer Lead account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles while working with customers to become Adobe references Develop and deliver comprehensive business plan to address customer’s priorities and hurdles. Apply Strategic Value Assessments, benchmarking and Return on Investment data to support decision process Follow a well-adapted approach to maintaining a rolling 4Q pipeline and maintain pipeline current Use and collaborate with support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory We want experience using Adobe Solutions – Be proficient in and bring all Adobe offers to bear on sales pursuits Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap Support all Adobe promotions and marketing / customer events in the vertical Ideal candidate will have: Demonstrated results selling value and sale excellence Maintain white space analysis and execution of initiatives (up sell and cross sell) on customer base Orchestrate resources: deploy appropriate teams and resources to execute winning sales Apply the Adobe sales model Understand Adobe’s competition and effectively position solutions to differentiate Adobe and secure the business Maintain CRM system with accurate customer and pipeline information Requirements: Minimum 5 to 7+ years with consistent track record selling solutions to Marketing, IT, and LOB Ability to work effectively in a team environment, acting as a liaison with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Product & Marketing Creative, problem-solving approach Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $222,200 - $288,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

This includes the development of long-term relationships with customers as well as developing account plans to expand relationships. The Account Director will achieve this through solution selling capabilities and direct interaction with customers. The individual will be responsible for navigating through the customer’s organization. Your team will guide and assist customers in achieving a successful start with Adobe and help them expand the value realized from our solutions. This is a key role at one of the hottest technology companies in Silicon Valley – and the entire US! The right fit will be, high energy, data-minded, and tech-savvy people with prior software sales experience. What You’ll Do Meet or exceed quota targets Develop effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and balanced growth. Develop relationships in new and existing customers and demonstrate to drive strategy through organization Become a trusted advisor by establishing positive relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and dedication to value (value of counsel and expertise, value of solutions, value of implementation expertise) Develop customer acuity to understands each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and the competitive landscape. Review public information (e.g. new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the customer Lead account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles while working with customers to become Adobe references Develop and deliver comprehensive business plan to address customer’s priorities and hurdles. Apply Strategic Value Assessments, benchmarking and Return on Investment data to support decision process Follow a well-adapted approach to maintaining a rolling 4Q pipeline and maintain pipeline current Use and collaborate with support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory We want experience using Adobe Solutions – Be proficient in and bring all Adobe offers to bear on sales pursuits Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap Support all Adobe promotions and marketing / customer events in the vertical Ideal candidate will have: Demonstrated results selling value and sale excellence Maintain white space analysis and execution of initiatives (up sell and cross sell) on customer base Orchestrate resources: deploy appropriate teams and resources to execute winning sales Apply the Adobe sales model Understand Adobe’s competition and effectively position solutions to differentiate Adobe and secure the business Maintain CRM system with accurate customer and pipeline information Requirements: Minimum 5 to 7+ years with consistent track record selling solutions to Marketing, IT, and LOB Ability to work effectively in a team environment, acting as a liaison with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Product & Marketing Creative, problem-solving approach Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $222,200 - $288,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We are seeking a Senior Administrative Assistant to support several Sr. Directors within our Adobe Experience Platform organization. The successful candidate will have the utmost attention to detail, the ability to proactively anticipate and handle challenges, be a self-starter with strong abilities to handle multiple responsibilities and prioritize appropriately, work efficiently, and remain flexible under pressure. A positive attitude and excellent communication skills are a must! What you’ll do: Daily administrative and business support for Sr. Directors and their respective orgs Heavy calendar management (Outlook) and extensive scheduling with both internal and external partners Attend key meetings, take notes and facilitate follow-up as necessary Coordinate special projects including team offsite, team building activities and all hands meetings, team space planning and floor moves, and potentially other types of projects Ability to travel occasionally to provide on-site support at events/conferences Regularly collaborate with cross-functional Administrative & Executive Assistants and provide backup as needed Continually improve the administrative process for greater efficiency Provide strategic administrative support to the Sr. Director and their organization Prepare agendas, presentations, and logistical support for the Sr. Director and department meetings, including preparation of needed background information for meetings Manage travel schedule, travel logistics and expenses Organize activities for a large, distributed and diverse group What you'll need to succeed: 5+ years experience in coordination, administrative, or operations capacity Experience interacting with customers and staff at all levels in a fast-paced, high-pressured environment, with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality Knowledge of computer technology, including MS Office applications including Teams, SharePoint, and Excel; proficiency with Adobe products is a plus Demonstrated ability to quickly turn around projects with quality and accuracy Very organized with ability to juggle multiple/complex demands in a fast-paced environment Work effectively with minimal direction, take initiative, and follow through Ability to assess and prioritize conflicting demands Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and exercise discretion Eagerness to network with other Executive and Administrative Assistants at Adobe and cooperate as a worldwide team

jobTitle: Senior Analyst, External Reporting and Technical Accounting
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Position Summary Are you passionate about story telling through financial information in alignment with SEC rules and regulations? Come join our dynamic External Reporting and Technical Accounting team at Adobe! We are seeking an highly-effective Senior Financial Analyst to prepare and review our SEC filings and internal reports, and research and provide technical accounting guidance across highly visible areas, including on equity-related topics. This role will report to the Senior Manager of External Reporting & Compensation Accounting. Responsibilities External Reporting Prepare external financial reports, such as Forms 10-Q, 10-K and 8-K, and ensure compliance with associated regulatory reporting, including XBRL tagging, and disclosure requirements. Assist in the preparation of other SEC filings, such as acquisition-related pro forma financial information and proxy statements, and other required financial reports; Prepare quarter-end management and other reports to support the earnings release process, and assist in the review of financial information in earnings documents; Prepare other quarter-end reports and analysis, including the statement of cash flows and accounting memos on segments; Partner with the international accounting team in accordance with statutory reporting requirements, specifically as it relates to share-based payments; Prepare and coordinate reporting timelines and schedule key meetings; Ensure Sarbanes-Oxley requirements are met for impacted areas (e.g., disclosure controls); and Assist with ad hoc projects. Technical Accounting Assess the impact of new and proposed accounting standards to ensure compliance with SEC and GAAP requirements; Partner cross-functionally with internal stakeholders to ensure the accurate accounting for complex transactions and lead implementation of new accounting requirements; Act as a technical accounting resource for the company by researching, resolving and documenting accounting issues, including equity-related accounting issues, that arise during the year; Prepare quarter-end stock-based compensation entries, weighted shares calculation and other equity-related analysis; and Manage and periodically update accounting policies owned and maintained by the team. What You Need To Succeed BA/BS in Finance/Accounting; CPA preferred. If not licensed, able to meet educational requirements to obtain CPA license upon hire in relevant jurisdiction; 2+ years of relevant experience. Big 4 public accounting firm experience preferred; Overall understanding and experience in the application of US GAAP and SEC/financial reporting requirements; Proficiency in researching accounting literature; Strong analytical and problem resolution skills, including being able to research and simplify complex situations; Excellent written and verbal communication skills; Meticulous attention to detail; Proactivity and passion for working cross-functionally with teams including equity, payroll, tax, treasury, finance and corporate accounting; Ability to prioritize tasks to manage and meet deadlines; Strong work ethic and drive to work autonomously with minimal direct supervision; Intellectual curiosity and commitment to continuous improvement; Desire to thrive in a multifaceted and collaborative team environment. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog (http://blogs.adobe.com/adobelife/) and explore the meaningful benefits (http://benefits.adobe.com/) we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) enables businesses to deliver the right experience at the right time to their customers. The Segmentation Service is one of the key AEP services, providing the ability to define customer segments and generate target audiences based on real-time customer profiles. Customer segment definitions are sophisticated queries over profile and event data capturing specific attributes or behaviors shared by a subset of users. With the need to perform trillions of audience segment evaluations per day, scalability and efficiency are paramount in segment evaluation. This is a great opportunity for engineers to solve extremely interesting challenges of scale and build core services that are used by all Adobe Digital Experience solutions. As part of building these services, you will work with an exceptionally talented and collaborative team, tackle large scale data management and complex query evaluation challenges, design & implement innovative algorithms and build highly performant services. What You'll Do Collaborate with a team of engineers & product managers in building a high-performance segmentation engine. Develop and implement techniques for large scale distributed data management across data lake and warehouse style environments Develop and implement query translation algorithms to generate efficient SQL queries from segment definitions Explore tradeoffs across alternate schema layouts and query translation optimizations driven by workload and application characteristics Deploy production services and iteratively improve them based on customer feedback Follow Agile methodologies using industry leading CI/CD pipelines Participate in architecture, design & code reviews What You Need To Succeed B.S. in Computer Science or a related field is required M.S. in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent practical experience is preferred Practical experience at scale in distributed systems or databases Knowledge and experience in data lakes, data warehouses or Spark is preferred Knowledge and experience in query compilation and optimization techniques is a plus Strong programming skills with extensive experience in Java or Scala Excellent communication skills Experience collaborating across teams is preferred Adaptable to evolving priorities, accepting challenges outside one's comfort zone, learning new technologies, and delivering viable solutions within defined time boundaries. Ability to think through solutions from a short term and long-term lens in an iterative development cycle.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Frame.io, an Adobe Company, is changing the future of how videos are made by helping over 1 million creative professionals seamlessly collaborate from all over the world. Frame.io is a detail-oriented, product-led company that is constantly pushing the envelope on design and performance. We're looking for a frontend developer to work with our marketing team to build better first impressions — on our marketing site, blog, and project-based microsites. This role is for you if you’re obsessed with the latest techniques in web design and development, and have an eye for differentiating between design fads and worthwhile trends. When you stumble on a cool website, you immediately open the inspector. You may geek out on tech, but you also have a strong design sensibility. No detail escapes you. Our design, marketing, and growth teams use a creative, data-driven, and iterative approach to craft experiences worthy of the customers we serve. We move quickly and have bold ideas, but you’ll work side by side with world-class talent to deliver the best work of your career. What You'll Do Craft and optimize our marketing websites, including https://frame.io and https://blog.frame.io Develop new projects with our marketing and growth teams to help more people discover and adopt Frame.io Optimize site design and performance across a variety of devices. Manage the implementation of our on-site marketing automation tools, like Segment, Intercom, Drift, and Sumo Work closely with our product, design, and analytics teams to push the envelope on elegance and performance What You Need To Succeed You're a front-end developer highly proficient in HTML5, CSS, and Javascript, who is comfortable, and even passionate about, working without constraints You've built a number of websites from concept to completion You are proficient in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS You're up-to-date with the latest web technologies and libraries (React, etc.) You have an eye for interaction, motion, and graphic design You have a strong working knowledge of responsive web design and cross-platform compatible coding techniques and troubleshooting You have experience with code driven animations and transitions (GSAP, Framer Motion or similar) Experience with graphics programming or shading languages (Three.JS, PIXI.js, WebGL) a plus! 4+ years of applicable experience Bachelors / Graduate Degree or applicable experience Frameio-All1 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $154,000 - $200,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Frame.io, an Adobe Company, is changing the future of how videos are made by helping over 1 million creative professionals seamlessly collaborate from all over the world. Frame.io is a detail-oriented, product-led company that is constantly pushing the envelope on design and performance. We're looking for a frontend developer to work with our marketing team to build better first impressions — on our marketing site, blog, and project-based microsites. This role is for you if you’re obsessed with the latest techniques in web design and development, and have an eye for differentiating between design fads and worthwhile trends. When you stumble on a cool website, you immediately open the inspector. You may geek out on tech, but you also have a strong design sensibility. No detail escapes you. Our design, marketing, and growth teams use a creative, data-driven, and iterative approach to craft experiences worthy of the customers we serve. We move quickly and have bold ideas, but you’ll work side by side with world-class talent to deliver the best work of your career. What You'll Do Craft and optimize our marketing websites, including https://frame.io and https://blog.frame.io Develop new projects with our marketing and growth teams to help more people discover and adopt Frame.io Optimize site design and performance across a variety of devices. Manage the implementation of our on-site marketing automation tools, like Segment, Intercom, Drift, and Sumo Work closely with our product, design, and analytics teams to push the envelope on elegance and performance What You Need To Succeed You're a front-end developer highly proficient in HTML5, CSS, and Javascript, who is comfortable, and even passionate about, working without constraints You've built a number of websites from concept to completion You are proficient in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS You're up-to-date with the latest web technologies and libraries (React, etc.) You have an eye for interaction, motion, and graphic design You have a strong working knowledge of responsive web design and cross-platform compatible coding techniques and troubleshooting You have experience with code driven animations and transitions (GSAP, Framer Motion or similar) Experience with graphics programming or shading languages (Three.JS, PIXI.js, WebGL) a plus! 4+ years of applicable experience Bachelors / Graduate Degree or applicable experience Frameio-All1 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $154,000 - $200,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Adobe 3D & Interactive team is seeking an experienced data science professional to drive our culture of data-driven decision-making. At Adobe 3D&I, we make and market a suite of software products that enable creative professionals to unleash their creativity in 3D and populate the metaverse. As a Data Scientist, you will work with Product, Marketing and Engineering to build the data ecosystem and discover insights. Adding business context to the data insights will allow you to craft compelling narratives that drive decision making. You will have a direct impact on the 3D&I business and product decisions! Are you passionate about exploring data and create data driven stories? Are you self-motivated with strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills? We invite you to apply today! What You'll Do: Work across the 3D&I organization and our partners to uncover insights and guide business decisions Collaborate with 3D&I leadership to define and implement the right metrics to track our business and product performance Regularly monitor and contextualize reports to build a consistent narrative and insightsWhat You'll Need to Succeed: 5+ years of professional experience in data science/analytics BS or MS degree in an analytical field: statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, economics, etc. Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large datasets using SQL-like languages (Hive, Spark, Presto, Databricks) Experience designing and analyzing A/B/n experiments, using appropriate statistical techniques to mitigate bias and interpret statistical significance Familiarity with descriptive and inferential statistics (e.g. t-test, chi-square, ANOVA, correlation, regression, etc.) to understand usage behaviors and generate hypotheses Experience creating data visualizations and storytelling to effectively communicate analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences (preferably Tableau or PowerBI) Experience with data science workflows in Databricks, Jupyter, Python, Git Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong standout colleague Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $147,400 - $191,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

At Adobe 3D&I, we make and market a suite of software products that enable creative professionals to unleash their creativity in 3D and populate the metaverse. As a Data Scientist, you will work with Product, Marketing and Engineering to build the data ecosystem and discover insights. Adding business context to the data insights will allow you to craft compelling narratives that drive decision making. You will have a direct impact on the 3D&I business and product decisions! Are you passionate about exploring data and create data driven stories? Are you self-motivated with strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills? We invite you to apply today! What You'll Do: Work across the 3D&I organization and our partners to uncover insights and guide business decisions Collaborate with 3D&I leadership to define and implement the right metrics to track our business and product performance Regularly monitor and contextualize reports to build a consistent narrative and insightsWhat You'll Need to Succeed: 5+ years of professional experience in data science/analytics BS or MS degree in an analytical field: statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, economics, etc. Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large datasets using SQL-like languages (Hive, Spark, Presto, Databricks) Experience designing and analyzing A/B/n experiments, using appropriate statistical techniques to mitigate bias and interpret statistical significance Familiarity with descriptive and inferential statistics (e.g. t-test, chi-square, ANOVA, correlation, regression, etc.) to understand usage behaviors and generate hypotheses Experience creating data visualizations and storytelling to effectively communicate analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences (preferably Tableau or PowerBI) Experience with data science workflows in Databricks, Jupyter, Python, Git Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong standout colleague Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $147,400 - $191,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
