We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Adobe 3D & Interactive team is seeking an experienced data science professional to drive our culture of data-driven decision-making. At Adobe 3D&I, we make and market a suite of software products that enable creative professionals to unleash their creativity in 3D and populate the metaverse. As a Data Scientist, you will work with Product, Marketing and Engineering to build the data ecosystem and discover insights. Adding business context to the data insights will allow you to craft compelling narratives that drive decision making. You will have a direct impact on the 3D&I business and product decisions! Are you passionate about exploring data and create data driven stories? Are you self-motivated with strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills? We invite you to apply today! What You'll Do: Work across the 3D&I organization and our partners to uncover insights and guide business decisions Collaborate with 3D&I leadership to define and implement the right metrics to track our business and product performance Regularly monitor and contextualize reports to build a consistent narrative and insightsWhat You'll Need to Succeed: 5+ years of professional experience in data science/analytics BS or MS degree in an analytical field: statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, economics, etc. Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large datasets using SQL-like languages (Hive, Spark, Presto, Databricks) Experience designing and analyzing A/B/n experiments, using appropriate statistical techniques to mitigate bias and interpret statistical significance Familiarity with descriptive and inferential statistics (e.g. t-test, chi-square, ANOVA, correlation, regression, etc.) to understand usage behaviors and generate hypotheses Experience creating data visualizations and storytelling to effectively communicate analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences (preferably Tableau or PowerBI) Experience with data science workflows in Databricks, Jupyter, Python, Git Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong standout colleague Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $147,400 - $191,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! We are looking for a Senior Digital Strategist with an e-commerce consulting background to join our Digital Performance Strategy team. This individual will have a high degree of initiative, a strategic approach, and a deep understanding of the retail sector, including e-commerce and stores. The right individual will have a sophisticated point of view on the ways in which consumer behaviors and expectations have changed as a result of the pandemic. Do you have a passion for human-centered design and great omnichannel shopping experiences? Do you get excited about the various contexts in which consumers engage and have experience with the ways that brands have adapted to accommodate (ROPIS, BOPIS, BORIS)? Do you love helping your clients develop new capacity and become beautifully efficient at flowing product-related content into personalized shopping experiences? If this sounds like you, we’d like to meet you. This individual will have a very broad range of consultative skills: to persuade and educate at executive levels, to collaborate and solve problems at the mid-level, while still being able to get into detail when discussing digital asset management for site merchandising, improving checkout flows, and retargeting. The right person will have a well-developed point-of-view on how context, content, and personalization come together across the Adobe platform. Possess an informed vision for cutting edge e-commerce and retail environments – people, process, and governance – to help Adobe’s customers align their teams toward business objectives, and recommend roadmaps and component programs to accomplish that vision. Have a strong executive presence and interpersonal skills, with ability to engage and inspire senior executives. Be a thought leader and educator on cross-functional teams, delivering clear, effective guidance, with a focus on customer value delivery. Synthesize client findings into presentations of strategic narratives and conclusions appropriate for all levels of client leadership. Develop strategies and experiences in the following functional areas: personalized omnichannel experiences, channel strategy, digital asset management, in-store digital experiences. Lead the evolution of our e-commerce strategy by defining and refining internal process, creating reusable templates, and mentoring team members. Ability to negotiate quickly through technical or other challenges during development, in deep partnership with our cross-functional AEM technical team Basic Qualifications: Relevant BA/BS degree in a related field or 6+ years of progressive experience in e-commerce and site merchandising Work experience in a digital agency, strategy consulting organization, content-or ecommerce-focused organization, marketing department, or leading technology company. Direct experience with Adobe Commerce (Magento) Strong proficiency in AEM and content management tools and workflows In-depth experience within Adobe Creative Cloud or comparable User Experience Tools, Adobe Marketing Cloud experience is a plus. Experience working in Agile environments. Willingness to travel based on client needs, pandemic considerations are in place at Adobe. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $117,400 - $152,500 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Your focus will be to lead our Adobe Real-Time Customer Data Platform (RTCDP) Product Management team, an exciting and fast-growing business within Digital Experience! You will also articulate a compelling vision to scale this business globally across the enterprise and mid-market segments. What You'll Do Build, own, and drive the roadmap of the RTCDP product, the fastest growing business within DX, to successful execution Scale the business to serve the needs of mid-market customers that require faster time to value at a competitive total cost of ownership Partner with the Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) to bring to bear shared services that unify DX applications and deliver a seamless user experience Deliver innovative AI/ML capabilities built on top of AEP that combine Data and Content Work with design, product management, and engineering teams across Adobe to bring the vision to fruition in ways that are long-lasting, cloud scalable, and reflect a deep sensitivity to customer needs Drive a robust software development process that is agile, predictable, and focused on results. Bring a combination of critical thinking and pragmatic delivery to yield the best short-term as well as long-term results Lead and build a team of high-impact Product Managers, that can work closely with their counterparts in UX/UXRs, Engineering, and Product Marketing to drive excellence in experience and execution across the platform portfolio Be on the lookout for strategic partnerships and M&A opportunities to bring more innovation to AdobeWhat you need to succeed 10+ years of executive-level product management experience Domain knowledge in Customer Data Management, CRM systems, and digital engagement applications is strongly preferred Understanding and experience working with UX and Product Marketing teams Deep knowledge of customer experience needs in B2B, B2B2C, and B2C companies Experience leading and collaborating with large teams across multiple geographies and functional areas (solutions, sales, marketing, engineering, professional services, and support) Executive presence working with customers, partners, C-staff and presenting at large conferences At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Digital transformation has led to the expansion of the role of content in fueling customer experiences. The opportunity here is to capture this market growth and accelerate from a $1.2B+ franchise to a multi-billion franchise! You will lead a market-defining portfolio of products for customer experience, which requires an experienced leader who can operate at a large scale and one that is also a self-disrupter; willing to push innovation, and adept at operating at both levels. Success will be measured by near-term enterprise customer success, existing install base retention, and the ability to drive a differentiated vision into product reality for the long-term in a manner that drives near-term market momentum. What You’ll Do Continue to evolve the product strategy that is inclusive of each part of Adobe Experience Manager as its separate products and also a connected strategy across the portfolio of both mature and emerging use cases Ensure execution against strategy in a technically optimal manner which drives above market levels of efficiency and impact for the given level of resources (people, budget) Continue to develop the leaders within the organization Work collaboratively with the rest of the DX and DMe product teams to ensure we bring together content, data, and commerce for personalization at scale and content supply chain Establish trust and relationships with senior leaders across customers and partners that expand commercial relationships for the long-run Establish credibility and influence with key functions across Adobe to support customer acquisition and success to drive business resultsWhat You Need to Succeed Deep technical expertise in content personalization and large complex, critically important cloud-based systems for enterprise and mid-sized orgs Innovative and imaginative thinking to drive thought leadership and execution that creates the future for an entire industry Ability to connect business and user design requirements to concrete product requirements and foster this culture across the product org. Product-led growth experience and understanding of the creation of both developer and business user-driven products Strong verbal and written communication that is both collaborative and conclusive - knowing the timing for one and/or the other Ability to lead and encourage the team and broader Adobe organization to achieve more than what otherwise would be possible A growth mindset that drives the individual and team growth Strong business instinct and rigorous thinking on all angles of a problem At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The challenge The Sr. Director of Sales Operations will be responsible for the Americas Digital Media for Enterprise business, including Adobe’s flagship Creative Cloud and Document Cloud solutions. The Sr. Director of Sales Operations will partner with the Vice President of Americas Sales to help define the strategy and operations of a best-in-class sales force for Adobe and support superior execution by the sales organization. The Sr. Director of Sales Operations will also be accountable for developing a comprehensive sales operations plan based on a substantial understanding of modern field operation dynamics to drive revenue growth. In addition, a crucial objective includes optimizing the field readiness architecture to enable the continued scale and success of Adobe’s field operations professionals. What You’ll Do Management responsibility for a team of professionals providing centralized support for the Americas Digital Media Organization. Responsible for building and delivering C-Level executive presentations, including RTBs, QBRs, and regular deep-dive sessions. Lead, coordinate and refine weekly sales forecasting processes driving predictability. Develop and action productivity and performance reporting of sales management, individuals, and account opportunity. Oversee sales team productivity and track critical KPIs (close rate, pipeline growth, upsell, cross-sell, churn rate, etc.). Establish highly repeatable and scalable sales processes, automation, and reporting methodologies for implementation across regions and business units. Conduct historical reviews of account performance, account segmentation, prioritization, and oversee win/loss analysis and other predictive analytics. Drive field sales and annual ecosystem planning, including determining account segmentation, financial targets, organizational design, account coverage, capacity model, territory assignment, quotas, and compensation plans. Support and optimize the GTM strategy, including core sales processes and productivity drivers, infrastructure and automation, regional performance, and Enterprise Data-Driven Operating model. Ensure that all field sales teams fully adopt the defined GTM. Help recruit, inspire, lead, mentor, and motivate the sales organization to capitalize on the market opportunity for Adobe. Effectively partner and appropriately challenge leadership to overachieve revenue targets and instill centralized processes effectively. Measure how Sales Reps spend their time and use that data to improve processes and IT automation priorities. Accountability to assist sales teams in improving performance by assigning sales goals, quotas, and compensation plans; and developing sales training and management programs. Manage the sales pipeline by monitoring deal flow across stages and conducting performance reporting. Establish sales asset needs, support development, and determine asset utilization and deployment guidelines. What You Need To Succeed Proven experience managing a best-in-class, complex Sales Operations function supporting aggressive revenue growth. Capable of managing a centralized go-to-market operational team responsible for supporting $2B+ of revenues. Candidates must have a proven track record of success in providing strategic guidance and operational oversight in Sales Operations within a complex technology sales environment. A proven ability to develop tactical initiatives that improve sales productivity and performance. Background of introducing innovative performance metrics and improvement programs. Ability to utilize combined industry benchmarking information with a robust analytical capability to identify market trends and test alternative strategy approaches that yield superior performance. Experience researching, developing and deploying sales tools, technologies, and automation solutions/strategies in the field. Experience developing and managing sales compensation plans and expertise in contract review and negotiations. Highly entrepreneurial and able to operate independently with minimum supervision. Heavily results-oriented; strong track record in meeting and exceeding revenue targets. Experience in a subscription revenue environment. Adobe’s Worldwide Field Operations Adobe’s Worldwide Field Operations provides customers with the products, services, solutions, and support they need to make, manage, measure and/or monetize their digital assets. Worldwide Field Operations includes Worldwide Sales, Reseller Partnerships, Partner Sales, Adobe Global Services, Sales Operations and the Adobe Worldwide eCommerce organizations. Take a peek into Adobe life in this video . When you join Adobe, you can look forward to collaborating with the most genuine people in the industry, working on projects with real purpose, and having immense pride in the products we create and the customers we support. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, cultural background or religious beliefs. We know that when our employees feel appreciated and included, they can be more creative, innovative and successful. This is what it means to be Adobe For All. Learn more about our vision here . Come create experiences that matter at a company that is recognized around the world and hear what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog .

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity In this role, your main responsibilities will be to provide direction, support and recommendations for the resolution of critical and impactful employee relations activities. You will provide consultation and coaching to Americas Region based managers and employees in related areas such as (but not limited to): workplace investigations, sophisticated performance management, conflict resolution, position eliminations, critical exit matters and employee wellbeing concerns. You will be required to build strong partnerships and work closely with all levels of management, the Employee Experience Business Partners, Adobe Employment Counsel, Internal Partners and Centers of Excellence (COEs) with the goal of driving high employee engagement and thoughtful resolutions. What you'll Do Demonstrate an ability to have a solid understanding of company policy, culture and values, and use that understanding to: make recommendations about the resolution of sophisticated and unique employment related issues; and, support vital interactions between managers and employees to drive positive outcomes Engage as a trusted adviser and subject matter authority who provides coaching on critical work-related concerns related (but not limited to): workplace investigations, performance concerns, conflict resolution and critical exit matters Lead internal investigations in compliance and employee related matters, recommend solutions, and support with the facilitation of the resolution Partner with managers on sophisticated performance matters and assess progress; coach managers and employees through corrective action and disciplinary actions Support and counsel on employee wellbeing concerns as they arise Participate in projects, as requestedWhat you need to succeed Experience leading multiple, concurrent, high-priority employee relations activities with a focus on providing clear guidance and timely and consistent execution 8+ years of experience working in an Employee Relations and/or HR Business Partner role, with a proven ability to conduct workplace investigations Ability to review concerns holistically, anticipate potential issues and diagnose the root cause through active listening and conscientious inquiry Effective in detailing and documenting case notes, investigation summaries, and correspondence with employees and partners Ability to work both autonomously and as a team, while developing strong professional relationships with peers, managers, executives, and cross-functional teams across diverse organizations Demonstrate commitment to helping employees and managers be successful and achieving those results in alignment with what we value Solid understanding and capability to communicate about Federal, State and Local regulations; ADA and Leave of Absence Bachelors required. JD or Masters preferred. Employment Law background, SHRM PHR or equivalent Human Resources certification a plus. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $98,600 - $128,000 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $118,700 - $154,200 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity In this role, your main responsibilities will be to provide direction, support and recommendations for the resolution of critical and impactful employee relations activities. You will provide consultation and coaching to Americas Region based managers and employees in related areas such as (but not limited to): workplace investigations, sophisticated performance management, conflict resolution, position eliminations, critical exit matters and employee wellbeing concerns. You will be required to build strong partnerships and work closely with all levels of management, the Employee Experience Business Partners, Adobe Employment Counsel, Internal Partners and Centers of Excellence (COEs) with the goal of driving high employee engagement and thoughtful resolutions. What you'll Do Demonstrate an ability to have a solid understanding of company policy, culture and values, and use that understanding to: make recommendations about the resolution of sophisticated and unique employment related issues; and, support vital interactions between managers and employees to drive positive outcomes Engage as a trusted adviser and subject matter authority who provides coaching on critical work-related concerns related (but not limited to): workplace investigations, performance concerns, conflict resolution and critical exit matters Lead internal investigations in compliance and employee related matters, recommend solutions, and support with the facilitation of the resolution Partner with managers on sophisticated performance matters and assess progress; coach managers and employees through corrective action and disciplinary actions Support and counsel on employee wellbeing concerns as they arise Participate in projects, as requestedWhat you need to succeed Experience leading multiple, concurrent, high-priority employee relations activities with a focus on providing clear guidance and timely and consistent execution 8+ years of experience working in an Employee Relations and/or HR Business Partner role, with a proven ability to conduct workplace investigations Ability to review concerns holistically, anticipate potential issues and diagnose the root cause through active listening and conscientious inquiry Effective in detailing and documenting case notes, investigation summaries, and correspondence with employees and partners Ability to work both autonomously and as a team, while developing strong professional relationships with peers, managers, executives, and cross-functional teams across diverse organizations Demonstrate commitment to helping employees and managers be successful and achieving those results in alignment with what we value Solid understanding and capability to communicate about Federal, State and Local regulations; ADA and Leave of Absence Bachelors required. JD or Masters preferred. Employment Law background, SHRM PHR or equivalent Human Resources certification a plus. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $98,600 - $128,000 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $118,700 - $154,200 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity You will be part of Adobe Experience Platform, the foundation of Adobe Experience Cloud products. You will represent the team internally in the various product and cross functional initiatives, define priorities, bring clarity and lead continuous agile development. Successful candidates will have a technical background and be passionate about delivering high quality software with effective and efficient engineering processes. As a Senior Engineering Program manager , you will have the ability to lead large and complex programs, use your negotiation skills and tradeoffs, influence the roadmap and set the team for success. What You'll Do Organize and coordinate engineering, product, operations and go-to-market activities across teams and across geographies resulting in quality product releases. Conflict resolution and negotiation skills. Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Manage dependencies effectively, track issues and risks, build mitigation plans. Lead all aspects of project delivery process with key contributors. Effectively communicate with technical and non-technical team members and provide inputs to architecture decisions. Motivated, passionate about customer experience, execution oriented high-performance individual with strong process and metric focus. What You Need To Succeed Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (or) equivalent work experience. 5+ years of technical program management experience, leading cross functional teams to deliver high quality products. Possess strong knowledge about software development life cycle including build processes, testing and code reviews. Strong analytical thinking with a track record of delivering programs in a fast-paced environment, use metrics and data to come up with recommendations and drive decisions.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity This is an exciting opportunity to join Adobe’s FP&A team. In this role, you will serve as a subject matter expert on our immediate team and a financial planner and a partner for the Adobe Technology Services (ATS) organization. Our team is responsible for budget management, forecasting, financial reporting, and providing insights to executive management to facilitate informed decision-making. Join our team in a fast-paced and high growth environment, demonstrate your capabilities, and you will find plenty of growth opportunities down the road! What You'll Do Partner with ATS leadership and ATS business operations Responsible for the forecasting and financial reporting of a subset of ATS organizations, capital expenditures, and private cloud financials Monthly and quarterly close and forecasting activities; variance analyses, highlight risks & opportunities, headcount variances Annual operating planning Prepare executive presentations What You Need To Succeed Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or Economics 5+ years of financial planning & analysis experience High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Strong verbal and written communication skills Positive and collaborative attitude Attention to detail Ability to multi-task and adapt in a rapid and fast-paced environment Nice to haves: CPA, MBA, experience with Anaplan, Microsoft PowerBI, Tableau, SAP

jobTitle: Senior Financial Analyst, B2B Digital Media
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to provide financial and business partner support for B2B Digital Media. This position will provide cross-functional engagement that will enable and influence key decision making. You will support FP&A processes through analysis and modeling to provide recommendations to senior management, driving strategic decision making. What You’ll Do Own scenario analysis to support emerging offerings, ensuring financial rigor when exploring opportunities for Adobe. Advise business strategy, opportunity sizing, pricing, and financial targets. Support strategic financial planning, setting the roadmap for Adobe's continued growth by collaborate with business owners to build long-term financial models. Partner closely with IT, Finance Systems, and Finance counterparts to continually improve & enhance DMe B2B reporting capabilities and processes. Trusted business partner working cross-functionally to actively address Adobe’s risk and opportunities while working with key business leaders to identify appropriate metrics to measure and evaluate business performance. Own quarter-end financial reporting, telling the “Why” behind financial performance. What You Need To Be Successful BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics. 4-6 years of relevant finance experience. Previous experience in creating financial models for a subscription/SaaS business a plus. Management consulting or investment banking a plus. High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel required, with experience in SQL, PowerBI, Tableau, Hadoop, and/or Snowflake preferred. Focus on building scalable analytics & reporting. Self-starter who can handle sophisticated tasks with minimal direction and develop new strategies and ways of approaching business challenges. Strong communication & interpersonal skills with ability to influence/drive decision making across cross-functional teams. Strong project management, planning, and organizational skills, including ability to handle several projects at a time in a fast-paced environment. Problem solver who can challenge the status quo and drive new ways of thinking across the organization.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! This is an exciting opportunity to join the Cloud COE FP&A Team. This role has unique insight into the Adobe businesses and products, and engineering teams. You will be able to reach insights others might not be able to make. In this role, you will work cross-functionally with the Cloud Operations team to solve complex business situations and build the right financial cadence. This is a fast paced, growing, and visible business area. If you’re ready to dig in and if you’ve got the passion, skills, and experience – we should talk. Finance deliverables include but not limited to: Cloud Efficiency program support, validation, and reporting; Cloud vendor negotiation support. What You Will Do Responsibilities include, but not limited to: Deliver Executive level content and analysis. Own and improve Adobe level Cloud Financial models. Dive deep to understand Cloud operational metrics, efficiency projects, and usage metrics. Run scenario modeling to provide a range of possibilities and identify areas of risk and opportunity. Provide ad-hoc modeling and support to drive decision making and to influence partners. Ability to prioritize multiple deliverables under tight deadlines. What you will need to succeed Positive demeanor, collaborative, and comfortable in a fluid environment that changes as the business and as the day evolves. Ability to understand key business drivers, communicate financial implications, business impact, and recommendations efficiently. High attention to details with excellent organizational skills and ability to take charge, set objectives, strive for results. A teammate who can work closely with peers across the FP&A community. 5-7 years of Finance or related experience. Strong problem solving, analytical and accounting skills. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills are critical, experience in Tableau and Anaplan are preferred. SFDC, SAP, or TM1 is a plus. Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field; CPA or MBA preferred, but not required. Creative, adaptive, and eager to learn new ways and skills At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We are looking to hire a Senior Financial Analyst to join our team! This is an exciting opportunity to join the Digital Experience (DX) Finance team as we continue to propel the business growth through providing meaningful insights! You will own R&D and cloud expense for a set of solutions under DX Business unit. You will also partner with PM/PMM team to provide insights about topline for GTM activities. In this role you will have the ability to influence management decisions, lead change & standardized methodologies, and challenge status quo as Adobe continues to scale for growth. This position is based in San Jose, CA. What you'll Do Partner closely with business to understand the underlying drivers of expenses Present financial summary and business insights to senior management, highlighting key opportunities and areas of concern. Drive Opex and COGS forecasting, partnering with R&D leaders, Bus Ops, and PMM/PMs Lead cost-of-goods-sold analysis on per customer basis to drive product pricing and gross margins Work cross functionally with other finance counterparts to chargeback/show back cloud expenses to various solutions Strategic Business partner to product management team providing insights and modelling behind topline Drive consistency, standardization, and cadence for expense outlook, QRF, Budget, supporting rolling planning process Support Hierarchy for overall product org and engage with Finance systems teamWhat you need to succeed The successful candidate will have shown experience in past roles influencing business owners and supporting decision making in rapidly evolving environments. Bachelor's Degree in Finance/Economics (or equivalent practical experience) required. Proven track record of strategic business partnership Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel Comfort with ambiguity and a willingness to work with a high degree of autonomy Proven ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workload Proficient in working in large data sets and identifying trends / anomalies against expectations PowerBI, Tableau, Anaplan, SAP, experience would be a plus Experience with SAAS companies a plus. MBA is a plus

jobTitle: Senior Financial Analyst, Digital Media Cloud Finance
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking an analytical, creative, and strategic-minded Finance Leader supporting Digital Media Cloud Finance. This position will serve as the backbone of the business analytics function. This candidate will build out Data Driven Operating Model (DDOM), the cornerstone of the strategic value of DMe Cloud Finance. This candidate will work closely with finance leadership as well as key business partners across Digital Media, including Product Analytics, Data Platform, Engineering, Product Management to build analytical frameworks, introduce scalable reporting and drive insights of public cloud usage to the Leadership Team. What You'll Do Acting as the key business partner working closely with leaders across Finance, Product, Engineering to establish cloud usage and value metrics curated based on business context Build out "One Source of Truth" scalable end-to-end dashboard (Tableau, PowerBI) reporting of cloud usage funnel, from top level customer cloud services usage to cloud cost unit economics, in partnership with Data Platform, Product Analytics and Cloud Optimization teams using modern data engineering techniques and querying tools (SQL) Using AI/ML techniques to create anomaly detection/alerting of cost to uncover real time insights and drive data-backed decisions/actions Continuous learning of current public cloud technology landscape, groundbreaking future trends; and how Digital Media product roadmap uses various AWS/Azure IaaS/PaaS/SaaS offers to deliver value to end customers What You Need To Succeed 5+ Years of experience in Finance, Business Analytics, or other analytical fields Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Math, Engineering, or other STEM fields Prior knowledge of Cloud Computing, either from user perspective (building services on AWS/Azure/GCP) or business model perspective (Pricing, Costing, Optimization Techniques) MBA Preferred

jobTitle: Senior Financial Analyst - Digital Media Retention FP&A
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a strong team member to drive our multi-billion SAAS business on a continuous growth trajectory, by accelerating our path of improvement in subscription renewal performance. This experienced expert will be planning/forecasting/reporting performance in customer renewals for millions of subscriptions across multiple routes to market, building innovative models to accurately predict customer churn, using a range of inputs available. What you'll Do Drive in-depth analyses to inform subscriber retention trends and drivers of Digital Media customer attrition/retention Drive Digital Media’s short-term (weekly) & long-term (1-3 year) financial planning in relation to customer attrition impact on net subscriber growth Provide subscriber retention/attrition forecast across all markets using both bottoms-up cohort-based modeling and top-down approaches. Develop customer-segmented decay curves to drive bottoms-up modeling. Ongoing ownership of near term (in-quarter, weekly) attrition churn forecast and long-term (multi-year) for A.com, Reseller, and App Store routes to market Business partner with retention improvement program leadership Performance analysis and executive reporting for all financial churn metrics (billable base, cancel attempts, customer support & account management save-rates, payment failure & recovery rates, win-back rates) Perform data analytics on various subscriber churn reports/metrics and provide executive level insights Build impactful visualizations on top of large/complex datasets to effectively communicate retention trends & drivers to executive leadership Present retention planning assumptions/opportunity/risks with varying levels of cross-functional partners including Regional Sales teams, GTM, Product Marketing & Product Management teams, as well as Financial Planning & Analysis leadership team Must have a foundational understanding of subscriber forecasting, Lifetime Value Prediction; Customer Engagement/Usage analytics; Cancellation and cross-product Migration analysis; Engagement and Retention Program Assessment; Web Analytics; Must be comfortable working in a deadline-driven environment, oriented around key financial planning deliverables on a quarterly cadenceWhat you need to succeed 5+ years professional working experience, with a minimum of 3 years in an analytics role Experience with SAAS is preferred Positive demeanor, collaborative and comfortable in a fluid environment that changes as the business evolves. Highly motivated self-starter who is passionate about continuous improvements Deep knowledge of ﬁnancial fundamentals, planning and forecasting processes Strong analytical and outstanding social skills to articulate key business and the financial implications/business impact High attention to details with excellent organization skills with the ability to set objectives and get results Sophisticated Excel skills are critical, and experience in Power BI, Tableau and Python are preferred Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics, or equivalent experience Degree in Statistics is a plus MBA is a plus Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $96,300 - $125,000 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $119,000 - $154,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a strong team member to drive our multi-billion SAAS business on a continuous growth trajectory, by accelerating our path of improvement in subscription renewal performance. This experienced expert will be planning/forecasting/reporting performance in customer renewals for millions of subscriptions across multiple routes to market, building innovative models to accurately predict customer churn, using a range of inputs available. What you'll Do Drive in-depth analyses to inform subscriber retention trends and drivers of Digital Media customer attrition/retention Drive Digital Media’s short-term (weekly) & long-term (1-3 year) financial planning in relation to customer attrition impact on net subscriber growth Provide subscriber retention/attrition forecast across all markets using both bottoms-up cohort-based modeling and top-down approaches. Develop customer-segmented decay curves to drive bottoms-up modeling. Ongoing ownership of near term (in-quarter, weekly) attrition churn forecast and long-term (multi-year) for A.com, Reseller, and App Store routes to market Business partner with retention improvement program leadership Performance analysis and executive reporting for all financial churn metrics (billable base, cancel attempts, customer support & account management save-rates, payment failure & recovery rates, win-back rates) Perform data analytics on various subscriber churn reports/metrics and provide executive level insights Build impactful visualizations on top of large/complex datasets to effectively communicate retention trends & drivers to executive leadership Present retention planning assumptions/opportunity/risks with varying levels of cross-functional partners including Regional Sales teams, GTM, Product Marketing & Product Management teams, as well as Financial Planning & Analysis leadership team Must have a foundational understanding of subscriber forecasting, Lifetime Value Prediction; Customer Engagement/Usage analytics; Cancellation and cross-product Migration analysis; Engagement and Retention Program Assessment; Web Analytics; Must be comfortable working in a deadline-driven environment, oriented around key financial planning deliverables on a quarterly cadenceWhat you need to succeed 5+ years professional working experience, with a minimum of 3 years in an analytics role Experience with SAAS is preferred Positive demeanor, collaborative and comfortable in a fluid environment that changes as the business evolves. Highly motivated self-starter who is passionate about continuous improvements Deep knowledge of ﬁnancial fundamentals, planning and forecasting processes Strong analytical and outstanding social skills to articulate key business and the financial implications/business impact High attention to details with excellent organization skills with the ability to set objectives and get results Sophisticated Excel skills are critical, and experience in Power BI, Tableau and Python are preferred Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics, or equivalent experience Degree in Statistics is a plus MBA is a plus Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $96,300 - $125,000 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $119,000 - $154,600 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! The Opportunity This is an exciting opportunity to join the Digital Media Finance team at Adobe. In this role, you will serve as the financial business partner to the teams at the forefront of Adobe's product innovation. Your work will contribute positive velocity in ever-growing business needs. Join our team in a fast-paced and high-growth environment, demonstrate your capabilities, and find plenty of growth opportunities down the road! What You'll Do Single point of contact and trusted advisor to business leaders for all finance and business decision needs End to end responsibility across all spend categories Provide spend management, insights to facilitate informed decision making, metrics to help grow and sustain infrastructure and innovation Monthly and quarterly close activities: present results and insights to stakeholders Forecast, track, monitor key business drivers, prepare analysis to explain anomalies, lead the resolution of issues by working across cross functional stakeholders In-depth understanding of business and support their key priorities Lead the Annual Operating Plan for the groups you support Design process efficiencies to support business at scale What You Need To Succeed Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or Economics; MBA and/or CPA are preferred but not required Demonstrated ability across FP&A, BU / sales finance. Comfortable with working under ambiguity / "start-up" type of environment. High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office Strong communication and presentation skills Positive and collaborative attitude, patience to support non-finance professionals Immaculate precision and attention to detail Ability to multi-task and adapt in a rapid and fast-paced environment Flexibility to support non-US time zones Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Digital Media Finance team is looking for a hands-on Data Savy Product Manager who can apply their technical skills to aid in driving systems, forecasting, and planning metrics to enhance Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) business processes. You will work directly with senior leadership and cross functional teams including Sales Ops, Sales, regional FP&A teams, Product Marketing, and IT. What you'll Do Use data to drive strategic and tactical decisions for finance programs Identify and solve broad complex technical data issues Lead cross-team collaboration through influence Demonstrate strong analytical and quantitative skills and drive data-based decision making Craft well thought out proposals/recommendations that specify a clear course of action Create streamlined solutions and prototypes to present up, down, and across the management stackWhat you need to succeed A strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets for analytical purposes using SQL-like languages (Hive/Hadoop experience preferred) Proficient in Python Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability. Excellent communication, relationship skills, and a strong team player. 5-10 years of relevant finance data modeling experience. Previous experience in creating/maintaining financial models for a subscription/SaaS business and/or supporting financial reporting systems and automation in a complex organization is a plus. Strong communication & interpersonal skills with ability to influence/drive decision making across cross-functional teams. Comfortable working with technical resources to ensure financial reporting and infrastructure aligns with business logic. Strong project management and planning skills, including ability to handle several projects at a time in a fast-paced environment. Problem solver who can challenge the status quo and drive new ways of thinking across the organization.

jobTitle: Senior Financial Data Engineer, Systems and Automation
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity This is an exciting opportunity to join the Digital Media Finance team as we continue to propel the business through data-driven forecasts and provide influential insights. In this role, you will have the opportunity to help drive Adobe’s pivotal initiatives by data engineering solutions that connect systems to visualization platforms for management reporting. The position will report to the Group Manager, Business Intelligence and Visualization to drive our systems and automation effort. This position will provide an outstanding opportunity to drive timely insights across Digital Media (DMe) Business at Adobe. The ideal candidate for this role is a well-rounded top performer with excellent data engineering, analysis, and visualization skills, who will be a catalyst for growth in a fast-paced environment. You should be a strong partner, who enjoys forming cross-functional relationships within Adobe. You will support automating complex financial models, develop engaging and interactive dashboards, streamline processes, and drive efficiencies in management reporting. What you'll Do Responsible for the strategy and execution of DMe lifecycle of financial and analytics dashboards and ensuring scalability of systems and processes Manage data transitions and platform migrations between Hadoop/SAP HANA/Snowflake/DataBricks, Tableau/PowerBI, and related ETL processes Develop data pipelines, connections, and infrastructure to better enable forecasting and data science modelling Correct data errors via systematic, logical fixes and provide updates within the data pipelines, connections and infrastructures that are built to support the teams Create documentation and support enablement for the teams who are interested and able to help themselves Accountable for ad-hoc support & participation in critical business analytics and key project support as directed by management. Partner closely with IT, Finance Systems, and Finance counterparts to continually improve, streamline & enhance planning and reporting processes. What you need to succeed BS/BA with preferred focuses in areas of Business, Finance, or Information Systems. Master’s in Data Science a plus 5+ years of experience working with large and complex data structures and develop efficient queries to create calculated fields and data aggregates 3+ years of proven experience designing and developing dashboards using PowerBI 5+ years of relevant experience in data science and analytics in creating/maintaining financial models for a subscription/SaaS business a plus Proficient in data platforms/systems (such as SQL, Hadoop, Snowflake, Databricks), ETL tools (such as Alteryx, SnapLogic), process automation, and standardization Self-starter with high attention to details, excellent interpersonal skills, and ability to take charge, set objectives, and deliver results. Strong project management skills with ability to juggle multiple priorities Strong team orientation with great customer focus. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $105,200 - $136,600 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $132,500 - $172,100 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with User Interface expertise to help build and evolve our internally facing web platform. Centralized Account Management (CAM) hosts all Adobe customer accounts, hierarchy in one place, and provides access to various internal consumers (such as in sales, marketing, support, other business units) who will search, manage, harvest, and govern the account data for their business needs. Role! Innovation: Develop UI screens make applications work intuitively and render designer mock-ups and wireframes into front-end code. Optimize user interaction to work on any surface such as desktop, mobile, etc. Develop backend RESTful APIs for UI with low latency, robustness, and scalability. Delivery: Strengthen the application with high security and ensure the system is built for expansion and offers a delightful user experience, reliability, and resiliency. Enrichment: Collaborate with peers and contribute to technical design & implementation of web applications on emerging technology and demonstrate new ways to build. Required Skills We value a great foundation in computer science, with strong proficiencies in data structures, algorithms, distributed computing, and microservices architecture. We embark on creative ways to handle complexity, automation, and user experience-focused design. We recognize the outstanding expertise in developing highly available and scalable production services and have a technic to engineer simple solutions to seek sophisticated problems and error handling. We appreciate taking ownership, delivering outcomes, and operating efficiently with minimal direction while teaming up with colleagues in multiple organizations and time zones. Required Technology Expertise Experience and Expertise in ReactJS, Spectrum framework, Material UI, Virtual DOM, Component lifecycle, JSON, JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS 3, Object model, DOM manipulation, Event handlers, JSX, and RESTful API. Experience building responsive web design and understanding React Routers and Flux. Experience in implementing role-based website security and personalization. Experience in cross-browser, multi-surface compatibility of application behaviors. Experience in API design techniques and developing microservice using Java 11, Spring, and Spring Boot will be required for the job. Experience in Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD, GIT, Artifactory, Jenkins, and JS debugger. Experience in building UI test framework using Selenium. jobTitle: Senior manager, Americas Small Business Digital Growth
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Global Growth & Digital Sales team at Adobe ensures customers achieve success relative to their intent and derive meaningful membership value, while delivering Adobe shareholder value seen in ARR growth and critical metric performance improvements. The team drives global growth through key business levers such as promotional strategy, free customer conversion, add-on/up-sell and customer retention. In this role, you will be a strategic leader focused on driving Americas Small Business (SMB) Digital Sales growth. You will have strong perspective on customer data and business trends that translate into impactful recommendations. This role is highly cross functional and will be responsible for collaborating across several organizations to ensure goal alignment and strong execution of strategic priorities that contribute to driving ARR and customer success. What You'll Do Perform analytical deep dives into the SMB digital journey across traffic, conversion, initial purchase, add ons, retention, and upgrades with clear insights on trends and growth levers. Collaborate across organizations to drive a/b testing of experiences on the web to maximize small business conversion across web and phone. Partner with marketing, product management, adobe.com, and commerce teams to drive initiatives across acq, retention, and upsell that help deliver on quarterly and annual revenue targets. Provide weekly and quarterly financial outlook updates for the Americas SMB segment based on leading KPIs and trends. Lead SMB promo strategy and execution across multiple digital surfaces. Be comfortable working across matrixed organizations to achieve common goals and drive growth. Ability to craft clear, compelling recommendations to prioritize growth opportunities, supported by strong analysis and business logic, and articulate them to leadership to gain support. What You’ll Need To Succeed BS/BA with 5+ years commerce, software, management consulting, or business analytics experience Data driven with strong analytical skills and an ability to quickly turn data into actionable insights Experience pulling data from multiple sources leveraging Tableau, Power BI, Web Analytics, and SQL Strong understanding of digital business models and how to test and optimize customer experiences to deliver results Understanding of customer journey metrics and how they translate into ARR Demonstrated ability to build cross functional partnerships with key teams including Product Management, Growth, Product Marketing, and Program/Project Management Outstanding communication and social skills with the desire and ability to take a stand and advocate a course of action, highly articulate, makes arguments in a compelling manner Strong team player and great sense of humor

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Senior Manager, Global Policy Communications will partner with Government Relations and Regional Communications teams to advance Adobe's reputation as a trusted innovator that positively impacts society through creativity, technology, policies, and advocacy. Would this work fuel your passion?What you'll do Drive communications strategy for policy priorities ensuring message consistency across platform and distribution across owned, earned, paid, and shared channels. Advance new and exciting stories related to key policy and advocacy priorities including digital experience, creativity in education, trusted information, AI ethics and innovation. Provide strategic reputation counsel that protects and strengthens Adobe's brand across priority initiatives. Partner with internal leaders, and external organizations, to advance Adobe and industry priorities through thoughtful engagements, dialogue, and storytelling. Lead consultants and agency partners as plans are creatively crafted; initiatives and engagements are excellently activated; and programs are meticulously measured. What you need to succeed Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Communications, Public Affairs or Public Relations or at least 12 years of equivalent practical experience An informed view of the policy environment as it today and as it is trending in the future to understand policymaker and advocate motivations and cull down points-of-view into practical insight. Interest and ability to understand Adobe's business across markets so that you may connect business acuity with practical insight to move Adobe's policy and advocacy efforts forward. Curious and enterprising approach to your work. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $156,300 - $203,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
