Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Job Description As a key team member of the Risk Advisory & Assurance Services (RAAS) team at Adobe, the Senior Manager will have primary responsibility for managing risk-based audit and advisory engagements that address a mix of operational, financial, compliance, third-party and technology objectives! This position requires building effective working relationships and business partnerships across the company, and providing guidance to improve the effectiveness of governance, risk, and controls. The candidate will be based in San Jose, CA and will report to the Director, Internal Audit. Responsibilities Lead a successful audit team by establishing clear objectives and accountability for accomplishing goals. Be responsible the execution and delivery of global audit engagements. Define audit objectives, manage planning, fieldwork, and reporting, and ensure quality and consistency in accordance with the internal audit methodology. Conduct risk assessment and planning discussions with business partners to scope audit engagements and incorporate input from RAAS leadership. Guide the team in developing the audit program applying a top down, risk-based approach to assess strategic, operational, financial, and technology risks for key business processes; leverage data analytics to aid in the planning and execution of the audit. Manage the execution of detailed audit procedures and confirm that audit objectives are met; evaluate the governance, risk and control posture seeking opportunities to improve risk management, increase process efficiencies, and helping prioritize areas for management focus. Review audit work papers to ensure they are clear, complete, and well-organized. Ensure that audit observations are well-defined, root causes analyzed and discussed and agreed with management. Prepare audit reports/presentations and communicate results to management. Establish a regular cadence of follow-up on outstanding management actions and timely implementation of corrective actions; provide ongoing status updates to RAAS leadership. Provide guidance and coaching to the audit team; share key takeaways, encourage creativity and teamwork, and empower the team to deliver. Lead special projects and reviews as requested by RAAS leadership. Acquire in-depth understanding of Adobe's core business and financial processes and keep current on company strategies, priorities, and business objectives. This position may require travel, approximately 10-15%. Education Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance preferred; other relevant bachelor's degrees will be considered. Professional certification such as CPA/CA, CIA, CISA or CFE is required. Experience Minimum 10-12 years of proven experience in a Big Four firm or large global public company or a combination 5+ years of people management experience Experience in software industry is desirable with solid understanding of business operations, risk management, and IT general controls (logical and physical access, change control, application controls, etc.) is required Experience in business and fraud analytics Experience with SAP and Tableau is a plusSkills Ability to cultivate and sustain strong business relationships at Senior Manager/Director/Sr. Director levels in the organization. Excellent interpersonal, oral, written and presentation skills with the ability to comfortably connect with all levels of management and demonstrate a high degree of professionalism and integrity in all interactions. Strong project management, organizational and planning skills. Flexibility to adapt to new situations and reset team priorities in order to accomplish objectives. Ability to provide clarity and act promptly to deliver results through challenges or ambiguity. Strong team-player who incorporates different perspectives across the organization to achieve shared objectives. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog (http://blogs.adobe.com/adobelife/) and explore the meaningful benefits (http://benefits.adobe.com/) we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands— everything they need to craft and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to build appealing and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best employee with the experiences where everyone is respected. We realize that new insights can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. The Opportunity Our projects are pushing the boundaries of Document Intelligence. We are the team behind Acrobat Liquid Mode, which made Fortune’s Change the World list 2020 and has large scale user usage around the Globe. As we continue to expand our portfolio of ML projects, we are increasingly investing in our Data Team. Our mission is to support all ML projects within Adobe Document Cloud by helping them acquire high-quality labeled data. We are looking for a Senior Manager to drive all our data efforts for machine learning projects. A successful candidate will be a key leader within the Document Cloud Artificial Intelligence group and partner with various ML teams across Adobe working on document intelligence. If this excites you, we'd love to hear from you! What You'll Do You will lead a diverse team of taxonomists, software engineers, and machine learning engineers. You will be responsible for encouraging a Data-Centric AI climate in the org, and will collaborate with both internal ML teams and external data vendors to help ML teams plan and complete their data strategies. Our team focuses on 2 main areas: Build a Data Platform to support the curation of high-quality document datasets throughout their lifecycle: acquisition of raw data, labeling, exploration, and assessment of fitness-to-task. We use active learning, weak supervision, and other techniques to optimize the labeling process while maintaining high standards for accuracy. Advising and coaching various ML teams, helping them to craft a taxonomy for their project, to develop an appropriate annotation strategy, and to connect with the right vendor to generate high-quality labeled data. You will lead a partnership with key stakeholders (engineering and product leadership) to help complete and evolve the strategy of the Data Team. You will grow the Data Platform, evolve processes, and develop strategic partnerships with leading Data-Centric AI companies to help optimize data for ML projects. What You Need To Succeed Expertise in Data for ML projects Understanding of ML techniques Exceptional active listening and communication skills (written as well as verbal) Ability to lead and plan projects in the face of ambiguity Exceptional organization and people leadership skills – lead with compassion, high emotional and growth mindset Experience in leading impactful and geographically distributed teams 5+ years of engineering management experience; 10+ years of total experience BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent practical experience At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our outstanding Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. jobTitle: Senior Manager/Principal Product Manager, Business Model Strategy
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Are you motivated by the opportunity to have a big impact? This is the team that made the business case for applying a SaaS business model to our perpetual products ­– a move that has been credited with driving our record high stock price. We’re a high visibility group responsible for making strategic recommendations that have a significant financial impact. As such, the right candidate will find this to be a strong foundation for growth and an outstanding opportunity to have a material impact on the business! Job Responsibilities We are a small, highly leveraged team that defines monetization strategy for the entire company and this particular role will be focused on opportunities within the Digital Media business, which includes Creative Cloud and Document Cloud. Our role is to influence the product roadmap to drive significant growth in revenues, profits, and stock price for Adobe. We do this by driving initiatives that optimize new and existing offerings via product configuration, product line determination, offer structure, and pricing. This may involve the following activities: Collection, synthesis and analysis of industry and competitor data. Develop and conduct qualitative customer research. Design and complete quantitative market research including one or more of the following research methods: Build-Your-Own Conjoint, Discrete Choice Conjoint, Gabor-Granger. Perform statistical analysis on empirical data (sales, usage, etc.) Develop financial models that simulate customer behavior and project costs to complete scenario analysis that estimates the impact of the proposal on market penetration, company revenues and margin. Develop and present business cases that articulate the strategy and return-on-investment in order to acquire and incorporate cross-functional feedback and ultimately achieve executive approval. We also ensure smooth execution of our proposals. Define and drive product requirements for product roadmap and future releases to address customer needs related to the business model strategy. Plan and coordinate operational activities required for execution, including the development of excel-based tools to facilitate the quoting and customer fulfillment process. Set guidelines for direct sales, develop sales plays and training as appropriate. Complete post-mortems to ensure proposals are successful and/or refine. Qualifications We are looking for an analytical wiz with high initiative, a strategic approach and quantitative talent. MBA or comparable. The ability to simplify the complex, quickly define core problem and frame the solution approach. Attention to detail balanced by comfort with ambiguity. Excellent deck-writing, communicating, and upward-influencing skills. Strong EQ and leadership ability. Experience driving consensus in a large matrixed organization. is an advantage. A background in strategy consulting, pricing and packaging strategy, and/or change-management are all big pluses.

jobTitle: Senior Manager/Principal Product Manager, Business Model Strategy
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Are you motivated by the opportunity to have a big impact? This is the team that made the business case for applying a SaaS business model to our perpetual products ­– a move that has been credited with driving our record high stock price. We’re a high visibility group responsible for making strategic recommendations that have a significant financial impact. As such, the right candidate will find this to be a strong foundation for growth and an outstanding opportunity to have a material impact on the business! Job Responsibilities We are a small, highly leveraged team that defines monetization strategy for the entire company and this particular role will be focused on opportunities within the Digital Media business, which includes Creative Cloud and Document Cloud. Our role is to influence the product roadmap to drive significant growth in revenues, profits, and stock price for Adobe. We do this by driving initiatives that optimize new and existing offerings via product configuration, product line determination, offer structure, and pricing. This may involve the following activities: Collection, synthesis and analysis of industry and competitor data. Develop and conduct qualitative customer research. Design and complete quantitative market research including one or more of the following research methods: Build-Your-Own Conjoint, Discrete Choice Conjoint, Gabor-Granger. Perform statistical analysis on empirical data (sales, usage, etc.) Develop financial models that simulate customer behavior and project costs to complete scenario analysis that estimates the impact of the proposal on market penetration, company revenues and margin. Develop and present business cases that articulate the strategy and return-on-investment in order to acquire and incorporate cross-functional feedback and ultimately achieve executive approval. We also ensure smooth execution of our proposals. Define and drive product requirements for product roadmap and future releases to address customer needs related to the business model strategy. Plan and coordinate operational activities required for execution, including the development of excel-based tools to facilitate the quoting and customer fulfillment process. Set guidelines for direct sales, develop sales plays and training as appropriate. Complete post-mortems to ensure proposals are successful and/or refine. Qualifications We are looking for an analytical wiz with high initiative, a strategic approach and quantitative talent. MBA or comparable. The ability to simplify the complex, quickly define core problem and frame the solution approach. Attention to detail balanced by comfort with ambiguity. Excellent deck-writing, communicating, and upward-influencing skills. Strong EQ and leadership ability. Experience driving consensus in a large matrixed organization. is an advantage. A background in strategy consulting, pricing and packaging strategy, and/or change-management are all big pluses.

jobTitle: Senior Manager, Strategy & Business Operations for Digital Media
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our team Do you aspire to become a COO or GM someday? If yes, we would love to talk! We are the central Business Strategy and Operations team reporting to the Digital Media President. Our scope is across all functions, all customer segments and all product categories with the goal of building the business for the next decade and beyond. Goal of this team is to drive business priorities and enable execution. The opportunity Strategic and Operating Planning: Drive and lead a rolling planning process for Digital Media’s $10B+ business – develop overall game plan, sequencing, timeline and communications. Lead and partner closely with business and finance leadership and extended operations teams to ensure coordinated plan across groups. Guide execution across teams to deliver on planning goals Financial Strategy: Drive an integrated Financial strategy for our business with our Finance partners, including Topline planning, Org resourcing investment, and marketing budget + spend Category & Route to Market Strategy: Drive a coordinated strategy with our category leaders and digital, SMB/MM and enterprise leaders, including development and tracking of OKRs Strategic Projects: Identify, structure and champion critical initiatives and partner with cross-functional teams across the organization to deliver them. What You Need To Succeed Strategic Thinker: Solve problems by zooming out to see the big picture, then zooming in to deep dive into the details. Build a framework around it and then set it in motion. Thrive in ambiguity: Flexible and agile. You welcome ambiguity as an opportunity to give shape and scope to problems. Analytical: Comfortable building / being in financial models. Able to dive into a data set and tease apart MAUs, funnel metrics or churn rates. Detail oriented. Get Stuff Done: Ideas are worth nothing without execution - create bold, yet realistic plans. Collaborate with team members to ensure we are considering all the right inputs. Storytelling, Communications and Influence: Take strategy and insights and craft a narrative around it that brings others along for the ride. Create crisp, clear and concise communications - written and verbal. Influence without direct authority. Leadership: Ability to work with senior leaders. Build relationships, set a roadmap and shepherd others to follow it, and while making it fun! Thought leadership: Influence senior leaders and the business strategy by providing key insights. Drive alignment across teams. Be a change agent: Challenge the status quo by finding new, innovative ways to run the business and lead the charge in setting up Digital Media for the future Requirements Bachelor degree. MBA preferred 10+ years demonstrated experience (ideally combination of management consulting and business operations at SaaS company)
location: San José, California, Estados Unidos 101 solicitudes

jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Job DescriptionAdobe is looking for a Senior Operations Audit Manager for our Sales Compensation Operations Function who will be responsible for leading all aspects of internal operating controls, processes, and practices. You are a key leader and have significant influence for changes and improvements to existing processes and controls to make sure they are current, adequate, functional, and applied in accordance with standards established by the company. You will establish the function’s core audit methodologies and procedures, help implement an audit tool, and use critical thinking skills to help highlight area of focus and inform the direction of the audit plan. This role will also be responsible for execution of important operational metrics leading to actionable outcomes. Analyze the health of the business and interpret key performance metrics. Continuously find opportunities for process improvement to drive efficiency and elimination of manual tasks.Responsibilities: Design, implement, and test internal end-to-end controls to mitigate risks associated with comp payouts Monitor progress of tasks and key deadlines. Help create a sustainable structure to monitor progress of the operational audit program Implement an audit tool and automate existing processes Collaborate with Compensation Leadership to determine end-to-end audits required Develop and track metrics to assess internal team effectiveness: Review team capacity, error rate, case management SLA, process improvement effectiveness Maintain controls required for accurate payout of commissions Develop, maintain, and update systems and processes critical to the reporting and tracking of compensation and sales team metrics Develop and present business insights and audit findings to senior managementWhat you’ll need to succeed: BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or related degree 8+ years of relevant experience in audit, data analytics with proven experience scaling up Strong background and experience with audit methodologies and techniques Prior success conducting external or internal audits Self-starter and can manage the progress of an assigned business process and see to closure Identify key risks areas and can create a prioritized mitigation plan Ability to establish relationships while asking tough questions Demonstrates management, analytical, organization, interpersonal, project management, communication skills Must thrive in a fast-paced environment, be able to work independently, and possess strong leadership skills Excellent written and oral skills Proven experience in sales compensation, FP&A, or sales operations at a high-growth technology company with recurring revenue (SaaS) Sophisticated Excel skills (including pivot tables, vlookup, data modeling, etc.)Preferred Skills: Sales Compensation Management experience Experience with ICM/SPM tools (Callidus, Anaplan, Xactly)At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog (http://blogs.adobe.com/adobelife/) and explore the meaningful benefits (http://benefits.adobe.com/) we offer.Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe.com is one of the most heavily trafficked corporate websites in the world, and the digital front door for most of our customers. The web product management team focuses on making Adobe.com a world-class experience for visitors across their entire customer journey. Working in close partnership with teams across the organization, you will drive the strategic direction and strategy for our Experience Cloud (DX) products on adobe.com and deliver best-in-class experiences to the site. You will help define key site opportunities, and marshal support from our UX, Creative, Publishing, and Development teams to deliver innovative experiences for our prospects and customers. You help guide strategy for the site, prioritize inbound business requirements and distill them into measurable roadmaps. You will interact with hardworking cross-functional teams that create site enhancements, testing and optimization, and ensure that the projects accomplish their business goals. What You'll Do Help lead the evolution of the Experience Cloud site section for Adobe.com (specifically business.adobe.co), further developing it as a critical digital engagement point for Adobe’s business products and solutions Use data, customer and competitive insights, and industry standard methodologies to find opportunities to create innovative capabilities and compelling user experiences Analyze data to drive testing and optimization Create use cases for site enhancements, clearly identifying the goals, KPIs, and targets for proposed initiatives Assess and report on the results of initiatives vs. their expected impact Maintain relationships with marketing partners in the Experience Cloud business unit, setting appropriate expectations and aligning with them on site vision Drive planning and vision refinement sessions with business and development teams Discover, validate, and document business and technical requirements Work with the UX and creative teams on site structure, customer journeys, UX flows, and page designs Partner with the creative team on providing timelines, creative briefs, messaging and direction for key content experiences Present convincingly to executives and partnersWhat is needed to succeed 5+ years of product management or website management experience, with B2B marketing website experience a major plus Enthusiastic, creative and innovative attitude Ability to lead issues and mitigate risk on the site content and capabilities roadmaps Articulate in documenting site requirements, specifications, and user stories (experience in Jira a plus) Experienced in defining and executing against roadmaps using an agile methodology Analytical abilities to test hypothesis and sort through complex options Ability to craft clear, compelling recommendations supported by strong analysis and business logic, and articulate them to the organization to gain support for recommendations Ability to influence executive and senior-level leaders regarding product vision, roadmaps, and priorities Ability to juggle multiple initiatives and shift priorities as needed BS/BA or equivalent required

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager, Business Model Strategy
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Are you motivated by the opportunity to have a huge impact? This is the team that made the business case for applying a SaaS business model to our perpetual products ­– a move that has been credited with driving our record high stock price. We’re a high visibility group responsible for making strategic recommendations that have a significant financial impact. As such, the right candidate will find this to be a solid foundation for growth and an outstanding opportunity to have a material impact on the business! Job Responsibilities We are a small, highly leveraged team that defines monetization strategy for the entire company. Our role is to influence the product roadmap to drive significant growth in revenues, profits, and stock price for Adobe. We do this by driving initiatives that optimize new and existing offerings via product configuration, product line determination, offer structure, and pricing. This particular role will focus on the design and development of pricing infrastructure improvements to enable our evolving business model strategies. This may involve the following activities: Develop prescriptive recommendations on technology solutions and applications to enable Adobe’s current and evolving business models and GTM strategies. Lead multi-functional teams in the identification of business requirements, capability design, technology/vendor selection, and assessment of business launch readiness. Lead evaluation of buy vs. build options for new pricing technology and drive internal alignment on the optimal solution. Develop and present a business case that articulates the strategy, total cost of ownership (TCO) and return-on-investment, in order to acquire and incorporate cross-functional feedback and ultimately achieve executive approval. Own the end-to-end initiative from design through development and deployment of the solution. Lead organizational change for deployment of the technology solution. Qualifications We are looking for an analytical wiz with high initiative, a strategic approach and quantitative talent. Experience developing sophisticated business cases for enterprise technology solutions. Proven track record of driving the design and delivery of large-scale technology transformations, preferably involving cloud-based solutions. Solid grasp of business process design for end-to-end price optimization and execution processes, including price analytics, price management, and pricing approval workflows. Deep understanding of the interplay between pricing strategy, business models, channel management strategies, and technology platforms. Industry experience in technology, software, SaaS-based or cloud-based businesses is a plus. Knowledge of ERP systems (e.g. SAP, Oracle) is a plus. MBA or comparable. The ability to simplify the complex, quickly define core problem and frame the solution approach. Attention to detail balanced by comfort with ambiguity. Excellent deck-writing, communicating, and upward-influencing skills. Strong EQ and leadership ability. Experience driving consensus in a large matrixed organization is an advantage. A background in strategy consulting, pricing and packaging strategy, and/or change-management are all big pluses.

What y Ou’ll d o Set user engagement strategy and establish a program roadmap Define and l everage product usage and user behavior data to drive personalized , outcome - based multi-channel engagements Gain a deep understanding of our customers and the needs of end users using research, interviews and data analysis to improve customer experience Collaborate and align cross-functionally to develop , evangelize, and drive adoption of innovative and creative best practices for engaging with our end users to help them achieve their expected business outcomes Help Experience Cloud product teams achieve short - term quick wins leveraging user engagement tools Inform product roadmap for end - user digital engagement platform (measurement, guidance, journey management, personalization) Identif y key moments for end users to inform journey best practices for multi-channel engagements along the customer lifecycle Document best practice strategies and program successes Measure and report on program performance and business impact What You’ll Need 5 + years of experience in designing and implementing end - user engagement programs in B2B SaaS companies 5 + years of experience in customer experience, customer success, or product management. Expertise identifying trends through data analysis – either directly or in partnership with data analysts – and turning insights into actionable outcomes Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to communicate at all levels, escalate product & project issues, and mitigate risks Expertise working with user adoption platforms like Pendo, Gainsight PX, WalkMe or others Proven record of designing impactful and compelling omni-channel customer experiences

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Role The Product Manager, User Engagement & Adoption will join our Experience Cloud product organization to help manage a program that nurture s Adobe customers in a scaled way . You will be part of a team that defines and drives technology and best practices for a digital-first user engagement program to ensure outstanding customer experiences and satisfaction. You will partner closely with other Experience Cloud product and marketing teams to enable measurable, impactful, cohesive experience s for our customer base via in-product, email, & other channels . In this role you will be an integral part of defining and t ransform ing the way we engage with our key end - user personas to improve engagement , drive adoption & value, and unlock product-led growth opportunities . This role will require creativity, strategic thinking, collaboration, and a data-informed aim to get things done. What y Ou’ll d o Set user engagement strategy and establish a program roadmap Define and l everage product usage and user behavior data to drive personalized , outcome - based multi-channel engagements Gain a deep understanding of our customers and the needs of end users using research, interviews and data analysis to improve customer experience Collaborate and align cross-functionally to develop , evangelize, and drive adoption of innovative and creative best practices for engaging with our end users to help them achieve their expected business outcomes Help Experience Cloud product teams achieve short - term quick wins leveraging user engagement tools Inform product roadmap for end - user digital engagement platform (measurement, guidance, journey management, personalization) Identif y key moments for end users to inform journey best practices for multi-channel engagements along the customer lifecycle Document best practice strategies and program successes Measure and report on program performance and business impact What You’ll Need 5 + years of experience in designing and implementing end - user engagement programs in B2B SaaS companies 5 + years of experience in customer experience, customer success, or product management. Expertise identifying trends through data analysis – either directly or in partnership with data analysts – and turning insights into actionable outcomes Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to communicate at all levels, escalate product & project issues, and mitigate risks Expertise working with user adoption platforms like Pendo, Gainsight PX, WalkMe or others Proven record of designing impactful and compelling omni-channel customer experiences

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We are looking for a Senior Program Manager to execute projects and programs within the Workfront product team. This position will drive the execution and program oversite for new features, functionalities, and capabilities within the Workfront product. What You’ll Do Collaborate with Product Management, Architecture, Engineering, and business partners to execute against Workfront’s product strategies. Create and track all aspects of a program, including: detailed project plans and milestones, resource allocations, risks/issues remediation, status reporting, budget management, and is the general “go to” person for details & status of the project. Maintain a deep, technical end-to-end understanding of the solution being built, its upstream and downstream dependencies and impacts, and proliferate the awareness and necessary changes needed to support the initiative. Be seen as a Subject Matter Expert, and can cover for any other role in the meeting: Product Management, Engineering, Architecture, QA, etc. You will have a firm understanding of the business goals, and find creative solutions for engineering problems yielding the fastest time to market. Oversees multiple concurrent projects and programs; varying in size/scope/complexity, spanning across several different teams and orgs. Participates with management teams in creating materials and models used for quarterly and annual recasting of initiatives and priorities. Creating material(s) that can be consumed at various levels of the organization – from executive-level presentations, to finite-level materials to be consumed by project/program teams. Proactively identifies risks in all assigned areas; work with teams and management to mitigate these risks before they become issues. Effectively engage and influence people at all levels: from front-line team members to VPs, communicating continuously to partners throughout the organization, including C-level executives. Understand and bring clarity to complex technical challenges, and successfully articulate and navigate through options that deliver the best customer experience Be relentless in the pursuit of delivery excellence; ensure ALL project/program team members have clear line of sight on the goals, expectations, and success criteria, and are setting the table to ensure success. What you need to succeed: Extremely organized with impeccable attention to detail; understands the what, why, when, how and who to drive better solutions. Self-starter w/ 7+ years of progressive project/program management experience on large scale initiatives; background in business process management and PMO-best practices a strong plus Working industry knowledge of B2B (SMB + Enterprise) software licensing, deployment, management, and administration (from both the provider and customer POV). Experience in an always-on, services based infrastructure/architecture, ensuring seamless customer experiences; scaled to address future demands Working amongst competing priorities and competing schedules to get your project across the finish line in a mode that brings value to stakeholders inside and outside Adobe. Must know their audience; be comfortable presenting to everyone from C-level to the Individual Contributor assigned to the project/program; must be able to influence, and have data-driven conversations. Be able to work well across organizations in a matrixed; globally-diverse workforce Solid knowledge of the Scrum methodology Familiarity with industry terminology (Marketing, PLG) Familiarity with compliance (PII, usability, GDPR, data retention and usage, security practices, SDLC constructs, etc.) Experience with applications such as Workfront, Jira, or other workload (Backlog) management tools required Bachelor's degree / 8+ years of progressive experience

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Summary The position requires a highly qualified professional who is innovative, organized, and dependable. Ideal candidate will have a strong technical experience and skills, an ability to manage expectations and the relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders, flex between the strategic and the tactical, outstanding verbal and written communication skills, and a high level of energy and flexibility to get things done What you’ll do Develop plan of action for running critically important initiatives from inception to completion. Establishes master schedule across GTM, Product & Engineering for Customer delivery Manage complex dependencies across cross-functional teams to allow smooth execution and delivery of the programs Efficiently handle change and risk, collaborating with your colleagues to ensure the right decisions are made at the right time. Ensure appropriate communication occurs across project or product. Identify and resolve miscommunication across the team and tailor the content and communication to the target audience. Autonomously lead multiple projects. Set own priorities and balances time between critical short-term issues with longer strategic goals. Work on difficult problems and issues of diverse scope where an in-depth understanding and evaluation of factors, including technical requirements, are required to formulate innovative solutions for multiple projects or initiatives that span cross product and BU lines. Take initiative to seek out and fix underlying issues that cause recurring problems. Able to independently influence project executives / partners in pursuit of a successful implementation of a product or service. Take personal ownership and accountability for ensuring that the projects complete and meet defined success criteria. What you need to succeed Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years of experience. MBA preferred. Solid track record in project management in software, SaaS and/or related industries Strong listening, analytical, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills. Able to communicate efficiently at executive level leaders Experience in Agile, Lean and/or scrum methodologies are preferred

jobTitle: Senior Researcher - Big Data and Machine Learning Systems
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Adobe Research is looking to hire a Senior Research Scientist in the broad area of Big Data and Systems Research. We are specifically looking for established researchers who can amplify our ongoing research in Scalable Systems and AI Ops in our research lab in San Jose. Responsibilities include working closely with researchers, engineers, user experience designers, and product managers to invent solutions to high impact systems problems, develop prototypes that showcase new research technologies, and to help integrate those technologies into Adobe’s products. Other meaningful responsibilities include keeping up to date with the latest research advances and integrating these into our platform. Our lab plays a key role in crafting next-generation applications and banner features in Adobe’s Creative, Document, and Experience Clouds. Adobe Research blends ground breaking academic findings with industry impact. Our scientists are provided with the resources, support, and freedom to shape their ideas into innovative technologies and products. They collaborate with colleagues at over fifty universities, often communicating their work at leading international conferences. Many of our researchers’ discoveries are incorporated into Adobe’s products, building the company’s reputation as a pioneer in content and data intelligence. Our lab has an excellent track record of impactful product features and an excellent publication record with dozens of papers at world-class Computer Science conferences and journals. Some of our research topics include Real-time ML, Online Learning, Edge AI, Reinforcement Learning, Deep learning, Deep Reinforcement Learning, Representation Learning, Homeostatic & Self-Healing Systems, Systems for ML, Data Ingestion and Storage for Data Lakes, Video Editing and Delivery, Immersive Media, Causal Inference, and Counterfactual reasoning. Adobe is one of the largest software companies in the world, and a market leader in three major areas: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and the Experience Cloud. Collectively, the three clouds process several trillions of interactions with content and transactions every year, involving hundreds of petabytes of data. This data offers researchers unparalleled opportunities for exploring web scale solutions for AI and ML. What you’ll do As a senior researcher, help drive the technical agenda in several critical areas, including developing the next generation of Systems for all Adobe Clouds, and solving challenges related to large scale data ingestion, system health, efficiency, redundancy, and cloud spend. Responsible for providing technical leadership across multiple teams, by understanding the technical space deeply enough to help guide corporate and business strategy, or by providing innovations that fuel the growth of Adobe. Be able to lead cross functional working groups or initiatives or provide consulting/advice to other departments or groups within the company. Partner with the existing research teams at Adobe, including world class experts in AI/ML, computer vision, deep learning, NLP, graphics, and HCI. Provide critical analysis of issues for continuous improvement of technology, process, and team productivity. Act as an industry evangelist, internally and externally. Engage with the research community, including university faculty collaborations, intern recruiting and mentorship, and publishing and participation in premiere conferences. Help attract world class talent to Adobe. What you need to succeed PhD in Computer Science, EE, or an equivalent field and at least 3 years of experience in Systems Research Prior experience working with product teams and delivering innovative research into products Recognized by peers in industry, academia, or the research community Recognized technical expertise includes but is not limited to publications, editorial and advisory boards, conference/symposium presentations, patents, professional peer recognition and strategically significant developments, innovations, or technical contributions Demonstrated experience in mentoring and coaching interns, and junior technical contributors.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! We are looking to hire aSenior Sales Manager to lead our US Mid-Market Field Sales Team, for our rapidly expanding Digital Media growth products’ business, Substance 3D, Frame.IO, and Sign: TheSubstance 3Decosystem is an end-to-end pioneering 3D workflow, that empowers Creative Professionals to intuitively model, texture, stage, and publish 3D content. Frame.iois the next generation of video collaboration, offering one central hub that lets you share media, track feedback, and streamline your workflow so your team can work closely together from anywhere in the world. Acrobat Signtransforms and speeds up your workflows — it's Microsoft's preferred e-signature solution and the only e-sign tool that also includes the power of Adobe Acrobat in one package. You will lead a team of experienced Adobe sellers to drive new and recurring revenue, bring growth within our existing portfolio, and via lead generation motions, close company-level business with multiple customer personas. Cultivating and expanding the existing business, upselling our customers, growing/closing the customers renewal, generating new leads and customer base, and ensuring business development activities will be the focus for your team. Success metrics for the position are team-wide quota attainment, total revenue growth, and strategic customer wins in your team. We need a very focused, well-organized, and goal-oriented business leader to help drive considerable growth . We are looking for an individual who will be able to demonstrate their team’s talents to win opportunities with new customers and grow our footprint with existing customers. Adopting an Omnichannel approach, and collaborating with Marketing, Go-to-Market, Lead Generation teams, Partners, Solution Consultants, and Sales Operations (among other functions) across the organization are essential for success. What you’ll do Lead your organization to deliver top-quality sales pipeline opportunities and to complete sales processes as appropriate. Work directly with key customers to build strong partnerships, deliver product presentations to help close, renew and grow sales, drive adoption of our world-class Digital Media growth products, and help customers realize tremendous value from their investment. Align with internal partners such as solutions consultants and product marketing to guide the customer through successful purchase and launch. Ensure your team’s deep product knowledge remains at the highest level (product releases and updates, market news, industry workflows) Closely align with 3rd party demand generation to drive strategic direction and alignment on SLAs by lead type. Align with the marketing demand generation team to ensure system capabilities are streamlined and drive enhancements/efficiencies where required. Partner with the Operations team to implement and follow efficient processes, and to ensure proper completion of meeting tasks, opportunity creation, and pipeline reporting. Responsible for building tight alliances with remote and local sales teams, making modifications where vital to always meet qualification and lead routing ensuring meeting quality. Handle reporting overall team results related to Key Performance Indicators as appropriate. Be accountable for the overall monitoring of team(s) to ensure top production performance Coordinate reporting and communicating to sales management, demand generation, Sales Operations, Quarterly Business Reviews, and overall program and team performance. Submitting accurate forecasts to Senior management to assist in business planning and reporting, preparing sales plans in association with Senior management, assisting company growth into new markets for its products by successfully implementing those plans. Identifying new venture opportunities for the company’s products and services. Enhancing the corporate reputation and transparency in the region through the promotion of growth products and technical expertise. Occasional Travel might be needed (Industry Events, Team working sessions). What you need to succeed 7 + years relevant work experience in sales and/or customer success with preference for experience in the technology industry. Passion, grit, and a desire to win. Exceptional leader with strong cross-functional relationships’ building skills; proven track record of effectively navigating organizations, champion joint partnerships, lead without authority, and empower others. Notable ability to perpetually build dedicated teams and exceed team goals Strong history of sales quota or customer success metric attainment and achievement. Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing environment, while still driving teams to exceed goals and produce quality sales opportunities. Previous experience working as a trusted advisor to drive business value and sales expansion opportunities. Shown success in selling to executives and leadership positions. Able to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively in ambiguous environments. Able to identify and deliver process optimizations and enhancements to go-to-market strategy. Exceptional capacity to implement efficiently, with attention to lead quality. Strong presentation and interpersonal communication skills. Understanding of CRM systems (SFDC experience a plus). University or College Degree preferred. Bring your authentic self! Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $250,000 - $324,700 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Building on top of the data layer, the team is responsible for delivering a rationalized set of core services. We are starting with foundational elements such as Identity, Profile, Segmentation, and edge components for real-time data capture and decisioning, and lay the foundation for higher-level services required for our Experience Business vision. We will run and maintain high traffic, high visibility applications with immense amounts of data and solve challenging scaling problems What you'll Do Integrate and improve Big Data tools and frameworks required to provide requested capabilities. Develop and deploy critical parts of the services and deliver to production. Articulate the choice towards an accurate tool, technology. Translate high level requirements to meaningful tasks/actions. Work well in a dynamic, fast paced team. What you need to succeed Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience 6+ years of industry software development experience Hands-on experience on open source technologies Spark, Hadoop Stack, Kafka Proven record of delivering highly optimized code in Scala/Java Proven experience on working with NoSQL databases, preferably HBase and Cassandra Proficiency in data structures, algorithms Additional experience that will be a plus Experience with Containers, CI/CD systems like Spinnaker Experience with other big data tech stacks

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Job Description Position Summary: The Adobe Analytics platform processes 20+ billion transactions daily and delivers reporting data to customers worldwide. The Adobe Analytics team seeks a dedicated and passionate Senior Software Engineer with top-notch technical, design, and development skills to join our Reporting Services team in Lehi, Utah. In this role, you will collaborate closely with engineers, QA, and Ops, developing and testing the next generation of reliable, high-performance, scalable solutions. You will have the opportunity to develop solutions handling Big Data for enterprise customers worldwide. Responsibilities: Design, build and maintain high-performance, scalable solutions for customers processing Big Data. Optimize and test existing software to enhance and improve performance, functionality, and usability. Participate in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, unit-testing, bug fixing, and operations. Collaborate with product management and engineering to help define and implement backend services, components, and interface requirements. Marketo is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our Customer Engineering Team (CET) . As advocates for some of our largest customers, we are in a unique position to both develop our own solutions and assist other component teams in delivering quality features across the platform to support our highest-scale needs . Work with highly-available data streams, RESTful APIs and both internal and external interfaces that support and empower our users . Learn to anticipate our customer’s needs through a suite of powerful monitoring tools and the support of your peers . Participate in cross-cutting platform investigations and find ways to unlock new levels of performance. While c urrently remote , t his position will move to a hybrid , in - office position as Adobe forms its future work vision. The core team is in Portland, OR while other associated teams are in Seattle, WA, and San Jose, CA . What You’ll Do Collaborate and solution with some of our biggest customers Work with data streams and APIs to provide enhanced automation capabilities Build tools to alleviate support bottlenecks Proactively monitor for improvement opportunities Enhance scalability and performance across the platform What You Have 5 + years working i n SaaS platforms & technologies Experience planning and implementing architecture for new services or components. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Are you an exceptional product leader who can drive strategy and deliver results? We want to hear from you! As the Adobe Support Product Manager for the Portfolio & Architecture team, you play a key role in developing the support offerings for Adobe Customer Solutions coordinated go-to-market strategy. This leader develops the right offerings, formulates the pricing strategy, analyzes portfolio performance and recommends improvements. Working with customer engineering, technical account managers, field engineers, customer support, and sales teams, we need you to build a profitable offer with a focus on customer success. As a team member, you help craft the positioning and messaging for the offer portfolio by supporting the product marketing team. Attention to detail and an eye for quality, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into benefits will be essential. The environment is fast-paced, upbeat, high growth, and highly collaborative. This person actively participates in the creation and execution of products, offers, and programs. The right candidate seeks opportunities to be strategic, produce results and receive recognition for outstanding work. What you’ll do: Support offers and programs: create, manage, and measure effective support offerings solving real customer problems in ways that drive product adoption, customer success and value realization. Product lifecycle management: identify and intake new opportunities; build the case; gather requirements as the advocate of the customer; help coordinate the standard bill of materials including scope and statement of work; refresh offers bringing in efficiencies and driving costs down; and prioritize the roadmap for your line of business with a strong 1-2 year vision. Get results: take initiatives from conception to completion; solve sophisticated problems in what can be at times an ambiguous environment; lead and influence cross functional teams like Legal, Marketing, IT, and Customer Care; oversee portfolio offerings world-wide; provide insights and encourage standard methodologies; present strategy to key influencers and senior leadership. Offer intelligence: become the authority on the buyers and users of your offers. Use data (quantitative and qualitative) to form hypotheses and shape your portfolio strategy. Product expertise: understand deeply how Adobe products are licensed, branded and consumed by customers. Work with product teams, learn the license roadmap and how new products and features may impact your offers. Marketing support and sales enablement: partner with product marketing to develop customer programs and incentives. Support sales enablement by communicating the value proposition of your services. Work in partnership with other product managers, customer engineering, market research, and partners to translate business needs into product requirements and integrate those into product/service development plans. What you need to succeed 5 – 8 years of product management experience in support services, professional services, or software. Experience in product marketing is a plus. Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing; MBA preferred. Strong communication skills suited for written or verbal presentations at different levels of the organization; rally people around a vision with both local and remote teams. Deep knowledge of customer needs, competition, and market trends. Ability to apply this knowledge to develop clear product / feature plans. Proven leadership and management skills. Ability to plan, organize, mediate, and establish priorities to achieve results. Demonstrable track record of relevant accomplishments. Self-motivated, results-focused, well-organized; able to successfully manage multiple priorities and bold business goals. Able to clearly articulate technical solutions to internal and external audiences. High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to learn and apply new concepts and technologies quickly. Willing to travel 10%.

This is a once is a lifetime opportunity for engineers to solve exciting challenges of scale and build core services that are used by all Adobe Digital Experience solutions. As part of building these services, you will work with an exceptionally hardworking and collaborative team, tackle big data challenges using the latest technologies, design innovative algorithmic solutions and build highly scalable, low latency services. The Opportunity Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) enables businesses to deliver the right experience at the right time to their customers. The Segmentation Service is one of the key AEP services, providing the ability to define customer segments and generate target audiences based on real-time customer profiles. Customer segment definitions are sophisticated queries over profile and event data capturing specific attributes or behaviors shared by a subset of users. With the need to perform trillions of audience segment evaluations per day, scalability and efficiency are paramount in segment evaluation. This is a great opportunity for engineers to solve extremely interesting challenges of scale and build core services that are used by all Adobe Digital Experience solutions. As part of building these services, you will work with an exceptionally talented and collaborative team, tackle complex query evaluation challenges, design & implement innovative algorithms and build highly performant services. What You'll Do Contribute to query engine implementations that evaluates complex customer segment definitions efficiently Develop query compilation algorithms that transform and rewrite customer segment definition queries Develop query optimization and evaluation algorithms including multi-query optimization, incremental evaluation and streaming evaluation Build tools to monitor query performance and identify & debug potential semantic errors Collaborate with a team of engineers & product managers in building a high-performance query engine. Follow Agile methodologies using industry leading CI/CD pipelines Participate in architecture, design & code reviews What You Need To Succeed B.S. in Computer Science or a related field is required M.S. in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent practical experience is preferred Strong grasp of algorithms and data structures Excellent knowledge of Java and or Scala Proficiency in Databases or compilers is a plus. Working knowledge of query optimization techniques Conceptual knowledge of distributed system technologies Excellent communication skills Adaptable to evolving priorities, accepting challenges outside one's comfort zone, learning new technologies, and delivering viable solutions within defined time boundaries. Ability to think through solutions from a short term and long term lens in an iterative development cycle.

Job Description The challenge Do you want to shape the future of how Adobe delivers personal experience at scale in real time? Are you interested in solving highly sophisticated big data problems with significant business impact? Data Prep team has the charter of building highly scalable real time data processing and machine learning solutions that will power the rest of the Adobe Experience Platform. We are seeking for a highly motivated individual to join a stellar team to help build this. Ideal candidates are passionate about working on high- performance, customer data platform, and a strong desire to learn and apply groundbreaking technologies! The role This senior software engineering professional would be responsible for developing a high performance globally distributed data processing infrastructure which is an integral part of the Adobe Experience Platform offered by Adobe. We will provide excellent exposure to the complete eco-system including: streaming processing with Apache Flink/Apache Beam, Kafka, Kubernetes based multi cloud environment with cloud agnostic deployment strategy, streaming algorithm driven data insights generated by machine learning applications. Your tasks will include Software architecture, design and development of high-performance software using functional programming paradigms in Java. You will be part of the technical team running one of the largest content delivery and personalization platforms in the world. You will have the opportunity to define Adobe's technology strategy as we incorporate this platform in all marketing channels inclusive of: mobile applications, display advertising, video content delivery as well as proprietary applications across the software landscape. What Opportunities We Provide Design and build fault-tolerant, high-performance algorithms for data processing at scale. Deliver features from scratch by working closely with Product team, Architecture board, and leadership team. Develop CI/CD pipeline that automates full development and release cycle in multi cloud environments. Manage and operate hundreds of data processing micro-services in production that supports streaming, batch and edge compute. Work with data science and research team to convert research outcome into production level products. Participate in open -source communities and contribute back to benefit the industry. What is needed to succeed Education in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. 7+ years of experience in directly related work and industry expertise. Strong grasp of algorithms and data structures. Experience developing in Java, Python with key on scalable design. Working knowledge of Kubernetes, Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Beam Experience working on large code bases. General understanding of Git, Gradle, Maven. Experience in projects associated with streaming data processing. Taking ownership for designs and features and be able to work both self-supervised and in multi- functional teams. Aptitude for simple, robust, and elegant designs, including how to design maintainable and evolvable systems.

The Opportunity Ethos deploys Adobe-wide software and infrastructure technology, promoting containerization, clusterization, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD). We build tools, processes, and workflows that connect and empower hundreds of internal development teams. Our team is highly skilled and forward-thinking, and we are looking for engineers who have extensive experience with cloud (Kubernetes/AWS/Azure), REST APIs, and Golang. If you have the fervor and energy to drive the next wave of Adobe’s cloud evolution, enabling product teams to focus on creating “Adobe Magic", this role is for you. We are a small core team and your ability to flexibly collaborate, to sometimes lead and sometimes follow, will be key to your success. What you'll Do Help define the product roadmap for our product offering. Write Kubernetes first-class components like operators, Custom Resource Definitions, s.o. Use Adobe’s security standards and best practices to implement L4 & L7 security controls. Craft the code standards for our products. Collaborate with other developers with many focuses including infrastructure, systems, backend, ops, s.o. Design, develop, implement, and debug solutions to complicated distributing computing challenges. Work in a fast-paced, agile environment. What you need to succeed Proven experience writing in at least one of the Go Lang, C++ or Python. Minimum of 1-2 years working with Kubernetes. Ability to give comprehensive and effective code reviews. Strong testing fundamentals that will assure confidence in any written code. Solid networking knowledge, targeting Layer 4 and 7 protocols (TCP/UDP, HTTP/HTTP2). Good debugging skills, using both live debugging tools, but also debug logs and tracing. Proactive conduct, creative thinking, orientation towards quality. Experience leading features to completion. Knowledge of the latest trends in the open-source industry. Experience working closely with product owners and architects. Familiarity with the twelve-factor app methodology. Nice to have: previous experience programming the Envoy proxy. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. The Opportunity Adobe Technology Services – Computer Scientist position will be based in our San Jose office and will be part of an Agile team working with Sales Operations, Revenue Operations, and Analytics teams to deliver technology solutions to business problems. The primary enterprise applications supporting the Enterprise Sales experience are opportunity, configure-price-quote (CPQ) management, and Contract Lifecycle Management. You will be responsible for implementing areas across the enterprise sales process, including configuration of sales and CPQ, workflow design and coordination of automation, and integrations to other enterprise applications. You’ll work closely with our team of analysts, developers, QA, and product owners in North America, India and Romania in designing, deploying, operating and supporting leading edge enterprise sales experiences. What you'll Do Maintains and continuously improves Enterprise Sales solutions enabled by Microsoft Dynamics, PROS CPQ, Salesforce, Apttus CPQ and related Sales and Marketing enterprise applications Strong Salesforce and Microsoft Dynamics product knowledge within Sales, and CPQ required Strong configuration skill set (Microsoft Dynamics, PROS CPQ, Conga CPQ, workflows, validation rules, approval processes, flows, etc.) Oversees and conducts complex Salesforce and/or Microsoft Dynamics deployments Works closely with integration, network, database, security, and development teams Analyze architectural and feature specs and translate them into solution needs Implement process improvements and automation to optimize operational and support processes Interface on a day-to-day basis with other solution analysts, business users, engineers, QA, and IT managers to support business operationsWhat you need to succeed B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience Solution-oriented with a minimum of 5+ years of proven implementation experience in Salesforce CPQ or Microsoft Dynamics CPQ subject matter expert to deliver CPQ solutions including (product, complex product configurations, pricing and discount rules, product rules, subscription management, order management and integrations with CLM and SAP ECC Lead and drive requirement gathering and technical deep dive meetings Experience with continuous integration solutions like Jenkins Participate in design, and implementation of CPQ components and Quote to Cash flows using SFDC, APTTUS/Conga, Microsoft Dynamics, and PROS CPQ Strong expertise in Lead to Cash process areas Ability to recommend best practices and competence in advanced APEX programming, APIs and integrations Effective verbal and written communication with local and remote team members Hands-on software development capabilities with large projects Experience with major sales platforms (Salesforce.com and Microsoft Dynamics) is a differentiating characteristic Excellent oral and written presentation and communication skills The ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is essential We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform crucial job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $133,400 - $173,200 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a Software Development Engineer to build Marketer Playground as the self-serve experience for Adobe Experience Platform where Marketers can strategize, ideate, and iterate on initiatives. What You'll Do Deliver best-in-class, responsive and scalable solutions ready for mass audiences. Drive and implement a variety of innovative, critical initiatives using the latest tools and technologies. Lead front-end engineering initiatives, assisting UI Architects, and ensuring technical quality. Design, develop, test, deploy and monitor features to enhance security, performance, and User Experience. Drive efforts to improve technical quality and solutions through code reviews, architecture reviews, test suite strategy, leading by example, etc. What You Need To Succeed Passion for building User Experiences; well thought through end-to-end solutions are second nature to you. 6+ years of professional experience building highly-performant and sophisticated web applications using modern web development technologies. Professional Experience with JavaScript frameworks especially ReactJS and responsive web design Expertise in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, NodeJS, and React Solid foundation in software engineering process & standard methodologies (unit testing, build automation, CI/CD, etc.) Experience with Jest, Cypress.io or similar testing frameworks Good written and verbal communication skills and English proficiency Good to have Experience with TypeScript, GraphQL and Apollo Knowledge of load optimization, cloud deployment strategies and CI/CD pipelines Exposure to REST based microservices using Java or Node.js Full-stack engineering experience At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you.
