The Opportunity Adobe Technology Services – Computer Scientist position will be based in our San Jose office and will be part of an Agile team working with Sales Operations, Revenue Operations, and Analytics teams to deliver technology solutions to business problems. The primary enterprise applications supporting the Enterprise Sales experience are opportunity, configure-price-quote (CPQ) management, and Contract Lifecycle Management. You will be responsible for implementing areas across the enterprise sales process, including configuration of sales and CPQ, workflow design and coordination of automation, and integrations to other enterprise applications. You’ll work closely with our team of analysts, developers, QA, and product owners in North America, India and Romania in designing, deploying, operating and supporting leading edge enterprise sales experiences. What you'll Do Maintains and continuously improves Enterprise Sales solutions enabled by Microsoft Dynamics, PROS CPQ, Salesforce, Apttus CPQ and related Sales and Marketing enterprise applications Strong Salesforce and Microsoft Dynamics product knowledge within Sales, and CPQ required Strong configuration skill set (Microsoft Dynamics, PROS CPQ, Conga CPQ, workflows, validation rules, approval processes, flows, etc.) Oversees and conducts complex Salesforce and/or Microsoft Dynamics deployments Works closely with integration, network, database, security, and development teams Analyze architectural and feature specs and translate them into solution needs Implement process improvements and automation to optimize operational and support processes Interface on a day-to-day basis with other solution analysts, business users, engineers, QA, and IT managers to support business operationsWhat you need to succeed B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience Solution-oriented with a minimum of 5+ years of proven implementation experience in Salesforce CPQ or Microsoft Dynamics CPQ subject matter expert to deliver CPQ solutions including (product, complex product configurations, pricing and discount rules, product rules, subscription management, order management and integrations with CLM and SAP ECC Lead and drive requirement gathering and technical deep dive meetings Experience with continuous integration solutions like Jenkins Participate in design, and implementation of CPQ components and Quote to Cash flows using SFDC, APTTUS/Conga, Microsoft Dynamics, and PROS CPQ Strong expertise in Lead to Cash process areas Ability to recommend best practices and competence in advanced APEX programming, APIs and integrations Effective verbal and written communication with local and remote team members Hands-on software development capabilities with large projects Experience with major sales platforms (Salesforce.com and Microsoft Dynamics) is a differentiating characteristic Excellent oral and written presentation and communication skills The ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is essential We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform crucial job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. The Opportunity Building on top of the data layer, the team is responsible for delivering a rationalized set of core services. We are starting with foundational elements such as Identity, Profile, Segmentation, and edge components for real-time data capture and decisioning, and lay the foundation for higher-level services required for our Experience Business vision. We will run and maintain high traffic, high visibility applications with immense amounts of data and solve exciting scaling problems. What You'll Do Work on high performance low latency, high throughput APIs Work on large scale Spark Jobs handling PB Scale data. Integrate and enhance distributed computation tools and frameworks required to provide requested capabilities. Develop and deploy critical parts of the services and deliver to production. Translate high level requirements to actionable tasks/deliverables. What You Need To Succeed BS + 2 years’ experience or MS in Computer Science or relevant field Experience building web services in Java/Scala, RESTful API's Experience working with streaming technologies like Kafka, Spark. Experience using NoSQL datastores, and data access patterns and strategies. Shown ability to develop robust, efficient, high-quality code. Ability to fix and resolve problems using appropriate tools and techniques. Knowledge of modern development patterns: Agile, CI/CD, Kubernetes, micro-services architecture Knowledgeable of secure, scalable, and highly available service development practices. Great teammate with a thirst to learn, ownership, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to changing priorities and requirements.

Job Description The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a backend software engineer for Adobe Target. We're seeking an enthusiastic and accomplished engineer to come join us on our journey to build the next generation of our industry-leading enterprise personalization platform! Adobe Target is a leader in the market for experience optimization, testing and personalized content delivery. We empower the world’s largest brands and marketing organizations to optimize and personalize at scale. Our mission is to enable marketers and product teams to comprehensively optimize on revenue and engagement. Inside Adobe, we build the personalization engine that powers the Experience Cloud. There, we form the foundation of a machine learning experimentation, recommendation and optimization delivery engine that processes billions of transactions per day. What you'll Do You’ll design, build and operate consumer-facing, internet-scale applications and services. You’ll be part of multi-functional development teams with exposure to deep platform architecture, and you’ll collaborate across teams on large projects. You’ll lead in driving development and operations standards for the team. You’ll raise the bar on quality with an emphasis on test automation. You’ll work in an agile, DevOps culture with a focus on maintaining operational excellence while delivering with high velocity. What you need to succeed Experience building a high performance, horizontally scalable, low latency service using the latest technologies. Expertise in Java or Kotlin or other contemporary languages Proficiency in SQL and experience with scalable, distributed NoSQL datastores such as Cassandra, Aerospike, Redis. Real passion for quality and engineering excellence at scale. Strong problem solving and debugging skills and direct experience with DevOps in a SaaS environment including monitoring, alerting and on call. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Undergraduate/Graduate degree in quantitative sciences/engineering. 3+ years of experience in design and development of software systems. Nice to have Experience in a cloud-native stack: containerized compute (e.g. Kubernetes), infrastructure-as-code, CI/CD and cloud services (AWS, Azure). Experience with batch data processing and streaming compute (e.g. Kafka). Expertise in microservice architecture, REST APIs, gRPC.

jobTitle: Solution Led Account Executive, Customer Journey Management
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity We are seeking an experienced Enterprise Account Executive who will be responsible for exceeding sales targets through the sale of Adobe’s Customer Journey Management solutions. As an Account Executive, you will drive net new revenue within an assigned account base. The ideal candidate is someone with a “hunter” mentality who thrives on being on the front lines, prospecting, consultative selling, closing deals, and winning! The perfect candidate will achieve success through solution selling capabilities and direct, face-to-face contact with the customer. If you are passionate about what you do, have an entrepreneurial flair and are excited by leading-edge online marketing technologies, we want to hear from you. What You’ll Do Perform outbound prospecting activities to generate new business for Adobe’s Customer Journey Management solutions within an existing Adobe customer base. Build, develop, lead, and execute an account plan that serves as a success roadmap to help ensure expected results are delivered in a well-thought-out manner. Maintain an active pipeline of forecasted sales to meet and exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual quota objectives. Handle, coordinate, collaborate and work with various cross-functional groups within Adobe (Product, Marketing, Legal, Finance) to successfully manage the entire sales cycle. Build strong, lasting relationships with customers by understanding their needs and business objectives. Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of Adobe’s Experience Cloud solutions. What You Need To Succeed A minimum of 5 years’ prior enterprise-level outside software sales experience, preferably within web technology and/or digital marketing solutions. Deep understanding of Adobe Campaign, Marketo Journey Optimizer, or similar solutions. Deep understanding of the competitive landscape for Adobe’s solutions. Proven track record of success and a history of exceeding quota. Creative self-starter: ability to work independently. Must have strong skills in the following: communication, presentation skills, negotiation, organization, and attention to detail. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $234,200 - $304,100 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Acrobat Reader Growth team is looking for a dynamic and versatile analyst to drive product-led growth for Adobe Acrobat Reader. You will employ data to deeply understand Acrobat Reader customers through their entire lifecycle, with a focus on Conversion and Monetization, drive strategy, measure progress toward goals and uncover new opportunities. You have deep technical skills, a passion for delivering compelling customer analytics, curiosity, and a desire to grow the business. The ideal candidate excels at establishing relationships and credibility across diverse groups telling data-driven stories, is a self-starter with strong initiative, excels at verbal and written communications and is a trusted member and adviser within cross-functional teams. What you'll do Analyze Acrobat Reader monetization and usage data to identify and model growth opportunities and validate that new growth experiences are performing as anticipated Use insights and data to inform strategies that increase conversion and improve the customer journey for Reader users Monitor weekly performance, trending and provide guidance on forecasts. Use data from multiple sources to understand customers and their in-product engagement patterns, create compelling data narratives that drive action and find opportunities to further elevate the product experience. Partner with the enablement and product teams to enable analytics measurement across existing and new features built in the product in supporting data systems. Prepare, consolidate, and contribute to executive presentations, telling the story of business performance and risks & opportunities, using high impact visuals with compelling insights Partner with Regional Growth Squads and cross-functional teams across time zones to derive insights. Partner with teams building new predictive models to understand the relationship between usage, engagement, monetization, and customer retention - and fuel the basis for Propensity frameworks. What you need to succeed Strong analytical skills to articulate key business and financial implications/business impact High attention to detail with excellent organizational skills and ability to take charge, set objectives, and drive to results, while remaining team oriented Advanced Excel skills are essential, and experience in Tableau, TM1, PowerPoint, Adobe Analytics are preferred; PowerBI and SQL are a plus Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with excellent data visualization abilities Comfortable presenting insights and findings to a broad range of stakeholders, team members, and regional partners. Ability to tell data driven stories in a clear and concise narrative. Ability to anticipate how a decision made can affect other regions and projects -- “connecting the dots.” Demonstrated success in fast-paced, matrixed, and dynamic environments, rapidly anticipating and adapting to shifting priorities. BS/BA with 8+ years’ experience in one or more of the following: analytics, ecommerce, software, high tech. MBA or equivalent experience preferred. Outstanding sense of humor.

BS/BA with 8+ years’ experience in one or more of the following: analytics, ecommerce, software, high tech. MBA or equivalent experience preferred. Outstanding sense of humor.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Acrobat Reader Growth team is looking for a dynamic and versatile analyst to drive product-led growth for Adobe Acrobat Reader. You will employ data to deeply understand Acrobat Reader customers through their entire lifecycle, with a focus on Conversion and Monetization, drive strategy, measure progress toward goals and uncover new opportunities. You have deep technical skills, a passion for delivering compelling customer analytics, curiosity, and a desire to grow the business. The ideal candidate excels at establishing relationships and credibility across diverse groups telling data-driven stories, is a self-starter with strong initiative, excels at verbal and written communications and is a trusted member and adviser within cross-functional teams. What you'll do Analyze Acrobat Reader monetization and usage data to identify and model growth opportunities and validate that new growth experiences are performing as anticipated Use insights and data to inform strategies that increase conversion and improve the customer journey for Reader users Monitor weekly performance, trending and provide guidance on forecasts. Use data from multiple sources to understand customers and their in-product engagement patterns, create compelling data narratives that drive action and find opportunities to further elevate the product experience. Partner with the enablement and product teams to enable analytics measurement across existing and new features built in the product in supporting data systems. Prepare, consolidate, and contribute to executive presentations, telling the story of business performance and risks & opportunities, using high impact visuals with compelling insights Partner with Regional Growth Squads and cross-functional teams across time zones to derive insights. Partner with teams building new predictive models to understand the relationship between usage, engagement, monetization, and customer retention - and fuel the basis for Propensity frameworks. What you need to succeed Strong analytical skills to articulate key business and financial implications/business impact High attention to detail with excellent organizational skills and ability to take charge, set objectives, and drive to results, while remaining team oriented Advanced Excel skills are essential, and experience in Tableau, TM1, PowerPoint, Adobe Analytics are preferred; PowerBI and SQL are a plus Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with excellent data visualization abilities Comfortable presenting insights and findings to a broad range of stakeholders, team members, and regional partners. Ability to tell data driven stories in a clear and concise narrative. Ability to anticipate how a decision made can affect other regions and projects -- “connecting the dots.” Demonstrated success in fast-paced, matrixed, and dynamic environments, rapidly anticipating and adapting to shifting priorities. BS/BA with 8+ years’ experience in one or more of the following: analytics, ecommerce, software, high tech. MBA or equivalent experience preferred. Outstanding sense of humor.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Frame.io, an Adobe Company, is changing the future of how videos are made by helping over 1 million creative professionals seamlessly collaborate from all over the world. Engineers at Frame.io are creative, technical people making beautiful and powerful tools to enable other creative, technical people to do their best work—Frame.io is the thread that runs through the entire video post-production process. The product and engineering team at Frame.io bases our process on five principles: We always come back to the problem to solve. We explore solutions at the right level of detail. We give full responsibility to designers and engineers during their phases of a project. We ship often to ensure we deliver value to customers often. We are looking for a senior back-end engineer who can turn ideas into beautifully written code that other people—or you, six months into the future—will find easy to comprehend and modify. You will: Model a rich and expansive domain. You’ll design and implement data models for every facet of the post-production domain, as well as powerful systems to keep the Frame.io application efficient and stable. Contribute to a mature (but not too crufty!) Elixir application. Frame.io is home to one of the largest Elixir applications in the world, and senior engineers here have the opportunity to design highly concurrent, fault-tolerant systems. Own the implementation of great features. You’ll work directly with designers, client engineers and product owners to bring new features to life. You’ll provide guidance and input into the process of building and deploying their vision, as well as writing the code that makes it real. Guide and mentor your fellow engineers. You’ll be an authority on best practices for the engineering team, as well as an important leader for other engineers in the organization - back-end and otherwise. Our team is highly productive and committed to mutual support, collaboration and knowledge-sharing. We are dedicated to a work environment where we can all grow and learn, and combine this commitment with a dedication to quality engineering and sound, informed technical decisions. We understand that the best code is the code that moves our business forward, and we make every decision about the back-end in the context of the product that everybody at Frame.io is building together. What you'll Do Write solid and scalable code. Doing regular code reviews. Building new features and services in Elixir. Providing technical leadership to junior engineers. What you need to succeed Extensive, solid experience in designing and developing multiple large-scale Web application back-ends. Experience in Elixir or a comparable functional programming language. Experience in MySQL or PostgreSQL outside of an ORM, including the ability to design SQL queries for performance and efficiency. Familiarity with common API and services design best practices. Deep experience in overall system design and implementation—how they scale, how they should fit together, and how they’re likely to break. Experience migrating legacy components with little to no downtime. Ability to analyze and solve difficult problems across the back-end. Frameio-All1 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $154,000 - $200,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

jobTitle: Sr. Business Systems Analyst, Applied Data & Analytics
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. New ideas can come from everywhere in Adobe, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe’s Information & Data Services (IDS) organization delivers the foundation behind Adobe's groundbreaking "data-driven operating model", and is responsible for delivering the Applied Data & Analytics products that power Adobe’s strategic decision making and customer experiences. IDS delivers real-time, operational, and analytical data capabilities using a variety of technology platforms to meet the needs of data scientists, analysts, engagement marketers, and executives. We are looking for a hard-working Sr. Business Systems Analyst to join the team responsible for the Marketing, GTM, and Customer Engagement applied data products and services, including our next-generation unified customer profile for segmentation, personalized targeting, and customer engagement and retention. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, sales and marketing, and customer experiences teams to understand data needs, and turn that knowledge into innovative and easy-to-use data products and features. This position will provide thought leadership and guide business adoption of data solutions. This is not an “order taker” position. What You’ll Do Democratize data and insights as you strive to deliver self-service tools to your partners and enable them to make better, quicker decisions Contribute to product strategy and vision for the Information and Data Services team, and build working relationships with partners to understand their data analytics needs and priorities, clarify objectives and clearly communicate plans. Review customer analytic needs and transform them into clearly defined product requirements, features and enhancements. Prioritize and lead end-to-end delivery of data solutions that integrate batched and streaming data sources. Leverage Adobe’s strategic data assets to deliver trusted insights that drive business outcomes, promoting our data driven decision-making culture Perform regular data querying and analysis for applied data analytic insights, customer engagement, predictions and recommendation solutions. What you need to succeed Requires bachelor’s degree. Preferred candidates will have a major in computer science, MBA from reputable institution or equivalent experience. 7+ years of data analytics BSA or product management experience with solid understanding of how to deliver data solutions in an agile environment Strong proficiency in SQL/SparkSQL/Python to query and manipulate large data sets. Experience with platforms like Databricks, Power BI and Tableau. You are a self-starter, independent, hard worker, with a high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand. You anticipate and creatively implement next steps in a complex environment You have mastered the ability to influence outcomes, navigate, mediate to consensus with integrity. You possess great interpersonal communication, presentation skills, and social skills and a solid sense of humor. Data requirement writing skills: collecting, prioritizing, and gathering input from multiple sources, providing accurate requirements with attention to detail You already know or can rapidly learn enterprise application capabilities in order to deliver transaction and event-driven data solutions (examples: SAP, MS Dynamics, Adobe’s Experience Platform and similar marketing tools, ADLS/Hadoop/Databricks, Kafka streams) At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Position Summary Digital marketing is advancing at a dizzying pace and companies are turning to the Adobe, the leader in enterprise marketing software, to stay ahead. Adobe Customer Experience Architects help customers succeed through partnership on digital strategies, product implementation and the consulting services needed to meet their business objectives. As a Solution Architect, you will partner with Adobe sales teams during the sales cycle to conduct customer discovery, scope out a roadmap of consulting services, and present your proposal to the customer. This involves maintaining a keen awareness Adobe product strategy, consulting offerings, and sales pipeline to find opportunities where Adobe Consulting can bring significant business value to our customers (such as increased revenue, improved customer experience, and reduced marketing spend). What You’ll Do Operate in a fast-paced environment where you will be responsible for driving multiple customer opportunities in parallel Conduct business and technical discovery with customers Problem solve, build strategies and create innovative solution architectures uniquely tailored to customer objectives Develop robust recommendations, proposals and scope of work documents for Adobe Consulting engagements Mitigate risk by identifying critical project dependencies & gaps Present your proposals to executive-level customers in a clear and compelling way Help customers understand Adobe’s diverse capabilities to drive transformation Continuously improve the Solution Architecture team’s knowledge, methodologies and customer-facing collateral What You Need To Succeed Experience working in a premier consulting or technology organization Passion for solving customer problems and rapidly convert pipeline opportunities into closed deals Balance of business and technology skill Ability to articulate complex ideas in a simple and understandable manner. Identify business problems and tie your proposed solutions to measureable success criteria Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills, including ability to build clear observations, analysis and conclusions based on customer interviews and data Excellent customer-facing skills with experience presenting to and achieving consensus from senior executives (managers, directors, VPs, CMOs, and CXOs) Exceptional communications skills both oral and written (e.g., Powerpoint presentations) Ability to multi-task and prioritize across multiple sales opportunities at the same time Trusted colleague who can collaborate with multiple team members to arrive at the best solution Understanding of the Digital Marketing landscape and experience with relevant Digital Marketing strategies and technologies In-depth understanding of the typical use cases of Digital Platform implementations (CMS, Analytics, Personalization, Ecommerce, DAM, Mobile strategies etc.) High degree of intellectual curiosity and ability to learn and apply new concepts and technologies in a wide variety of marketing disciplines Bonus: experience with Willingness to travel up to 40% of the time MBA or equivalent advanced degree preferred

jobTitle: Sr. Director, AI/ML Solutions - Document Cloud
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe Document Cloud is looking for an executive leader to drive AI/ML innovations in our Document Cloud products and services! Document Cloud is the world's leading PDF and e-signature tools solution integrated across desktop, mobile, and web. It enables complete, reliable and automated digital document and signature workflows to drive business productivity and delivers delightful customer experiences. We’re looking for a leader that has experience creating innovative capabilities in AI/ML with experience delivering those capabilities in products and services. This leader will drive data scientists and engineers to effectively deliver impactful digital experiences for our customers. This role will lead the team that develops sophisticated automation features for Document Cloud. You will work closely with Machine Learning scientists AND software engineers in your team to build a pipeline of innovations that will continuously roll into our products and services. You will deliver server side, mobile, and desktop components to create the optimum customer experience possible. You will also partner with Adobe Research, and especially the Document Intelligence Lab, to demonstrate their pioneering innovations. What You’ll Do: Using the power of Adobe Sensei, you’ll build PDF solutions that will help automate many of the tedious steps in PDF Build a team that will develop and ship new Deep Learning and NLP models Guide senior technical and product leaders to deliver innovation into Document Cloud. Partner with the Research team to incubate a pipeline of advanced projects that provide innovative features for documents Establish a process to migrate those research projects into production, including desktop, mobile, web and back-end server environments Help establish product solutions for these automation areas that align with our various go to market models Lead a data team that provides datasets for model training Present to Adobe’s executive leadership teamWhat You’ll Need to Succeed: Have deep knowledge of machine learning, especially in the NLP and Deep Learning areas Keep up with rapid innovations in AI/ML across the industry and consistently bring new ideas to the team Humanize AI: Translate machine learning result and insights to a business-centric language with easy-to-understand visualization Build analytics into your solutions and use that data to help improve the effectiveness of the solution Partner with research labs at Adobe to drive new innovations Mentor an impactful team and hire exceptional talent Work with cross functional teams in multiple geographies Guide internal and external customers in their AI Transformation Represent Adobe and provide thought leadership in various conferences and meetups. Have hands-on experience developing data science solutions, from concept to production, and selecting the right tool for the job at hand. Be familiar with and be able work with popular ML frameworks. Continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. Be a critical thinker who is passionate about developing highly innovative breakthrough technologies and has the resilience to make innovation happen. Be obsessed over delivering products that solves critical business needs and iterating with customers for early feedback. Have experience interacting with enterprise customers Have experience leading data science teams, provide technical leadership that can keep the team focused on priorities. Communicate complex ideas clearly. Ideally PhD/Masters in Computer Science or similar field
location: San Francisco, California, Estados Unidos 133 solicitudes

jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe.com is one of the most heavily trafficked corporate sites in the world, and a primary customer interaction point for the company. A highly visible and critical role, this leader will focus on transforming Adobe.com into a world-class experience for our Digital Experience (DX) enterprise offerings! This scope is very broad: Digital Experience is a multi-billion dollar B2B business unit within Adobe, encompassing a diverse set of flagship products (from Adobe Analytics and Adobe Experience Manager to Ad Cloud, Adobe Commerce, Marketo Engage, and Workfront.) Our customers span many industries and our users represent a wide variety of personas. This is a high profile leadership role that will lead and organize a globally distributed team of senior level Product Managers, SEO Managers, Analysts, and Optimization specialists who are currently building the future of this web experience. Equally important will be the ability to mobilize an extended cross-functional team of web engineers, program managers, designers etc. to deliver against the BU goals The successful candidate will be able to build, articulate and execute on a vision that will continue the growth of our Digital Experience business, and speak to the needs of today’s prospects & customers. They will have a proven track record to see the trends, interact with clients, get key insights, and make strategic decisions to drive the roadmap and measurable results for Adobe.com. Another key element of this role is acting as “Customer Zero” for our DX solutions. Adobe.com is built on top of AEM, Analytics, Target, and the Adobe Experience Platform. This individual will drive a feedback loop from our team to the Digital Experience product organization, helping evolve and improve our solutions. What you’ll do Develop a comprehensive roadmap and lead the evolution of the web experience for our DX business across Adobe’s enterprise web (Adobe.com, Marketo.com, Workfront.com, and other web experiences), encompassing chat, personalization, and more. Map and optimize the complete online journey for our enterprise customers, from prospect to lead, through purchase and active product use. Optimize the lead gen funnel, but also actively work to drive product engagement, in partnership with the BU. Use data, research, competitive insights, to identify and drive implementation of key content & web platform initiatives Balance the requirements of various business units, and blend them to build a seamless, powerful B2B experience Collaborate closely with key partners – Enterprise Marketing, Customer Insights, Product & Go-To-Market, UX & Design, and Sales – to deliver content and capabilities that support our strategy and marketing campaign tactics Partner with the engineering team, delivering detailed roadmaps, use cases, and B2B focused requirementsWhat you'll need to succeed Deep experience with web strategy and leading global cross-functional web teams in the enterprise / B2B space. Experience leading a globally distributed team (with members in the US, EMEA and APAC) is a plus. Strong strategic thinking combined with a metrics-focused ability to lead operational execution Excellent understanding of digital marketing technologies, across content management, chat platforms, analytics, personalization, and marketing automation Experience bringing together a diverse cast of non-technical and technical collaborators to build a shared vision and roadmap Knowledge of enterprise sales processes, from demand gen to lead scoring and sales funnels

jobTitle: Sr Experience Design Manager, Business Commerce
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The opportunity Are you constantly thinking about improving workflows, solving large design and system challenges, or creating a more appealing visual design? This is an opportunity to work with and build a truly outstanding team at Adobe! The challenge Our growing design team invents and redefines the account, e-commerce, identity, automation, and administrative experiences for consumer and business customers across all surfaces. We collaborate with business leaders, product managers, engineers, data scientists, and research to deeply understand customer needs and build exceptional products and experiences. The role We’re seeking an energetic experience design leader who thinks holistically and inspires their team to use modern tools to evaluate multiple experience directions quickly. As a broad role, it will require a champion for crafting experiences that scale across a wide range of experience surfaces, from mobile devices and the web to desktop workstations. This pragmatic leader will employ a user-centered and data-informed approach to lead the Business Commerce design team. They will work closely alongside their design leader, designers, partners, engineering, and product teams to develop ideas from concept to implementation. This role offers a chance to unify and deepen the commerce practice across surfaces, apps, and service ecosystem with visibility across the organization. The ideal candidate should have a strong design background, a passion for excellent user experience, a desire to drive innovation and iteration, and an ability to lead and develop teams in the design industry. In this role, you will: Unify. Drive the evolution of the Business Commerce system by making important decisions about the way our experiences look, feel and behave. Lead . Enable a highly effective UX design organization including a culture of critique from concept through finished product Strategize. Define the future of Business Commerce experiences including how people discover, purchase, and successfully engage with Adobe apps and services Simplify. Break down large and complex problems into solvable chunks while prioritizing reliably in fast-moving and evolving environments to deliver practical design solutions Collaborate . Work closely and constructively with product management, visual and interaction designers, writers, engineers, and user researchers to lead product design Visualize. Bring design to life. Articulate the need and proposed solutions through sketches, storyboards, hi-fidelity mockups, prototypes, or animations across all levels of the organization. Influence . As a sought-after advocate for design excellence, you show design-thought leadership through collaborative sessions and workshops with product and engineering partners What you’ll need to succeed: 4+ years of management and leadership experience Experience working in large teams with many moving parts Experience working with and/or helping your team conduct research, presenting results and acting on those results Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process A consistent track record of launching products that delight, innovate and scale Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills Willingness and ability to contribute to the creative spirit of the design team and the company Ability to create mechanisms and processes to deliver quality product experiences in an effective, predictable way College degree or applicable experience  How To Apply To be considered for this role, please submit your resume and portfolio. We’d especially like to see strong systems thinking, establishment of design systems, and how your work has evolved over time. About Adobe Design Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers , content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $170,700 - $221,700 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The opportunity Are you constantly thinking about improving workflows, solving large design and system challenges, or creating a more appealing visual design? This is an opportunity to work with and build a truly outstanding team at Adobe! The challenge Our growing design team invents and redefines the account, e-commerce, identity, automation, and administrative experiences for consumer and business customers across all surfaces. We collaborate with business leaders, product managers, engineers, data scientists, and research to deeply understand customer needs and build exceptional products and experiences. The role We’re seeking an energetic experience design leader who thinks holistically and inspires their team to use modern tools to evaluate multiple experience directions quickly. As a broad role, it will require a champion for crafting experiences that scale across a wide range of experience surfaces, from mobile devices and the web to desktop workstations. This pragmatic leader will employ a user-centered and data-informed approach to lead the Business Commerce design team. They will work closely alongside their design leader, designers, partners, engineering, and product teams to develop ideas from concept to implementation. This role offers a chance to unify and deepen the commerce practice across surfaces, apps, and service ecosystem with visibility across the organization. The ideal candidate should have a strong design background, a passion for excellent user experience, a desire to drive innovation and iteration, and an ability to lead and develop teams in the design industry. In this role, you will: Unify. Drive the evolution of the Business Commerce system by making important decisions about the way our experiences look, feel and behave. Lead . Enable a highly effective UX design organization including a culture of critique from concept through finished product Strategize. Define the future of Business Commerce experiences including how people discover, purchase, and successfully engage with Adobe apps and services Simplify. Break down large and complex problems into solvable chunks while prioritizing reliably in fast-moving and evolving environments to deliver practical design solutions Collaborate . Work closely and constructively with product management, visual and interaction designers, writers, engineers, and user researchers to lead product design Visualize. Bring design to life. Articulate the need and proposed solutions through sketches, storyboards, hi-fidelity mockups, prototypes, or animations across all levels of the organization. Influence . As a sought-after advocate for design excellence, you show design-thought leadership through collaborative sessions and workshops with product and engineering partners What you’ll need to succeed: 4+ years of management and leadership experience Experience working in large teams with many moving parts Experience working with and/or helping your team conduct research, presenting results and acting on those results Awareness of how visual design languages and UI frameworks affect the design process A consistent track record of launching products that delight, innovate and scale Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills Willingness and ability to contribute to the creative spirit of the design team and the company Ability to create mechanisms and processes to deliver quality product experiences in an effective, predictable way College degree or applicable experience  How To Apply To be considered for this role, please submit your resume and portfolio. We’d especially like to see strong systems thinking, establishment of design systems, and how your work has evolved over time. About Adobe Design Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers , content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud. Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $170,700 - $221,700 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. This individual will have ownership of a wide range of activities in support of business decisions and management reporting. You will drive partnerships with senior leaders, unlock insights to grow existing and new lines of business, and develop & improve consistent processes. jobTitle: Sr. Financial Analyst FP&A - Digital Media Marketing
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is seeking a rockstar Senior Finance Partner to provide critical financial, strategic, and operational support for the Digital Media Marketing organization, an award-winning organization that is the steward for one of the world’s most recognizable and creative brands. This position will be responsible for supporting marketing and campaign investments that drive +$11B in ARR across our industry leading businesses Creative Cloud and Document Cloud. In addition to driving planning, forecasting, and reporting, this position will also help to ensure alignment of spend to strategic growth initiatives while growing return on our marketing dollars. The finance team celebrates understanding the big picture, and this role will balance deep financial reporting and oversight, with strategic investigation and analysis. We strive to influence key decisions affecting the business and seek top talent to help us steer the ship. The best-in-class Adobe finance organization welcomes candidates with energy (boundless curiosity, motivation, and initiative), integrity (shoots straight, find out what’s true), and intelligence (financial competence with analytical horsepower). We ‘run to trouble’ in solving tough problems while adding to the culture of ‘best places to work’ Adobe community. What you will do: Lead dynamic forecasting to accelerate insight into funding opportunities and risks Develop aligned Finance point of view on funding priorities and align to revenue layers Drive relationships with peers in FP&A to improve alignment of marketing spend with revenue performance Evolve the taxonomy of tagging campaign and spend data in partnership with Finance and Marketing Operations to drive improved efficiency of analyses Re-imagine finance led marketing performance dashboards and partner with business leaders to drive consistency in the production of KPIs (e.g., LTV/CAC, Campaign Traffic & ARR goals) Improve campaign performance assessment to support funding decisions Prepare executive presentations, telling the story of business performance, and risks and opportunities, applying high impact visuals, with compelling insights Lead projects to drive automation and process improvement, reducing time to deliver, while growing accuracyWhat you need to succeed: Positive demeanor, ability to succeed in a heavily matrixed environment that changes as the business evolves Solid hands-on experience with Financial Modeling / Forecasting Trend & Variance Analysis / Budget Formulation & Management Strong analytical, and outstanding communication skills, to articulate key business and the financial implications/business impact High attention to details with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to take charge, set objectives, get results, team oriented. Outstanding Excel skills is a requirement, and experience in Tableau and Power BI are preferred. Anaplan and TM1 are a plus Bachelor's degree in business, finance, or related field; CPA/MBA preferred, but not required Minimum 4-7 years of FP&A (or related) experience required If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

jobTitle: Sr. Growth Product Manager, Adobe Express Acquisition
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe Express is a newly launched product within Adobe that enables users to transform their ideas into visual stories and empowers consumers to create outstanding content in minutes. We are a highly motivated Product-Led Growth team that functions as a startup within Adobe to build, next generation products on web and in mobile apps. We are looking for someone who can lead user acquisition through in-product growth loops. You will partner with various cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, user research product marketing, core product managers and analytics to drive substantial user growth. Your role will be to develop a growth strategy, build a data-driven roadmap, and implement through experimentation. What You'll Do Develop a data-driven growth strategy and targets that ladder up to Adobe Express user acquisition objectives based on your deep understanding of the customer flows, growth loops, and your product intuition. Define key in-product acquisition loops, including viral loops, content loops for Adobe Express free and premium experiences and grow user acquisition by optimizing every stage of these loops. Prioritize roadmap initiatives based on impact by working with product analysts, data science and user research teams; constantly iterating based on new findings. Secure consensus for your strategy and roadmap among your key partners and executive leadership teams. Lead execution of your roadmap from concept definition to live rollout through rapid testing and experimentation process. Report and analyze test results regularly at reviews out with insights and recommendations on rollout plan. Continuously motivate your cross-functional squad (engineers, analysts, designers) to drive outstanding results. What You Need To Succeed 6-8 years in product management or equivalent field with an emphasis on driving KPI-driven roadmap. Prior experience shaping high-impact growth loops for freemium technology products. Analytical approach and customer empathy- you pick the right bets based on data and insights. Excellent communication skills at all levels. Entrepreneurial spirit- you are a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, deals with ambiguity, and focuses on driving impact. Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills- both at technical and business level. Ability to work cross-functionally, keeping teams motivated and excited about your next big idea. MBA preferred

Position Summary As a member of the Enterprise Commerce team, this Java Developer will collaborate with Business Analysts, Adobe's Order Management and Product teams to understand and support their strategic priorities. This person is required to have strong Java and Cloud environment experience and be able to deliver microservices and portals to meet business requirements. While the candidate in this position will work heavily on Microservices and Enterprise Commerce portals and is required to have strong Order to Cash and pricing domain expertise, they must also have experience with integrating non­-SAP systems and SaaS providers. The candidate will play a key role in the transformation Adobe’s Quote to Cash processes and systems. It is important that this person is able to provide insights and expertise in best­ case business practice in the area of order management. They may be required to work with multi-functional teams and help mentor junior developers. The candidate must be able to communicate effectively, think creatively, think end-­to-­end, embrace change, and self-­ driven and able to work with ambiguous requirements with little or no guidance. What you’ll do Have a good understanding of industry standard SaaS/Subscription Management processes with a focus on Usage based Metering and Invoicing. Have a good understanding of web technologies and cloud deployment. Work within the framework of the Project Management standards to deliver business needs quickly. Work on Application Assessment and Requirements activities for projects and enhancements. Assist Adobe business partners in defining key capabilities/requirements that will enable their strategy Create complex conceptual designs (including application interfaces and interactions). Document Design decisions and Configuration and Development rationale. Evaluate, prototype and implement solutions to meet the Enterprise Commerce requirements and needs of Adobe’s Enterprise customers. Develop micro services using Java 8, Spring Boot and Frontend. Contribute to application design and architecture activities. Work with team across multiple geographies. Be recognized as a professional on one or more applications vendors/products. What you need to succeed Requires bachelor’s degree. 8 + years of Java experience Experience supporting Order Management business functions desired. RESTful Web Services, OOP Design patterns. Must have Java 8, Spring Boot & Jersey Framework, Cloud deployment experience Web Frontend technology (React JS, Angular JS, Node.JS, npm, HTML 5, CSS) experience RDBMS (MySQL) Experience Non relational database (Cassandra, Mongo…) experience MacOS, Shell scripts, Make, Gradle, Maven, IDE’s such as Eclipse, NetBeans. Docker containers, AWS EC2, VPC, RDS, Cloud formation. CI/CD, Jenkins, Git. Understanding of integration technologies such as Kafka and Middleware tools. Ability to communicate effectively and experience in documenting requirements and specifications is essential. Ability to operate in an agile delivery framework. Proven track record to work creatively and analytically in a problem­ solving environment. Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills. Ability to build and manage multi-functional relationships.

jobTitle: Sr Manager, Engagement and Retention Marketing
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The challenge One of the most important aspects of Adobe's business is cultivating deep, meaningful, and lasting relationships with our customers. In support of this, the engagement and retention of our customers has become the top strategic priority for the company. As our business continues to grow, we need to focus even more closely on the engagement of our customers and ensure that they are getting value from their membership with Adobe, with the goal of increasing our customer satisfaction and retention rates simultaneously. As a Global Engagement & Retention Manager, you will drive the integrated strategic planning and be responsible for the execution, reporting/analytics & ongoing optimization of your campaigns globally – with cross-functional support from media teams, agencies, in-house creative studio and our marketing insights and analytics team. A successful candidate will be expected to effectively partner cross-functionally with mentioned teams as well as cross functional partners within Product Marketing, GTM (Go-to Market) and regional teams. They will also be a dynamic leader that can balance longer-term strategy with short-term financial results focused execution in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will constantly put yourself in our customers’ shoes – to make sure that everything we do ultimately benefits them. In addition, we need marketers who are comfortable using data to drive most aspects of our campaign strategies and ongoing performance optimization – since Adobe applies the DDOM (Data Driven Operating Model) across the company. As a newly created team, our plans are not set in stone. There's always something new to discover and try. This is a roll-up-your-sleeves and get stuff done position that’s perfect for someone with an entrepreneurial-spirit, who enjoys identifying and tackling new opportunities to improve our customer’s experience/retention. Success in this role is tied directly to our ability to measure our impact and materially improve our customer engagement and retention rates. What you’ll do Develop integrated marketing plans directly addressing key E&R business opportunities for both free & paid Creative Cloud Express users – for example: Nurturing free users, upselling free users (trial and units), reduce new customer cancels, Win-back lapsed customers, etc. Use existing key customer insights and data (or partner with internal Insights/Analytics team to establish new insights) to create relevant and impactful messaging. Write creative briefs and kick-off initiatives with internal COE teams & either internal studio and/or external agency creative resources. Oversee integrated campaign executions (e.g. Targeting, Creative, Offers, Pricing, Tactics, etc.)– to ensure they’re on strategy and meeting/exceeding forecasted objectives. Partner with cross functional and regional peers to scale campaigns globally and provide ongoing guidance & campaign kits to ensure consistency in execution and outcomes. Develop and maintain a campaign measurement framework to ensure ongoing review and adjustment in alignment with marketing funnel metrics. Develop a bottoms-up forecasts and budget asks for your campaigns – as part of the larger Annual planning & quarterly re-forecasting. Storytelling: know what it takes to bring a message strategy together in a way that tells a clear, engaging story around Adobe’s value proposition. Strong communicator & attention to detail: ability to distill feedback and points of view from senior team members and prioritize accordingly. Proven influencing skills: ability to work with and influence team members from across the organization whose input is critical to success of the plan. Robust analytical skills: the ability to digest large amounts of data, identify trends and pursue the right questions to take action. Be a change agent: guiding teams forward in a constantly evolving environment Fast learner, with a positive demeanor and willingness to try new things! Ability to navigate a matrixed organization and represent team with professionalism and self-sufficiency. jobTitle: Sr Manager, Engagement and Retention Marketing
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The challenge One of the most important aspects of Adobe's business is cultivating deep, meaningful, and lasting relationships with our customers. In support of this, the engagement and retention of our customers has become the top strategic priority for the company. As our business continues to grow, we need to focus even more closely on the engagement of our customers and ensure that they are getting value from their membership with Adobe, with the goal of increasing our customer satisfaction and retention rates simultaneously. As a Global Engagement & Retention Manager, you will drive the integrated strategic planning and be responsible for the execution, reporting/analytics & ongoing optimization of your campaigns globally – with cross-functional support from media teams, agencies, in-house creative studio and our marketing insights and analytics team. A successful candidate will be expected to effectively partner cross-functionally with mentioned teams as well as cross functional partners within Product Marketing, GTM (Go-to Market) and regional teams. They will also be a dynamic leader that can balance longer-term strategy with short-term financial results focused execution in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will constantly put yourself in our customers’ shoes – to make sure that everything we do ultimately benefits them. In addition, we need marketers who are comfortable using data to drive most aspects of our campaign strategies and ongoing performance optimization – since Adobe applies the DDOM (Data Driven Operating Model) across the company. As a newly created team, our plans are not set in stone. There's always something new to discover and try. This is a roll-up-your-sleeves and get stuff done position that’s perfect for someone with an entrepreneurial-spirit, who enjoys identifying and tackling new opportunities to improve our customer’s experience/retention. Success in this role is tied directly to our ability to measure our impact and materially improve our customer engagement and retention rates. What you’ll do Develop integrated marketing plans directly addressing key E&R business opportunities for both free & paid Creative Cloud Express users – for example: Nurturing free users, upselling free users (trial and units), reduce new customer cancels, Win-back lapsed customers, etc. Use existing key customer insights and data (or partner with internal Insights/Analytics team to establish new insights) to create relevant and impactful messaging. Write creative briefs and kick-off initiatives with internal COE teams & either internal studio and/or external agency creative resources. Oversee integrated campaign executions (e.g. Targeting, Creative, Offers, Pricing, Tactics, etc.)– to ensure they’re on strategy and meeting/exceeding forecasted objectives. Partner with cross functional and regional peers to scale campaigns globally and provide ongoing guidance & campaign kits to ensure consistency in execution and outcomes. Develop and maintain a campaign measurement framework to ensure ongoing review and adjustment in alignment with marketing funnel metrics. Develop a bottoms-up forecasts and budget asks for your campaigns – as part of the larger Annual planning & quarterly re-forecasting. Drive regular campaign performance reporting & optimization Develop credibility and relationships with key internal collaborators. Understand the and metrics for each of the marketing channels contributing to a plan and know when plans are under-performing; own the virtual team in identifying areas of weakness in the plans in order to course-correct, and provide thorough reporting on the results of the marketing plans to ensure transparency and enable action Understand and manage the budget spend needed to deliver the marketing plan; find opportunities for greater efficiency and improvements in return on investment. Requirements: Experience of product led growth and freemium go to market models. Entrepreneurial spirit: with ability to seek out and act upon new E&R opportunities Be a strategic problem solver: drive and use qualitative and quantitative research & data analyses to define audience insights, develop strategies, etc. Be customer focused: have a detailed understanding of our target customer and the journey they take from awareness to purchase. Storytelling: know what it takes to bring a message strategy together in a way that tells a clear, engaging story around Adobe’s value proposition. Strong communicator & attention to detail: ability to distill feedback and points of view from senior team members and prioritize accordingly. Proven influencing skills: ability to work with and influence team members from across the organization whose input is critical to success of the plan. Robust analytical skills: the ability to digest large amounts of data, identify trends and pursue the right questions to take action. Be a change agent: guiding teams forward in a constantly evolving environment Fast learner, with a positive demeanor and willingness to try new things! Ability to navigate a matrixed organization and represent team with professionalism and self-sufficiency. Qualifications 8+ years of data-driven marketing experience in either a Corporate AND/OR Agency setting. Strong executional knowledge across a wide variety of marketing tactics/channels (e.g. Email, Display, Paid Search, Web Pages, Direct Mail, Paid Social, etc.) Deep understanding of best-in-class E&R marketing efforts. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to learn new technologies, products, or systems quickly. Ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines with minimal oversight. Experience in SAAS business model and freemium go to market models is ideal.

jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Job Description As a key team member of the Risk Advisory & Assurance Services (RAAS) team at Adobe, the Senior Manager will have primary responsibility for managing risk-based audit and advisory engagements that address a mix of operational, financial, compliance, third-party and technology objectives! This position requires building effective working relationships and business partnerships across the company, and providing guidance to improve the effectiveness of governance, risk, and controls. The candidate will be based in San Jose, CA and will report to the Director, Internal Audit. Responsibilities Lead a successful audit team by establishing clear objectives and accountability for accomplishing goals. Be responsible the execution and delivery of global audit engagements. Define audit objectives, manage planning, fieldwork and reporting, and ensure quality and consistency in accordance with the internal audit methodology. Conduct risk assessment and planning discussions with business partners to scope audit engagements and incorporate input from RAAS leadership. Guide the team in developing the audit program applying a top down, risk-based approach to assess strategic, operational, financial, and technology risks for key business processes; leverage data analytics to aid in the planning and execution of the audit. Manage the execution of detailed audit procedures and confirm that audit objectives are met; evaluate the governance, risk and control posture seeking opportunities to improve risk management, increase process efficiencies, and helping prioritize areas for management focus. Review audit work papers to ensure they are clear, complete, and well-organized. Ensure that audit observations are well-defined, root causes analyzed and discussed and agreed with management. Prepare audit reports/presentations and communicate results to management. Establish a regular cadence of follow-up on outstanding management actions and timely implementation of corrective actions; provide ongoing status updates to RAAS leadership. Provide guidance and coaching to the audit team; share key takeaways, encourage creativity and teamwork and empower the team to deliver. Lead special projects and reviews as requested by RAAS leadership. Acquire in-depth understanding of Adobe's core business and financial processes and keep current on company strategies, priorities, and business objectives. This position may require travel, approximately 10-15%. Education Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance preferred; other relevant bachelor's degrees will be considered. Professional certification such as CPA/CA, CIA, CISA or CFE is required. Experience Minimum 10-12 years of proven experience in a Big Four firm or large global public company or a combination 5+ years of people management experience Experience in software industry is desirable with solid understanding of business operations, risk management, and IT general controls (logical and physical access, change control, application controls, etc.) is required Experience in business and fraud analytics Experience with SAP and Tableau is a plus Skills Ability to cultivate and sustain strong business relationships at Senior Manager/Director/Sr. Director levels in the organization. Excellent interpersonal, oral, written and presentation skills with the ability to comfortably connect with all levels of management and demonstrate a high degree of professionalism and integrity in all interactions. Strong project management, organizational and planning skills. Flexibility to adapt to new situations and reset team priorities in order to accomplish objectives. Ability to provide clarity and act promptly to deliver results through challenges or ambiguity. Strong team-player who incorporates different perspectives across the organization to achieve shared objectives. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog (http://blogs.adobe.com/adobelife/) and explore the meaningful benefits (http://benefits.adobe.com/) we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.
