The Opportunity We are looking for an exceptional teammate to join the newly created M&A Finance team to support all aspects of M&A lifecycle from Finance side. We are seeking a results-oriented team member with strong finance/accounting knowledge, effective communication skills, and experience leading cross functional projects to drive shared objectives and detailed plans. This person should be able to think at a 100,000 ft strategic altitude as well dive into the operational nuts & bolts. What you'll Do Be a centralized finance point of contact throughout the deal lifecycle including deal construct/close, integration, post-close value capture. Own M&A integration budget across the company; building and cultivating strong relationships with integration partners at all levels. Coordinate with Finance due diligence team & IMO, to clarify and share all findings and impacts with relevant teams. Partner with BU FP&A teams to evaluate the rationale and financial merits of M&A opportunities. Review & provide suggestions to A2S model in terms of growth trajectory and synergy opportunities. Develop and deliver detailed FP&A integration plans incl. creating integration plan, organizing Day 1 activities, and implementing integration activities through plan completion. Facilitate discussions across finance and cross-functional workstreams to clarify interdependencies, "connect the dots", and handle critical deliverables Build out & evolve FP&A M&A integration toolset (e.g. playbooks, process flows, dashboards.) Supervise 1-2 team members. What you need to succeed Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related fields. 10+ years of combined experience in Finance, Corp Dev, investment banking or related functions with a focus on the Technology sector. M&A/deal experience (e.g. corp dev, due diligence, integration, post-integration) required. CPA preferred. Significant experience with the Finance function of large complex organizations. Ability to explain Finance/Accounting concepts to non-Finance/Accounting teams. Familiarity with deal closes processes and financial implications of various deal structures Exceptional program management skills and excels at leading multiple projects concurrently Exceptional EQ, proven influencing skills with experience operating in an unstructured environment. Strong written and spoken communicator. Strategic problem solver. Proactive self-starter. Calm and agile in fast-paced, ambiguous environments. High learning agility. Strong financial modeling skills & fluent with Excel. Great people leader and coach. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. jobTitle: Sr Mgr, Professional Services Consulting - Enterprise Architects
jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe’s Professional Services Team is a dynamic group of best-in-class consultants who partner with our customers to define, execute, and govern digital marketing strategies, so they can realize the most value from their Adobe investment. We work with senior leaders to understand our customer’s business challenges and turn their vision into reality. The role of an Enterprise Architect within Adobe’s Professional Services Team is to be the technology lead on our professional services engagements. Our Architects have experience and expertise across enterprise marketing technology solutions, data, and integrations with other enterprise platforms. The Architect’s leadership, experience, and strategy will guide cross-functional project teams through definition, deployment, and optimization stages of Adobe Consulting engagements to ensure customer success. As a practicing Senior Manager on the Enterprise Architecture consulting team within the Adobe Professional Services organization, you will be responsible for managing a team of the industry’s best and most dedicated enterprise architects while also leading implementations yourself for a handful of key strategic customers . You will drive continuous professional services process improvement and efficiency while holding our high standards for delivery quality. You will recruit and develop architects and be accountable for productivity goals to ensure target achievement. You will support client success through direct and indirect client engagement . You will also help develop a culture of innovation, technology excellence, and architectural discipline, and serve as a strong champion for change. What You’ll Do Lead, recruit, and mentor a team of Enterprise Architects and thus ensure customer success through quality in consulting delivery. Be the lead architect for key accounts, see the big picture, set the future state vision, and become a long-term trusted advisor to key executive stakeholders at our customer organizations Drive continuous improvement of consulting delivery processes, standards, and practices, driving customer excellence. Support client escalations by guiding and coaching your team members to ensure proper communication, prioritization, and ownership throughout the experience. Meet and exceed goals around customer outcomes, customer facing utilization, consulting revenue, and margin as well as driving operational excellence. Proactively collaborate across Adobe including Customer Success, Sales, Engineering, Product Management, Technical Operations, and other internal Adobe teams. Organize and conduct enablement sessions to strengthen team with respect to both technical and role-based proficiencies. Lead and inspire the team with positivity and optimism, creating a culture of high expectations, innovation, and achievement. What You Need To Succeed 5+ years of experience as an enterprise, solution, or application architect; systems integrator; consultant; or equivalent experience Preferred 5+ years of experience leading consulting teams, including remote-based delivery of technical solutions Track record of delivering successful Enterprise or Solution/Application integrations, with digital marketing tools and systems related to big data, analytics, testing & optimization, personalization, and activation Proven experience in creating architecture best practices, technical diagrams, capability maps, current/future roadmaps, and related technical topics Executive leadership skills including the ability to coach, mentor, influence, and empower a diverse and high-performing team to maximize results. Ability to communicate, coordinate, and drive optimal revenue, team productivity, and margin performance. Ability to interact and communicate for impact and change within all levels of an organization both internally and externally, including business and technical stakeholders Confident ability to lead, collaborate, triage, and make decisions in a fast-paced, changing environment. Strong experience in negotiation and conflict resolution. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with meticulous attention to detail. Bachelor’s Degree in information systems, computer science, or a related field of the technical industry. Ability to travel up to 35% At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Adobe is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. The opportunity Adobe Acrobat Sign plays a pivotal role in bringing digital transformation whether you are a small, medium, or a large business. In recent years e-signature process has shifted from being an optional efficiency to a business continuity solution across organizations. By joining this customer centric product team, you get to bring digitized workflows that include preparing documents, to requesting signature, document management including data collection. We are looking for a Sr. Product Manager to ensure we solidify Adobe’s position in the market and complete the growth strategy for 2023 - 2025. As a core member of the Sign product management team, you will envision, design, develop, and deliver features within the broader Sign ecosystem that address our mid-market segment’s business process automation needs. What You'll Do You will play the central role in gathering, prioritizing, and communicating requirements working across multiple partner groups and ultimately mapping product features to business value proposition. You will develop a rolling four quarter roadmap and focus and prioritize key themes while addressing and coordinating with business partner groups across marketing, customer support, sales. Strong product design and leadership will be required to drive consensus on requirements, ensure decisions are made in a timely manner and drive clear requirements for the engineering teams. In this role, you will build Acrobat Sign’s mid-market product strategy, including products, services, and technology platforms, by using customer and market analysis and your well-informed instincts on what could create disruption. Other responsibilities include: Own the collaboration with cross-functional teams, e.g., marketing, research, engineering, shared technology teams, project planning and delivery and the user experience design. Be the customer advocate every step of the way, help the entire product team to see what makes the difference between just another feature and customer delight. Understand customer requirements and work with Adobe sales to craft an appropriate strategy to close the sale What Is Needed To Succeed B.S. in Computer Science and MBA or equivalent experience 5+ years of product management experience preferably with SaaS products Proven track record of releasing features and products into production Translate vision and strategy into product requirements and facilitate the execution of initiatives from design to development to go-to-market Experience with agile software development practices within a large, matrix team Ability to work with technical leads, product owners, and customers to translate solution concepts into specific features and integrations. Analytical abilities paired with the capacity to make decisions using both quantitative and qualitative data. Excellent interpersonal communication Skills in politely saying No to everything that isn't required to meet our long-term goals More reasons why Adobe life is the good life Work in a place that cultivates strong leaders throughout the organization. Feed your brain and grow your skills with educational reimbursements of up to $10,000 per year. Take off for a four-week sabbatical after five years of employment. Give up to $10,000 to your favorite cause each year, and we’ll match every penny! Get generous reimbursement for your favorite wellness activity. Enjoy serious discounts on the Adobe software Winter break, of course. Summer break, too? Yes! Get adoption assistance, backup childcare, pet insurance, commuting reimbursement, and more. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $128,100 - $166,400 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Senior Product Manager, Adobe Acrobat Sign Ecosystem The Opportunity Are you a forward-thinking product manager? Do you have a passion for customer delight and product growth? The Adobe Acrobat Sign product organization is looking for a Senior or Principal Product Manager, who will play a pivotal role in defining and delivering Sign Integrations with key partners such as Microsoft, Salesforce, and others. You will lead the charge in understanding market requirements, defining and crafting key platform capabilities for value realization across the Adobe Acrobat Sign and Microsoft + Salesforce portfolio and with other key partners. You and your team will drive the research, definition of requirements, launch of product features and collaboration with the Go-to-Market teams. Specifically, you will deliver product capabilities and optimize user experiences that enable increased adoption of electronic signatures using Adobe Acrobat Sign with key partners. This is a high visibility position with senior executive interaction. Document Cloud is the fastest growing business unit at Adobe and Adobe Acrobat Sign is a key growth pillar. What You’ll Do Effective collaboration cross-functionally with Engineering, Marketing, Product, Customer Support, Finance, Legal, Program Management and Design teams to ensure alignment on requirements, roadmap and prioritization. Influence senior executive and the broader organization as to the product direction and other key strategic considerations. Lead a large cross-functional cross-matrixed team to execute against our key goals. You are adept at being in a “player-coach” role. Grow strong relationships with key people in our external partner organizations. Conduct customer research for new initiatives and product capabilities. Build business cases outlining projected impact for each platform initiative to help prioritize the roadmap. Author detailed end-to-end use cases, user stories and product requirements to be used by Engineering & Design teams. Lead feature development across the product lifecycle from conceptualization, requirements gathering, user acceptance testing, launch, to post-release adoption. Work with counterparts in Marketing, Operations, Design, and Product to promote new features Use metrics to identify discovery, activation, and engagement opportunities. Test and grow those opportunities. Who You Are You have led product at scale for the past 4+ years. You can pitch a vision and get alignment on the strategic direction from internal and external partners. You are successful at leading initiatives in a large, matrixed organization and are comfortable in a player-coach role in the organization. You are adept at channeling the “voice of the customer”. You are user-centric, and data driven in your decision making. You have the ability to effectively communicate across the breadth of the organization from engineers to senior executives. You are knowledgeable about A/B testing approaches and optimization techniques. You enjoy leading, mentoring, and growing product teams. Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics, information systems, computer science or equivalent.

Frame.io an Adobe company is seeking a Sr. Manager, Business Operations, to partner with the Frame.io Leadership Team to implement strategic objectives. This individual will be a key partner to the VP of Digital Product along with Operations, Recruiting, Product Management, Engineering and Marketing leaders to help optimize execution across Frame.io. This leader will build upon their experience in developing and delivering outstanding strategy, operations, and communication! The individual will put the right level of discipline and rigor in helping own the Frame.io operations organization including implementing critical initiatives, driving organizational change, encouraging an inclusive and exciting company culture, focused on aligning and enabling teams to efficiently scale the business and deliver customer value. This is a highly influential role across the org and requires true passion for business strategy, business operations and highly effective execution of strategic and product objectives! Specifics of the Role Own internal communications end-to-end on behalf of VP of Digital Products, including all hands, written communications, and external presentations and interviews. Lead or co-lead discrete cross-functional projects. Find opportunities with no natural home within the organization and own cross-functional efforts to completion. Keep a pulse across all facets of the business, transfer knowledge and the connect dots with appropriate team members across various functions. Help build systems to institutionalize knowledge gained. Run senior leadership and executive team meetings. Lead internal planning processes and presentations (e.g. quarterly planning, board meetings, annual reviews, investor updates) with Director of Operations. Across initiatives, identify key team expertise needs and capture/streamline inputs. Job Requirements Proven professional operations/strategy experience. Exceptional verbal and written communications. High degree of organization and follow through. Confirmed ability to understand all aspects of company operations deeply. Ability to scope, communicate and solve problems that arise anywhere in the business. Ability to operate autonomously when needed and to gather cross-functional resources to support you. Prior work as a management consultant, business operations, PM or CoS preferred. Proven leadership and experience in identifying and solving broad and sophisticated issues. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity: We’re looking for an engineer that loves learning technology and uses it to deliver sustainable business solutions. Our focus is helping engineering teams know how their systems are performing so they can find problems before customers do. We believe in automating whenever possible, pull requests, infrastructure as code, and failing fast. We are also advocates for standard methodologies, and regularly train internal teams on how they can use our technologies. This team member will build and maintain solutions for getting insights on infrastructure and services supporting applications, with a focus on logs, metrics, and application traces that improve observability. We think about the problem end-to-end: automation of data collection from common data sources, storing data efficiently in performance managing, and monitoring tools. Are you comfortable running production environments *AND* writing code? Do you have an intimate understanding of the operational challenges of running services at scale? Tackle challenges through software engineering instead of sustained human toil? Are you keen to explore new technologies and looking to help build a path not-yet-traveled? Do you combine the above experiences and talent with strong communication skills, a customer-centric demeanor, and a will to “get stuff done” - all while learning and having fun? What you’ll do: Collaborate with operations & engineering teams, application developers, management and infrastructure teams to assess near- and long-term monitoring needs. Keep an eye on emerging observability tools, trends and methodologies, and continuously enhance our existing systems and processes. Assist with driving observability standards to improve the consumer experience of meaningful applications, services, and business processes with a strong focus on the end-to-end journey. Assist in scheduling and hosting regular tool training sessions to better enable adoption and standardize methodologies. Work with multiple teams to design, deploy, and support large scale clustered software platforms in multiple datacenters and public clouds around the world Deliver highly secure solutions within comprehensive compliance regulations. Integrate diverse technologies in multiple environments to provide monitoring, alerting, and reporting of performance and costs Work with third-party hardware and software vendors to recommend solutions and drive performance and cost efficiency What you need to succeed: Proven track record with Linux, including large scale OS deployment and automation Experience in public cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred) Experience in Python/Go Experience building and using orchestration, automation and configuration management solutions (Terraform/Kubernetes preferred) Experience deploying a modern monitoring stack (Prometheus/Grafana preferred) Previous experience defining, creating, and supporting monitoring dashboards Working across departments popularizing observability expertise and standards Possess practical knowledge of various aspects of distributed service design, including messaging protocols, caching strategies and autonomous software design practices. Experience with monitoring and observability solutions and methodologies including server and network performance, hardware, web synthetics, and application performance monitoring a plus. Eager to learn, able to take guidance, and able to understand that there is always more to learn Frameio-All1 Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $154,000 - $200,000 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Adobe is looking for a backend software engineer for Adobe Target. We're seeking an enthusiastic and accomplished engineer to come join us on our journey to build the next generation of our industry-leading enterprise personalization platform! Adobe Target is a leader in the market for experience optimization, testing and personalized content delivery. We empower the world’s largest brands and marketing organizations to optimize and personalize at scale. Our mission is to enable marketers and product teams to comprehensively optimize on revenue and engagement. Inside Adobe, we build the personalization engine that powers the Experience Cloud. There, we form the foundation of a machine learning experimentation, recommendation and optimization delivery engine that processes billions of transactions per day. What you'll Do You’ll design, build and operate consumer-facing, internet-scale applications and services. You’ll be part of multi-functional development teams with exposure to deep platform architecture, and you’ll collaborate across teams on large projects. You’ll lead in driving development and operations standards for the team. You’ll raise the bar on quality with an emphasis on test automation. You’ll work in an agile, DevOps culture with a focus on maintaining operational excellence while delivering with high velocity. What you need to succeed Experience building a high performance, horizontally scalable, low latency service using the latest technologies. Expertise in Java or Kotlin or other contemporary languages Proficiency in SQL and experience with scalable, distributed NoSQL datastores such as Cassandra, Aerospike, Redis. Real passion for quality and engineering excellence at scale. Strong problem solving and debugging skills and direct experience with DevOps in a SaaS environment including monitoring, alerting and on call. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Undergraduate/Graduate degree in quantitative sciences/engineering. 5+ years of experience in design and development of software systems. Nice to have Experience in a cloud-native stack: containerized compute (e.g. Kubernetes), infrastructure-as-code, CI/CD and cloud services (AWS, Azure). Experience with batch data processing and streaming compute (e.g. Kafka). Expertise in microservice architecture, REST APIs, gRPC.

The Opportunity Ethos deploys Adobe-wide software and infrastructure technology, promoting containerization, clusterization, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD). We create tools, processes, and workflows that connect and enable hundreds of internal development teams. Our team is highly skilled and forward-thinking, and we are looking for engineers who have extensive experience with cloud (Kubernetes/AWS/Azure), REST APIs, and Golang. If you have the fervor and energy to drive the next wave of Adobe’s cloud evolution, enabling product teams to focus on creating “Adobe Magic", this role is for you. We are a small core team and your ability to flexibly collaborate, to sometimes lead and sometimes follow, will be key to your success. We need a senior software developer to help us extend the existing Argo based CI/CD capabilities and build on our end-to-end observability of the platform. In this role, you’ll be a member of a small full-stack scrum team within a larger team, leading the design and execution of new features and rethinking existing ones. The perfect candidate will have experience in multiple areas of the stack and will be comfortable learning new things. What you'll do: Develop against container orchestration and cloud provider platforms to deploy, manage, discover, and secure web, analytics, and machine-learning workloads. Collaborate and coordinate with partners around the globe. Work in an agile environment, planning features and prioritizing changes based on team goals, product usage, and client feedback. Design, develop, implement, and debug solutions to complicated distributing computing challenges. Work closely with development and client teams in production-level environments. What you need to succeed: Desire to work in a fast-paced environment using innovative tools. Like working with a distributed team. In depth understanding of Argo projects and its usage for implementing GitOps. Excellent and effective communication skills; on our geographically distributed team, sometimes it takes extra effort to connect. Your code demonstrates that you understand reusability. Some of the technologies we work with: Languages: Go, Java, Node.js, Python, Bash Platforms: AWS, Azure Technology: Argo Projects, Helm, Docker, Linux, Kubernetes, Git, ArtifactoryAbout the Team We’re building the platform to run Adobe's web, big data, and machine learning services. Our team of 40+ people work in smaller groups of 5-8 developers. This allows us to be agile while working as part of a larger organization. We're globally distributed but remain intimate. The group is in India, Romania, New York City, Seattle, Lehi, and San Jose just to name a few. Our product and teams are growing quickly. Though we are established, in production, and iterating, there are plenty of challenges to overcome, decisions to be made, and new development to do. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

The Business The Adobe Experience Cloud solutions provide thousands of enterprises with deep insight into their customers, along with creation and management of content, assets, and personalized campaigns. Adobe Analytics tracks over 80 billion customer interactions a day and provides real time interactive insights into that data. The Team We are a core set of senior software engineers with a background in distributed computing running across thousands of nodes and processing billions of events per day. We have a wide range of experience, and we’re looking to further improve those skills by bringing on a new team member to help fortify our engineering and operational proficiency. Are you looking for a new challenge that will enable you to work on one of the most exciting data-intensive platforms in the world? If so, this is the team for you! Job Summary We need a capable and amiable Sr. Software Engineer that loves learning new technology and using it to deliver sustainable business value. We need you to help drive powerful software platforms on private and public clouds enabling quicker software development cycles and delivering secure, highly available, and scalable solutions with minimal maintenance. This position demands deep understanding and proven performance. What you'll do: Quickly understand existing codebase and contribute significant changes. Design, build, test, deploy, and maintain large-scale applications. Operate, monitor, and debug highly available distributed services in a production environment. Define and implement the Four Key Metrics for our projects. Work with NoSQL databases that can store billions of records. Work with queuing systems (Kafka, Azure Storage Queues, etc.). How you'll get it done: Foundational understanding of the software creation process and standard methodologies. Proven coding skills with a JVM language (Java, Scala, etc.). Affinity for big-data and real-time processing technologies. Real passion for learning, developing, and getting things to work. Fearlessness and curiosity when staring into the abyss of a repo you’ve never seen, but you now have to debug, update, validate, and deploy. Before Thursday. Work with a wide-range of technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Grafana, Azure Cloud, Jenkins A clear focus on a career, not a job. Ability to work well with introverts, extroverts, and bombastic personalities. Who you are: Analytical. Eager. Fun. Passionate.

The Opportunity Adobe’s Document Cloud team is looking for a hardworking, proactive Strategic Account Executive to help grow our Education business. The Account Executive is responsible for the sourcing and closing of new Document Cloud & Sign customers, and for the end-to-end management of Adobe's existing client relationships. Measures of success include revenue delivered vs. targets, up-sell and optimization effectiveness, client satisfaction and retention levels, and contribution to overall sales team and business unit. We are looking for a hunter in the West with enterprise sales experience who can demonstrate a history of quota over-achievement and deep customer relationships at the Executive Level. This role is to ideally be staffed in the Western Region of the U.S. What You'll Do Source new prospects and close new business Drive specific product revenue in the territory Build strong, lasting partnerships by understanding their needs and business objectives. Track, monitor and report performance for each partnership Perform outbound contact to existing customers to sell additional services. Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of our service offerings Convert customer problems into solutions Maintain an active pipeline of forecasted opportunities to meet monthly, quarterly and annual quota objectives Improve overall customer satisfaction in assigned customer accounts. Work with various groups within Adobe (Product, Marketing, Finance and Engineering) to provide customer feedback and drive revenue opportunities in the regionWhat you need to succeed Minimum 5+ years proven track record of field account management/account executive experience, Selling to fortune 500 customers Shown success selling Complex Enterprise SaaS Solutions to Higher Education customers Strategically create account / territory plan to exceed goals Ability to generate 2.7X pipeline to quota through active prospecting Ability to forge and maintain good business relationships Demonstrated analytical and computer skills Excellent communication and presentations skills with top-notch customer service approach Experience in using quantitative and qualitative analysis to assess customer relationships and make recommendations for each account Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/ opportunities and recommending an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities Ability to work successfully in a team environment, collaborating closely with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Engineering, Production & Marketing Strong understanding of document services, electronic signature and SaaS-based technology Creative problem-solving approach Experience in selling emerging technology At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists (http://www.adobe.com/careers/awards.html). You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmL6uQZhYhw&list=UUlDSu3-Y4-BfI08784K-P4g&feature=share&index=1) approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. THE CHALLENGE Do you want to join a growing team that drives Adobe's most important customer interactions, its largest deals, and its most transformational strategies? The Adobe Strategic Partnership Program (SPP) team is seeking a dynamic business development professional to join our growing team! The opportunity within this high-performing team is to lead the development, deployment and optimization of groundbreaking programs that support SPP’s focus on transformational business. This critical, highly visible role will report to the SPP Director of Special Operations. What You Will Do Pioneer sustainable programs for the creation and development of SPP transformational pipeline. Leverage quantitative skills to build data models, complete pattern analysis/recognition and provide informed recommendations on targets. Use qualitative skills to round out qualified/disqualified opportunity recommendations. Synthesize large amounts of content, data and first-party inputs into SPP-led assets, enablement, events, and communications. Partner with cross-functional extended teams to understand Adobe Leadership/Field/Business Unit strategy, operations, and prioritization. Translate those inputs for SPP prioritization alignment and continuous team enablement. Support transformational opportunity progression when "all hands-on deck" dynamism requires. What You Will Need To Succeed Strong organizational and communication skills, both written and oral. 5+ years’ experience and comfort working with sales teams and senior executive staff. Cross-functional leadership skills are a must. Solid understanding of sales workflow and processes. Candidate knows and understands general sales nomenclatures. Must demonstrate critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills. Degree or years of equivalent practical experience. Strong and proven writing, presentation and content creation skills are a must. Have a persuasive approach, be a strong storyteller and creative problem solver with a track record of producing concise and impactful content. Develop and maintain strong relationships with sales/sales management, digital strategy, strategic partnerships, sales operations, consulting, executive marketing, and more. Advanced degree preferred with a focus in Sales, Data, Marketing, Technology, or a related field a plus. Years of relevant experience will be considered.

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Strategic Initiatives & Partnerships team ensure that 3D & Immersive is well-equipped and coordinated to tackle two strategic challenges for our business going forward: Build strategic vision for 3DI with a 360° approach (Products, Marketing, Research & Labs, etc.) to unlock significant growth potential in new vertical markets such as fashion and e-commerce. Partner with key industry allies in hardware & tech, ISVs, and startups who are key to our success in the market of 3D Creativity. As part of the team, you will lead a selection of high visibility and high impact reporting directly to the Director of Strategic Initiative and Partnerships. What you'll Do Strategic Initiatives: Work on the strategic vision/deck of the 3D&I Division, working closely with senior staff including 3D&I VP. Setup and manage strategic projects with key customers and/or partners to showcase new workflows and technologies. Manage and coordinate the 3D&I org (Product, Marketing, Sales, etc.) engagement to deliver POC, Demos, R&D prototypes, and more. Marketing successful collaborations to extend footprint in new markets. Build strong ecosystem around initiatives (e.g. Power users, Schools, Partners). Partnership Management: Lead discussions with partners and be their main point of contact Manage all partnership projects and coordinate internally with the different teams (marketing, product management, R&D, legal) to sign new partnerships and deliver new products with partners Contribute to the sourcing of new partnership opportunities (attending industry events, etc.) Make sure we value our existing partnerships by leading co-marketing and co-selling activitiesWhat you need to succeed Master's degree in Business Administration and/or Engineering and/or Industrial Design or equivalent hands-on experience. 5+ years of experience combining strategic vision and brilliant execution. Autonomous, influencer and user oriented. Understanding of 3D market and Industry trends. Fast learner. Ability to ramp up quickly on a wide range of 3D technologies. Excellent communication skills to both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to federate people and teams around a common goal. Strong project management skills & experience. Fluency in English.

We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The opportunity The Business Platform Architecture Team defines and maintains the architecture of Adobe’s identity, commerce, provisioning, and licensing systems. It’s via these systems that Adobe’s customers discover, try, buy, and use Adobe’s award-winning software applications. In this job, you'll play a key role in the definition and evolution of our platform architecture. The role focuses on our commerce capabilities: pricing, quoting, check-out, recommendations, and ordering. It requires coordination with your teammates focused on identity, provisioning, and licensing. And Adobe will look to you to develop innovative and intelligent solutions as we expand our product offerings, adopt new monetization models, and scale revenue and transactions. Responsibilities and opportunities include working with the application teams and our public cloud providers. You’ll work with research to identify and apply transformative technologies, such as machine learning. And you’ll be in a community with the thousands of architects, engineers, researchers, and data scientists who make Adobe’s products the best in the industry. What You'll Do Provide assessments, strategies, and roadmaps for the architectural and technology evolution of Adobe’s product provisioning and licensing capabilities. Work with product teams and customers to understand their use cases and requirements and help them understand and adopt the Business Platform. Develop Proof-of-Concept projects to validate new approaches and technologies. Propose changes, complete designs, and see them through to production. Use your system architecture skills to analyze performance, correctness, dependability, efficiency, and other attributes of your and other’s designs. Participate in mentoring, information sharing, and standards-setting as a member of Adobe’s principal engineering community. What you need to succeed Master of Science or higher degree in Computer Science, or equivalent Proficiency with techniques, patterns, and practices of large-scale system architecture 15 years of industry experience, with 5 years of experience in cloud-scale systems architecture Extremely strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills Working experience with Azure or AWS Working experience with e-commerce Experience with Kubernetes, Java, JavaScript, and React is a plus

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity The Systems Engineer will be responsible for collaborating with business units to analyze current-state business processes with an emphasis on developing automated reporting and dashboards using BI technology. Also performing ETL (extract, transform, and load), SQL database development, and automated reporting. The Senior Systems Engineer will develop and maintain BI applications for cross-functional teams across our diverse and growing Finance organization. This role will also need to be able to build professional and clean looking dashboards and reporting. Secondarily helping to maintain a SQL server database platform for cross-functional teams across our diverse and growing Finance organization. This role will also need to be able to use ETL software to support incoming and outgoing request. We look for self-motivated individuals who can function and adapt in a development model with iterative delivery, incorporating feedback rapidly into delivery components. Our team partners closely with groups inside and outside of the CFO organization and requires individuals to bring a can-do, positive demeanor, with a focus on delivering exceptional customer support. Advanced experience with PowerBI, SQL Server, Snaplogic, SQL Server Integration Services, Python, Power Platform, or other similar platforms required. What you'll Do Your daily activities include, but are not limited to, supporting, and participating in project planning and communication for PowerBI, SQL, and ETL initiatives. Partnering with others to develop reporting specifications; analyzing and observing processes and developing solutions based on business goals and objectives. Integration of multiple technologies and applications to build comprehensive process automation while ensuring process efficacy and stability is essential to all our project successes. What you need to succeed Bachelor’s Degree required (Information Technology or computer science preferred) 5+ Years Industry Experience Advance experience with BI tool such as PowerBI Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, including business process expertise Experience with SQL Server or other similar database platform and ETL software Database design and administration skills a plus Good interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and written Committed to finding solutions to challenges and enjoy creative problem solving Ability to solve problems collaboratively and build strong relationships Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects Process orientation with strong attention to detail Flexible team player committed to quality process and outcomes Strong self-direction and initiative; willingness to take ownership over projects and tasksAdditional Consideration Given Python and data science experience preferred Advanced Power Platform experience with PowerApps and Power Automate At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

jobDescription: Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The opportunity Adobe's Customer Success organization is on a mission to accelerate customer value! The Global Strategy and Operations team supports this mission through the delivery of strategy, key operational services, data, programs, and platforms for scale and insights in support of a growing $3B+customer base. You will join an outstanding enterprise strategy, operations and technology team supporting the unique value of Customer Success with the opportunity to help shape the impact on broader Adobe and our customers. What you'll do Build, source, and manage digital-led systems, tools & data required to execute scaled digital customer programs to effectively drive Customers Success impact with Adobe's customers and contribute to overall business growth Partner with customer programs and lifecycle teams to build automated workflows and audiences in service of shared digital and scaled campaigns Contribute to the definition and measurement of digital engagement effectiveness and strategic vision for impact Provide requirements, operational support, and governance for core digital engagement technology including, but not limited to, email campaign execution, nurture campaigns, digital content on website, webinars, etc. Work with other technical teams to ensure integrations are optimized and data is flowing effectively between multiple marketing systems Build positive relationships and alignment across customer success, marketing, and operations/strategy teams within the business unit Inform strategy and investments through a data-driven view of impact and effectiveness Lead organization to adopt Adobe Digital Experience solutions (Customer Zero) to allow our organization to innovate, deliver on objectives and be the best Adobe customerWhat you need to succeed BS/BA with 3+ years of systems management and/or sales operations experience Experience architecting digital solutions to drive value for our customers, and interfacing with technical teams to translate business and systems requirements into technical requirements Excellent at building and fostering relationships across functions and teams Analytical, data-driven approach that can rapidly assess a business problem, structure and evaluate options, and implement Exceptional written and spoken communicator, structured problem solver, resourceful, and persistent Articulate the rationale for decision-making in a way that is clearly understood and instills confidence in the strategy Experience driving projects from start-to-finish, even when faced with complexity and ambiguity Nice to have Power user or Administrator of one or more of the following tools: Gainsight, Marketo, Adobe Campaign, Microsoft Dynamics, and Salesforce Experience with leading webinar platforms such as (but not limited to) ON24 Experience writing HTML code Experience with marketing automation and audience profile/segmentation tools Pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role if based in New York City. New York Starting Salary $125,400 - $162,800 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! Adobe Consulting engagements involve full life-cycle project delivery, in-depth product, and technical consulting, and mentoring and knowledge transfer customers. As a Technical Consultant, you will deliver high quality consulting services to our growing client base. This includes facilitation of technical requirements gathering, performing solution and application design, and development, testing and installation of Adobe software as required by the project. The Technical Consultant should have demonstrable experience delivering complex solutions to customers and be able to work both as an individual and provide technical and team leadership within a larger project team, in partnership with a project coordinator. Re sponsibilities: Implement specific parts of AEM-centric solutions with high quality, following AEM best practices Diagnose the client's technical environment and how they use Adobe technology in order to deliver the best, focused advice, and ensuring this information gets stored in Adobe’s client data center. Efficiently multi-task, working across multiple client engagements at the same time as well as key internal initiatives. Play a key role as a change agent in pursuit of constant tuning and improvement of our team. Effectively analyze complex project issues, identify the possible solution options, and facilitate the presentation and review of the options and our recommended solution with the client. Proactively maintain the highest level of technical expertise by staying current on Adobe technologies through internally and externally available learning opportunities as well as self-study. Deliver high quality consulting services to our growing client base and lead ambassadorship in our client relationships. Effectively analyze complex project issues, identify the possible solution options, and facilitate the presentation and review of the options and our recommended solution with the client. Mentor and guide others on the team, from new hire on-boarding to complex implementation issues. Lead the team in i I dentify ing , captur e ing , and distribut e ing knowledge and standard methodologies with clients, partners and colleagues via direct interaction and Adobe communities. Requirements : 2-5 years’ experience in the Web and/or ECMS technologies 2+ years of direct client consulting experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as customer relationship building skills. Articulate technical solutions and how they can solve client business problems to both technical and non-technical audiences. Adapt to and work effectively with a variety of clients and in challenging situations, employing strong facilitation skills and establishing credibility and trust quickly. Work effectively with sales teams and understand the dynamics of the sales process. Conceptually understand business requirements and translate them into architecture, design and development activities for our most complex and large Web based solutions. Desire to help build and strengthen a team-oriented environment and to mentor and guide others in areas of your expertise both formally, as part of engagements, and informally. Provide input and leadership in estimating and other delivery process activities and complete engagements following the Agile methodology including SCRUM. Knowledge in the Sling or OSGi frameworks, JCR API, RESTful principles or ExtJS framework, Dispatcher or CDNs a plus. Proficiency of Object-Oriented Programming Methodology & Practice, ideally with designing and programming of applications using Object Oriented Programming Methodology applying Java language constructs. Debugging and appropriate debugging tools usage skills in general TCP/IP networking, UNIX Operating system, HTTP protocol and request processing, SMTP, etc. Mastery in at least one of the current SQL dialects. Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, JS, CSS, etc. Proficiency in XML and related technologies, e.g. definition and interpretation of DTDs, supporting architectures etc., preferably also including XSLT, extended DTD know how, XML dialects such as SOAP, WML, ICE, etc. Administration and debugging of Web servers, e.g. Apache. Optimizing web solutions and architecting to accommodate performance requirements. Position may require up to 15 % travel Adobe is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace.

The Opportunity This is a great opportunity to be part of a growing team that provides consulting services for Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) products and solutions. AEM helps customers organize and manage the delivery of creative assets and other content across digital marketing channels, including web, mobile, email, social media, and video. The AEM consulting team provides expert skills in the implementation of the Adobe AEM solution offering as well as integrating complementary Adobe enterprise solutions and working with clients' existing IT infrastructure. Adobe Consulting engagements involve full life-cycle project delivery, in-depth product, and technical consulting, and mentoring and knowledge transfer customers. As a Technical Architect, you will deliver high quality consulting services to our growing client base. This includes facilitation of technical requirements gathering, performing solution and application design, and development, testing and installation of Adobe software as required by the project. What You'll Do Be a recognized expert in AEM software-based solutions & technologies. Deliver effective consulting services and lead ambassadorship in our client relationships. Provide technical leadership in sophisticated AEM-centric digital marketing solutions. Lead solution architecture design, guide and mentor teams to develop high quality solutions Be a sought-out partner by Sales. Support consulting representation in sophisticated solution selling, collaborating with Sales to define initial architectural approaches and identify potential challenges and associated solutions. Drive the continuous improvement of delivery methodology and planning guidance. Partner with and enable Sales to develop accurate scoping and cost estimates Mentor others on the team, from new hire on-boarding to complex implementation issues. Lead the team in identifying, capturing, and distributing knowledge with clients, partners and colleagues via direct interaction and Adobe communities. Diagnose the client's technical environment and how they use Adobe technology to recommend options for improvement. Efficiently multi-task, working across multiple client engagements at the same time as well as key internal initiatives. Play a key role as a change agent in pursuit of constant tuning and improvement of our practice. Effectively analyze complex project issues, identify the possible solution options, and facilitate the presentation and review of the options and our recommended solution with the client. Proactively maintain the highest level of technical expertise by staying ahead of Adobe technologies through internally and externally available learning opportunities as well as self-study. What You Need To Succeed Demonstrated ability of over 5 years experience in the Web and/or ECMS technologies including direct consulting experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as customer relationship building skills. Articulate technical solutions and how they can tackle client business problems to both technical and non-technical audiences. Adapt to and work efficiently with a variety of clients and in complicated situations, employing strong facilitation skills and establishing credibility and trust quickly. Conceptually understand business requirements and translate them into architecture, design and development activities for our most sophisticated and large Web based solutions. Desire to help build and strengthen a team-oriented environment and to mentor junior consultants in your expertise both formally, as part of engagements, and informally. Proficiency in the Sling or OSGi frameworks, JCR API, RESTful principles or ExtJS framework, Dispatcher or CDNs Proficiency of Object-Oriented Programming Methodology & Practice, ideally with designing and programming of applications using Object Oriented Programming Methodology applying Java language constructs. Debugging and appropriate debugging tools usage skills in general TCP/IP networking, UNIX Operating system, HTTP protocol and request processing, SMTP, etc. Exposure to the latest AEM Cloud Service is a plus. Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, JS, CSS, etc. Proficiency in XML and related technologies, e.g. definition and interpretation of DTDs, supporting architectures etc., preferably also including XSLT, extended DTD know how, XML dialects such as SOAP, WML, ICE, etc. Administration and debugging of Web servers, e.g. Apache. Position may require up to 15% travel At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge Customer Success Engineers are designated customer facing engineers for our Strategic clients, driving value realization and return on the client’s investment! This team is filled with technology-savvy individuals who have experience in digital marketing and know its value in driving company strategies. We work directly with our clients to understand business and technical requirements, build long term relationships, and develop and operate AEM cloud solutions that delight customers and meet SLAs. This position includes all of the following aspects: Strategic client relationship management! CSEs are assigned as a designated technical operation advisor to 5 to 7 customers who are using Adobe Experience Manager and other digital marketing products. The CSE role is equally: client facing (developing long term client relationships, keyboard facing (technical operations), and colleague facing (developing your own subject matter expertise, and drawing on that of others in a collaborative environment) CSEs are trusted advisors who champion projects and initiatives and bridge between clients, third party providers, project management, internal engineering and automation engineers. There will be frequent interaction with clients including Directors, of Fortune 500 companies. What We Do We communicate consistently with clients throughout the contract lifecycle, calling out relevant issues where needed. We maintain client contact and provide status updates for all outstanding issues while continuing to handle client expectations, keeping clients satisfied and expectations realistic. We help our clients achieve their business objectives by provide resources to answer clients' questions, identifying needs for account customization and oversee implementation changes and encourage client contract renewal. We work closely with account teams and collaborate with other internal team members (consulting/project management/engineering services/customer support) to be sure mutual objectives are met in support of client happiness. CSEs lead all aspects of customer support to ensure timely closure of quality and security issues and provide project management for professional services requests. You will ideally have: Real passion for digital marketing and client success and have a proven track record of successfully leading client relationships and technical projects with an excellent work ethic and collaboration skills. Self-motivated and passionate about exceeding client expectations and understand enterprise internet business models and online processes, terminology, concepts and strategies. Ability to evaluate and adopt change and excel in high-stress situations, taking action to provide, responsive, thoughtful dedication to client success. Shows excellent social, presentation, and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written. Duties include: Work with Adobe's Experience Manager (AEM) and other DMa products and teams to assist in developing new automation tools that increase efficiency and productivity. Demonstrate proficiency in Amazon and Azure cloud operations and the use of Adobe Command/Control and CI/CD tools to enable next generation cloud management solution. Collaborate with the teams that provision, customize, monitor, handle and upgrade our cloud hosted Enterprise offerings. Strong knowledge of Linux and other services such as Docker, Kubernetes (AKS/EKS), PHP, MySQL, Redis, Java, Chef and CDN (CloudFront, Akamai, Fastly) services. Experience with long term operation, monitoring (New Relic, Nagios, Splunk) and upgrade of Enterprise software a plus. Special consideration given for: Master’s degree or other advanced education Prior account management and/or project management experience with Fortune 500 clients Knowledge of and experience with digital marketing technologies Prior experience with customer success in a SaaS, or Managed Services company Experience using digital marketing products and FSI vertical experience Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We support diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. Full benefit position. Adobe follows the reasonable accommodation requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act (“ADA”) and other applicable federal, state or local law. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $114,300 - $148,500 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Challenge Customer Success Engineers are designated customer facing engineers for our Strategic clients, driving value realization and return on the client’s investment! This team is filled with technology-savvy individuals who have experience in digital marketing and know its value in driving company strategies. We work directly with our clients to understand business and technical requirements, build long term relationships, and develop and operate AEM cloud solutions that delight customers and meet SLAs. This position includes all of the following aspects: Strategic client relationship management! CSEs are assigned as a designated technical operation advisor to 5 to 7 customers who are using Adobe Experience Manager and other digital marketing products. The CSE role is equally: client facing (developing long term client relationships, keyboard facing (technical operations), and colleague facing (developing your own subject matter expertise, and drawing on that of others in a collaborative environment) CSEs are trusted advisors who champion projects and initiatives and bridge between clients, third party providers, project management, internal engineering and automation engineers. There will be frequent interaction with clients including Directors, of Fortune 500 companies. What We Do We communicate consistently with clients throughout the contract lifecycle, calling out relevant issues where needed. We maintain client contact and provide status updates for all outstanding issues while continuing to handle client expectations, keeping clients satisfied and expectations realistic. We help our clients achieve their business objectives by provide resources to answer clients' questions, identifying needs for account customization and oversee implementation changes and encourage client contract renewal. We work closely with account teams and collaborate with other internal team members (consulting/project management/engineering services/customer support) to be sure mutual objectives are met in support of client happiness. CSEs lead all aspects of customer support to ensure timely closure of quality and security issues and provide project management for professional services requests. You will ideally have: Real passion for digital marketing and client success and have a proven track record of successfully leading client relationships and technical projects with an excellent work ethic and collaboration skills. Self-motivated and passionate about exceeding client expectations and understand enterprise internet business models and online processes, terminology, concepts and strategies. Ability to evaluate and adopt change and excel in high-stress situations, taking action to provide, responsive, thoughtful dedication to client success. Shows excellent social, presentation, and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written. Duties include: Work with Adobe's Experience Manager (AEM) and other DMa products and teams to assist in developing new automation tools that increase efficiency and productivity. Demonstrate proficiency in Amazon and Azure cloud operations and the use of Adobe Command/Control and CI/CD tools to enable next generation cloud management solution. Collaborate with the teams that provision, customize, monitor, handle and upgrade our cloud hosted Enterprise offerings. Strong knowledge of Linux and other services such as Docker, Kubernetes (AKS/EKS), PHP, MySQL, Redis, Java, Chef and CDN (CloudFront, Akamai, Fastly) services. Experience with long term operation, monitoring (New Relic, Nagios, Splunk) and upgrade of Enterprise software a plus. Special consideration given for: Master’s degree or other advanced education Prior account management and/or project management experience with Fortune 500 clients Knowledge of and experience with digital marketing technologies Prior experience with customer success in a SaaS, or Managed Services company Experience using digital marketing products and FSI vertical experience Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We support diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. Full benefit position. Adobe follows the reasonable accommodation requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act (“ADA”) and other applicable federal, state or local law. Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company if based in Colorado. Colorado Starting Salary: $114,300 - $148,500 At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Our Company Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity At Adobe, we encourage everyone to be a leader and use creativity while growing their career passion and scaling the business. This is an exciting opportunity to join the best-in-class Treasury team as we continue to propel the business through global cash and liquidity management. This individual will be exposed to a wide range of activities in support of business decisions and management reporting. You will partner closely with internal and external elite business partners to work through all cash & banking management and reporting aspects. In this role, you will help enhance and streamline consistent processes, own the banking management processes, and contribute to various projects and initiatives. Together, we will improve Adobe's liquidity and banking management worldwide and help the business increase profitability and efficiency! What you'll do: Maintain worldwide bank account management, including opening and closing accounts, updating signatories, responding to bank compliance requests, and banking activities related to mergers and acquisitions. Perform daily worldwide cash management functions, including cash positioning, preparation of wire transfers, investment analysis, treasury dashboard design, and short-term cash forecasting. Lead, and improve the KYC processes to ensure timely global account compliance. Collaborate closely with banks and internal partners to ensure timely handling of operational requirements and business inquiries. Maintain and improve Adobe's treasury technologies, such as Kyriba treasury management system ("TMS"), ServiceNow automated wire request process, and RPA/bot processes. Preparing journal entries and reconciling cash accounts at month-end. Manage periodic reporting requirements such as bank signatory audits, bank system user audits, FBAR reporting, bank confirmations, and ongoing audit support. Coordinate and analyze banking fees Participate in ad hoc projects to drive continual operational improvement for current treasury processes and technologies that facilitate operational efficiencies and proficiencies. Participate in broader treasury projects and cross-functional projects at any given time. What You Need To Succeed Minimum 3 years of Corporate Treasury experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. BS degree in Accounting or Finance or equivalent practical experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Adobe Acrobat. CTP certification a plus Proficient Excel and PowerPoint skills are required, and experience in Tableau and Anaplan is preferred. SFDC, SAP, or TM1 is a plus. Validated understanding of emerging payment trends that you can translate into strategies to transform Adobe’s payment processing system to outstanding levels. Solid understanding of accounting concepts and familiarity with financial reporting for large public companies. Sophisticated critical and analytical thinking, project management, and problem-solving skills with high customer satisfaction. Strong attention to detail and delivering timely and accurate information in a fast-paced environment. High attention to detail with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to take charge, set objectives, work toward results, team oriented. Self-motivated, superb work ethic, and working independently with minimal direction. Proven time management skills and ability to contribute to multiple projects simultaneously.

The Opportunity Reporting to Adobe's CFO and EVP of Finance, Technology Services, and Operations, you will lead Adobe's Treasury services team and interact with all levels of accounting, finance, tax, and legal professionals. What You'll Do Ensure that our Treasury capabilities stay ahead of the increasing complexity of our business Resolve that appropriate controls are in place to safeguard the assets of the company Direct the management of bank accounts, cash, investment portfolios, and global daily liquidity Liaise with the company’s bankers and ratings agencies to handle existing debt and credit lines, as well as any new issuances and re-financings; recommend and implement related interest rate exposure management activities Review and recommend capital structure positioning for the optimal mix of cash, debt, return of capital, and strategic acquisition firepower Work closely with business development teams to proactively handle the acquisition funding process Evolve strategy for foreign exchange hedging, trading controls, policies and procedures, and quarterly reporting of hedging results Lead initiatives to further automate and scale Treasury processes and Executive Team level management dashboards Corporate insurance risk management, including risk identification, selection of insurance brokers and carriers, insurance renewals, and claims administration Credit and collections function partnering with sales to provide financing solutions that drive revenue within an appropriate level of credit risk Accounts receivables and disbursements, including evolving payment products and methods, merchant processing structures, and related costs and benefits Short-term and long-term cash flow forecasting to aid in liquidity positioning and capital structure decisioningWhat you need to succeed 15+ years experience in senior finance leadership roles partnering with officers and executives, including direct experience interacting with boards and board committees Be a hands-on leader who inspires and mentors colleagues and direct reports with clear thinking, market insights and problem-solving Deep subject matter expertise in Finance, especially Treasury, with an extensive network of external relationships that can be used to keep a pulse on the business and competitor dynamics Firm grounding in treasury accounting and SEC reporting, international tax and legal entity structures, and treasury management systems Proven track record of successfully managing c-level relationships, effectively partnering on financial planning and strategy development and execution Experience leading complex operational and critical initiatives, ideally with/within a global, matrixed organization Ability to lead, inspire the team, and develop bench talent for Adobe Incredible attention to detail and ownership of business outcomes At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. Adobe is an equal opportunity employer.
